The late night eats they have here are yummy too! They have pizza, pretzels, hot dogs, and all of that other fatty stuff you'll stuff in your face to suck up all the alcohol from the many Fat Tuesday drinks you sucked down all day\/weekend. 

Unfortunately, this last visit we didn't get to see our dealer Taison =(

I'd stay here again =)

I enjoyed this hotel a little more then others that I have stayed in at Vegas and like this location.  I don't remember the name but the Chinese restaurant in there was probably the best Chinese I have had before and the steakhouse is pretty good as well.  The NYNY environment in hear is kind of neat to see and a lot more appealing then the typical other casinos on the strip.

We stayed at NYNY when our original flight was canceled due to weather.  The room was clean (basic room), bathroom was tiled with marble, beds had crisp fresh sheets and fluffy pillows and we had a great view of Las Vegas Blvd. Only small thing was sink was cracked. We were impressed with the speed of check-in, the professionalism of the valet and bellhops and how easy it was to get some food and good show tickets (Blue Man Group) for the same evening. All staff had smiles on their faces and were very considerate of our being stranded. We would stay here again. It was an area of Vegas with plenty to do and see.  We had a blast! Food was on the pricy side. Only downside was the volume of slot machines, my ears were ringing after walking thru the casino floor. We caught the double decker bus ($8 for a 24 hr pass) across the street in front of the MGM and toured the strip and a few other casinos.

Just visited Las Vegas last weekend and stayed at the New York New York Spa Suite. My boyfriend and I loved it. From check-in to check-out our experience was great. I also loved the layout compared to other casinos. I only gave 4 out of 5 because the decor could use a little updating.

So I am a vegas addict. I have stayed at most of the MGM properties. NYNY though, is near the top of my list. The park avenue rooms were very clean and seemed nicer (better decorated) than an average hotel anywhere else. The best part about this casino\/hotel is that they have EVERYTHING. Not cheap and not glamorous, NYNY sits right in the middle. BUT it is always fun time. Dueling piano bar, those big frozen drinks, Rok night club, pizza 24 hours and a roller coaster. Lots of fun slot machines and more young people at this place. Plus there are some cute stores that sell NY themed gifts and stuff that are fun to look in. I would definitely recommend if you're looking for a hotel thats lots of fun, great location, fairly cheap and nicer rooms. 

Be warned, there is a daily resort fee that can jack up the price but if you're a players card member you should get decent deals on this hot hotel.

I think this hotel is okay. It is not as smokey in there and it is for adults and children as well. You can ride the rollercoaster as well, but it is quite expensive $14 dollars which is not even worth the money. The rollercoaster is not as fun either.  They do have an arcade which is okay. I tried their Nathan's famous hotdogs and their fruit punch margaritas were okay, but had way too much alcohol in it.  8 ounces for $8 dollars is sure is not worth it.  Anyways I like the slot machines and did win some money there.  I like the architecture outside however and definitely you can take good pictures.
Kinda sucks now that they are charging for parking if you are not a hotel guest or a resident of Las Vegas.

Just checked in and not having a positive experience. Only one of the two rooms was ready an hour after check in. They stalled us for 20 min at the check in and didn't  offer even a complimentary drink for the hassle. Probably won't stay here again. Made it seem like this is standard procedure for them. Really disappointed.

Had a great two night stay here.  We had to change rooms because the park avenue room in the century tower was not cool enough.  They moved us with no problem to the New York Towers where it was nice and cool.  Beds were good and the room was clean.  Like that there is really not a lot of smoke in the Casino.  Had to visit the Riviera for an event and it was horrible with smokers.  I have stayed at the NY NY a few times and would definitely again.

What a cool casino, I love the interior looking like the different neighborhoods of NYC.  There were so many places for food and drinks, you definitely have a lot of options.  My two favorite things inside this casino was the Irish Pub and Cirque show "Zumanity".  I think I may have to stay here next time I'm in Vegas, as I really enjoyed wandering around this casino.

We're  on parking level 8 and traffic getting out of the structure is completely stopped! 8 levels of cars stuck in the structure. It's 2:30 in the afternoon on a Monday. Never will come back here. Been in the line to get out for 30 minutes so far and we're only down to level 5. There should be someone directing traffic!!
All cars were New York New York employees leaving at 2:30 PM. All single drivers we watched coming to their cars and trucks. Apparently the hotel does not provide employee parking and guests leaving at the same time are stuck. No holiday traffic!

Fun hotel to stay in. At least I'd imagine! We came to ride the roller coaster and visit Hershey World! There are some freakin yummy things going on in that store! Try the Cookies n Creme popcorn! MMMMM!!!! So much to do in there!
Worst hotel experience ever!!! Total rip off stay somewhere else!!!! I work in the field and this is not a hotel is sell again!!

Basically the same as last time I've been here, except for parking.  With your players card, parking in the lot is free.  

Very smoky still, but other than that we moved around & had a very nice time w\/ old friends.  Too early to try the finer dining restaurants, but they have a nice daytime selection.  Still the cute cobblestone, polished rock type of mini neighborhood road in NYC.  Love that! 

I do not do roller coasters, but the arcade & Zumanity really keep you entertained as well.  It's also walkable to a festive & entertaining environment such as The Park, TMobile Arena, a great Mexican spot & much more!  Take lots of pix of this is your first time in this area!

Love coming to chin chin's for their morning buffet when staying at NYNY. Good variety and always filling. The best part about my visit was the awesome service the first time. Our server,Pedro, went above and beyond. He stopped to check on us constantly, was super friendly, and overall a terrific server. I actually ate here three mornings during my trip and sadly I didn't get him as a server again. There was definitely a difference between Pedro and the others, which proves a good server can make all the difference. Would have given 5 stars if I had him each time or if the others were as spot on as he was. Either way, I'll be back!

New York New York, the city that never sleeps is mimicked in this large casino and hotel. 

I only walked the grounds and saw an act here. Maybe the hotels are fine. 

As for the casino it differed from others on the Strip by trapping major landmarks from NYC.  Even the dirt and rude people. 

There are several nice restaurants and coffee shops in the area too.
I go here every time, at least for a couple of days, newer and cheaper than Excalibur, great table dancers too :)

This is another of many casino's I enjoy coming to. We came here New Year's Eve. They had a beer truck set up outside will inexpensive beer and a stage with a band playing which was nice. We wanted to ride the roller coaster but it was closed. I have been on it a few times and I wanted my wife to have her first try. Guess it will have to wait until next visit. I think it would have been nice to have the roller coaster open for the New Years crowd. 

This facility has been kept up really well. My family is from New York and it's kool to she how they have made the City streets inside look like your walking through New York City itself. We of course got a couple slices of New York pizza there. It's was pretty crowded. I like the casino here, it's set up well and has several lower minimum tables. I like to gamble here. The slots are nice as well. Employees that we came in contact with we all friendly. 

This is one of those themed casinos that's fun to visit. I think it was great all the themed casinos they have built here. Seems like that are getting out of that. That's sad to see. It's part of the allure. It's part of why people come to Vegas. 

Anyway, put this on you list of places to visit while in Las Vegas.

Hey, whatever you do...try to stay anywhere else in Vegas! 

Reasons I hated this place:

- found hair all over my shower. Like full balls of hair in the shower\/on the wall. I am blonde and this hair was black, so like...? I guess the shower was not cleaned between guests?

- water was shutoff the morning before I left. I came back to my room around 3 am and the water was off...completely. Called the front desk and they sent up three mini bottles of water but this didn't help me shower or wash my face the next morning 

- more hair (not mine) found in the sink

Overall, not a good experience. Plenty of other nice places on the strip for around the same price to stay at.

New York Hotel Las Vegas is not a 4 star hotel it is 3 star  hotel all the way... The bathroom was old and outdated. It looks like something you would see in the a motel.  I ask for champagne and got it in a glass instead of a flute.The Chinese restaurant food was grose, awlful and very nasty. We paid $60.00 for food we had to throw away, my stomach still hurt . The service in the Italian restaurant was poor from the old man bartender.   Please pay the extra money to stay somewhere nice like Venetian or Bellagio

This review is based solely on one Security guard working at 2:50 pm patrolling the arcade section. He goes by the name of Joe extremely lazy and seems to have no ambition in life. I know it's not fair to rate an establishment on one individuals actions but in this case your brand is the strongest thing you own and if you employ ill equipped employees than you deserve a horrible review. I stayed at the Cosmopolitan this weekend and frequented the casinos in the near vicinity; "Joe" would never be hired by any of these hotels. Every person I encountered from Thursday- Sunday was from the service industry including the security guards and we're professional and courteous- this sloppy slob of a human is more like 200 lbs of dormant body fat. He is a Caucasian, taller, balding dumpy and dopey looking piece of work. You can spot him out by his oversized non tailored and soiled uniform. He mozys around and does absolutely nothing to earn any amount of monetary compensation. This arcade does not have adequate seating for those taking their children to play for the afternoon- 2 benches that seat 4 people each- my younger sister and her friend were seated quietly on the ground and instead of this man asking them politely not to sit on the ground he screamed at them "GET OF THE GROUND YOU CAN'T SIT THERE!"  I'm talking about two little innocent children doing nothing but having a conversation - later while doing his usual nothing rounds he steps close to my face and screams at me "WAKE UP!" I simply had my glasses on inside and wearing my hat, if you think someone is sleeping kindly ask them to not sleep in this establishment NEVER shout in anyone's ear ever- this place should not allow this man to work here- I advise all of my friends and family never to step foot into this place until he no longer is employed - I won't be returning until then -

Alright! New York- New York has got to be one of the most beautiful yet simplistic hotels on the strip. As soon as you walk in it's an inviting setting. While I didn't stay there the hotel sold itself quite well. The casino was very well organized and it was easy to get through. They also had a kids area that I must admit was quite fun! The roller coaster there was A LOT of fun and is definitely worth the $14 a person ticket. Although be prepared to hold your head very stiff because it will shake a lot if you don't. It is very worth it though. Definitely something to go on when in Vegas!

I got a great deal off of mlife.com. I totally recommend everyone sign up an account on that site. They have all sorts of deals.
The location worked for me. It was great.
Check in was painless. It was great.
Elevator location was convenient. It was great.
Got off my floor and got hit with the smell of weed. Went down to mention it and when I got back from walking the strip, the smell was gone. So Security was great.
What wasn't great? First....I was on the 35th floor..ice machine was on the 30th.
Second...bathtub doesn't want to drain so I'm pretty sure my feet were soaking in the residue of previous guests.
Third....and this is the big one
I went to check out Thursday June 22 at around 10:40 am. I went to the desk at the end where there is a sign that says lost keys. 
I handed my room keys, credit card, mlife card , and my driver's license.
When she was done she handed everything back... except my driver's license.
Didn't find out until I was to go through security at the airport.
Luckily I was able to talk my way through without it and made my flight back home.
Called lost and found the next day and sure enough...they had it.
Now I'm on hold waiting to make arrangements  for them to get my license back to me.....for which I am expected to pay.
Unreal.
Its an old hotel but was ok with the stay. The room was OK but it does not include a coffee maker or refrigerator like like any other Hotels

I am at this casino right now and my boyfriend just picked up $50 on a blackjack table and the dealer had the nerve to say "thanks for being generous" when he didn't receive a tip. We were at the table for 5 mins TOPS. Such a classless comment. We cashed out immediately and took our money elsewhere!!!

With Tom Cassel as a Casino host, you dont get a much classier act then Mr Cassel.  He has been my host for over 2 years now and has always came through with rooms and any other issues that I need.

The casino itself is always lively and along with Caesar's palace, they got some of the best craps dealers in vegas (and yes, they pay triple on the 12, instead of double like some other casinos).

NY NY is always one of my top choices when it comes to staying in vegas.

A+

checked in here for 2 nights. rooms were clean and updated.  entertainment unit used for closet space and for the flat screen tv.  No mini frig located inside the room. ordered room service for late night eating. 18' one topping pizza approx $25 and order of chicken wings.  ~$10 room service delivery charge.  Pizza and wings were delicious.  Great late night food.  Food fed 5 people. 

self parking in the garage was pretty easy to get in\/out of. there is currently a lot of construction around the NYNY & Monte Carlo back area, evening traffic can become a standstill if you get caught in the rush. Better to hoof it or call a taxi.

I really loved my recent stay here.  

Vegas makes it tough to choose.  You literally have every option under the sun for... well... everything!  We decided to stay in New York New York the week before thanksgiving since the price was right, we like it's location on the strip and we prefer MGM properties.   Overall it was a fabulous stay.   Sure, the rooms are slightly dated looking but they are huge, affordable and insanely comfortable.   I also love the fact that it feels less sprawling than other vegas strip resorts.  We come down the elevator and *bam* we are in the casino or next to F&B options.   2 minutes later we are walking along the strip.  Try doing that in some of the other resorts!  

F&B options are varied and good.  The America 24 hr diner is surprisingly decent as is the Italian restaurant.   Service is pretty decent for Vegas and most employees are pretty friendly.   

The best advice I can give is to book the level of room that you want to actually stay in.  Don't rely on the hope of an upgrade (free or paid) and then be disappointed when it doesn't come through. 

Yes, the resort fee is ridiculously high, but so are almost all other strip properties.  Yes it's frustrating that they charge for parking now, but so do most other strip properties now.
Super cozy and stylish hotel in Las Vegas. I paid in total just 87$ and got room at 33rd floor with nice view to Las Vegas strip. It was my 3rd time in Vegas and I totally enjoyed by this hotel.

This was my second time staying here. Though the main entrance and our rooms smelled like apples and cigarette, something about this place is so cool. The staff is nice. This place is truly good if you are on a budget but don't want to stay in a dump...I.e. Circus circus. I recommend staying here.

Checked in on a Friday afternoon for a one night visit. 

Pros: 
early checkin was FREE before 1
Comfy clean beds. Not too fluffy pillows. 
Good location
Lots of dining choices
SO many places to drink beer
Nice view from strip view room
Pool was fun
Good AC
Roller coaster 
$50 beverage credit! How did I get that??

Cons:
Shade at the pool comes w\/ a cost. 
Longest hallways ever. Good luck finding your room if you're drunk. 
The non-stop flushing of our toilet. Had to jiggle the little ballcock (hehe) thing every flush so basin would fill. Eww. 
No mall type place like Caesars or PH

Yes, it is one of the older hotels & yes, it could probably use a remodel to vamp things up. BUT. THIS IS ONE OF MY FAVORITE HOTELs!!! It is always my home away from home. Costumer service is great. But one of my favorite spots to go is Greenberg's deli!!! I Loooooove their Matzo ball soup here. It's is out of this world, Oscar & Nour always go above and beyond to get to know you and memorize your order. Will defiantly be back soon.

This review is for the casino and eating\/shopping areas only...I really enjoy myself here! Although we were staying at the MGM we came over several times to shop and dine in NYNY. Its always got a fun up beat energy! The casino offers a clean well laid out selection of current slots. The food choices are many ranging from a quick pretzel to full sit down finer dining. We saw entertainment in the pub. The food selections do a good job of replecating NYC venues and styles. The shops are varied and now enhanced by the redone front exterior area that is fun to explore. All staff we encountered were helpful and pleasant. MGM does a nice job managing this facility and I'm sure you will enjoy a visit here!
l love walking through here. It brings back memories of New York. They inside looks like the city with the decorations they put up.

hotel staff was great check in great  entertainment great check out great
but be warned there breakfast buffett at chin chin resturant was verry disapointing had only 8 iteams and  cost 15.00 bucks

It's never been one of my favorite casinos, but NyNy is actually a decent place to visit. First, they house Zumanity, so yeah, you HAVE to go there, and they're RIGHT next to the Monte Carlo, so that's a plus as well. 

They had some of the neatest games on the floor too, like the Batman Game, with the old school Adam West bat man and Robin. I was greatly amused. again, this was a pass through and though I played in the casino, I really didn't get a chance to go through the hotel much at all.

I like this hotel even though the pool is not the fanciest. However, this visit it took almost 45 minutes to get our luggage delivered to our room from the bell hop. We also added two additional guests to our room reservation but yet had to call because we were given only two sets of shower towels (and zero hand towels the entire stay). The most disappointing thing this visit was that the air conditioning in our room did not get cold. Not a situation that is enjoyable in late August. We called the desk twice for engineering support but ultimately the only solution was to move all of our things to another room (which we were not offered assistance with) or use a fan. I would have expected a higher level of customer service from what I remember of the New York New York. I hope they will read this review and improve training \/ customer service.

Stayed for 7 nights..Oct 17 thru Oct 24..Loved it!! Staff was friendly and welcoming..room was clean, comfy and big with flat screen t.v.
Housekeeping came everyday to clean when we left. They did not bother us if the sign was on the door.
  Loved the casino! The cocktail waitresses were always there with free drinks never had to wait long (and I am a fast drinker) so that was a plus.
   The roller coaster..what noise didn't even hear it and we were right by it on the 5th floor!! Wow hard to believe people actually complain about this...I guess if you try hard enough you can probably hear it (try putting your ear to the window,that might help).
   We loved everything about this hotel and will be returning!! Had no complaints are entire stay :)..

It was okay. Just okay. Fun casual casino floor, restaurants and bars. Drinks pricey, and not that good at Pour24, but it's the strip so that's to be expected. Pool closes at 6pm so pretty early. Corner room we had had a good view, and while recently updated, carpert was loose on floor and wall paper in bathroom was peeling; bed was comfortable and room service was great!  Houskeeping was very friendly, 9 Fine Irishmen had a great band and dancer our first night. Lost a star because of the big brawl in the piano bar that went on for about two minutes before security got there. No reason patrons should be breaking up fights. Excuse given was security was dealing with a medical emergency at the time. Tell that to the bride who's mother was knocked onto the floor because security was otherwise engaged standing around a medical emergency. I was shocked at the poor response time. Absolutely no reason patrons should have been put in that situation; again it's about response time, not that a fight occured.
Except for the rediculous fight, the public areas are fun, the room was so-so, service hit and miss. I expect more for a $250.00 a night room, $32 resort fees and $10-20 drinks; at least there were cheap eats. Finally, what are resort fees when the pool is only open from 10-6, the roller coaster is pay to play, and you do nothing but drop plenty of coin in the public spaces(restatuarnt\/bars\/casino floor, etc)? I know Lori will let us know.

The hotel staff here is largely unfriendly. The front desk staff seemed friendlier than the rest of the staff though. While walking through the hotel and dining at the various eateries, the staff made it seem like it was a bother to serve and help you. The staff rarely smiled. The only person who was truly friendly was the gentleman who worked at Hershey's out in the kiosk. He gave us some free samples and made us feel welcome at the hotel.

The hotel itself has a confusing configuration. If you checked in at one of the kiosks, you get a card key but have no idea what tower you have been assigned. The email the hotel sends you does not indicate it either. You can either access the pool by walking through the hotel lobby in your swim gear or go to the third floor, walk down a hallway and take another elevator that brings you to the first floor and to the pool. It would make life a bit easier if the designers of the hotel would make going to the pool more fluid.

The room we stayed in smelled like smoke even though it was a non-smoking room. Perhaps, the hotel could separate the smoking rooms and non-smoking rooms in different buildings. If the building shares the same ventilation system, then the smoke goes into all the rooms. 

New York New York is a reasonably priced hotel, but I feel that if the hotel is charging a resort fee it should actually have some amenities. There was no mini-fridge, complimentary water or any extras. There were four people staying in the room and there were only towels for three. What is the resort fee for? Is it our honor to stay there and we are charged because NY NY is so great? NOT!

My dad was here 7 years ago and was approached by a prostitute. Tonight I learned the hard way that this place is a dive. A Swedish prostitute approached us at the bar at Times Square my mom and I were enjoying the music and drinks. The lady began distracting me by telling me about a club I should try out while her friend walked up and STOLE my clutch!! They had pulled this exact same scam many of times at NYNY and security can't do much about it. Girls, I am not a drunk stupid person please believe me when I say watch yourself here!!!!!!!!!! Gypsies are on the prowl at NYNY.....

I didn't ride on the roller coaster.  Booo!  But then again... spending $14 to ride it might seem like it was good that I didn't ride on the roller coaster.  It's still something I would probably do once and that's it.  When I came to check in, there was a portion of the counter that was closed because the roof was leaking water in multiple places.  They were using trash cans to catch the water.  I don't know what happened there.  The staff at the check in counter all seemed nice.  We paid about $73 for 1 night on a Thursday and it was from Travelocity's website.

When I was here, it didn't seem like I was there for leisure because I had business to take care of which will bring me to my next point: the business center.  They had a business center where you can check your email, fax, and print stuff.  I needed to photocopy something and there was nobody there to help.  The other person who was there tried to help even though that's not his position.  All the computers in the business center require you to use a credit card (maybe a debit card too?) in order to use their computers.  The prices varied for each transaction.  Eventually, I got everything I needed to do taken care of.

One thing I liked about the room we stayed in was the internet.  I think it was included but I forgot.  It was an ethernet cable that you could plug into your laptop.  The room was roomy and the bathroom was good, too.  I don't think anything stood out in the room so that's all I'm going to say about the room.

There was an arcade but I didn't get to look at it when everything was turned on; instead, I quickly walked through when it was shut down in the morning.

Other than that, this place was good to stay at and I wouldn't mind coming back (especially to ride the roller coaster).

Hotel Negligence!  My locked room was burglarized in Vegas! Has this happened to you? Burglary and theft in hotel rooms. Apparently this is a common occurrence at their hotels and one is responsible. What a nightmare! My partners kidney transplant medication was stolen along with many other less valuables... Do not stay!! Do not stay!!!

Probably won't stay in the hotel again.

We stayed on the sixth floor.  There was a really loud annoying sound going on all night.  It sounded like the rollercoaster, but the rollercoaster doesn't run all night, so I have no idea what the heck it was.  Nobody else in our party had this problem.  They all stayed quite a ways up from us.  It was so loud our friends could hear it when we were on the phone with them.

We had a king size bed and our hotel room totally sucked as far as size.  It was the most cramped room I've ever been in.  You open the door and there's your bed!  The bathroom was larger than our room.  I recommend going for a two queen bed room, as your room will be bigger for the same price.  We were tripping over our stuff in the middle of the night.  Otherwise the furnishings are nice and the hotel room was clean.

On the outside, I'm wondering if there is supposed to be water around this place?  We were standing on the bridge to the Paris and noticed a bunch of pipes in a concrete thing under us.  Didn't look very attractive.  Perhaps there were budget cuts.

If you go on the rollercoaster, be aware that you can't take purses, cell phones, or any loose items with you.  They make you rent a stupid locker for that for something like fifty cents or you have to give your stuff to someone who doesn't want to ride the rollercoaster.

This hotel needs renovations asap.  Rooms are really old.  Moreover, there is nothing in the room--no coffee machine, no fridge, no laundry bag.  I stayed there for work but I would not be back on my own.

I will give this place 5 stars when I actually have the opportunity to stay here! I have always wanted to because of it's perfect location on the strip and becuase some of my favorite places are located inside. 

Sorry Venetian, sorry Paris, but New York, New York has the best themed indoor-but-you-feel-like-you-are-outdoors area! I just LOVE walking the streets, stopping for a hot dog or popping in to the dueling piano bar. Coyote Ugly is a great place for a more laid-back club experience (I say laid-back loosely... it's still a club-like atmosphere, just more laid back in comparison to, say, Tao or The Bank.) and the frozen drink vendor outside of it has the best bang-for-your-buck drinks- even better than Fat Tuesday! I also really enjoy the Nine Fine Irishmen bar, and, even though I do not enjoy sports of any kind, I even like the sports bar and grill.

NY, NY is a must-see casino when visiting Vegas. Don't pass it up!

One of the filthiest dirtiest casinos I have ever been inside. This hotel is so off my list I can not explain it ! The casino floor was so filthy dirty, empty drink glasses all over the place, full ashtrays everywhere, disgusting machines so dirty that you do not want to touch the buttons. When I asked the floor "key" person, he simply shrugged and said, "you can go anywhere you want, why do you come here if you do not like it?" Seriously- the bathrooms are so dated, you actually have to flush your own toilet, imagine that ! The bathrooms were also very filthy dirty, no one had been around them for a while, most were dilapidated of toilet paper or seat covers. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME at this hotel !

Didn't stay here, but it IS a pretty fun place to walk around. 

Now, if you've spent much time in NYC, you will *not* feel "as though you're there." But, with all the shops, and sights, and shops (yes, I said "shops" twice), it's a good place to visit that feels less overwhelming than the rest of Vegas. Somehow, its scale does help you feel like you're walking around in a cozier area, so if you're with friends and want to be out and about but you're not in the mood to cruise the Strip any longer, duck in here and wander around.

This is the hotel that i have stayed at the most times in vegas. The rooms are nice and not expensive and there is so much to do within the hotel. There is a great dueling piano bar as well as Coyote Ugly to name a couple. I thought the roller coaster would be noisy for rooms on that side of the hotel, but didnt really hear anything. And for my craps players, every time I have played here, it has not gone well for me.

Types of rooms i've stayed in:
Park Avenue - Great size for one person
Madison Avenue - Good space and the cheapest of the room types that offers 2 beds
Spa Suite - Booked and will update after trip

I love staying at this hotel\/casino. I love that it's not overwhelmingly big. However, my last stay was a bit upsetting. When I made my reservation I specifically asked what they were charging for parking. I was told $10. When I arrived on a Sunday, at valet I double checked with him he informed me it was $18 for valet for every 24 hours if I was a guest and $10 for self parking. While I was terribly annoyed, I realized I didn't specify valet or self parking when I made my reservation. I checked out Tuesday. To return on Thursday. Again, I confirmed the price for valet. I was told as of the day before the prices went UP! Valet was now $20 and self was $12. What annoys me is a lot of people drive to Vegas. Wouldn't it make sense that in the multiple emails sent from NYNY they notify you of the parking fees? I don't know about y'all but I'd rather lose my money at the slots\/tables then parking my damn car!

We got an email special for $44 a night and a Park Ave room which I was very pleased with. The deal came with 2-for-1 drinks and coaster rides but i think everyone gets those coupons anyway.  Loved the decor, the bathroom wasn't anything special but no biggie. Bed was a little firm but not unomfortable. We had a partial strip\/rollercoaster view. The pool isn't overly exciting but it is kinda cool looking up at the "skyscrapers" and having the rollercoaster whizzing by. Very family-oriented pool (only 3- and 4-feet deep, volleyball net).  Pretty good location but not as central as I always think it is. I would stay here again for a bargain, but I'm always wanting to stay at a new hotel each time so I probably won't come back anytime soon. Good coffee at Il Fornaio downstairs by the casino floor (and help yourself to the ice water they put out, very handy on a 110-F day!). Good people-watching at some of the slots near the escalator to Coyote Ugly and the passovers to the other hotels. I always want to go to the piano bar but it's always too packed.  I would give it a 6th star if I could because I left my iPhone charger in the room and thought it was long gone, but still called Lost and Found and they took my info and remembered to check the room when the new guests checked out and actually called me back saying they have it!!  And only charged me like $1.90 for shipping too.  Highly recommend overall.

Ever been to NY NY? Table limits are ten bucks to a thousand unless you're about to win mid shoe. Then the limit is a measly 200. Before you go to NY NY think about mid shoe, maxi shoe, almost mid shoe, way over mid shoe... Get the point.

New York New York is a nice hotel. Can't really complain because I always stay here for free. The rooms are nice and always clean. It's conveniently placed at the beginning of the strip so you don't have to decide which way you want to walk first. I also like the eateries inside. Chin Chin is a really good asian food place. Their seafood noodles and friend rice are amazing! Very nicely seasoned and not too salty. The cafe with the desserts is really good too. I love my chocolate! The hotdog joint is really good as well. I recommend their chili cheese dog. It's SOOOO good!

I know I'll be staying here again since free rooms are always offered! :)

My wife and I enjoyed our stay here very much, the staff are all very helpful and friendly. The resort has pretty much everything you need to have a great time. The only reason for the four stars instead of five is the dishonest practice of adding a "Resort Fee" instead of just advertising the true room rate up front.

I'm gonna give New York New York 4 stars, where I would normally rate a large Vegas Hotel of any type at 3 stars max (due to prices)...    And the reason this gets 4 stars is due to the fact that their roller coaster was so rough, violent and scary that it pretty much frightened the living son of Jesus out of my brother and I.   

My brother and I are veterans of some of the most notorious roller coasters in the US.   And upon walking by New York New York, and hearing the screams of the people riding, we thought it looked "cute".   We noticed the signs warning people with heart conditions, etc., not to ride it and just thought "Yeah, yeah yeah, whatever, bring it on."  

I can tell you why the people were screaming.   I know now...    It's because they were terrified of dieing!     This coaster shakes more than any I have ever rode in my life, and from an engineering point of view, when riding, I was 100% certain that the wheels were going to break and we were going to be killed.   I was totally sure of that.   In fact my brother says that I screamed "I want off this ****** NOW!!!!".    I don't recall that, but once you're on it, there ain't no one to listen to your demand that it stop.....     :)

After that ride, our parents were laughing and said that we looked "pale".    So we rode it again.    

After the second ride my brother could not stop laughing as I had "slobber" all over my shirt.   I don't recall "slobbering" but sure enough I was covered in slime.     Those two rides are all I care for on this roller coaster.   I won't do it again.    But I highly suggest it for anyone that wants to get to know their own religious beliefs a little bit better, quite fast.

This review strictly addresses the rollercoaster at the New York, New York. 

 What a rush!  We ride this rollercoaster anytime we're in the area. It lifts you up 203 feet and drop you down 144 feet. Simulating a jet fighter's barrel roll, it will turn 180 degrees, hang 86 feet in the air, take the famous "heartline" twist and dive, and get your negative g's on! 

The New York, New York Roller Coaster is open  Sun-Thurs 11am-11pm, Fri-Sat 10:30am-12am.

One of my favorite hotel casinos! It's moderately priced compared to the fancier Bellagio or Venetian. It's totally fun and does have that NY charm. I like coming here for the food (Nine Fine Irishmen) and gambling (of course!). Plus NYNY is generous with player card perks. I get free rooms quite frequently and I'm no whale (casino speak for hey big spender!). I'm the occasional gambler and apparently it's enough to have NYNY woo me. The rooms are nice and clean. Service is great! I'll keep coming back and maybe you will too!

The Good:
Location, you are right in the heart of center city.
Clean rooms and nice beds.
Fun environment.

The Bad:
There is a fee for EVERYTHING. 
Staff could be friendlier.
Rooms offer sub par amenities. No fridge or coffee pot in basic rooms.
Parking is difficult due to construction and hard to find if you haven't stayed here before.

This place was okay, you are basically paying for your location. Even though the rooms are clean they are sub par and nothing special. I would not stay here again because of that. Most basic rooms in Vegas have a fridge and coffee pot in them, so that was a big disappointment for me to see our room didn't even have those basic items. There are way better places to stay at in Vegas. If you are looking for a higher quality room at a lesser value, I would make a different choice. The rooms here at New York New York are just not that special. The three stars is for the clean rooms and nice beds, at least we slept well and felt we were in a clean environment.

Eveyone should ride the Manhattan Express Roller Coaster at night. Aside from the 200 ft climb and 144 ft drop at top speed of 67mph, you'll be rewarded with striking sights of the Strip for only $12.50 - just remember to keep your eyes open.

Our first time here.  Front desk was awesome.  The concierge, I think Stephanie, was totally great and friendly.  Hotel is in a great spot for walking around to sight see.  It's near everything.  We dont' gamble or drink, but we were kept busy with things around for our son.  The room was ok.  AC wasn't strong enough for the heat coming through the window, maybe?  I mean I can feel the cool air, but our room was way too hot.  We didn't bother with asking since I doubt there's anything they can do.  We jjust kept the thick curtains closed assuming that it's due to the sun hitting the room directly?  

We were very disappointed with Chin Chin.  Food wasn't that great.  No children price for breakfast buffet and it's was $18.  Kinda high for breakfast even for the adults when the selection was pretty plain.  Service was a bit different.  I didn't take the restaurant was a divey place like Dick's over at Excalibur so I wasn't too used to the waitresses being kinda ???.  The waiters, however, seemed to be great and very attentive.  We were watching the other tables.

I stay at this hotel A LOT.. Not once or twice but probably 6 times a year... This visit was awful.  A big hair in my jacuzzi tub,  a big greasy handprint on the mirror and clothes tags in the carpet.   Just a nasty room.  I photographed all to prove I am not making this up.

So this was my first time in Vegas and we found a great package online through LasVegas.com for the Spirit Airlines flight and the New York-New York Hotel & Casino. I had only heard of the bigger hotels like MGM Grand, Belaggio, and Paris, but figured you couldn't go wrong with this hotel! Well... You definitely CAN go wrong with this hotel.

Night 1 (8\/8) - Arrive at Check-In. We had 2 rooms booked, each with 2 double beds, with a view. They only had 1 double room and 1 king size room. They informed us that if we wanted the other double room (that we reserved well in advance, January I believe), we'd have to take the king for 1 night and then repack everything and move to the double room. Guess reservations are useless here... We were staying in the New Yorker. We got off the elevator on the 16th floor in the middle of the tower. We had a good 5 minute walk just to get to our room. There is only one block of elevators in this tower and if you were stuck with Room 1604 like we were, you've got a LONG walk. Got up to our room noticed it was a little toasty in the room, walked over to the A\/C to find it on the lowest setting... Guess we ordered a sauna in our room too!

Day\/Night 2 (8\/9) - We decided to keep the king size room because it was too much of a hassle to pack everything back up. We left our room with our towels on the hang racks (as they instructed if we DIDN'T want them replaced by housekeeping) and came back a few hours later to find our towels gone (we had 3 bath towels, 2 wash cloths, and a hand towel), and replace with only 2 bath towels and nothing else. We called down to housekeeping and told them we were missing towels and they said they'd get them up here right away. We left the room and walked the strip a bit, grabbed dinner, and came back about 3 hours later to find no towels. Called housekeeping again and they told us they'd get them up here right away. 45 minutes later and we finally got a knock on the door. But instead of giving us 1 bath towel, 2 wash cloths, and 1 hand towel, we got 3 bath towels, 3 wash cloths, and no hand towel. I guess we made it work, but little attention to detail.

Day\/Night 3 (8\/10) - I FINALLY realized what the god awful stench was on the casino floor... It's stale cigarette smoke mixed with some sh*tty air freshener that makes the cigarette smoke worse.

Day\/Night 4 (8\/11) - Went to the Grand Canyon South Rim, so it was a relief to get out of this place.

Day\/Night 5 (8\/12) - Needed to get online to buy some NHL Stadium Series tickets. Tried logging onto their WiFi, and that's a joke. IF you can connect, it's usually slower than molasses, and frequently gives errors when it won't load web pages. So we ran down to the Business Center to use a computer. Minimum $5 just to log on... I guess they're not making any money on the casino floor, they need to make up costs elsewhere. We also noticed a number of people that walked into the Business Center asking for towels too (common theme, no?).

SPA SUITE- 3.75 stars
The spa suite in NYNY was very nice. We went for my husband's birthday.  When I first walked into the room there was a smell like cigarettes,  but it might just be the hotel smell.  After a while I got used to it and didn't notice it for the rest of the 3 night stay.  The room was clean and we had a great view on the 23rd floor.  The room service was great.  The food was good,  not too bad on price,  and it was delivered within 20 minutes. 
THE SPA-the spa is the reason we went.  It was in the room so you could still watch the TV from it.  Very relaxing.  The only thing is that after the first night we used it my husband and I got red bumps on our stomach and arms. They looked like bug bites! I goggled it and we came to the conclusion that it was a bacteria in the spa  (this is OUR conclusion). We think it was the spa because when we got in we didn't have red bumps and when we got out we took a shower, dried off and that's when we noticed the bites\/bumps.  I called the manager the next morning to inform her and to ask if we could have chlorine wipes to clean the spa. She was very nice but said they didn't have any.  She said she would notify the room cleaning manager.  I was ready to just leave at that point but my husband said we could get rubbing alcohol at the CVS near the hotel and rinse the spa before using it again.  That worked! No new bites\/bumps after that.  We poured rubbing alcohol and a little tea tree oil in the spa before each time we used it. After that we were able to enjoy the rest of our stay there. 
Would we stay again? Yes, I would just pack rubbing alcohol and tea tree oil so we could apply it to the spa before we used it.

Don't try early check in they get your information and never call you. When we first checked in the lady at the front desk was really rude until me and my boyfriend told her we would be moving to NV. She got my number at 12:00 pm and said we would be contacted from 1-3pm. At 2:30 we called the front desk and a lady said she would call back in 5 minutes and never called back. In the beginning they give you a slip telling you what floor your on ; ours said floor 35. So of course, the lady doesn't call me back so I call at 2:45 and they tell us were in room 3711. We go to the 35th floor and there's no 3711 it's on the 37th floor. Once we got in the room it's a king size bed but cramped. The TV set is so close to the bed. We did order room service and if I could rate room service alone it would be 5 stars the guy that came was really nice and had everything we needed.

Stayed in the Empire tower. Sad, tired affair - saggy sheets, hairs in toilet, smells from wash basin, beat up elevator. Everyone of the toilets on the casino floor was spattered with feces. Food options are sub par.

Until management has the decency to do a major upgrade, they should not align their name with that great city.

Yuck.

I have been wanting to stay at NYNY for the longest time! I'm glad I finally got the chance to book a room here! I went for the Madison Deluxe room and upon arriving after booking through my MLife membership I was greeted by a nice representative! I originally booked for a king but was told they were all out! So because of the request not being granted I was able to get two queens on a high floor providing a very nice strip view as well as a view of the roller coaster! The room itself was very spacious and provided everything i needed just for the short stay! The bathroom is rather small and the fact that the ice machine didn't work was super annoying!! I waited an hour and returned thinking that maybe it needed time to make the ice but this still didn't work! I wasn't going to go to a different floor for ice either! Other than the ice drama and the bathroom being way too small the overall stay was just okay! Maybe I'll try booking the suite with the whirlpool in the middle of the room next time..

Embarrassingly, the only thing I remember about my stay at New York New York was that the rooms were small, the bathrooms ... I don't remember, but the pool was incredible.

This is probably one of the few properties I stayed at where I stayed during a time where going to the pool was possible. For some reason I tend to avoid Vegas when it's a reasonable weather outside. The 92 degree day meant that the pool was the perfect place to chill, literally, and relax with a drink and have absolutely zero agenda or worry while the boys went gambling through the casino.

I heard that they have great minimums, especially during the day or late late at night but I'm not too much of a gambler so I wouldn't know. My stay here was so memorable because it was so relaxing, which isn't really a word you usually use to describe a Vegas vacation. Nevertheless, there is a small complaint. What is with that Coyote Ugly bar? I was so expecting some hot girls at the bar.

Stayed here for my first trip to Vegas this past weekend. I have no big complaints but I didn't spend much time outside of sleeping here. The atmosphere is pretty cool. The donut shop is really good and of course Nathan's. Didn't get a chance to ride the rollercoaster sadly, next time for sure. We had a smoking room but it was really clean and nice. I am super sensitive to smoke and didn't smell anything. My only complaint is how loud the cleaning staff is and when we first checked in we had to ask for a blanket but everyone who worked here was really nice. I want to try other places but would stay here again.

stayed here for 6 days. I eat at there nicer restraunts. went to there show, did a bit of
 gambling had pretty ok time. i would have maybe liked a little better customer service. spent  a bit of money and never got noticed. but over all the place is nice and pretty clean and rooms are good but the pillows suck.

We didn't stay at New York-New York but we came to the dueling piano bar after our late flight into town.  We ended up getting a table and quick service all night which was exactly what we wanted.  

The piano guys do a good job of engaging the crowd and we had a blast on our first night in town.  We've come here every trip and I'm sure we'll be there again.  Check it out.

My favorite place to gamble hands down.  I sat at one $5 blackjack table for about 4 hours.  The dealers were all really awesome and the pit boss's were hilarious.  The crowd there isn't too booshie nor salty, but a perfect diverse group.

They made me a player's club card which I was very proud to have!  Not bad for my first time at the tables.  :)

I would say this is the hotel that stay's most true to its theme, of New York of course. Not only does it look like NYC from the outside, but even walking on the inside it feels like you are roaming a mini NYC. 
There a section in the hotel where alot of the restaurants are bunched up together and there are so many choices from pizza, hot dogs sandiwches, seafood crepes, mexican, irish, italian, chinese, and even a steakhouse. Which if u ever and in this casino, make sure to pass their Gallagher's Steakhouse because they have a meat display case that shows how they age their meat, pretty cool to look at.

The front of the NYNY has like a plaza of shops, such as a large 2 story Hershey's store, a silly fun shop called Stupidiotic, and the best addition of them all..... Shake Shack!!!! In case you don't know what that is, its basically the In n Out of the East coast, plus they serve beer!!

I took the beautiful Carin S. (my lovely mom) on a mother and daughter trip to Vegas. Holy crap we had fun! I'm surprised Vegas is still standing after our trip. New York New York was wonderful and I'd sure stay there over and over again! We checked in fairly quickly considering it was peak time and spring break. When we got to our room I was amazed! The view was great and the room was very modern. I could have easily spent the weekend relaxing in the room. But this is Vegas, so of course we didn't. After we polished off a bottle of champagne we were off to the casino to give away our money. With a good buzz, I falsely felt lucky and donated my money to the starving casino fund. I have to say I had such a blast doing it that I didn't even mind! And lets get to the yelpers favorite part of places...The FOOD! Greasy New York style pizza, Starbucks, a really great Mexican restaurant, and room service! OH MY! My fat kid was blushing with all the choices. I have to recommend the pizza the most. It was a great way to start a night of drinking with my mom. 
All in all we had a blast, lost a few bucks, but made some great memories. New York New York was a wonderful hotel\/casino and I'd stay there again in a heart beat!

I can't pass up the Manhattan Express Roller Coaster whenever I'm in Vegas.  It's always on the short list of things to do.  NYNY is also pretty spectacular to view from across the street, and you can't resist going inside to check it out.

Last time I stopped by there was some significant remodeling going on in the middle of the casino floor that caused some inconvenience in maneuvering around.  

I made an attempt to gain access to the Coyote Ugly bar\/club one Wednesday or Thursday night but the line was backed up way, way out the door.  

I'd like to stay here at least once if a decent room rate was offered.   Maybe that'll happen next year.

Stayed at New York New York this past trip to Las Vegas and had to say I loved it. It's not your typical Vegas strip hotel and has great character to it. They have an awesome variety of restaurants inside that can fit to any budget and the food is great. The rooms were immaculate and my view of the strip was amazing. Awesome shops and night life at the hotel. The pools laid out nicely and is pretty well sized but not huge like a couple other hotels I've stayed at. The casino floor is only average though in terms of Vegas casinos. The beds were some of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on though! I would say if you are looking to explore Vegas and stay at one of the more interesting hotels this hotel is the one for you. Great location on the strip and did I mention they have a roller coaster on top?

This really deserves a 3.5\/5 stars. The room was the largest I have stayed in, with a separate suite, but the view was poor and it was loud due to the roller coaster. The casino itself is great. Would recommend this to friends.

I stayed here on New Years Eve and paid almost $600 for the most basic room with a view to the strip. Our FIRST problem began right off the gate. We checked in at 3:30 (right at check-in time) and our room was still showing "dirty" per the check-in attendant so he called to make sure the status was showing correct and stalled us for a good 20 minutes while he was on the phone checking the "status"...im sure just waiting for the maids to finish cleaning. After the 20 minutes he tells us "oh its ready, IDK what took so long, they had me on hold." RIIIIIGHT...so then we go up to our FIRST room and the maid is still in the room and then blurted out "oops I heard a different room number" which of course, confirms that they were stalling us so they can hurry up and clean the room...this was not the only problem with the room. It was NOT facing the strip! Let me remind you we paid an additional $100 or so to make this happen and we double checked with the check in person before we went up and he confirmed it would be...the room view was HORRIBLE and facing the side strip as well as a HUGE part of the building below us -_- . I then called to talk to a manager and she moved us from  room 1625 i believe to room 2360, she then told me they would send a bell attendant to help us move our stuff..20 minutes later,,,nobody got there. Since we had reservations somewhere else at 6PM we decided to just move the stuff ourselves, went down stairs and got our new keys...by that time the line to get on the elevator was RIDICULOUS. We lost another 30 minutes there. Needless to say we couldn't make it to where we had our reservations for which had been planned for a while now. My partner was beyond pissed so we waited until the morning at check out to talk to a manager about the domino effect not having a CLEAN, strip view room ready when we got there. From the time we got there to the time we walked into the room we had already wasted an hour and forty minutes.

We talked to the check out lady and said she would not charge the resort fees a nice $38 savings (WOW!) and insult if you ask me. I then proceeded to tell her that it wasn't enough due to all the time wasted and making us miss our reservations, she then told us she might have a letter in the back to where we can get a free upgrade at our next stay. (Who would want to stay again after that experience) so i kindly declined and explained this to her. She then went to talk to what I am assuming is the manager and came back saying they would comp us a room for ONE night at a later time which of course would have black out dates. 
We agreed because it sounded like the best they could do which still doesn't make me happy. She then proceeded to say that they were "out" of letters and they would send me an email with the letter "tomorrow" which was yesterday...of course I still haven't received anything, oh and they STILL charged me the $70 they said I would not be charged!

They completely ruined our FIRST New Years experience in Vegas! The LEAST they can do is comp us a few days with no black out dates or another chance at having a good experience in Vegas on New Years Eve\/Day! SMH!

So this place eventually won me over because quite frankly we didn't start off on the best foot.

Reservation was for a Park Avenue, King Bed Room.

I arrived on a Sunday around 7:30PM and was told that they no longer had king bed non-smoking rooms even though that's what I reserved.  So they gave me a double bed room, 12th floor.  Upon arriving I was less than pleased with the room.  The desk was in the middle of the beds facing the back wall.  It was awkward.  The view was crap (to be expected for the lower paid rooms) and lastly the window blind was stuck open!  It couldn't close.  That's no fun when you're trying to sleep while the sun comes up.

I went back down to the reservation desk to pick up my complimentary buffet vouchers as I forgot earlier.  This time I met with a different person.  I mentioned that my window blind was broken and asked if there were some way to fix it.  Instead he said he could move rooms for me and I asked if there were a King room available as that was my original reservation.  Rest assured (just a mere 20 mins after my initial check in) a King room was magically available!  I'm not sure if the original female check in person did their due diligence.

The king room worked much better for me because I got a bigger bed (obvious) and the desk was to the side of the room.  And I got a higher floor (27 versus 12) with a slightly better view.  Everything else between the King Room and the Double Bed room were basically the same.

It was pretty easy to walk from here to MGM, Excaliber, and Tropicana hotels.  The Hersey World store was a nice place buy some souvenirs.  I enjoyed the food court area some nights if I were a rush to get a bite to eat.  You get a younger vibe at this hotel than like...Tropicana.

The Brooklyn Bridge area was nice to hang out and listen to street music.  

And it was pretty affordable to stay here.  I would return.

I stayed here with my girlfriend because her daughter got room for her birthday.  This hotel is pretty old and need renovation in a few months. it was a clean room and the beds were comfortable.  They do not offer shuttle to and from hotel.

This place is visually entertaining, lots to see and do. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The pool is just "ok" nothing special but I've seen worse.

The worst part about this casino\/hotel and will keep me from staying here again is the tone and mood of so many dealers. Some (very few) were a ton of fun but my friends and i encountered quite a few irritable and obviously bored dealers here. They would snap at us and other gamblers and were often caught staring off into space with absolutely zero interest or attention paid to the table and guests. We learned that tips are shared with all dealers at the end of the night which seems like a really bad way to incent them to be engaged in the guests and create a fun atmosphere. They get tips whether they are nice or not making it feel like they just don't have to try therefore they don't. Last year when we were here we picked new york new york because the gaming area was super fun with the dealers, this year they killed that :( sad...they also have awful wi-fi but that felt the same all over the strip there is most likely too much interference so not their fault but it is part of the surprise $20 a day resort fee which was disappointing
A very cool hotel.  It is big and has a fun roller coaster.

I like it. There pizza is very good and the service is efficient. I love the interior. I'm a sucker for whimsy, so it works for me. The pizza is also, very very good. One of my favorites on the strip.

Pick pocketed twice my last two stays.  I'm a VIP  comped guest.  Treated very well.  The hotel is a hotbed of drunks, thieves and out of control screaming cigar smoking jerks. Worse security people in all of Nevada.  They don't care.  This is a small casino for the number of room's.  Hard to find a table of any denomination that you can enjoy. Some jerks just think being rude is OK.  Great food.  Pool is almost always closed. I have never seen a larger arcade.  Explains why there's so many children.  This is not the Vegas experience I have looked forward to.  Done and done, won't be back.

The checkin experience was equivalent to a roadside budget motel during a motorcycle festival in Oklahoma. The only difference was that the manager spoke English and I wasn't paying $49 a night. 

When you book your room 3.5 months in advance you expect that it's available when you arrive, right? Wrong! There are no guarantees, no exceptions, and no compassion. The manager on duty was short, and intolerant of my request to be placed in the room that I paid for. Additionally, the rooms are outdated and the beds are extraordinarily uncomfortable. 

Key points; Outdated, unprofessional, inconsiderate. You Definitely do NOT get what you pay for. You're better off at the Super 8.

Only thing I can find wrong with this property was in the rooms they need to have plugs conveniently located by the bed so you can charge your phone they had one plug that was a accessible because it was on a lamp but the other one was behind the bed. The casino the restaurants and the overall Hotel we're good and we would definitely stay here again.

I've stayed at several hotels on the strip.  Not great.  Not horrible.  They seem to be following the trend of the airlines.  Want early check-in?  Pay a fee.  Want late check out?  Pay a fee.  This is on top of the resort fee.  Room types and preferences are "requests" only unless you pay a fee.

We booked a basic room and at check in we asked about upgrades.  We could have upgraded to a strip view room for a small fee, and a more deluxe room for $20 per night.  We opted for this one.  

The room was nice.  But the pillows were hard.  And the hot water in the bathroom was hot, but if you turned on the cold, it was instantly cold.  It was hard to find the balance to get warm water.  Internet was slow. It's hard to get off of the property from the valet area due to construction of a new arena.

Nearly all of the staff we encountered was very friendly, even the cleaning staff we passed in the hall.

It was a lackluster experience for us.  However, for our stay the price was right.
the novelty of the roller coaster is worth four stars but the price knocks it down to a three.

Everything was great, we just had some problems walking up the Strip in the early September heat. Played at three tables; the first one was not nice at all, even after I tipped her more than normal (it was my first time gambling at a table!), but the other two were perfect.
Our room was a good five minutes' walk from the elevators, which was annoying; if that's what "strip view" means, then it's not worth it.

These people don't even deserve one star worst experience ever... DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! I stayed here The weekend of March 12,2016 only to be the worst experience ever at a hotel in Las Vegas I had property stolen from my room i reported it they sent Security who took an incident report. He asked when so I check out I told him the following day he said someone will be in contact with me before I check out. So the following day I checked out with front desk I asked to speak with somebody in regards to my incidents I didn't want to leave without a name or a department I could contact I told them I lived in California. front desk manager still refused to give me any information other than someone will be in contact with after arguing for 35 minutes I left all I wanted was contact information since I live in California but after calling another Hotel and expressing my situation I got a contact who then put me in contact with a Mary Little from risk management. She stated she would be handing the investigation and that she would contact me the following Monday even stated she would put it on her calendar she wasn't sure how long the investigation be but even if it wasn't finished she would update me. Well the day came u never got a phone call I finally got in contact with her days later after being persistent. She was rude and told me she wasn't gonna update me daily I told her I didn't expect her to but it would have been nice for her to keep her word. she then proceeded to say the investigation was still on going and she didn't know how long it would be. Two weeks past nothing I finally decided to call again spoke with hotel manager Jennifer who said she would leave Mary an email to contact me five days pass still nothing finally got in contact with her today after speaking with hotel manager Robert who sent Mary a message Mary finally contacted me and says the investigation is done there's no evidence that my items were missing I told her of course that wouldn't be the items were stolen out of my room there's no cameras in the room she said well hopefully you have insurance there's nothing she can do. From the beginning these people showed me NO CONCERNS for me or my missing items. And I forgot to mention the day I checked in two hours after. housekeeping just walked in as I was changing did not knock reported to supervisor  because she walked in while I was changing and I had no clothes on no even then did I get a Im sorry!!!!!

Aside from having to pay a resort fee to stay at this hotel of approximately $20\/night (BTW, this fee is taxed), I had an enjoyable experience. It is interesting to peer out of your window and see a roller coaster go by your window. 

Since it was my first time staying at this hotel, I was dreading having to enter into this property since it is located on the NW corner of Tropicana and Las Vegas Blvd. Since I was exiting off the 15 freeway, I wasn't sure if there was an entrance off of Tropicana. As I was making my approach, I did notice an entrance off of Tropicana Avenue. However, the left turn lane can be easily missed at night. Also, there is a long curb delineating the left turn lane so if you miss it, you will have to enter through Las Vegas Blvd which is not really the best idea due to the traffic congestion. When you get to the parking garage, there is an attendant who supposedly monitors people entering the garage but all he does is just say hello to you. Once you find parking, there are two pedestrian bridges that lead into the property on the 3rd floor. Actually, they both lead into the lobby registration area so don't worry about getting lost although the signage can be spotty at this property as I was confused initially as to where registration was.

Being that it is a MGM property, many of the properties are right next to each other such as MGM across the street, Monte Carlo, Excalibur, Luxor, and Mandalay Bay are pretty close by if you just take the free tram.

I love that New York New York has a wide range of restaurants from budget to pricey food, there is something for everyone. I really wanted to eat a Nathan's hot dog, but of course got distracted from all the other food and entertainment choices on the strip. Since I was inebriated for most of the time in Vegas, I found myself stumbling to Sirrico's Pizza frequently. 

Even though I was on vacation, I found myself also heading to their gym on the 3rd floor of the Empire Tower. It was actually a very decent facility, must bigger than the gym at the Tropicana. Since the gym was included in the resort fee, I might as well use it since I was paying for it. 

The casino area had a wide range of games that seemed to be quite reasonably priced for the strip that is, although if you wanted lower limit tables and slot machines, the downtown Las Vegas area would be better for that. 

Overall, I enjoyed my experience at this hotel and casino.

Ambiance très détendue, accueil super sympas dans un style new yorkais les boutiques intéressantes et les restaurants sont abordables pour une ville comme Las Vegas.
Les suites un peu vieillottes mais confortables et bien entretenues, literie nickel, salle de bain pratique, bonne insonorisation et wifi gratuit.
Un bon plan dans le Strip.

Not worth what you pay $70 plus $33 for resort fee.

After speaking with other guests, it seems like some parts of the hotel differ or are out dated. Room was very clean and quiet with great view, but we did not have a coffee maker or a fridge like other guests.... And the cleaning woman would keep entering despite the fact that we had the do not disturb sign up. Staff was kind of unhelpful\/borderline rude. 

It was our first time in Vegas, so we were nervous about being off the strip. Ended up seeing my Aunt's hotel just a short walk off strip (Hooters). It was surprisingly nice--they had a whole suite for way less than we paid. 

Overall it wasn't a horrible experience, but it was definitely an expensive one.

The rooms are nice enough, but were very warm, and no lock on the bathroom door. It beats me why anyone would want to stay here or anywhere near this part of The Strip. Congested and the prices suck for everything! The internet stinks here too. Then these greedy jerks charge you 20 dollars a night plus tax for it. The casino itself stinks too! Terrible paying machines, and not a good variety. Do yourself a favor and stay downtown or a casino a little ways away from The Strip.

For the amount of you pay, the locations a steal. We checked in twice over the course of a week and both times our rooms were upgraded (once to a strip view and once to a deluxe) upon check in and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful.
We stayed in the Chrysler tower for the majority of our stay. If you're traveling with a lot of bags\/kids\/things that need to be lugged or pushed, enlist the help of the bell desk as it can be a maze to get to your room. We stayed on the 21st floor and I swear a vent from some burger place shot right up into the hallway. The room didn't have a fridge or microwave, and the bathroom looked like it could use some upgrading, but the beds were so plush and comfortable.
....I'm also pretty convinced the room we were staying in was haunted. The bathroom light turned on and off and so did the TV. Also we would come back to a completely dark room at night when we distinctly remember leaving a light on.......
Other than the ghosts its a pretty decent place to stay. Casino doesn't get too crowded and there's Hersey's World!

Stayed here for my birthday back in November.
Absolutely loved what this hotel had to offer.

I have to say that this was the best one, If I ever came back to Vegas, I would definitely stay at the New York New York Hotel Casino. 
I love the breakfast special for people staying at the hotel, It was very accommodating.

I love to salsa dance, they had a nice little spot right in the hotel!

Stayed for 5 days in the Spa Suite. 
Hot tub is amazing, the lack of ventilation is not ideal. The maid came in one Saturday while my friend and I were napping and proceeded to try and have a conversation about how much we drank the night before after we repeatedly told her we didn't need anything and that we were sleeping. It was a really weird experience.
Overall had a great time!

The casino is terrible. Keep eating up all my money. Please don't gamble here! Come here to play video games, ride the roller coaster and have breakfast, lunch or dinner. This place is like a giant vacuum cleaner! Suck up all your money! Don't gamble!

We stayed here last year and this was not our first vegas trip. My husband and I really do not want to spend crazy amounts of money on a hotel because - really - who stays in their room in Vegas?! not this girl. I had previously stayed here and I actually really liked the place, so we decided to stay here because the prices were reasonable and the location is good. Mind you we are cheap travelers, no I am not paying $20 for a beer because I bring my own beer, which we did BUUUUT NYNY does not have fridges in the room :( I mean the prices are not high but I am sure they could spare $50 and buy little fridges for each room come on people even walmart sells mini fridges and even super 8 has little fridges (told ya i was cheap). Other than that we had a good time! The pool was really nice and we spent a lot of time just bumming around. The rooms were clean and comfy. We had a good time!

I've only been to LV once, and I stayed at New York New York. I loved that I could mix two of my favorite US cities together like that :D

The first thing I did when I arrived was throw my bags in my room and then went straight to the roller coaster. I call it the CSI coaster, since Gil would ride it when he was in deep thought at the end of a CSI episode. I decided to ride it just like him, pensive, with no smiling or yelling. It was hilarious. 
I loved the smell when you walk in....like vanilla. It was so nice! I loved the pizza place downstairs, and the piano bar....the magic shop....everything about this hotel I loved. 
The room was nothing special but who hangs out in their room? I would stay there again in a heartbeat, although I would like to check out some of the other hotels (except Circus Circus...who would WANT to stay in the Clown Hotel??).

I have very strong feelings about this hotel.  Probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed in with the exception of some gross shack of a hotel I stayed in during a visit to Key West. 

I have nothing good to say about this hotel with the exception that the beds were comfortable. We stayed here for a convention and we had our room and flight expensed. This was not our choice but I was still looking forward to it as I have never stayed at the NYNY. Check in was extremely frustrating. We were given 4 different sets of directions by 4 different workers to our elevators. The elevators are not clearly marked or distinguished from the other towers (there are several sets of elevators). Seriously awful planning on the hotels part. I think it took us 1\/2 an hour to find the right set of elevators. 

The room was on the 33rd floor and when we arrived I noticed that there is a pink film on the window. It gives a weird red hue during the daytime and makes the room look even smaller and darker than it is at night. There is no source of natural lighting in the room what so ever. It's like a tiny outdated bat cave.  As a  woman, it is the most poorly lit room I have ever stayed in. I would actually have to get ready and then go downstairs to the casino bathrooms to check my makeup because I literally never knew what I actually looked like when I left my room. I was ready to leave the hotel by the first night but didn't want to insult the company I was traveling with.   Also, to say that the rooms and hotel is dated, is an understatement.

Let me also say, that ALL 3 MORNINGS of my stay, prior to 9am housekeeping would just walk right into our room totally unannounced. Of all of the hotels and times I have been to Vegas a maid has never even knocked at our door prior to 10am or just walked right in.

Third time staying at New York New York.  The check in process is quick and everyone is professional and extremely nice.  The rooms themselves are spacious and clean.  We ordered room service for breakfast a couple of times and the food is always delicious, if not better than an actual restaurant.  I would recommend trying it at least once during your stay. Overall it has been a great experience staying here all three times.  I have yet to be disappointed.

Sorry but this is my last visit, EVER, until they offer free parking again. I will also change my vote when it's free again . The "resort fees' are insane enough but now you want $10 MORE a day from me? I'm coming there to SPEND MY MONEY and you are giving me a reason not to anymore. 
No, sorry, you will never get it. I will just go off-strip if the rest do this and eventually, skip Vegas all together. This policy will ruin Vegas for me forever. It's the straw on the camel's back. I used to like it here and the main floor food options were great fun. Too bad.


NO MORE MGM PROPERTIES UNTIL I CAN PARK FOR FREE.

Got one of the worst rooms ever...came from Florida to a 700 dollar room that was not cleaned for 3 days and i was there 4 days...grossest room and trash on every floor...i WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN AND I WILL SCRESM TO THE MOUNTAIN TOP TO EVERY ONE I KNOW...DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

Was heading to Vegas for one night and choose New York New York as it was one of the cheaper packages for flights+hotel. Right from the beginning our experience was fantastic! Jenny at the front desk was very knowledgable and fulfilled all my requests!  Even to the point of checking in our room at 11:45am as it was ready with no charge! Hotel was clean, tidy and pretty modern considering it's not one of the newest hotels. The hotel has everything you need (even a rollercoaster), business center allows you to print boarding passes for FREE which is great as Spirit Airlines charges for not having printed boarding passes. Really like the location as you're pretty much in the heart of everything. Very friendly staff, even the housekeeping staff wish you a great day as you pass them. Highly recommend this hotel for you short visits to Vegas!! I'll be staying there again!

Love this hotel and most of the staff here.  

Roller Coaster Review: As a New Yorker I know that sometimes you come across the wrong people and their attitudes on daily basis. But, this time I got one after another from the roller coaster staff.  The older woman was my first encounter and then followed by the gentlemen boarding the passengers on the ride.  Finally, the guy standing behind the counter was too busy on his cell phone to pull up the proper photo with me in it.  Really, you guys need to get it together!!!

I have this weird obsession with staying at a different hotel in Vegas everytime I'm there until I find my favorites.  I also categorize them based on my needs.

If I need an inexpensive, clean, but no frills room, I usually go Rio, Luxor, Westin, or, now, NYNY.  For luxury rooms, the CityCenter or Encore.  For a true getaway, it's Green Valley Ranch (which also tends to be very budget friendly vs the strip).  

Anyways I enjoyed my stay at NYNY.  I received a comped room via MyVegas and also paid for a 2nd night ($80).  When I arrived, I decided to upgrade to the Madison Ave room for an additional $20\/night.  The rooms didn't look that much different, although the Madison Ave room has a pillowtop and 50 more sq ft.  

My room was a long trek from the elevator, which was probably the most annoying thing about the room.  The room itself was slightly antiquated.  A large armoire stood near the king sized bed, with a small table and desk along with 2 comfortable chairs, which made it a nice place for a conversation.  Central air was available.  The bathroom was a bit outdated...no individual tub\/shower, it was a combo.  The necessary amenities were included (which I think are the same as Luxor).  

The gym was small but decent enough.  It had freeweights, some cardio machines, a pull up bar setup, leg press, shoulder press, and a few other machines.  

There wasn't a mini-fridge in the room at all, which was mildly annoying, since I like to keep extra water in the room.
