Overall, I wouldn't mind staying here again if I need a decent, basic room in Vegas around the $50-$60 range.

I didn't Stay at New York, New York during my  Vegas Trip but I wished I had.  Looks very nice all around and quite a few attractions in the Hotel itself.  A good variety of restaurants inside, from high priced to some of the dirt cheap awesome deals t hat were the best on the strip.  No lower-priced machines on the premises that we could find, which was kind of odd considering the demographic of their patrons, but what can you do.  I intend to stay here on my next trip to Sin City.

Room is pretty decent, customer service is horrible, OMG, those people look n acted like they hated their jobs, apart from that it is in a very convinient place near everything, n it had almost everything we needed

The statue of liberty and a roller coaster right outside my window, I must be on something. Comfortable stay and the area is well-kept. The hotel may look older on the outside, but the inside doesn't reflect its cover! Plenty of inexpensive quick food\/snack selections downstairs.

This was my first time here and I fell in love with the place.  It really clean and that was the first thing that struck me compared to some of the other places I have stayed.  The other thing I love about it is the size.  It's not too big its not too small it's just right.  Just enough tables.  The rooms are not so far away from the casino but you are far enough away there is no bother from the noise.  

My experience with staff was all positive at tables, resteraunt,  in the halls, check in and out it was all good and pleasant.  The price is right too.  Combine all of this with location location location and shazam!

All in all, I can't complain about the place. We upgraded from a Park Hotel room to a Marquis suite and I gotta say, unless you're in need of the mini Jacuzzi that comes with the upgrade, it's not worth the money. We were in a group, and had three rooms at three different levels, and I'd say the Madison Ave. room is all you really need.

The hotel is fun. The pool is no frills, it's got some good music, but it's family oriented and not the day club atmosphere. The pizza when you're coming back from a late night hits the spot, and the Greenwich Village Coffee company beat Starbucks hands down in my book for a good pastry and cup of iced coffee. 

The rooms were clean, the service was good, and so it goes. The one down is a down not just for New York New York but all the M Life hotels- not only is their loyalty product beyond confusing, the customer service for that in particular was incredibly horrendous. I looked into it since you can transfer points between that and Hyatt now, but I must say, it's nothing impressive whatsoever.

So stay at New York New York if you are looking for a cool mid range hotel on the strip, with some good eats inside, and some fun just around the corner!

Meh...
The wait to check in was long and annoying. The spa was mediocre (facial was really great; massage seemed rushed and routine) 

The rooms decor was lousy. It was very old fashioned and desperately needed an upgrade.

The food.... The MGM has much better offerings. The buffet, The District, etc. 

Find somewhere else to stay!

I like New York New York's design and theme. They do a good job with the atmosphere. I've stayed here about 3 different times when I've gone to Vegas. If I want a cheap stay with a decent room I'll stay here because that's what you get. If you are looking for a nice luxurious room like the Cosmo or Wynn you won't get it here unless you get a premium suite. I would stay at NYNY again because I like the hotel and the staff is nice too. I'd say the Luxor and New York New York are the best bang for your buck on the strip. The roller coaster is fun too

This is a great, if not the best motif hotel \/ casino in Las Vegas. The decor inside is great. It resembles NYC and has the New Yorkers in attendance BIG TIME. That might be the only drawback of this place...

It's always a good time here and I've won money here even. I probably wouldn't stay here but I've heard the rooms are nice. The one thing I did notice were that he drink prices inside NYNY were insanely HIGH. I'd go off the strip if you want to drink...say a place like The Stage Door.

A. Structure looks too busy; ironically, the casino feels too busy as well
B. Seems small inside and way too dark
C. Rooms were adequate 
D. Coyote Ugly, c'mon now...its so over
E. ESPN gets too packed
F. Sports book is not that bad, but tiny

I will not hit again.

I haven't stayed here in 12 years. Kinda disappointed. 

Service was great. All the staff were friendly and helpful 5 stars

Parking has walkways to casino

Casino: smaller but easy layout in a round. Bar and food accessible and affordable. Nothing super fancy. 

Food: love Nine Fine Irishmen. Very tasty and relaxed setting. Pizza is good on second floor. 

Seen Zumanity in the past and enjoyed it

Room: We booked the spa room for the large jacuzzi. This is the only selling point of the room. This is where they lost the stars. The light flickered. The lamp was possessed. The outlet by the tv ( the easy access one for our phone chargers) would spark and turn off. The dresser was missing knobs. These aren't deal breakers. The room was clean. The bed was comfortable but this room didn't have a fridge or minibar. There were a few little things, annoying things. We didn't call them up for maintenance because the point to be on vacation is to have a stress free stay. These things should have been checked. The last thing I want to do is waste time moving rooms and repacking all my crap up when I have a dinner and show both nights. 

If this was a comp room or the cheap room, I would kinda understand... that it's just to pass out before you go out and party again. This was a SPA room. I wanted to spend time in it. Soaking and relaxing. The lights flickered - not that I didn't use the other lights but it's not the experience I paid for. 

TLDR room is 2 stars. For an upgraded room it was lame.

New York, New York took my wife and I's Vegas virginity away from us back in August of 2006. It was hotter than hell that week! 110 to 118 the whole time we were there!

This is one of the last themed hotels on the strip. We had a great time at this hotel. The roller coaster was fun but made me sick. Everyone who worked at the hotel was very nice and pleasant. Our room was clean and comfortable and had a great view of the mountains. Those were the most beautiful sunrises and sunsets I have ever seen!

My only two complaints are that our room was right near the roller coaster which made it hard to sleep at times and the fact that this hotel is far from all the action in the middle of the strip. (Wynn, Caesars, Bellagio etc) You are also around all of the "porn slappers" and the people that try to get you to take timeshare tours.

All and all a solid place to stay while in Vegas.

Good for kids because they have arcade section and roller coaster.

But please, please, please, fix the roller coaster because they are bumpy on the head and my son was feeling so dizzy after the ride.

Food court also close to the arcade, of course choices are for kids liking.

Casino review only:

Not bad.  Great variety of games, various denominations and we can often play here for quite some time.  GF got lucky during our May trip and won $$$$ here, so we were all happy.  Service doesn't come around as often as we'd like.  Actually, come to think of it, floor assistance took forever when a slot was being funky, but it's okay.  We'll always come back here.  It's convenient, it's tight-spaced (which I normally don't like about casinos, but it works well in here).  Coyote Ugly upstairs (yeah! for boots!).  We ate at the italian restaurant downstairs, and that was okay.  Wouldn't necessarily eat there again.  As the server was pouring oil (for the bread), I pushed over my plate (because I want my own) and she looked and me and RUDELY said, you know this is oil for the bread, right?!?!?!?!  Lady, look, I want to make my oil the way that I want.  I don't want to be picky if my cousin or her husband or le BF don't want a crap load of pepper & vinegar in my oil.  My oil, my way.  What are they used to serving, chimpanzees?  Yes you moron I know it's oil.

Other than that though, I truly like this place.  Not sure if we'll ever stay here, but we'll always be here to play.

In light of the response from mgmt & after realizing I never asked for any changes or let them know about any issues I might have had during my stay, bumping this up to a four star. Considering that I've stayed at Excalibur , CC & other 2\/3 stars on the strip, NYNY was definitely not in that category and deserving of another  1\/2 star. Thanks , Christie, your response is greatly appreciated :)

I noticed the same thing at the MGM and Excalibur also - also MGM properties: the doorman actually delays the boarding process of taxicabs rather than speeds it up. It seems to be just a way to gather tips by making you board one at a time and first asking you where you want to go, and then telling the taxi driver. Would have been 7-8 times more efficient to have 7-8 cabs pull up simultaneously and direct guests to the cab they should board, as they do in some great airports.

After staying at more luxurious hotels like the Venetian, you can't help but miss the high-end amenities here at the New York New York. However, rooms are clean and hotel is lively. This place is very cost effective, with our mlife rewards we scored a king size room for only $49 a night plus resort fees. Not bad! We're not disappointed and would stay here again. Front desk had great service upon check in and accommodated us with early check in, which was very much appreciated being that I had my wedding dress and other things for my wedding with me. Overall happy with our hotel choice :)

This place is awesome.  I've stayed here a lot because they give the best comps and deals.  I do wish I wouldn't find issues each time but I always do.

Invited guest line is supposed to be VIP treatment yet they only have 1 rep working at a time.  My last stay there I had to wait 20 min for the guest in front of me to finish strangling the reps throat about the best deal for 1 more night.  I could've gone through the normal line 5 times if I tried and wouldn't have missed the first 2 rounds of a prelim UFC fight if it weren't for this.  Anyways talk about bad checkin service as the IG line wasn't even open to checkin the time before that.

Also on my most recent trip the people in the room next to us seem to just be blasting music all night and it took 3 calls over a 45 min period before the security finally showed up to enter and quiet them down.  It was 4 in the morning and the music was so loud they couldn't even hear him knocking. It shouldn't take any calls for these people to be quoted down.  Some places just need a "room off" button for disturbances in the middle of the night.

Besides this last trip most of my experiences are really good and if the deals keep coming I will definitely go back as long as there aren't any repeats checkin hogs or midnight rappers.
Spa in the room was nice, but the beds aren't comortable, and the pillows were like rubber. Casino is smokey compared to other places.

We stayed there for 2 nights, the staff was very good. The rooms left a lot to desire. Unless you get a suite no fridge or coffee pot. Even in the cheapest hotels you get a coffee pot. Bed was ok the AC was noises and kept my wife up. While we didn't spend much time in the room, it was our saving grace. I won't stay at the location again.

I had worst customer service I've ever experience on numerous occasions while staying here for a week for my Wedding. I brought 30 other people to stay here as well and I can assure you not one of us will stay here again after this experience. My sister stayed at the Cosmo, great service there. Worth a few extra bucks to stay down the street.

My mother in law works here so I may be biased lol.

We usually just come in to see my mother in law but a couple nights ago she got a room. The registration line was amazingly long for a Sunday night but they were quick! The lady who worked there was very friendly and gave us a room with a strip view! So we went up to the room and it was a pretty good size. The room had enough space to run around in and it was just your standard two queen beds size room. As for the bathroom though it was on the smaller side, which surprised me. Other than that everything was great!!
I stayed here for 2010 CES.  You know what, I like this place.  It is clean, and doesn't reek of smoke.

It's been a few years but I want to come back here soo bad.  OK, NO it's not authentic New York, it would be impossible to do it.  Now it is pretty darn cool if you're a Missouri boy stationed in Cali that gets a chance to hit Vegas for the weekend.  I personally thought the inside was really cool, modern and clean.  Everyone that worked there was really cool.  I didn't get to ride the roller coaster though, next time.  I will be going back to stay here someday when my career gives me a couple days off in a row :)

+2: The casino area: I loved Ten Fine Irishmen! Fun pub with live Irish music! The Piano bar was fun, too. I also liked their eateries better than the nicer hotels. It's weird that Paris and Venetian have McD's and other disgusting chain food eateries. NY NY actually tries to stick to a theme...

-1: The casino area: I know. I loved most of it, but the arcade and roller coaster have to go. Noisy (some of their rooms have double-paned windows, but not all) and attracts a "family" atmosphere. Bleh. It's Vegas - leave the kids at home or go to Circus Circus. Plus it takes away from the theme. 

On a side note, we looked up a review and they were listed as a kid-friendly Vegas hotel. Definitely my bad then. I guess the pubs and go-go girls threw me off. Oops. 

+2: The spa tub: Super romantic and relaxing!

-1: Cleanliness: The rooms weren't filthy by any means. Everything you used, or could see, was clean. However, once we pulled the pillows off of the dresser, dust flew everywhere. Pretty ick. The wall paper was also peeling and dingy. 

+2: The gym: Their gym was conveniently located and nicer than I'd expect to find in a Vegas hotel. They even had complimentary purified water and towels. Sadly, I was too hungover or drunk to use it after the first day.

-1: The neighbors: By far the worst part of my stay. I guess it's not the hotel's fault and they really did try to help. But knowing the clientele this place attracts made the decision to never stay here again an easy one. 

The first night we had a room (with a connecting door) next to a family with a brat (yes, I know. I should have considered their poorly chosen arcade and coaster idea). The brat cried and the parents constantly yelled at it. We moved to another room. Not as nice but quiet... until the next morning. A group of German guys moved in. They brought their own sound system and cranked the European techno full blast, bass pumping. They even used our adjoining wall as a drum for emphasis. Maybe they wanted to let us know which tunes they liked best? The entire floor was serenaded with lovely Euro tech which saved us the trouble of complaining - someone else quickly beat us to it. 

-2: The view. Each room we had a view of the back of other hotels or buildings. At least the second room had a view of the mountains, but the windows were really tiny. 

Total: One star wonder. I would never stay here again. Ever. But they weren't 100% heinous.
Excellent Hotel! You really feel like you are in New York City when you are in the hotel!

Nice suite with in room spa. The beds are very comfortable like home. Room is big with it's own dining area,  living room, 2 TV,  Bose surround system and home like amenities
The bid thumb down is the awful cigarette smell.  My family and i had one year of our  life gone in smoke.    I recommend to this Hotel to smokers only and keep kids away from there.

We booked this stay as Invited Guests through the Players Club. When we arrived, the invited Guests check-in was closed and we spent twenty minutes waiting in the general line. Our room type we'd reserved through our Player's Club invite was not available (we weren't told this however, we got to "discover" it when we walked into our room.) No accomodation was made for this (an upgrade? something to indicate that the property was sorry?), and although we were moved to the room type we'd reserved the following day; we had a beautiful view of a wall and a sliver of skyline. Poor form.

Additionally, this property now seems to be overrun by the "Jersey Shore" crowd. Tons of drunken "Situations" wearing their Ed Hardey and pumping their fists while preying on the stumbling "Snookies" who are too drunk to walk in their ridiculous heels.

Pretty standard room - nothing wrong with that. Good maid service.

EXCELLENT room service. Nothing like breakfast in bed - awesome bagel, cream cheese and lox breakfast, cranberry juice and tea.

Good price, great casino, EXCELLENT restaurants. Gallagher's is the best.

Great game room for kids and cute shops if your interested. Nice that the public bathrooms have individual stall\/room that go all the way to the floor and a solid door. Clean too!
This is the coolest of the theme oriented casinos in Vegas.  It's cheesy but it works.

Why on earth anyone would give this hotel a 4 star rating is beyond me. The only thing i can deduce is that they just don't travel much and have nothing to compare it to.  I stay in a lot of hotels and motels, and other than the Motel 6 I stayed in in the early 80's, I have never stayed in one I disliked more. And I have stayed in all levels of hotels and motels  (5 Star diamond resorts to little roadside motels like Sleep Inn) so I have a pretty good base to compare this to.

For starters, the rooms are dirty and the furniture and carpet is old and dirty.  They have no microwaves, or mini fridges,or even a coffee maker!  The rooms are smaller than the little Econolodge I stayed in in Houston. The tubs have a very high side you have to hang onto something and step over to get in to shower, there is no dresser to lay things on, the beds have indentations in them and I felt like I was sleeping in a hole against the side of something.  You do get a free paper, but you have to go to the gift shop across the lobby to get it.  I worked in my room one day until about 12:30 (noonish).  The housekeepers were cleaning the room next to mine. When I returned that night, they had never come in. Used towels were in the bathroom floor in the pile I'd left them, the bed was unmade, the trash had not been taken out.   When I called to ask if they supplied coffee makers on request, the answer was no.  Basically, they will use any means to lure you to the lobby where all the slots are because they think you are weak and will start playing.  That's an insult to my intelligence. I did not spend one dime in that hotel, other than the room cost. I was there for a company conference they booked and paid for, so I had no choice, but I will NEVER stay at that hotel again!!  I don't know what they do with all the money they make but they sure don't put it into their rooms or amenities. Even the little Econolodge had a coffeemaker!

I had never been to this Casino only driven my it once.  As an amateur photographer, I love the lines and views for pictures from the outside.  You can amazing pictures.  The Casino, very well done inside and lots to do.  If you're a gambler or just a people watcher, then this is a must-stop place for  you!

My group of 16 women collectively bought 5 rooms at New York New York for a bachelorette party. The brides mother reserved our rooms back in FEBRUARY to insure we had connecting suites due to the large party! Our group traveled thousands of miles with months of prep expecting to be greeted by these reserved rooms and an AMAZING weekend. The brides mother previously called the NYNY reservation line directly and partially paid for our rooms to lock down the reservation..or so she was told. Yet today they told us that we never booked our rooms together and that they can't get us rooms together at this point. (We at the hotel 5 hours BEFORE check in) After being at the desk for close to an hour they took off a $40 fee..and down grade one of our rooms! Okay again FIVE ROOMS for a family bachelorette party of 16 women who will not be staying here again. We are all just so disappointed that we were so disregarded by the desk and management team. The one star regards our CheckIn experience and their Welcome Desk Team.

I wanna wake up, In a city that doesn't sleep.
And find I'm king of the hill, top of the heap.

These little town blues, are melting away.
I'll make a brand new start of it, in old New York.

I love this Casino, although I did not stay here, I found myself here a lot because the Casino did not smell like smoke as much as other casinos. 

They also have a Hershey's chocolate store which I loved as well as NYP Pizza but that's a diff review.

Would love to stay here soon.

Stayed here for 3 nights last week and I have no complaints. Short distance between parking lot and your actual room, that's always a plus. I love how big Vegas hotels are, but sometimes after a long day of walking on the Strip you don't really want to walk another 30 min from your car to your room. 

Standard rooms are a little on the small side but that's not a problem for me. Why do you need all that floor space anyway? (Cough cough, Venetian) Front desk was very nice and polite; she waved our first night's resort fee because we got there super late at night. 

The only thing I dislike is their location. The hotel is a bit more South than the hotels I usually stay at, and that means further distance from hotels such as Bellagio and Caesar's Palace. For a more centralized location on the Strip, you're better off staying at Paris or Planet Hollywood.

As far as dining options, NYNY has everything from quick bites like Nathan's hot dogs to an upscale restaurant like Gallagher's Steakhouse. We had a $35 dining credit and used it at their Irish pub, Nine Fine Irishmen. Pretty much ate for (almost) free. Overall, can't beat this hotel for the value. I had a free night from myVegas, got the other two nights from an Expedia deal, so I stayed for three nights for under $200, that's including resort fee. I'm definitely coming back!
this is one of my favorite casinos on the strip. its so cute and they have fun stuff inside, good restaurants fun bars and like i said, its cute!

For the value, I could not like any other casino as much as this one.  So much to offer at NYNY.  And this time, I decided to take my niece on the roller coaster, something I have not done in years.  Let me tell you, for a man in his fifties, I got an absolute kick out of this ride!  What a rush.  Only negative was the price of the photo afterward. Take a selfie before the ride, then shove your phone in your front pocket.
Room was good, shower was excellent.  Room was clean throughout.  Nice tile floors and great amenities.  I do wish they offered a mini fridge in every room.
Last time I was here they only had the jelly bean Statue of Liberty.  This time I also saw the Statue made of Twizzlers.  Absolutely awesome!!

As long as NYNY continues to offer great service and a good time, I will continue to book here.

Most likely won't stay here again because of the experience.
Even though the price is great, the trouble wasn't worth it.

I discovered bed bugs on my bed, so I slept with my clothes on.
Too tired to complain that day since I've been walking everywhere.
On top of that, the front desk accidentally charged me twice for my room..
I caught the first one when I was checking out. They refunded me for the first one, then I realized they charged me again once I got back to my hometown.
I had to email billing dispute and wait for another week for a reply & a refund.
Too much problem & the bed was filthy. Gross. Make sure to check your bed, cause I always do.

Won't be coming back.

Want to start by saying Vegas is not my preferred Vegas destination; my bf chose the city, I chose the hotel based on location, size, and proximity to the attractions I wanted to hit. I'm glad I went with NYNY. 

The hotel itself is not as massive as some of the other resorts we visited (MGM, Caesars, Bellagio,) so you don't feel like you're walking for days between your room and the exits or somewhere else in the hotel. The staff at check-in was fantastic and accommodating -- we had asked for a room near an elevator and while she tried to up sell us to an upper floor for $50, we stayed on the 3rd floor, about four doors down from the lifts. Also, I had a fabulous chat with the ladies at the MLife desk (I wish I could remember their names... One was from NC!) and felt very much at home at NYNY. 

While is isn't much in the way of shopping, the restaurants are superb and I recommend hitting up a slice of NYC-style pizza on the cobblestone streets for $4 (or $7 with a drink). Plus, at night you can listen and dance in the street to the piano bar through the open windows. 

Also, I don't know what other people are talking about... The mattress in my room was incredible. Best sleep I've had in a LONG time!

We needed a change of scenes at our extended stay in Vegas so we dropped in NY NY for a few days. I had stayed here before and its a decent hotel. If your looking to party the night away and sleeping is just a second thought, then this is an excellent hotel. Right in the middle of action on the south side of the strip and now close to the Aria and Vdara, its a pretty good choice. I ended up getting the rooms for about 40 a night which is excellent! The beds are comfortable and the rooms are fairly spacious.

If you are looking for a hotel where you are cruise around or take advantage of some of the amenities, this might not be the place for you. No buffet =(, the pool area is very weak, the show Zumanity is adult in nature so its with your significant other only, and the food places are mostly quick stop places (only good place is Nine Fine Irishmen, but even that is heavily geared towards mostly drinking. After all your in an "Irish Pub").

In think in the end, it really depends on what you are looking for. At minimum, I need a clean hotel that is nice looking, located on the main section of the strip, provides a roof over my head when I need to crash, and has excellent  customer service and housekeeping... and NY NY definitely delivers.

As a Tourist from Australia, I didn't stay there nor did I gamble at The Casino, I just walked through it, exploring the Shops and all that, tell you what though it was much cheaper, Prettier & more value for money than Crown Casino in Melbourne, Victoria...

The draft is pertaining to the pool. We rented a cabana and had great waitresses (especially Kerry) It is very family  friendly. Not the first choice to ball out, but a nice time to have a few brews with the fam. Again, great service!

Hotel is not bad and one of the top 5 hotels that I would stay in. Mainly I like staying here as its close to the middle of the strip that you can walk it. Vegas during the summer is super hot! It's only end of May and it was up to 95F! NYNY has good deals and you can be offered free buffet meals or room nights especially if you spend money gambling or slots. They have Starbucks within the hotel for those coffee people like me. They have many restaurants, stores and snack shops around. 

As for the rooms, they are clean. Beds are comfy and clean; no bed bugs seen! They give you enough pillows. They have a safe in the room but no microwave or small frig. Bathrooms are clean but the last bathroom, the shower didn't work right. It was spitting water on the shower head and faucet.  I have only stayed at the Century and New York tower rooms. Easy to get to and close to the registration desk. I like this hotel. Will come again...

Loved this hotel casino. Check in was a breeze. Everyone was friendly. It was cool and dim inside, a wonderful "New York Evening" atmosphere. Our room was spotless and comfy. There was no coffee maker or frig, but it had a bow dryer, ironing board & iron. While our view wasn't spectacular, we could see part of the roller coaster, which was pretty cool. We got the basic two bed room with no frills. Housekeeping was super nice and offered us more supplies even though we weren't having our room cleaned. We ate at an Irish pub downstairs that was fantastic. I wish I could have stayed longer. I can't wait to go back without high heels so I can explore more of the fabulous New York New York!

I loved visiting NY, NY years ago. However, we were guests of the hotel on this trip to Vegas and I'm so disappointed with the exorbent resort fees. The last night of our stay, policy changed and we were charged $18 to valet our car overnight. 

It used to be you would go to Vegas to be pampered and now you go to be nickel and dimed. 

Our room was a hike to get to, down a very long hallway. The rollercoaster was right outside our window and ran all the time. We had to use the computer to print something and we were charged $15 for it.

Very unimpressed with the hotel and our stay.

It's not the worst place. You can't opt out of your resort fee, even if you're checking in at 9:30pm and leaving at 4:30 the next morning and not using any "resort" amenities (which didn't sound that great anyway). Also it stank like cigarettes - I know you can smoke everywhere in Las Vegas, but none of the other hotel\/casinos we checked out smelled like that. I guess it's cool if you have kids. Otherwise, stay at the Cosmopolitan.
This hotel was decently accommodating. Great pool area with good crowd but not over crowded. Dj's on Friday and Saturday are great. Well worth the stay

This use to be one of my favorite places to stay, however the rooms at the hotel are going down hill and down hill quickly. 

This review is based off my stay for 5 nights at the end of March 2017. 

I normally stay here on longer visits because the rooms are priced reasonable and they are decent size. However, here are the problems I had on the most recent stay. 

- Below the window (view of Las Vegas strip) there was mold on the wall, where the wall paper had been pealed back and ripped off. 

- When we went to use the blow dryer in the bathroom for the first time, the whole system came off the wall. The screws they used went into nothing but the sheet rock and they didn't use the proper wall anchors. 

- The drain in the shower was very very slow. Would be standing in water that covered the top of the foot by the end of the shower.

- The bed only had 2 pillows, with no spares in the room. Had to call to ask for more pillows. 

- Sports book is the tiniest I have ever seen. 

- The TBS channel in the room was HORRIBLE. Couldn't watch the basketball games (NCAA tournament - March Madness) games on the channel it was that bad. 

- The MLife card is very inconsistent at locations. Some restaurants will take the card and add the points, some make you take the receipt to the MLife counter to have the points added, in which you can wait in line for 30 minutes depending on how busy. 

- If I am already paying a daily resort fee of $30 I believe, why do I have to pay more to use the sauna in the workout facility?? They wanted $15 more to use that...

I really like the places to eat inside, the atmosphere inside (minus the cigarette smoke all over) but I don't know if I would stay here again. 

I had mentioned to someone at the front desk about the mold below the window, I don't even know if they did anything about it. They didn't offer to move us to another room or anything either!

NYNY hotel, famous for the replica of Statue of Liberty, the Big Apple coaster, and Nathan's Famous Hot Dog... Great restaurants, great shops, and we couldn't even get decent service here. We arrived there thinking this will be the ultimate Vegas vacation. Half of that was not fufilled. Anyways, we checked in, walked to our room, and I have to say, NYNY really improved and modernized everything, which was nice. 
   One day we decided to go to the pool, the weather was perfect and what was a better way to cure a hangover  than being at the pool and absorbing some sun? .. Turns out it was under construction... Maybe I'm being prissy, but I felt enraged.
   Our check-out experience was horrible. This woman, charged us for the full resort fee and we argued that we shouldn't pay the full fee because the pool wasn't available. She then tried to explain to us that they mentioned it when we checked in and also mentioned that we can use the pool in certain hotels. They assumed, but in fact they did not tell us this during check in time. She was arguing that they did. She didn't even give us a discount on this stupid resort fee. We didn't want to waste our time, so we left. 1 star deducted for the pool, 1 star deducted for bad customer service, and 1 star deducted for hiring this lady. 
   Oh, on top of that, housekeeping didn't do their job. 
   They could have handled their costumer service better, but they didn't, so looks like I won't be visiting this fake big apple crap anymore.

Casinos rarely get more than 3 stars because they are casinos. Unless I"m staying in a room where I get the full experience, most casinos all offer the same thing on the floor. 
Rolled in here on a Friday night with my friend because she wanted to gamble. I hadn't been inside NY NY for a few years. I think it got a little bit of a makeover because it looked cleaner and had some more neon signs. Stopped for a slice of pizza which wasn't good then off to the tables. Hit for a quick $300 then upstairs to Coyote Ugly for some dancing\/fun. This place was packed, a few bachelorette parties and birthday parties. Happy hour as well, we got a shot of tequila, heineken, and a vodka cranberry for $15 which is decent for the strip. Plenty of hijinx with a future bride getting a stranger to take a shot from her cleavage, then getting motorboated!! Haha. Fun place but overcrowded with people bumping into each other as they tried to get around. 

Overall NYNY seemed to be nicer than I remembered.

Stayed in NYNY, Gallagher's Steakhouse is the best.  I had a great time except for the guy at the players club named James Karlin, He was Disrespectful and unprofessional.  I talked to security and then talked to the shift manager Keith Coty, he was  very helpful, courteous and professional.  He handled the situation and I left feeling better about everything.

We stayed here recently when on a family birthday trip, I love this hotel. I was an instant fan the moment we upgraded to a spa suite! The room was fantastic, great view, huge hot tub, spacious and modern. The only downfall was that I found the bed too uncomfortable (my partner of coarse found nothing wrong with it - each to their own:) I loved the casino for the fact that it was always busy and that we were also surrounded by many food options. From NY style pizza, smoked meat sandwiches, steak house, classy Italian, and an Irish pub, this hotel had everything. I also loved the outdoor\/indoor theme of the streets of New York. I will definitely come back during my next visit.

Okay  so New York New York  isn't the fanciest of places, but it really is a great  place.  While the New York part of their set up doesn't do that much for me, I do enjoy the conveniences of the place. I really love while in Vegas  going  to their dueling piano bar, it has a kitschy feel to it ,that just makes me relax, it's so predictable and yet comforting at the same time. I mean who doesn't love Piano Man several times in one evening..they also have video poker right on the edge of the Bar so I can people watch , play poker and have a nice lemon drop ...it's a win all the way around.
They also have a food court that has great extended hours,  and they have a  Haagen Daas  just in case I have an ice cream emergency. The Food Court had a Pastry area that had really decent  tarts which I felt I needed to sample. 
The rooms have recently been remodeled and are clean and nice at the moment ( casino rooms get messed up really quick). Loved the marble in the bathroom and rich looking bedding on the bed ..yes thread counts make a difference.. and this felt good. 
One concern our room was very small , well planned out but small,  not that we needed a lot of space..but small.  Get the picture? But for the low price we got and how little we walk around the room no biggie. 

By the way  the Roller Coaster is a lot of fun and great to let out your primal screams.I recommend it. 
NYNY  is at a good location near MGM. Mandalay Bay is a tram ride away and the newish Planet Hollywood is just down the street. Good location to walk from.

Thus far I am not impressed.  Staying in Vegas for 5 days and figured I would mix it up staying at 2 places.  Started at the Luxor which isn't anything special but is a decent place for the money.  Decided to "upgrade" when I came to NYNY to a suite.  The room is only marginally larger than the room at the Luxor, and frankly the room at the Luxor was about as nice for half the cost.  At least it didn't have a broken wall safe, and wall paper peeling off like it does here.  Additionally, can I possibly be any further away from the elevator?  Probably won't stay here again but will stick with the Luxor and just upgrade to a real suite for less than I paid here.

The NY NY is actually a really cool casino to spend time in, and I'm surprised to say that. I was half expecting a tacky, faux-type tribute to New York, but the bright lights, brick village walkway with New York pizza shops and general charm of the place won me over. I did appreciate the open-air feeling of it, as too much smoke can definitely be a problem. I tried the Manhattan Express - a monster of a roller coaster and my first upside down ride of any kind. It was terrible. Which means, for roller coaster fans, it was great.

The circular bar in the center of the floor was nice, but understaffed, as we waited quite a bit for our drinks, refills, and our check. Overall though, a nice place to spend some time gaming. The dealers were friendly, except for one younger hot shot who had a chip on his shoulder.

Free craps lessons here at 11am-12pm. 

I won $500 on the $1 slot machine last trip in january and this trip, I won $1,080, also on the SAME machine. I wish I kept the monies :(

Greedy, I went back to where we were staying, Aria, and lost it all back and more.

Will try again next time :)

We checked in with ease yesterday.  While checking out the view from our room there was a light knock at the door I thought it was next door so I didn't open it. Next thing I know someone is opening our door.  The lady said it was a room check. Weird we have never had that happen.  Decided to watch the Seahawks game but since we are in cardinals nation we had to go to one of the bars downstairs. Fine.  Met some great people and seahawks won.  Even better.  Put 5 bucks in the slots came ahead 12.00. Put 1 more in the big slots won 4 more(then lost it in a different big slot).  All in all so far no major complaints.  Room is clean bathroom looks clean. View is nice although it really sounds like new York with the street noise. But hey we are in vegas right.

New York New York is a landmark hotel at the corner of Tropicana and Las Vegas blvd.  The iconic Statue of Liberty and ew York skyline are a popular backdrop for photos and make this hotel easy to find.  

There are many of family friendly areas in this hotel which includes the pools and a huge arcade where you can also grab a ride on the roller coaster that runs around the outside of the hotel.  

The rooms here are clean and comfortable but not overly huge or posh.  There are plenty of restaurants and also a food court with lots of selections to please most everyone.   

One other iconic club that is just at the walkway entrance to this hotel is Coyote Ugly where the music can be heard pumping out of the club feom almost anywhere within 150 feet of the entrance. 

Overall this is a nice hotel for the price and one which I always check pricing on when I'm planning a stay.  

Enjoy!

The bar service here is absolutely horrible!!!! My date and I waited over 20 minutes before the server David even attempted to acknowledge us. I pointed this out to him and his response was other people were there. Yes this is true the same people who arrived after we did. David if you have an attitude with providing good customer service then go home, get yo life, & get another job!!!!

Don't drink the water, and if you do, don't let the staff know it tastes bad. They will put you down and down talk you, and tell you it's ridiculous to post signs or advise people not to drink tap water. Sorry, my tap water at home is safe. So I would assume the same from an MGM resort. I have never had to be concerned about drinking water. I will never stay here, or at any other MGM resort again. They will tell you that it's common sense not to drink hotel water. Really? Where? I've stayed at many resorts where drinking water was not a problem. I can't believe that they had the nerve to be so disrespectful.

I liked New York New York each time I have visited the location. They have a big statue of liberty made out of jelly bellies which is cool. The outside also had a smaller version of a cable bridge you can walk over which is a nice touch. There is a section of restaurant shops on an upper level with the casino and other restaurants down on the lower level. Prices for most of the options here are decent when compared to some of the other hotels. They have a roller coaster which goes through the inside of the casino which is something you do not see everyday. Pretty cool location that you should check out on your visit to Las Vegas.

This was the second time i stayed at NYNY on my annual Vegas vacation, and both times i have been completely satisfied. I managed to book a spa suite this time and highly recommend it! The room and spa tub were clean and spacious and the suite was completely away from noise and elevators.

I love this hotel for it's central location and convenience along the strip. NYNY has TONS of great eateries inside, along with the incredible Nine Fine Irishmen, which has AMAZING fish'n'chips and beer! 

My stay was during Labor Day weekend, known for it's last summer parties. There was no wait during check in, during check out and every place inside we ate at we were seated immediately. Bonus: smoking\/smokers and kids were not a issue! All in all, one of the most pleasant hotel stays i've had along the strip.

One of my favorite places in the whole wide world is New York.  If I ever win the lottery that's where m moving too....  Maybe I should start playing???  I digress.  One of the best parts of Las Vegas (besides the booze) are the themed hotels.  I love the theme hotels, the really goods ones transport you somewhere else.  Yes, the "luxury" hotels are nice, but i much prefer to be in Faux-Paris, Faux-Venice or Faux-New York any day.

::::::::::HOSPITALITY::::::::::

As is expected in Vegas, service is great.  We had an issue with the TV in our room and they were quick to replace it.  And quick to replace the replacement that died too lol.  The service technician was really funny so it wasn't all bad.

::::::::::ROOMS::::::::::

We had a basic room and it was decent.  They have upgraded rooms available as well.

::::::::::EXTRAS::::::::::

The roller coaster and arcade is great if you have family in tow.  Also, strolling along the mock city is pretty cool.  Once, a date and myself came in for a drink.  We had one drink (I think) and we were feeling pretty nice.  We went down to the machines and won a couple hundred dollars....SCORE.  I met a nice man here a few years ago... well I'm not sure if he was nice, but he kept buying drinks... and in my book that makes you nice.

This hotel is good for being on the strip on a budget and with family.

The Good
-Check in line was not too bad
-Cool kitschy NY theme 
-Close to Freeway 
-Spacious room 
-Decent  price ($124 a night when you factor in the taxes & resort fees) 
-Easy to navigate parking garage 
-Home to Zummanity & a roller coaster
-Pretty cool views available 

The Crappy
-No coffee maker in the room
-Small gym that closes at 7pm
-Room cards can easily be demagnetized 
-Slightly crusty clientele if you are looking for a fancier vibe head to bellagio or the wynn

Great choice for a strip hotel. Coffee maker and mini fridge would be nice ; however, these $ grabbing hotel chains want to try to squeeze every penny out the consumer. To avoid walk across street to McDonald's for your $1 coffee & have breakfast lunch elsewhere i.e Denny's or food court across the street. 

Friendly staff, great valet parking and nice Casino area. Their restaurants & bars are severely over priced ...maintain your own room bar!

If you have a car rental drive farther south on the Blvd. About 10 min. out bargain priced liquor outlets! $1 brand named coolers put a smile on my wife's face. We're on a fixed income & we can't afford to throw $ away if not necessary.

I wanted to relax at a video poke bar so I sat down at a bar in NYNY and met Charlette. What a absolute asset to this business. Very nice and energetic girl. I really appreciate such a great attitude in a casino. WELL DONE!!!
The hotel rooms are big like where you can have a small party in the room. The beds are soft and comfy. Casino is cool. A good variety of restaurants. I enjoyed staying there.

bed bugs

i stayed at this lousy hotel and all i got was bed begs. 

with a bill to get rid of them;  avoid at all costs unless you love infestation.

Only 4 stars for now because we haven't had the opportunity to stay in the hotel yet, but the casino alone is really great! I love this  casino!  Go here every trip no matter how close or far I stay from New York New York!

Gonzales  Gonzales is a mexican restaurant inside the casino. I've been eating there for years but not anything recent. I ordered chicken fajitas. Normally this selection would be served sizzling hot when arriving at the table. This item came out luke warm and the beans and rice arrived on another plate.

The rice and beans were only luke warm and only about 5 bites of rice and 5 bites of beans, no cheese!
The tortillas were luke warm...the service waiter was very good and attentive. no chips and salsa were served and chips and salsa have to be ordered as an extra cost.....most mexican restaurants will serve chips and salsa before you order......

The chandeliers above the eating area need to be cleaned or shaved , they look hairy from dust and lint. Gross!

That's it!!.......


******************Security Warning ***************

I was a guest at this hotel for five days. during this time period I stayed in the same room and at my request refused any type of room service or maid service.

I had brought a pair of mini canon binoculars into the room, upon check out the binoculars were gone, I realized this a few hours or less after I left when I needed the binoculars for sight seeing at Red Rock.

I contacted the hotel house keeping, short version, the maid said she had not seen them. A security report was filed and this is under investigation. It's hard to believe they had not been located , there's a possibility that someone used a room key during tbe week I was there unbeknownst to me.. The only people in the room was my wife and I and the cleaning staff, who cleaned the room one time right after we left. We had refused room service the entire week. I really hadn't seen the binoculars for about three days but wasn't looking for them either, when we checked out they were just out of sight out of mind. I didn't realize they were missing for a few hours after check out. Update will follow upon conclusion of the hotel security investigation. Just be mindful of these circumstances. I was sloppy for not having a good inventory of my stuff when I packed.

08-27-14
Update Conclusion

Hotel completed their investigation, nothing to support my claim other then my statement. Through their own follow up and interviews and checking electronic records of my room lock they feel the theft is unsubstantiated.  Bottom line I arrived at the hotel with the binoculars and somehow they were stolen from my room during my absence . They just didn't vanish into thin air...no compensation offered for replacement                                                                              ( WHICH I DIDN'T EXPECT ) and they closed their case.....I won't be staying here again for obvious reasons. Take the information for what it's worth.........
.
THERES ANOTHER REVIEW THAT TALKS ABOUT THEFT OF MONEY FROM ANOTHER GUEST'S ROOM!

That's it!!....

Cool! It's like a mini NY outside this hotel. It's cute~ Inside it's very NY themed. I liked their mini jelly bean sculture of the Statue of Liberty. There's also a roller coaster that you can pay to ride outside. I wonder if it's noisy for the guests. It's a new hotel so it's very clean and nice looking.

casino review:

i literally got into a yelling match with the dealer of roulette. all i kept saying however was: "quit arguing. quit arguing. QUIT arguing! QUIT ARGUING!!!"

what an a**hole.

How times have changed!!! Remember free valet parking?? No more. $13 on a Sunday! Self park.. Also not free $7. Need to use the ATM? Another $7. Wow! I think I'll head over to the Harrahs properties. Oh and I gambled for an hour - not 1 waitress to offer a drink.

Spent about 15 min here. The croupiers are across the board unfriendly, rude, and consescending. From all the casinos BY FAR the worst atmosphere. Save your fun and dollars. This casino is a complete buzz.

I have stayed here twice in the past 10 years. This trip, I was kind of surprised that there were not a great deal of changes. The hotel rooms have little to no outlets, to charge your electronic devices. Each bed has only 2 pillows, whereas today's chains usually have 4 pillows to a bed. You pay extra for a pillow-top mattress, but they aren't any more comfortable than the regular ones. There are no mini fridges either. One thing going to them, is they have a safe. While napping in my room, with a do not disturb sign on the door, housekeeping unlocked my door and entered without knocking. They saw me and left. When I went to see what they wanted, all they could say was "room check". Checking on what? They had already cleaned the room much earlier. I do like that the hotel has numerous restaurants, from quick counter service to fine dining, as well as a couple bars. They also have more than a few shops. Taxi service is quick to obtain.  I can say I've stayed here twice, but I doubt there will be a 3rd time.

I was here and I appreciate the place.That's because I'd  been walking for an eternity, I was hot and stopped at the bar upstairs from  the gaming floor across from NY PIZZA and right off the south street entrance.What really surprised me is they had a great selection of beers on tap and bartenders who could actually make drinks.The place is replete with New York kitsch and is fun to look at.

Great place to be nice and cozy the best thing is free valet park couldnt ask for more prices are great book only through hotel tonight gives you best prices 
Also ive never slept so well in my life the pillows are amazinggggggg
Have fun in vegassssss!!!!!

disclaimer, this is a review of only the casino
positive:
craps machine minimum of $2 and right by casino bar with DJ music
negative: 
below average comp cocktails.  Pina Colada was not even blended, Jack and Coke tasted like it used some random nasty whiskey, white russian tasted like a full cup of milk with the slights of splashes of coffee liqueur and vodka possible.  Luxor is a cheaper grade resort and their cocktails are better
Nice room, staff is very, very nice, the lobby has over 25 very good places to eat. I had a great time.  The location is great, it is right in the middle of the strip.

The room we got looked kinda old. But they were nice employees. We got balloons and champagne sent to the room for our anniversary and they actually did it in a timely manner. The idea of the buildings were really cool though.

If you've never been to NYC on the East Coast, don't even bother because NY NY Hotel and Casino in Vegas is ten times better than the real Big Apple (not to mention way cleaner).

We stayed here one night in a regular room and had no problems with the room condition, smell, view, etc. We overlooked the giant T-Mobile arena next door on the strip. No mini fridge  in the room was a disappointment, but we weren't in Vegas for a mini fridge.

Decent location on the strip. I did not realize how big this place was- it's massive. The casino is great but the drink girls were a bit inattentive during the day\/evening (although at night they came out in full force). Casino was decently clean and did not smell like smoke, despite people smoking at the games (it's gotta be something they pump into the rooms).

Decor is fun, games are fun (and you can find some 3\/2 blackjack games that dont favor the house! who knew). I would stay here again but I also want to explore other options, since it is Vegas afterall.

We stayed her for two nights! The room was clean, and large- we got the Park Avenue room! We had a few electricity issues with the bathroom, but the hotel went above and beyond to help us (waived the hotel fee and later check-out). Their front desk was very nice and accommodating! We rode the roller coaster, and were able to check out the fun shops and things like the Hershey Factory as well. The DJ at the bar downstairs on 9\/9 was AWESOME!!!!! Great tunes! 4 stars because the bridge to MGM was out of order, so we had to go ALL THE WAY AROUND which was a huge pain in the A since the MGM is a main casino and has access to the Monorail, so it took us 3 times as long to get to the MGM. Would stay here again- Great location on the strip, and a super fun hotel to stay at! Not as crazy as the MGM too- I think that place is too big.
This review is based on their arcade\/carnival that they have upstairs.  They have a decent selection of video and arcade games near the roller coaster.  Nice alternative to gambling downstairs

Love the Roller Coaster. One of the big reasons to visit New York New York is that awesome coaster. I have not played on the tables, so my rating excludes the casino floor for the most part. It was a bit dark, as the lighting remind me more of what I may come to expect walking down the streets of new York at night. Its a neat touch, but may annoy me if I were trying to roll the dice. Definitely worth a visit if you happen to be in vegas, and don't forget the awesome rollercoaster.

Me and a group of friends just recently had the BEST experience here last week (EDC weekend). Saturday morning in particular at the pool, the staff was the absolute best....Eddie I believe? Great guy, he defenetly made our weekend after dealing with a small problem we had.  They defenetly know how to treat their guest with the best service!

Very rude service, not willing to help you in any ways, dirty rooms full of dust. The windows were so dirty i couldnt see through. They explained the dirty window issue that the building is high and they cant clean it. WHAT?!? Avoid it at all cost

Very dirty seriously needs updated. Stains on chairs in room, horrible shower will not stay here again. To top it off a homeless bum urinated in middle of casino and guest services did nothing to remove him or even care. He was allowed to wander around casino. Dont stay there.

Staying on the strip again at just another huge strip themed hotel. I didn't find anything spectacular about staying here. And what I found to be a huge negative was where the pool is located. You don't get a lot of sun at the later part of the day. Because they have the parking garage build up right behind it. The only real benefit I found was in the resort daily fees they include Wi-Fi. When I come to visit Vegas again I will choose another hotel for sure.

I was out here back in July for a bachelorette party! I can say the bed were comfortable and the rooms were affordable!  Downstairs had a great varieties of eatery and it was open 24\/7 which was awesome coming back from my adventures lol! What I thought was neat that each casino were connected that was a plus! The only thing I can say was weird at the time looking out from my window I can see David Copperfield staring at me do I decided to catch the show. Had a great time beware of thE billboards lol but it was worth it!!! Great service, great food! I had a quiet stay enough though I was tumbling to get to my room lol :)

This hotel has everything you need. 

Great restaurants with many options at all price levels. Italian, American, Asian, Mexican, Pub fare. 9
Bars with no frills, beer cocktails and fun. Dueling pianos seem to be the better one. 8 
A quick bite value oriented food court comes handy. 8 
Location is very convenient  with access to tram, monorail or quick walk to other hotels. 9
Gym is small but with most you need. Health club a bit disappointing no cold splash tub. Weird set up IMO. 8
Pool and hot tub outside were nice and fun.   
Room is nice, convenient, bed is comfortable, bathroom is clean, AC worked perfectly. OK size flat screen tv. Not sure the point of a shower tub where you cannot have enough room to let arms or legs hang out. You feel cramped, unless there are kids playing in it, I don't see the point. 9

Pay attention to happy hours since they have good deals on drinks and food.

The price it offers per room is what makes it a great value. The team of people working every place were friendly and happy. 9.

I wish I could give this hotel no stars! One is too generous. Our experience started when we walked through the doors and the smoke hit us like a brick wall. Wow, that was awful. The welcome was lackluster, not the experience we wanted from Vegas. We checked in and we're upgraded, things were starting to look up! Until we got to our dirty room. Bed was had many stains and lots of hair. The view? A brick wall 2 feet from the window. I did not expect a view of the strip, but I certainly expect daylight. Never ever again. Whatever you do, don't book at New York New York.....

Location location location... Other than that they're much better hotels to stay at on the strip for the money.

The best thing to do is wait and go during the week... You can get some pretty good rates per night. Less than $100. I would not stand the weekend when you're paying the hundred and 50 to 200 for these rooms

This place was okay, it was located near everything else you could want to visit. The floor of the casino is okay mostly not the kind of place you'd go and meet new friends. The tables themselves were not 1$ stakes either. The rooms are nice the view of the roller coaster and the tops of other buildings is a diffrent matter all together.

I would go back if i could get some sort of deal or special. There is a nice place to get steak and eggs in the Lobby.

Note the taxi's are thieves, want to pay 40$ to go a couple of miles then this is the spot to find them as well. So angry.
All I can say after walking around the property is it has been rode hard and put away wet. Frayed carpets everything is very very old. Stayed here for 2 nights for a business meeting.

Yeah New York-New York is cheesy as hell but it ended up being one of the better hotels on my trip. At least for entertainment purposes, they have some HOT shows going on right now!! Zumanity (think Cirque du Soleil meets sex) and Rok your ass off (a hot new club) will really entertain you. There is plenty of things to do at NY-NY, ride the roller coaster (personally I think $14 is a scam), play in the arcade, or just gamble like everyone else. 

Hungry?? Grab a pretzel from NY Pretzel stand (personally I've had better pretzels in NY) or maybe get a sandwich at Greenberg's Deli. There are all kinds of places to grab a quick bite here. 

Thirsty?? Check out Nine Fine Irishmen a perfectly good Irish pub or Bar Times Square. The service is excellent at both. 

It has all the standards, pool, golf, shopping, and a spa like most of the strip hotels do. I don't know what makes this one any different but it did seem a lot busier then the others. I'd go back but not stay here, it's just too many people.

The atmosphere and decor are a little tired. Very much appreciated the attention to my request for a quiet room-was honored and was able to sleep without any interruptions. I know it's not unique to this hotel, but the quick walk through the lobby\/casino floor will permeate your clothes and hair with the smell of a month-old ashtray.

Just stayed in a spa room at New York New York for 3 days. The giant jacuzzi tub in the room was awesome. The price of the room was incredible as well. The only downside? The wifi was terrible. TERRIBLE. To have it included in the daily "resort fee" was just insulting.
We ate at the American Restaurant in New York New York. Server was Robert. Great service. Attentive, professional, thorough and quick. Helped make a great visit even better

Wow what a bad night at this hotel...first they lost our reservation then wanted to charge us $30 more then what we had the room reserved for....then at 4 am the fire alarm went off for no known reason! My husband suffers from PTSD from being over seas for 2 tours scared the crap our of all of us....not to mention we had a 2 queen room reserved they put 5 of us in a king bed room and brought up a roll away bed my son slept in a chair cause there was no where for him to sleep never again will I stay here a complete waste of $140!!!

I was not happy with my stay here at all and I'm still disappointed in the quality and service at this hotel. I'm not complaining about the price per se because I am well aware of the service fees and extra charges. I just think the quality received was extremely poor compared to the price payed. The room didn't even come with a fridge.

I am also convinced that housekeeping stole a stuffed animal of mine. My friends thinks they thought it was cute and gave it to their kids. The item in question was never removed from the room by myself and several calls to the lost and found produced no results. It just seems odd.

Would not stay again.

EDIT: WAIT, THERE'S MORE! Say it in the Billy Mays voice. My ipod also never left the room and has mysteriously not turned up either. Change "would not stay again" to "would NEVER stay again.

I'm rounding up, the current 3.5 star average is spot on. The NYNY is good option on the Strip. Would I stay here again? Yes, if I needed to be in the area, for example catching a show at the T-Mobile Arena. I've walked through NYNY many times but this was my first stay. The rooms are beginning to show their age but nothing terrible. We stayed in the Empire Building, the elevator was close to check-in, taxi line, casino and pool. We had a Park Avenue Room with a view. The view was nothing spectacular and am glad I didn't pay for the upgrade as the windows were tiny and looked out at Tropicana, Hooters and the airport. 

We didn't have much luck in the casino but it's a fun environment. Also, a great food option is Sirrico's; they have a large pizza slice and Rolling Rock draft beer special for $7.77. 

Upon check out we easily hoped in a taxi with literally no wait. For this one night stay, NYNY was a solid option for the right price.

One line - "Motel 6 of the Las Vegas Strip".

We stayed here one night on our way back from Grand Canyon since I like to try different hotels on the strip. We stayed at MGM few days earlier before we went to Grand Canyon, the rooms are much nicer there.

Check-in line was horrible, over 30 mins with 3 front desk agents helping.  Once again, no MLife line late nights.  The front desk person apologised for the long line and we finally got to our rooms which were a dump. I didn't feel like sleeping on the bed at all. The resort fees are a joke. They should increase the room rate instead of pretending the customers are getting any value add for the resort fees.

The casino floor looks beat down, it is depressing. We went to Paris Paris after our last experience at MGM. Will be staying there in future. I didn't want to pay cancellation fees here other wise would have done that in a heart-beat.

I typically come to Vegas once a year, and I've stayed at New York, New York many times. I stay here because the hotel prices are good for an average hotel. My two stars are here for several reasons:

1) The hotel rooms are hit or miss. Sometimes, I get a great room that is extremely comfortable and very clean. Other times, I have to ask for another room because the room isn't clean or there is a problem with the plumbing or air conditioner. 

2) It is so difficult to fine cocktail servers on the casino floor. I've taken to going and buying a bottle of booze and just taking my flask with me so I don't have to rely on a server. That's kind of sad given that I know the casino wants me sitting in one spot with money to burn.

3) The casino is small in comparison to other casinos around it. MGM and Monte Carlo, for example, are both massive. Mandalay Bay is not too far, and it is huge. New York, New York could stand to do some improvements in the casino, move out some of the overpriced restaurants, and turn that area into some more casino space

Those things said, I do like the fact that there is an arcade and coaster in the hotel. Keep in mind that the coaster is expensive to ride. It would be nice if NY, NY included it in the resort fee and charged those not staying in the hotel. I like the fact that the hotel is so close to the new park and new stadium.

I think the hotel\/casino has a lot going for it, but it needs some updates and some customer service care.

I'm hesitant on the 4 stars, sure this is Vegas and it's a tough market to compete in, but I still think they could do a little better. Our "updated" room may have been updated 10 years ago. The bathroom symbolizes nothing modern. The check in process wasn't enjoyable, the woman checking us in was rude and didn't care to help or want to accommodate us. The manager soon took control and helped us. The other staff around this MGM property are great! People in the south are usually super friendly, and that rule follows right through here. Sure the hotel is not as nice as Caesars or the MGM Grand, but it's still very nice, has a large casino, roller coaster, arcade and shopping area!

We usually stay at Mandalay Bay or the Bellagio. However, I wanted to try something new and save a little money.  Plus, NY NY is home to our favorite steakhouse in Vegas: Peter Gallagher's. I read through Yelp's that NY NY went through renovations so all the rooms are "nice."

We were initially assigned to the New York tower in the 8th floor. We had to walk about 6-7 minutes through a dark, very worn-out maze-like hall to reach our room (and mind you - my husband and I are in our late 30s', healthy for the most part, and he was lugging just 1suitcase w wheels). When he opened the door to the room, I didn't even want to step into it.  

I really wanted to cancel my reservation and book somewhere else.  However, the M-life front desk was understanding enough to change the room to the 32th floor in the Century tower, which is accessible exclusively through two guests' elevators. We had the northwest view of the valley and Aria, which is nice. The hallway and room are cleaner. The bed and sheets are nice as I was able to sleep comfortably.  The bathroom is okay, but it is nowhere near fancy. 

I think this hotel is okay, but if you are used to Mandalay Bay and\/or other 4 stars hotels, then this is not it.  As for the casino, NY NY dealers and floor managers are super nice and friendly. I give 5 stars for the casino.

Only doing a review on the pizza place inside ( NY Pizzeria ). Arrived at my hotel (Luxor), late Saturday night (3.11.17)and my husband and I were starving so we thought, why not walk the strip and find a place to eat. We walk into NY NY Hotel and Casino and there is a pizza place in the front. We stopped and ate. I had the stuffed spinach with cheese and broccoli, my Husband has the spinach and mushroom pizza, one slice each. We ate the whole thing. We walked back to our hotel and instantly became very queezy. I was throwing up for a complete 24 hours and then at the same time non stop diareah. My Husband the same! Horrible food poisoning!!!!! Ruined my whole Vegas trip! I was so weak and violently ill from this food! To think I spent a huge amount of money to come to Vegas and stay in my hotel bed the ENTIRE trip! Not one show, NOTHING! Thanks a lot!!!

Very interesting hotel. The lay is is just as interesting. Usually hotel have 3 to 4 long hall ways. This hotel has long halls that go left and right and back to right then left. hahaha. 

If you plan to party hard and sleep in at this hotel, think again. The roller coaster starts up in the morning and that's all you're going to here when you're trying to find off the red-eye.

Just checked in. Was excited for a weekend stay in our king bed Madison room with a strip view. Paid extra for the strip view. We have 2 queen beds in a very tiny room and the front desk was very rude when I said we didn't want queen beds. There are 2 small windows facing mgm grand. I would call this a strip view. Not a good start to a weekend in Vegas.

I have dropped my star rating because now even if you stay at the hotel here you have to pay 10.00 parking a night unless you are a pearl status mlife member which is stupid! If I stay at a place and I pay for the resort fee I don't think I should also pay for parking because you chose to build that stupid T mobile arena! You are starting to get to greedy and I'm done staying here after this.   There is no extra security or safety effort it's just paying 10.00 more dollars to park, i think the resort fee should include parking but we all know the 10.00 a day goes to the t mobile arena. I get the paid parking for that but if I'm staying there it shouldn't cost. I'm sorry but I spend enough at these casinos that I'm not willing to pay even more to park so I will no longer be staying here! I heard a lot of complaints about this so I'm glad some people don't mind but there are a lot that do not like this. I'm paying to stay I deserve to park for free! I know it's all about the money and that's your business but I'm one who will no longer stay here and warned a lot of people about this.

Soo we stayed here because Expedia had good deal and we were going to a concert at MGM to see Sade.   Check-in was easy didn't have problem.  I asked for a quiet room and the agent suggested we upgrade for a more modern room (flat screen tv).  I asked her if our room would be able to hear the roller coaster.  So she put us on a high floor which was cool.  When we got to our so called modern room there was nothing modern about it.  The decor was old and the flat screen wasn't all that.  We still did hear the people screaming on rollercoaster but we got use to it.  Overall this hotel is good for like two nights.  There's nothing modern about it.  Also there's no refrigerator and microwave.  Oh and you have to pay a extra $15 a night for the wi-fi, unlimited telephone, newspaper and gym.  Wi-fi came in handy.  There's a nice mexican restaurant and a nice french cafe.   Thats about it.  I'm from NY and NY, NY didn't impress me.

I'm afraid this place has gotten rather long in the tooth. There are better places to stay for the same rates. I got the sense that New York New York has been a little neglected. It's nothing that can't be fixed with a nice remodel but I wasn't impressed. 
My room was on the small side, which isn't a big deal because I didn't spend much time there. I was mainly there to sleep but little things left me with the sense that there was some wear and tear that needs to be fixed. First off, my bed was sagging a little in the middle. Not to mention the sheets and towels seemed a bit worn. In the bathroom, there was a large scratch on the mirror that didn't obstruck the view but just left me with a sense that I was in a second class hotel. Also one of the curtain rods was broken in half.
When I was sleeping, I could hear folks in the hallway which isn't a big deal but it added to the impression that I could have done better.

It's an A-OK place to hang your hat after partying the night away. All the bars are really LOUD if you like that sort of thing. If not, you'll need to party at another hotel like we did. They have plenty of affordable eateries in the hotel when compared to most places on the strip.

Our room was decent except for the fact that there was visible blood stains on the bedding. You can tell the sheets were washed, but my wife was having none of that, Fugetabboutit! We called housekeeping to change the bedding. The desk clerk didn't recognize this as a problem when reported at checkout since no financial accommodation was offered.

I'm hoping the bedsheet thing was an aberration and would return if the price was right.

Stayed here for the first time this past weekend, and definitely enjoyed it. The fact that I used some myVegas points for a free room also helped. 
Pros: Very clean and spacious room. The bathroom was nice size and all of the furnishings were updated and clean. The bed was really really comfy. I don't know why someone else complained about the roller coaster noise because it doesn't open until 11am and closes at like 9pm. If you're going to bed before 9pm, why are you in Vegas? The casino is nice; just your basic MGM casino layout. 
Cons: It is not easy to get to. Seriously. Not fun. Even walking was not that great. We went for a bite over at Planet Hollywood and it seemed like it took forever to walk there and back because of traffic and the placement of the hotel. Perhaps that's why I prefer off the strip hotels. I can always just drive up somewhere and get valet. The check in staff were pleasant enough, even if for some reason none of the express checkouts were actually working, which made for a longer check out.
But overall, it was a nice stay. I like the hotel, just not a fan of where it's located on the strip and the streets getting to it. Of course that also could be because of construction going on nearby. Hopefully this will get better.

Stayed here over the May long weekend (in Canada) and had an amazing time! Was able to book a package through Southwest that gave us free tickets to Cirque shows as a bonus. We received an upgraded Park Ave room and it was huge and lovely. The beds are very comfortable and we loved the funny packaging on the toiletries provided. Our bathtub drain was ridiculously slow, but otherwise everything was great.

I would recommend checking out the room-service menu. We browsed through it the first night we were in and found that their specials (and meals in general) are very reasonably priced. We got a huge slab of prime rib, that came with veggies, potatoes, buns, and a side salad, an entree salad, and a plate of nachos all for $50. There was more than enough food to feed the four people we had staying in the room, plus leftovers. And the menu is fairly similar to the 'America' restaurant down in the casino.

There is a wide variety of gaming options in the casino, plus food and bars to keep you entertained. Note that the Zumanity box office is the only one that sells day-of tickets in the afternoon and can usually give you a better price than the other ticket retailers. Watch for the Rok reps walking around the bar as they'll give you wristbands to get in free and there is free champagne for ladies from 11-midnight. There is always a giant line for Coyote Ugly but if you're a lady and are with all girls, head up to the front of the line as they'll let you right in. Guys, befriend girls as this will be your ticket to avoid the lineup. 

I would definitely stay here again as the walk to the center of the strip isn't too long and the hotel has everything you could need. We had a fabulous time and really enjoyed all of the subtle signs mocking NY\/NJ.

Great roller coaster.  One of my favorites of all time.

Disgustingly smokey casino - they must have NO attempt at ventilation in there.

Fun kids' arcade area.  

The end.

The room was filthy. There was trash everywhere from the previous guests. They refused to change us rooms and we had to wait almost two hours for them to clean the room. The air conditioning didn't work well either. Our room was hot.

We stayed here because my dad spends lots of money in the casinos so we get free rooms and comps. The Merriweather fight was on the weekend we went so we didn't get our first, second, or third hotel choice. We went with NYNY since we'd never stayed here and it looks cool.

First, the parking was fine. It was quite a long walk from the garage down the elevators, through the midway, down the escalators, then to registration...but at least we weren't carrying lots of bags (insert sarcastic mark)

The trouble began once we started dining. We had breakfast on Saturday at Il Fornaio (delicious!)...then when we tried to charge the meal to our room I was told (very politely, btw) that I wasn't authorized to room charge. I informed the waiter that I was on the room and also authorized, so he talked to his manager and it was fine.

Nine Fine Irishmen, no problem. Then we go to the pool (they don't allow outside beverages - ridiculous) and get a couple of drinks. I'm told I can't charge to the room (again). Repeat earlier experience, except this time the incredibly rude pool bartender doesn't call his manager or the front desk and simply says NO. Ok fine. Here are the drinks back that you already poured, except you have to waste them. Definitely better than getting money for them (insert another sarcastic mark).

We call the front desk and ask what's going on as we can use the room charge sometimes and sometimes not. They say that I am on the room charge, but whomever is running the bill has to call the front desk for authorization. Sounds like a broken system to me.

The cherry on top was checkout. We go to checkout, and the rooms, room charges, etc. are all on the bill. My dad argues with the supposed casino host for about 15 minutes (reading off of printed email confirmations of offers of free room and food) and only gets 2\/3 off of the bill.

Overall, the good was good, but the bad was so bad. The people we encountered (except the pool bartender and casino host on the phone) were actually really cool people - you could tell they were hamstrung by the suits upstairs and actually cared about the customer (they were the only reason I didn't leave one star). Their system is so messed up that if you were less aware, you'd think the faces you see incompetent, but in actuality, they are in dire need of a system overhaul.

Needless to say, we will NOT be staying here again, even if offered another free room, as apparently even that is not guaranteed.

You could easily walk in and out of this hotel in 10 minutes, tops.  Unless you've come here for a specific reason (i.e. Zumanity, Rok Vegas, roller coaster], there's not much reason for you to stay. 

* Zumanity - The Sensual Side of Cirque du Soleil.  Great show, theatre was comfy and complete with red lighting.
