* ESPN Zone - This place is a lot of fun if you're there to watch a game.  Plenty of tv's surrounding the area.  Can be a long wait, so come early if you really want to watch here.  Plenty of arcade stayle video games to keep the kids and kids-at-heart busy. 
* Nathan's Hot Dogs - We had a great meal here during our last visit to NY NY, but surprisingly we ddin't have the hot dogs.  The philly cheesesteak was insanely good; huge portions and very meaty.  The chili cheese fries were nom-nom-good.  

Come by to the hotel to take a pic with the Statue of Liberty and walk over the Brooklyn Bridge... and then keep walking...

This is always a good people watching spot. Decent amount of tables and plenty of food\/drink options. Typically crowded due to its location and photo ops. I haven't stayed in the rooms here in a while, but last time I did they were fairly dated.

Replica of NYC. I like the concept of the theme. Even indoors feel like you're in NYC. They have a small food court who has NYC food. Haven't tried any of them yet but I will next time. They have a roller coaster too. The only one on the strip. Shara closed down and Stratosphere is far away.

I am only reviewing the restaurant and shops selection. I do not gamble and did not stay in the hotel. I did however eat at 3 of the restaurants, satisfied my chai addiction at Starbucks and shopped at a few stores. 

They have such a great selection of restaurants and shops. It's Vegas so they are all very pricy. If you step away from the casino the smoke isn't quite as bad and the restrooms are always clean.

Stood here this weekend when me and my hubby came to UFC202 it was a great stay. We walked to the t-mobile arena in less than 5 minutes. We stood at the Chrysler building quiet and comfortable rooms. I LOVE the bed they are so comfortable. They do charge $10.00 for parking now if you staying at hotel which I knew before coming thanks to other people who wrote reviews you get a key to come in and out of parking anytime, that is one of the reasons we didn't move out car figured if we go to other hotels they will charge us for parking? Enjoyed the pool it was not too crowded waiters were friendly and fast. I like the fact that it is connected to MGM and Excalibur since NYNY does not have buffet we walked across the bridges to eat at those two locations less than 10 minute walks each. They have many restaurants downstairs that look yummy but we had to much alcohol in our body we didn't get a chance to stop by somehow you don't get as hungry when you are drinking.  Would most definitely be coming back soon!!!
This is my favorite place to stay when in Vegas. You never have to leave the hotel because everything is in this one! Lots to do in this hotel.

I love hotel rooms.  Seriously.  I could go on vacation and just hang out In a hotel, and what better place than Las Vegas where your hotel has a casino, several restaurants, bars, shops.. It's like, my ideal vacation spot. 

I've stayed at NYNY before when I was younger and was drunk over half the time I was here (who isn't?) but now I'm a little older and can't keep up as much and like to chill and relax.  The rooms are a decent size and decor is fine, bed is comfy BUT- the Internet is absolutely terrible.  You can't load ANYTHING.   And my TV kept cutting in and out and was always broken and jumping like a satellite dish with interference.  It's a sunny, hot day right now too, not a drop of rain since we arrived.  

I'm giving it 2 stars just because of how ridiculous it is that you have to pay 20 dollars a day for things included like the Internet and TV, which isn't worth 5 dollars a day.  If they want to say it's for all the other shops\/restaurants\/attractions here then they need to lower the prices of some of their items.   

I doubt ill stay here again.  I prefer something like Paris or Planet Hollywood.

Worst hotel ever- overpriced for what you get, should have just spent $50 more and stayed at the Wynn. Rooms are dirty and stocked with nothing. There were pubic hairs in the shower when we got there, seriously skeeved out. No refridgerator, 2 glasses, no wine or bottle opener, 2 towels that are super small and old. Restaurants in the hotel left a lot to be desired for. Bottom line ny ny is past its prime. Won't be back

A fair hotel, a decent price.

As far as hotels in Vegas go, it's not the most beautiful. But if you want to stay off the strip and not spend an arm and a leg to do it, New York New York is a good way to go.

The rooms were large and quite fairly clean. They had all the amenities you could possibly require. My only complaint about our room was the serious lack of a view. We large windows on the corner of the building...and only really had a view of a portion of the roof and the roller coaster. Not the end of the world, but...mundane. 

Because of the price it seems this hotel attracts a moderately sloppy crowd. There will be no shortage of overweight white people in flamboyantly colored track suits playing the slots. 

I liked that the interior lobby was designed to look like you were in the middle of downtown new york, however, the architect would have been better served designing some window seating or something. We didn't eat here, but I'm pretty sure it's not possible to have a nice meal when you're directly across from someone loudly yanking at the slots.

Overall this was a decent hotel. If you're in town to take in the get some good food and see some shows, you'd be better off staying at the Bellagio or The Aria. If you're bringing you're 3 kids and you don't mind walking a bit to get everywhere interesting, New York New York would be perfect for you.

This hotel is located on the strip.  There are a lot of food options available at this hotel.  Parking was free in the rear parking garage.  We were in a standard room which was average.  We would stay here again if the price was right.

I've never stayed here, but I've generally stopped in every time I've been in Vegas - including back when it first opened.  I don't know why, but this hotel appeals to me with its fake back alleys and mock up of New York - to which I've never been.  It's not as charmingly done as Paris, nor as splendid as Bellagio, but it does have its own appeal and vibe.  The roller coaster is fun to watch, not quite as much fun to ride, even though I enjoy roller coasters.  It's been 15 years since I rode it, so perhaps they've made some changes.

There are a number of more reasonably-priced restaurants in NY-NY, one of my favorites being Nine Fine Irishmen.  There's also a food court upstairs with even cheaper options.  It can get loud in there, but that's part of the energy, I think.  As many times as I've been, I usually see something new on each visit.  A few years ago, I found the NY firefighters\/WTC memorial outside, which is very touching.  

It's certainly worth dropping by and taking a look!

Booked a week for a hockey tourney. I tried cancelling the last day on the first day of checking in. I was given the running around and basically held hostage for the final most expensive night. I had to pay an extra $179 for a room that I wasn't using, not including a resort fee and a parking fee for a day that I wasn't going to stay. I tried speaking to numerous people. No one was willing to help but they're great at passing the buck. Customer service is really lacking. They're trying to gouge you for everything. No coffee pot in the room. Want a fridge, it's an extra $25 per night. Pool is closed at 8:00pm, trying explaining that to your kids when it still daylight out during the 100 degree Summers. Other parents in our group couldn't get an extra blanket or extra towels. One parent was trapped in the parking lot for 10 minutes because the gatearm wouldn't go up. They tried calling but no one answered. Overall, it was one of the worst customer service experiences ever!!!  I would never willing come back to this hotel.

Pros: As others have mentioned, service here is phenomenal. Hotel check in and check out was fast. We left our room key up in our room a bunch of times and it was no trouble to get a replacement. However, what are all the complaints about? Our room was nice? There was no peeling paint or outdated furnishings? Our room was clean. House keeping did a good job. Ate some traditional NYC foods. I had a pizza and the hubby had a hot dog. 

Cons: not as ultra modern as other Vegas hotels, but I like that it has a unique personality all its own. Old school Vegas with a cool theme. My friend and I were talking, we felt that all the newer hotels are so generic. They're all the same. Starbucks in the Casino was overpriced.

Thin walls.
terrible view from the dirty window, 
rooms FAR away from the elevator,
no refrigerator in the room, 
loud vacuum from the maids, 
Took forever for the toothpaste to arrive.
un friendly staff when you check in, I'm the guest remember?

free wifi? its really NOT free if you're charging your guest $22.00  a night for a "resort fee"
WHAT A SCAM!!!

4 night stay....I would return.
I had the standard room...Try to get a room near the elevators, or you will be walking forever.  Smoking floors available if you smoke.  The bathrooms are a good size and there are plenty of towels. Beds are super comfy.  The room service is excellent as well as the restaurants downstairs.  The drink prices are super high!!  Pour 24 was a nice bar\/good bartenders.

OK, so check this out.  I know I have been long dormant with the Yelp reviews (bad girl, BAD GIRL!), so to make it up to ya'll, I am now embarking on a casino-by-casino tour of my new hometown of LV, NV, and will include reviews of each as I tour them.  Now, these will not include room stays, but just schlepping around the premises - eating, drinking, and checking out anything that moves or doesn't move.  Got it? OK, let's proceed...

Review #6:
spoiler alert: it is themed after New York City!; some very cool features including the outdoor faux Brooklyn Bridge along Las Vegas Blvd., the outdoor roller coaster that actually runs right above areas of the casino, and the Greenwich Village area of low key eateries; the hotel check-in is not impressive, basically part of the casino; the entry to the roller coaster is via a huge maze of arcade games - great area for the kiddos, I suppose, but Hades for childless adults; serene & classy conference room area on 2nd floor with cool black & white NYC photos; I must say that Nine Fine Irishmen is the greatest Irish pub west of Manhattan, especially with the house band Sin e Ri Ra kicking it almost every night; best craft beer bet = Pour 24 on the 2nd level has a great selection on tap (please stop ordering Bud Light here, people!), and the Broadway Burger Bar has a fair bit as well
Gonzalez Y Gonzalez restaurant is bomb! I love the guacamole made right in front of you! its amazing! i loved the tacos de asada! im sure a fan and I am coming back
Tends to attract the younger crowd.  On the weekends there seems a lot more reallllllllllly drunk people as opposed to other places.  The hotel is nice and a pretty reasonable price.
Been here for four hours, still waiting for room that I reserved. Crap service, rude employees, and it hasn't even been one day.

I am a fan of this casino. I like where the elevators for the rooms are located (at the front of the casino, not the back) and that it is at the four corners. This casino is a very good home base casino. The prices are usually pretty reasonable and the staff typically very helpful.

One of my go to places when in Vegas.

I arrived at NYNY on 1\/25 after making a phone reservation via VIP Services using an MGM M Life offer. Initially, I was told via the phone operator that I was unable to make a booking due to the fact I had just used an offer at Aria. However, she double checked her accuracy and confirmed that she could make a three night complimentary reservation for me. I arrived at the hotel and due to an event earlier in the day, I did not have a credit card to make the reservation at check in (entirely my fault). I spoke with a front desk agent who informed me that if I was unable to check in on the 25th that he would leave a note in the system moving my reservation forward to 26th-29th...great! As it turned out I was unable to come up with the necessary deposit until 8am the next morning when a friend (M Life Platinum member) laid down the cash and checked in with me. At this point we were told the reservation was cancelled and we couldn't check in due to the fact that I had just used an offer at Aria....at this stage I'm starting to realize NYNY Hotel and Casino has serious communication problems. The lady in VIP services who was phoned by the front desk agent didn't even bother to read the notes that had been logged in the previous night stating that should I not check in the reservation would be moved forward. I instructed her to read all the notes and she then realized her error and proceeded to confirm the reservation. However, without telling me, she instructed the front desk agent to make the reservation from 25th-28th against the instructions in the notes. Furthermore, I was told so many different deposit amounts for check in that I became confused as to how much was required. One time it was $367; another time $300...finally my friend put down $200 cash and they gave us a room after a 30 minute process early on a Saturday morning. 

My buddy who put the cash deposit down had to suddenly depart Las Vegas Saturday evening and wanted his $200 so we went to the front desk and explained the situation and they eventually refunded his deposit. HOWEVER, they didn't explain initially that is was contingent on the room being cancelled until I provided another deposit. I informed the front desk agents that another friend would be arriving within the hour to provide a credit card. At this point the agent said as a courtesy the hotel would allow me a one-time entry into my room and provided a key which would work only once to allow me to grab a few belongings and freshen up. I grabbed the key and took the elevator up to my room and, of course, the key didn't open the door. I returned back to the lobby and explained to the male agent, Robert, who programmed the key, that it didn't work. He went and spoke to the assistant manager, Michelle (unprofessional and horrific communicator), who then came over and said I couldn't access my room because they needed a deposit and that she was unaware I had already been in the room!! WHAT?!?! As a manager, how could she not have looked at my folio and made this mistake. Poor poor poor service NYNY. She wouldn't allow me to access my room to grab a few items. So I waited another half hour...keep in mind this past encounter took at least 30 minutes by the time I was told no!!!

I waited and decided to speak with another manager, Jackie, who was even more unprofessional than the assistant manager. Jackie told me that the only reason I got in the room was because I paid a deposit (is she serious?). Anyway, she gave me a bunch of dud excuses about why they made a mistake and miscommunication on their behalf. Finally, I left in disgust and simply said their service was deplorable. 

My friend arrived an hour later with his credit card and I was able to access my room. I am going to be a nightmare to deal with until the end of my stay as I felt the disrespect they showed me was unlike anything I have ever experienced. 

The two female managers that worked that shift on Saturday January 26 were the worst example of customer service I have seen in the US. Vegas and MGM International most certainly pride themselves on exemplary hospitality and these ladies were not trying to find solutions but rather defending their mistakes. 

If you have other options for a hotel, explore them. Numerous other guests were complaining about the service that day as well.

Stayed here a couple years ago for a friends 21st. We were on a budget but still wanted fun and this was the perfect hotel. It's affordable and on the strip. The beds were very comfortable & clean. I always recommend people to stay here.

I was totally disappointed with the rest rooms on the casino level, very dirty and I don't ever remember seeing that at NY NY.
Love the roller coaster and the lines move pretty fast, don't pass up when in Vegas.

Wow! this place got so many restaurants!
So interesting and it right across from Hawaiians Market place!
Came here to see a show here and had to go back to our hotel...
Very Interesting place!
Next time I got to check out Hawaiian Market place across the street!

Staying at the NYNY tonight after many previous trips to Vegas in several other hotels. This has to be by far the worst run hotel Vegas has to offer. The customer service experience leaves much to be desired. In fact, I'm surprised the employee name tags don't just say "give us your money! screw you!". Reserved a king bed for my husband and I- we are newly weds, however we showed up to a room with two double beds (which they swore were Queen. They're not.) and then was told a room with a King bed would cost extra. We tried to quickly redeem our vacation by going to the roller coaster which is just a maze of meandering employees who don't know where the line begins (they looked blankly and shrugged). Additionally, that whole area where the ticket booth, lockers, & gift shop are located- is a crowded mess of people sitting, standing around, waiting in lines, and there is zero signage up helping direct where to go. We ended up paying for a locker, not going on the ride, and leaving disappointed. As a young woman with a chronic illness, I can assure everyone this is only a place for a young healthy and able-bodied person who isn't phased by demeaning comments slung by staff. I ended up asking an employee if I could speak with a manager, waiting and waiting and waiting and finally just saying "nevermind" before heading back to my room. Glad I'm heading to the Golden Nugget tomorrow. Would never step foot in here again and will make sure no one I know for as long as I live ever visits this establishment. I wouldn't wish such a miserable experience on my worst enemy.

So the kids have been wanting to ride the roller coaster here and as usual they don't understand that it's for "big kids".  So we valet parked and walked in just to check it out and make our way to Excalibur and MGM (since we normally don't frequent this side of the strip).  We walked upstairs and it was super duper noisy, loud obnoxious music coming from Coyote Ugly bar and I thought, please get me the XXXX outa here.  We did however shop at the gift store downstairs and found some souvenirs for our friends who were moving away.  Overall, I don't see us coming back:(

A tad bit aged, lots of fun though and lots of places to eat. The roller coaster still runs which is good, and it is themed to sort of look like a New York street, at least they try to make it that way.

Good friendly people working here

Price was not bad compared to other hotels

Rooms were nice and clean

I stay here again

We stayed one night here in the Empire State Building. We booked a non-smoking room through Expedia, and were kind of disappointed that our room had been a smoking room until recently. Unfortunately the smokey smell was still present in the room. Aside from that, this hotel and casino was pretty fun. Our room was big, although the bathroom left something to be desired with it's tiny shower and low shower head.
The casino is pretty nice compared to others on the strip. It's comparable to the other MGM properties. The food court area designed like a New York City street is fun and offers a decent variety. The patrons seem less pretentious here than at some of the other casinos. I would probably stay here again.

My girlfriend (at the time) wanted to stay at NYNY, so I booked. The price was pretty decent for the strip (100\/nt). The rooms were ok, neat, clean but my GF kept complaining about the beds being uncomfortable.

There are a lot of cheap food choices here, but my fav was 9 Fine Irishmen. Irish pub with decent food, good beers, and excellent service. The waitresses' uniforms did not hurt either. Ben & Jerry's was convenient and great as always. Il Fornaio and America were decent, but better food could be had by walking to MGM or Monte Carlo. The only breakfast buffet was at Chin Chin, with an Asian twist.

NYNY was all over location. It's centered in the south strip, across the street from MGM and next door to Monte Carlo. Excalibur is across the street, but I only used it to pass through to Luxor and Mandalay Bay.

Next time I will definitely skip the spa services at NYNY. Their spa is small and overpriced for the amenities. Also, the guy on the men's side was kind of rude.

When you were a kid, did you ever want to have a giant slot machine? Well, I did. 
How are you expected to get on the elevator, past reception, with that giant slot machine staring at you...laughing in your face because it knows it's going to take all of your money. 

True story folks. It all started when I put $20 in this machine. First few pulls and I'm down. Next few pulls and I'm up. Up, down, up, down, up. Now I'm exhausted and have a crowd around me as I've been here for about 20 minutes (I'm sure people were just gathering because they were fed up with me not sharing the machine). I am heaving and hawing, yanking on that machine over and over. Every time I got back to  the original $20 I had put in I told myself I was going to leave, but I never did. 

Downward spiral. In a matter of minutes went from $47 to $1. I took my last $1 pull and gone, the money is gone. I share a moment with the machine, pulling my face close to it...more like using it to cover the tears gathering in my eyes. I take a moment, step back and take a breath. No longer than a minute and someone else has already taken my place. $1 in. 

DING, DING, DING, DING. $1, 1 pull, jackpot of $4,793.54. For realzies?

Things to remember:
1. That was a true story
2. You can't ask someone for a cut of their winnings, even if it was you who had just dumped an endless bucket of cash in the machine for over 20 minutes. It doesn't go over very well. 
3. Don't go in March because the pool is closed (I learned that the hard way)
4. Nice accommodations, good value.
5. They have a chipper in the hotel :)

I have stayed at a few different hotels in Vegas, and this one is my favorite. I could probably stay here and never leave the building. The food and bars are great, and I love the atmosphere. The rooms are also clean and comfortable. They also are working on adding new shops to check out, and I am already planning to come back once Shake Shack opens!

Ok.....for a town that is hurting for people.....they are adding costs on to everything. Check-In b4 3pm.....pay extra($20). They will charge you a $15 per day resort fee, which includes: in-room high speed Internet, unlimited local and 800-number calls, boarding pass printing, notary services, and incoming\/outgoing faxes (limit 5 pages), Fitness Center access and daily newspaper. Have them take it off it is useless! Room is average and shower was kind of gross. Bed is hard, lighted mirror did not work. It was really an average place to stay. Also never got the feeling that staff cared about anything. These casino\/hotels seem to only be interested in the younger party crowd or the retired age group. Seems like middle class gets screwed again! Oh well....will wait another 3 years and see if it gets better.

Love this casino.....just love it. Plenty of great bars and the slots. I like the layout of the rooms, lost of good choices. Restaurants are good - IL Fornaio is really good, plus there are plenty of reasonable food choices in the NYNY food a ante area - Greenbergs Deli is my favorite. Don't miss the Dueling Pianos.

Nice family oriented hotel (huge arcade for kids, roller coaster, family friendly restaurants and Hershey store)  but worse customer service ever. Room was average at best and had many things broken upon arrival that had to be fixed. Windows were filthy. Requested and paid for a rollaway bed at check in and had to call back at 10:30pm because they never delivered it. Had 4 peeps in room but only gave us 3 bath towels. Everyone at this hotel acts like they hate their job including those that work in the restaurants.

No. Just... No. 

Yes, the free wifi rules (with a $20 resort fee per night) and yes the dueling pianos are awesome ($5 cover just to stand inside, $15 if you want to sit...) but the pool is minuscule & has NO SUN (!!) until noon, there's very little people cruising the strip on this side, the food is mediocre and their customer service sucks. Hard.

At 6:45am the morning after we checked in a strange man walked into our room, using a key & turned on the lights. We are two ladies passed out after a long day of getting to Vegas & had the hell scared out of us. Probably scared him, too. 

I call to front desk, obviously very upset & confused and she tries blaming it on me saying it either didn't happen or we must have left our door open & he randomly walked in!!! She checks the computer saying no other keys have been made for our room & insists it was our fault. Then she suddenly puts me on hold for 5 minutes because he came back down to the front desk saying exactly what I said. 

She offers no apologies, no making it up to us, just says it rarely happens & we can get a new key programmed. Like that makes a difference. Wow. When I ask to speak to a manager, she says she is one. When we ask for a room she says we have to wait until 9am to see if there is anything available. I ask if she'll be on at that time and no... I get to explain this all to a new manager. 

Very very very unhappy with New York New York.

New York - New York was: Stinky, Crowded, Loud, Overpriced and Dirty\/Rundown.

Still it was a decent experience but we won't be back because of the above.

Some Redeeming qualities:
The Hotel Staff - Hard workers that labor in the above environment.
Location - Good part of the strip
The Roller-Coaster and Coney Island are neat additions that my kids enjoyed.  

MGM should spend some money and renovate NY NY and not just use it as a cash cow.

This place is one of the favorites when I have no choice but to dive into the fishbowl we call the strip. The New York New York has the pretty cool places to grab a quick drink or a fast slice of pizza if you are hungry. There seems to be a lesser percentage of Douche bags in this place. The ESPN Zone is okay if you are wanting to catch some sports and grab something to grind on.. This casino is also pretty centralized and has easy parking.. This is also a pretty good place for us people watchers, they have seating outside of all the small cafes..... Enjoy!

The hotel is OK. If you want a quick check in, check out or any kind of service that involves hotel personnel, you're out of luck. There will be no answers to phone calls either. Or at the very least you'll have to on hold for longer than you can bear.

If you're a part of the older crowd, sure, go ahead and book here cause if you end up getting a suite and feel like partying with 10-12 of your closest friends, they'll eventually kick you out (we got kicked out at 3 AM-- that's pretty early for Vegas--so much for a city that never sleeps). Apparently, in this hotel, they sleep at 10PM.

So if you're a part of the retired crowd and feel like you need to sleep at 10PM, by all means, book here cause they'll accommodate you. If you're a part of the younger crowd and love to be loud and party it up in Vegas, choose another hotel cause eventually, you'll probably get kicked out for having fun. By far, the worst hotel I've been in (I have never been kicked out of a suite until this weekend).

What a wonderful hotel.  It was our first time in Vegas, and a friend recommended the New York New York, and I am so glad she did.  We stayed there for two nights - Saturday and Sunday night.  I thought it was very affordable.  We used an entertainment book coupon to save a little on the price (10%, I think).  I booked online and called to confirm my room a few days later. 

This hotel met, and exceeded, all of my hotel requirements - clean, quiet and comfortable.  The room even had black out curtains.  When we woke up at 10am my husband and I literally thought it was the middle of the night.  It was wonderful. 

Every employee we encountered at the hotel was kind, friendly, and helpful.  I truly enjoyed staying there.  As I typically do in hotels, we just hang the do not disturb sign up, and we don't have housekeeping come into our room - we ran into them in the hallway and got some fresh towels.  

We stayed in a king sized nonsmoking room, which was exactly what we had requested.  We were even able to check in early at 1pm for no extra fee, and when we arrived before that time the early check in process was explained to us, and it all went smoothly.  We arrived on an early morning flight, so they held our luggage at the bell desk (efficient and friendly service) while we checked out some casinos before our room was ready.  

We stayed on the 29th floor of the Century Tower and had an amazing view of the back side of the strip, the mountains around the city, and the Rio.  

During the day I sometimes heard people talking while we were in our room, but we slept straight through the night and into the late morning without hearing anything (which I can rarely say about a hotel).  We kept our AC fan on medium speed, and that kept our room nice and cool, and possibly covered up any background noise if such a thing existed. 

Everything was efficient at this hotel - luggage drop, luggage pick up, check in, check out...and they have plenty of employees available to answer your questions with a smile.  We enjoyed the casino.  It's big, but not too big.  There are also lots of affordable food options in the lobby area by the casino - pizza by the slice, and a deli.

I checked out the roller coaster on top of the casino with our two for one deal that we got since we stayed at the hotel, and it was a lot of fun - and we did not have to wait in a line to ride.  

I would highly recommend the New York New York to anyone looking for an affordable hotel in Vegas.  We had an amazing time and will definitely stay here again.

The parking structure is filthy, dirty gross. Don't wear your nice shoes. Wear rubber boots over them cause you're walking thru shit.

That's why I like Bellagio and Wynn the best. He cleans the parking structure.

The beds are great. Room is small. Wifi is a little slow. I had to call the tech to log me on.
Parking is horrendous. Staff doesn't assist in the garage with anything. Over priced and not worth it.

I really like this hotel.  SO much more than the Las Vegas Hilton which I was staying at earlier in the week.  

I see that many of the reviews complain about the hotel not living up to the city of new york.  And all I can say is DUH!  It's a THEME for crying out loud.  :) Do you expect to feel like you're on a pirate ship when you're at Treasure Island, or like you're in ancient Egypt when you're at Luxor?  They did put a lot of effort into detail though..  You do get that "gritty, hardcore" new york feeling to a much larger degree than anywhere else on the strip.....despite the fact that a large percentage of the people here are weekender transplants from LA.  

What I find funniest of all is that the most "new yorkish" thing of all is the lines that you'll run across in the food establishments in the "village".  The lines are all VERY slow moving and long...just like new york.   I swear, they must've went to new york to hire these people too... because most of them seem to have everything from the accent to the look of typical new yorkers.  

The room - The room is a pretty standard room.  You get what you pay for.  You're not going to get the posh opulence of the Bellagio....but it won't be a bargain basement slummy place like Hooters.  I did have a problem with a safety pin being on the floor upon my arrival.  (Must've been missed by the cleaning people, I almost stepped on it barefoot.. ouch), and one morning there was a problem with water temperature.  (Might have been a fluke as it was better later on in the evening, and the following morning).  Other than that, I have no problems at all with the room. 

It's a nice middle of the road hotel.  For 10bucks a night they upgraded me to a strip view, which has an excellent view!  The location is in a perfect spot on the strip.  It's within easy walking distance to the heart of it all.  Also, you're just a hop away from both the Monorail AND the Mandalay Tram.  There's a pharmacy within easy walking distance if you want to pick up essentials like mouthwash, bottled water, (condoms) etc...without paying the overpriced strip prices.  

Highly recommended if you want to stay in a decent vegas location and room...while at the same time..saving money for vegas's other fun activities.

At check in there was a very long line like at the airport but the font desk was well staffed and the process was pretty fast. Mila assisted us at check in, she was professional but not friendly. The room was fine except that we paid for a room for four but there were only towels and toiletries for 2. The phone in the room was not working so I had to go back down to the front desk and stay in line all over again to address the issue. Which was solved in timely manner. Other then that I would rate it average like the many other older hotels on the strip.

We did not stay in the hotel so this review is based off the Casino.

GREAT! We left Excalibur (see my review) and came here based on the recommendation of a buddy. Fantastic recommendation. Within five minutes of sitting down on the slots the drinks started flowing. I got fairly drunk and dumped quite a bit of money into the slot machines here. Funny how that works isn't it?

There were half naked dancing women behind the poker tables, great way for the house to win LOL. All in all, we will definitely be back, and may never wonder anywhere else on the strip. New York-New York is about the best we found in our walk of the strip.

First time in Vegas and we were very happy with this hotel. Great location to see everything up this end of the strip and not to far from the free tram to get to the other end. The room was fairly nice, you couldn't really hear any of the outside noise even with a big game in town.

I stayed at the New York New York the past three days when travelling to Las Vegas. I got a really good deal to stay there, and was excited to see the room. My best friend and I arrived early in the morning and were hoping to get early check-in. Unfortunately, you have to pay for early check out. I asked for a room on a higher floor so that my friend and I can have a nice view of the strip, but I only got floor 18.

The room was very nice, and seemed clean. Everyonce and in a while you can hear the rollercoaster go around the building. There are a lot of restaurants downstairs as well. Although I love New York, I was a little bummed out about the experience in the hotel.

Very cool hotel & casino. Had so many restaurants and a Starbucks (very important) and we got food right there before heading out to the club and strip. Our room was very nice. Only complaints are that their toilet made a lot of noise when not in use - yes, weird- and the "Mexican" restaurant Gonzalez Gonzalez was just not authentic and food was poorly "re-heated" so just skip that. Other restaurants and delis were pretty good. We stayed in the 29th floor and the view of the strip was amazing. I would definitely go back.

Ahh, the infamous New York New York. I have to say, as we slowly entered into the hotel, I did not expect to see what I was about to see. I did not know there is a mini New York INSIDE the New York-inspired buildings themselves. The whole entire food court is based off of the infamous streets of New York. You can see mini ny apartments, along with the iconic ny food served there in mini restaurants. I started r frolicking around like a little kid in the candy store. NyNy's food court is so cleverly designed that we rarely ate elsewhere. 

Now, to the room. As we reached our room number, we heard muffled music. Weird. After a few tries with the card, we got into the room. Lo and behold, the blaring music came from the radio in the room. The room keeper must have knew we were coming to party our asses off as that is the only explanation I can come up with that explains why she left the radio on (with volume allll the way up). Needless to say, our little dance parties took off right away. 

The room was very spacious and nicely decorated. I have nothing to complain about except for one thing: there was no vent in the bathroom. So with no windows and no vent, one may wonder how to do their daily deeds (deeds that don't smell too great) without everyone else knowing AND smelling it. Yea, it was definitely tough......

Anyway, all in all, I loved NYNY!

Get a room with a view on the strip. It's only 15 dollar a night extra but it's totally worth it. The hotel is fine. They have a nice selection of restaurants. I would recommend the italian place and the oriental restaurant. Great Hotel to get into the Vegas Vibe.

The whole stay was okay 'coz we only stayed for 5hrs at least. But the moment we found our room, there's still an old tray in front of it. I guess the room service left it there or totally forgot about it.

A definite no return again. Check-in was fairly smooth; May 26-29, and our room in Century Tower B on the 33rd floor had a nice view of the T-Mobile Arena and neighboring Monte Carlo Resort for our 4 night stay. But even at check-out, no one could tell me what the incessant noise was that sounded like machinery; or a train; or even the roller coaster, almost non-stop day and night. I know the coaster doesn't run throughout the night, and from our room the track looked to be maybe 10 floors below our window. And the only sound from the coaster, was the screams heard from riders during its descent down the drop, seen from our room #3337. 

The bed mattress was firm but quite comfortable, but the pillows are some of the most uncomfortable I've experienced anywhere, and you're not given a choice of two, only one each.

The restaurants were for the most part quite decent, minus my experience at Il Fornaio Cucina Italiana Bakery. Which I found to be below average. I confused this bakery with the restaurant, which we did not dine at, so disregard my check-in and tip of that establishment.

Staff, for the most part, were quite helpful but at check-out, the desk clerk tried to charge me $20.00 for our use of the complimentary drinks we had on our tab. Apparently my wife's bartender at the pool when ordering her virgin mixed pina colada\/lemonade drink, and Starbuck's barista, my Frappuccino and son's coffee, entered these orders as food not drinks. Fortunately my wife arrived with my frap in hand, and the receipt from Starbucks, just as the clerk was heading off to his manager to get the charges dropped. Sure, it's only $20.00, but you awarded me the complimentary $25.00 drinks card at check-in, don't now try to charge me for its use. And train your staff the difference between food and drink items when inputting them into the register. He was eventually given the okay from the manager to drop those charges.

My true rating would probably be more like 2.5 Stars.

The casino was fun, won some money, so yay!  Lots to do here if you decide to bring the family.  There's a giant arcade that's on the way to the roller coaster.  The roller coaster is fun, but very rough.  Still, its worth a try... when in Vegas, right?  Also, do do DO check out Zumanity!  Leave the kids at home or put them to bed, there's a reason they have a warning that the show is for people 18 and up.  But that's a separate review.  The only issue I had was the cartoony New York look.  Not a huge issue, but the look was a little annoying for someone who lives less than an hour from the actual New York.  Otherwise I give this place a thumbs up.

Used to think this place was cool until they started charging for parking.  Went to see a show there and spent $150 for tickets and then they hit me for another $30 for parking since I misplaced my parking pass. Yeah I messed up by losing the pass but I don't think that charging $30 to park for less than 2 hours is acceptable.
The atmosphere was really nice.  I loved the Central Park setting inside and my girls and I couldn't help but ride the Manhattan Express several times while we were here!  A lot of great memories.

2014 YELP 365 CHALLENGE - 86\/365


We stayed at Bally's so our experience at New York New York felt like a breath of fresh air, literally. Our friends were staying in a suite here so we met up with them and I have to say that I was really surprised. First off, it smelled delicious throughout the hotel and casino. They are certainly pumping extra oxygen into the casino and they must have a thousand glade plug in's because it was refreshing and not as smokey as other casinos. On Saturday night it was a party in there as well. The casino was blasting great music, every table was full, slots were being used all over. My friend's insisted on finding the $5 blackjack tables (really?!) and of course the two they had were full of college kids and had crowds of people around them. We finally got in and it was pretty fun. We also had a chance to hang out at the pool for a bit on Saturday afternoon and it was a lot of fun there. The pool seating area was not too large, but the pool itself was a good size. We had to roam around for a while until we found the perfect seats right next to the pool. They have those fun chairs in the pool which were cool because you get to sit in the water without having to actually get INTO the pool. Lots of people at the pool but not overwhelming at all. There were fun games of water polo happening and the people watching was priceless! We got a few margaritas, they were stiff and delicious. The restaurants area was very lively and fun. My friends ate at Gonzales y Gonzales and the food looked good and they said it was delicious. And finally, we didn't stay the night there but we hung out in their suite on the 17th floor. I have to say that I have seen better suites for SURE! The decor was pretty bland, nothing special. Two small single person chair\/sofas and a small table. They also had a really ugly looking Jacuzzi in the middle of their room which was fun for them but awkward looking aesthetically speaking. Also, the walk to their room was literally over 10 minutes from the casino elevators. Once on the 17th floor it was a windy trek all the way to the room. That would have been an inconvenience for me if I was staying there. And here's something alarming to me. My friend and her bf are heavy smokers and when they got to their room, they realized it was a non-smoking room. After they called the front desk, they told her that they didn't have any more smoking rooms like she had reserved so they could go ahead and smoke in the room anyway. As someone who deals with bad allergies, it would suck to check into a non-smoking room and have to deal because the couple who stayed for a whole week before me were allowed to smoke over a pack a day in that room.

Our room was nice with a good view. I would stay here again but am really disappointed with the high resort fees and daily parking fee. We chose this hotel because of the lower prices but it is an older property. The room was clean but not sanitized. The throw pillow had an ugly white stain on it and one of the chairs had a big stain on the seat, hope it wasn't urine! The furniture is scratched and dinged but I understand this is Vegas so there is a lot of use. The bathroom was clean but attention to the corners is needed. The ceiling above our shower had a bubble in it which leaked water when we showered. It didn't appear to be an old leak so may have just happened. The housekeeping staff were the nicest people. I was really impressed. For Vegas it was a good deal just needs some attention to detail

Worst customer service ever!! I will never stay at a mgm property ever again. I'm in the service industry and if I treated people that way I wouldn't have a job.. and the topper on the cake is they are trying to charge me 50 on a Monday for one of the rooms I checked into 2 hours ago. Never again!!!

One of my favorite's in Las Vegas... Fun at a reasonable price.

NYNY is great to spend some time strolling and drinking beers. the gaming floor is laid out well and the staff is generally friendly and helpful.

Be sure to get a slice of pizza :)

I will never stay here again.  We are Las Vegas locals. I recommended the hotel to a few friends in town for a couple of nights.  We only stayed there one night.  First we chose the upgrade to a spa suite.  The jacuzzi tub had 6 jets in it.  3 were stuck in a poor direction and could not be moved, 2 others on the other side of the tub did not work at all.  Secondly, we patronized 2 different restaurants and had bad service at both.  We won't be having any more "staycations" here nor will we recommend it to friends or family visiting from out of town.

It's your basic Las Vegas casino...nothing fancy. If I get food here it's typically Chin Chins...because of the sexy hostess that works there and their food is pretty good!! Lol Or the Starbucks.

The bar under the Statue of Liberty light sucks...but that's due to TERRIBLE service. 

Chin chins and Starbucks...outside of that, you're on your own!

I've stayed here a few times because the location and price were right. I go every year because of the Strip at Night half marathon. This past weekend, my husband and I decided to upgrade the room to a players suite for more square footage and just to be comfortable. We enjoyed the two tv's and my girlfriend and I enjoyed foot soaks in the jetted tub that is in the room.

I'm inspired to write this review because we mainly stayed here and got to pretend we were living in a New york apartment. Go downstairs for breakfast (grab a cronut at the America place, or breakfast samich at the italian bakery) or heading down to go to a show or grab lunch. I like choices. While there is no buffet (we walked to Cosmo for Wicked Spoon which is amazing!) I did like the diversity of quick eateries that were available.

The one thing I would stay away from is the Cell phone accessories place located on the Mezzanine level. That guy is a total con artist. My phone charger broke (it's a cord I bought at the swap meet) and since I was only there for one more night I didn't intend on bothering to charge my phone. I passed by it and specifically asked if the item in my hand was the cheapest iphone 5 charger. He said $24 and then proceeded to try to sell me a phone case that included a charger. I asked if that one was cheaper than $24 and his reply was it's $99. Did you NOT just hear what I was asking you. When I stepped away to leave he tried to pull me back in and say he would sell the first one to me for $20. When I asked what time he would open til (because I still wasn't justified in $20 purchase for just 12 more hours til I got home) he said "I won't be open later for you, after you leave, I'm closed". That was the last straw.

Later as i was passing the Essentials shop by the Empire elevators, there was a Best Buy machine! the cord I needed for charging my phone was $15!! PERFECT since it's an actual APPLE product and exactly what I would need to buy once I got home anyway.

My husband has stayed here before and found his room passable.  But I think this is one of the more fun casinos to stroll through.  It is outfitted with numerous small eateries, all with a delightful miniaturized New York decor complete with parking meters, street signs, and "outdoor" seating in the walkways.  The ventilation is good, so it isn't overly smoky.  There's a place where the roller coaster pops through and you can here people screaming.  Like all casinos, it is labyrinthine and easy to get lost in; you can get a free map from the front desk.

I love this hotel. I have stayed here numerous times and gets better every time. From the newest slot games, dueling pianos, comfy food court  and Coyote Ugly's you can't get a better hotel on the strip. The wait staff made sure I had a drink in my hand at all times and the people at the check in desk are great! All in all my fave hotel in Las Vegas (I have stayed at almost all Hotels on the strip and I have been to Vegas almost 200 times)!

Took my husband to Vegas for his 40th birthday and we stayed at NYNY on the strip.  We loved this place!!  Great room....we upgraded to the Luxury Suite which was amazing and definitely worth the extra money. The casino was nice, not too big and just crowded enough for a fun atmosphere.  The restaurants were great....especially the pizza place at about 4 am. Over all, had a great stay...good customer service and no issues.  Would definitely stay at NYNY again.

The decor is reminiscent of the NYC I knew in the 80's which is sad. So sad. Kinda cheesey, dark and drab. I was happy since I won some cash and then a purple monkey at the Coney Island style carnival games. Then they were introducing the Absolut Brooklyn vodka, which is flavored with apples and ginger, at the outdoor pub which had a live alternative rock band playing. 

Dancing with the monkey on my shoulders + drink + good live music = me likey.

I want to give a shout out to the management team. I had some issue but they resolved it. Assistant manager Jackie is a lovely lady and she's a smart manager who knows how to handle customers complaints. Brian at the concierge is a wonderful manager. Charles is a wonderful manager. Lastly, Tim of the risk management   Team, he's a super nice guy. Thank you for all your help to make my trip even more wonderful than I could possibly imagine. That one star missing only because of the bell boy joe who had a nasty attitude and threw my bags on the floor and left. I have got to give props to the management team at nyny. Customers aren't easy here and they handled it extremely well. Thanks.

NYNY has made a fan out of me. I was very skeptical of this hotel due to the type of clientele that some of the attractions entice. (Coyote Ugly, ESPN Zone, Arcade area on 2nd floor, Mediocre restaurants) but after a lot of research (on Yelp and other sites), we decided to give it a try. 

Luckily due to the crappy economy, there are a LOT of hotels offering killer rates, especially for the Sunday - Thursday crowd. NYNY was offering free upgrades to the Spa Suite including a bunch of coupons for drinks, food, and BOGOs. Also, the Spa at NYNY was offering a deal: 2 50 minute treatments for $170 which is about $70 off of the regular price. ALSO, Zumanity tickets were 40% off. Signs pointed to stay at NYNY this trip and give them a shot. 

Check in was a breeze. Arriving on Sunday is great. No crowd at all at the front desk. We got our keys, went to our elevator which was very close to the front desk, and went to our room. 

We walked in and it was BIG! Huge picture windows overlooking the pool and 1st drop of the roller coaster, Big flat screen on the wall, Huge Kingsized bed with footside bench, Roomy bathroom with walk in shower and big shower head, and the coup de grace, the elegant Hot tub for 2 with all kinds of mirrors surrounding it. Lots of stuff in one room but there was still enough room to run around, do cartwheels, whatever you fancy. It really is a nice room with modern decor and a lot of space. Too much space almost. It seemed like a chore to walk all the way to the front to answer the door for the bellhop who brought our bags up, but I complain in sheer jest. 

First order of business? Test that hot tub out! It had one of those cascading water spouts that pour into the tub. After about 10 minutes, I finally realized that it wasn't filling up and I had to close the drain. Duh. It took around 20 minutes to fill and we were ready to dive in. We actually took a shower first because we didn't want to soak in dirty water. Must be the Japanese in us. Once in, it was nice. 2 little seats to enjoy the jets. Very very very nice way to start our vacation. Also, you would think that it would get a little musty in the room that has a hot tub in it, but the venting system was very good and it didn't stink at all. Good job to the engineer for that job! 

We decided to get a drink at Pour 24 because they boasted a large beer tap inventory. 24 I presumed. We sat at the bar and got 16 oz pours of Moosedrool Brown Ale and Abita Purple Haze. Both were very good beers. We also had the Rogue Stout and the Blue Moon Honey Wheat. All were good and will be reviewed more deeply in Pour 24's dedicated Yelp. :) 

After getting a good buzz, we decided to go pick up our tickets for Zumanity at Will Call and also make reservations for dinner at Gallagher's. We didn't want to walk outside the hotel for the night and Gallagher's was the best option for this hotel. Both Gallagher's and Zumanity will be reviewed separately as well. Good for both though. 

Next day was our Spa treatments in the morning. Great experience. Review to follow as well. Same goes for the pool. Not huge but a great atmosphere. Perfectly crowded on a Monday afternoon. 

After a great dinner at L'Atelier at MGM (highly recommended) we came back to some leisurely gambling at NYNY. They have a good assortment of everything for every budget. I stayed in the high roller area just to kill time (yeah right) We headed up to the arcade area to check it out. Wow, still a bunch of loud and obnoxious teenagers running around at 11pm. Bleh. Decided to grab a slice of NY pizza and Nathan's hot dog and head up to the room for the night. Both were delish BTW. 

Check out was a breeze. BTW, everything is payable via room card so you don't need to carry around your wallet except for gambling and such. Great system. No employees acting skeptical as to how to charge the room or anything. Very professional. I didn't meet one employee that I didn't like. 

Like I stated above, NYNY has changed my mind about staying here. I still wouldn't come here if I wasn't staying here, but I would definitely come here to stay. Spa Suite or better only according to the other reviews.
I hate this hotel. Trashy and with the smell of cigarettes, it was a dump. Probably equivalent to circus circus.   CRAP

Great hotel amenities, however I'm writing a review due to their lack of customer service, they charged my card twice, attempted a third time but was declined by my bank, after multiple talks to the front desk they said they corrected it. wrong. They only reversed one charge proceeded to charge my credit card as well. It's been a nightmare. Unable to reach their accounts receivable after several attempts, only helpful one was Kurt the Front desk manager whom I spoke with today. What could've  been simple has been turned into a nightmare, p.s this was our honeymoon as well.  We will never sTay there again. 5 days of worry and wondering when our bank accounts will be correct.


We did email yesterday as well as today And placed multiple calls, we've received  no response by email, however it does say it can take 48 hours so we will wait and see.

It's my 15 time in Las Vegas in the last 2 years, 
This hotel and the service it's disaster, 
Including the check in (big mess) room -small then all the other rooms that I been in Las Vegas, 
Room service- wooow!!-40 min and 3 phone calls for blanket .... and I have a more complain... 
I make so bad decision to stay at this hotel...
Doesn't worth even half of the price that they charge ,
The first and the last time for me (and for all the people that I know)!!!!!

Classic place on the Strip. Typical casino, mediocre rooms at best. Terrible customer service. Charged me for 3 nights, even though I only stayed one because I was so disappointed in the experience. Visit for the day, go elsewhere for the night.

We didn't stay at New York, New York, but we did gamble and eat there. I had more fun in this casino than any of the others we went to. I loved the atmosphere! 

We had the best service when we were here; either on the floor with the comped drinks, which where not watered down like some other places, or at any one of the bars or restaurants there. We moved around a lot and it seemed that every time we'd stop to gamble, one of the waitresses would come and ask us if we wanted a drink. We never went with out one for long. 

We'd chuckle every time the rollercoaster would come through and you could hear the people on it screaming. It just added to the fun. 

 I enjoyed this Casino much more than I did the hotel\/casino I stayed in. The next time I go to Las Vegas, this is where I want to stay.
the atmosphere and crowd was a lot better than Excalibur...and there fun arcade zone is soooo much cooler!!!!

One of my favourite hotels that I had the chance to visit in Las Vegas. I didn't even stay there (as I was staying at the Flamingo) but it felt as though I was staying there with all of the time I spent there. There is so much to do there with the roller coaster (which I would highly recommend- being a half inside and half outside roller coster be sure to pick a good day but it is something to do with kids that is not expensive), the Hershey Chocolate store with a delicious variety of baked godsend the Chocolate Bar right outside of the Hershey Chocolate store- this is a place to stay that is good for both adults and kids :)

This is what happens when you value profits over positive customer experiences.

Due to family (kids want to go to arcade), was forced to set foot in an MGM Resort properties for the first time in over a year (boycotting due to them charging for parking to squeeze more profits for executive bonuses). Casino has no poker room (my usual game) so went down to the pits for a little blackjack while the kids do their thing. Sat down, bought in for $100 with plans to re-buyin for a couple hundreds more, and gave the dealer my player's card along with the money. Dealer immediately toss the player's card back and condescendingly said 'we don't track at this table'. Wow. Really? $5-25 a hand action is too small for New York-New York\/MGM? I realize everyone love whales but it's the everyday gamblers that keep the lights on for you and prevent your property from looking dead. Everywhere else give you at least token credit for sitting at a table.

Dealer had personalities of zombies - just going through the motion. Nobody was tipping but with that attitude and company policies no wonder nobody tips.

Crappy multi-deck blackjack rules with high house edge. To top it off after giving them $300 in under an hour of play, you still have to give them $$ for parking. 

Awesome experience (sarcasm). No thanks, won't be back. Good job turning a property that I am somewhat neutral on (never played in NY-NY before) to a negative experience. For the couple bucks in parking fee you chased off customers that would drop a couple hundreds in your properties.

Let me preface this by saying I haven't been to Vegas in 10 years. Yes, I live in SoCal, but sometimes life and career happen. That aside, seeing the towering, cluster of buildings took my breathe away and he excitement was kind of overwhelming; I'm a 31-year-old man, just two months out of major abdominal surgery. I couldn't have asked for a better place to enjoy 24 hours of just fun, albeit toned down fun, but fun nonetheless. 

After purchasing my room from Expedia and whatnot, I couldn't wait to get there. (Just FYI- date of arrival was 10-22-15 and departure, 10-23-15 AM) I counted down the days and seconds, etc. Valet is quite easy to find and on Tropicana (just a quick U-turn from Tropicana if you're coming from the 15 North). Our valet attendant was incredibly nice and welcomed us to the little bit of the isle of Manhattan on the West Coast. Exciting! It was such a rush waking through those double doors; the smell to me is highly intoxicating and a happy familiar smell that 10 years later feels like you've arrived in Vegas. Awesome sauce! 

We got into the registration queue which took an astounding ...5 minutes to check in. Alfonso, I believe was his name, checked us in quickly. As my room was not a suite, was prepaid via Expedia, no credit card was required as I paid the resort fees in cash. No credit card needed for a hold for incidentals, deposit or anything. (Hope I answered some of the questions about that.)

After we got to our room assignment 2931, Century Tower A or 1, our awesome room on the 29th floor, the first room you come to once exiting was our room. Now, some might find that unappealing as it is so close to the elevator. However, for someone who isn't entirely at their prime (only 2 months out of surgery), it was a godsend. I must also mention, there was zero hallway traffic noise throughout the night. Zero, zilch. 

We ventured to the Lobby Bar which is very quaint, we plumped down to two video poker games, pumped it with a $20, the first drinks of the day began. Cameron, at the Lobby Bar, is quite possibly the nicest, funniest and most accommodating bartender I've ever encountered. The bar was full and people from all parts of the casino wanted drinks from him. As busy as he was, he never faltered in giving each of his patrons the best service with utmost attention. Thank you, Cameron!

If I had one issue, it would be the mLife desk to check-in, sign up or redeem MyVegas app comps. It was about 3:30pm, the line was 25 people deep and only 2 registrars. There is also a separate line for mLife "high rollers" that trumps the rest of us who doesn't have all those points. I'd recommend, especially during peek check-in hours, there'd be more folks over there helping us out. I digress from the positive. 

For dinner, I made reservations for my aunt's birthday at Nine Fine Irishmen and the 6 of us gathered there at 5:30. The lovely hostess explained the history and liveliness of the restaurant (my mom's family, which is who attended said dinner, comes from the UK, so we enjoyed it). We are, at times, heifers so we love trying as much as possible. We ordered the fried sausages with those delicious dipping sauces, the Beer Cheese dip with artisan breads and the baked Brie with balsamic marinated cherries; all 3 were unbelievably and insanely good. (Side note: the bartenders are no joke. Every drink that was ordered was delish). Our main entrees were 2 fish & chips, Shepherd's Pie, two Nine Fine Salads and one Bangers & Mash. All was delicious. I'm a trained chef and yes, I stand by these opinions on the food. Our server was very attentive and the expediter was also very nice and attentive. Just an all around great dinner. 

I'm sure I've bored you enough with my review, but we gambled a bit and my traveling companion and I went to the Center Bar for drinks and some gambling. Drinks were fantastic (Cosmopolitan was amazingly cold with little floating chips of ice -- perfection!)

To top it alllll off, after the alcohol seeped in, we decided to order room service. I can't say enough about how great the menu is for us late night eaters who need booze sopped up. We ordered quite a bit (because why not) and were quoted 45 minutes or less; it was there in like 25-30, piping. Very happy!!!

We checked out today, Friday morning and the email to check out was super easy and key drop right in elevator waiting area on first floor. Got our car from valet and off we went back to Los Angeles. 

I cannot thank you all enough at NYNY for making this trip, as short as it was, just so much fun and how happy I was. Thank you thank you thank you. From the bottom of my heart. Thank you.

Worst FUCKING HOTEL EVER! We paid 1500+ dollars for the weekend PENTHOUSE! They tried giving us a crappy ass fucking suite! Really? What the fuck is wrong with you guys! Trying to fool us into giving us a crappier room thinking we wouldn't notice? It's my cousins BACHELOR PARTY and you guys try to screw us over like this? Are you kidding me? NEVER COMING BACK HERE, DO NOT COME HERE! THERE SERVICE IS REALLY REALLY BAD! IF I COULD GIVE A LOWER RATING I WOULD

Stayed here for my company's Annual Conference 2\/4-2\/7. LOVED IT. The room was nice and had an amazing view. Great places to eat inside, it was a nice attempt to recreate the East Coast atmosphere. I will be back. (will post pics soon!)

This is a pretty cool hotel and casino... very similar to Paris. I prefer the north end of the strip, but it's still a good location, being across the street from the MGM and very near the new City Center. The prices are generally pretty low and the table games have low minimums. Simply, it's a great casino if you don't want to go too fancy. Kids would love it too.

Three stars for the hotel, five for the blackjack tables, so I'm averaging for a 4-star review.

Hotel:  Our $85 run-of-the-house room for a Sunday night was clean and comfortable. Certainly showing some age, but the shower had good pressure and the bed comfortable. One sign of age was the fact that there are few places to charge cell phones.  Neither of which were convenient. (desk and bathroom, not nightstands)

  Two strong dislikes: 1)  no security!  No security guard at the elevator, and no card needed to access the elevator.  2) The mobile check-in service sucks!  Checked in the day before.  Was asked for an estimated time of arrival.  Well, check-in was 3, so I said 3 (although earlier would have been better).  After filling out all the info (including credit card), I was told to NOT go to the desk UNTIL an email arrived with our room number.

Fast forward to FOUR hours later (7pm) and we still had not gotten said email.  So now we're ticked off and ready to do battle when we decide to risk all and go to the check-in counter.  After a simple "sorry" when he heard we had been waiting for four hours, we were given the key to a room via the New Yorker elevators.   Note to NYNY management...we would have spent more time and more dollars IN your hotel had we received the email and been able to check in earlier, instead of killing time and spending dollars nearby.  Just sayin' you might want to revisit this strategy.

Casino:  Hell yeah!  I can't recall another time where I had more fun at blackjack tables!  My rule for playing blackjack is it has to be a fun table with a friendly dealer, and literally every table I hopped around to was exactly so!  Even the pit boss was friendly.  It truly felt like they wanted us to play and have fun.  Which we did for as long as our one night,early morning flight allowed.
Again, too bad we couldn't have checked in earlier and spent more gambling entertainment dollars.

Parking:  It was $12 for the night.  We had problems with the machine to pay on the way out, but they had a help button. Have to check my credit card statement to make sure that worked out okay.

4 STARS FOR THE ROLLERCOASTER.
 I haven't stayed in the hotel so this review is directed towards that awsome ride.
So the first time I went on this I loved it, its like a rush of excitement & energy throughout the whole experience. After it ended I went back on it a few more times because I loved itso much. Def. worth going on while your in vegas. (esp. if your under 21 'cause there's not much to do)

I love this hotel stayed here twice, it's in a great location love the new York theme.
The roommate really spaces we had a massive bed and it has to be one of the most comfortable beds I have ever stayed in I felt like I was on a  cloud. The rooms were really clean and so was the cassino.
All of the staff were fantastic and couldn't do enough for you.
I really liked the layout of the cassino we did most of are gambling in this cassino.
The selection of restaurants was great we had so much choice. We didn't get time to go on the roller coaster so gives me a reason to go back.
Highly reccomend  this hotel.

Rooms are definitely dated. One of the lamps were broken when we checked in (burnt bulb) so had to call maintenance. The other lamp could not be turned off manually as the switch was broken so we had to unplug the lamp if we wanted it off. The room had the smallest windows I'd ever seen at a Vegas hotel. The furniture were mostly paint-chipped with scratch marks. Oh and the kicker of the whole trip was that the king sized bed sagged one ONE side and not the other, so either me or my partner had to deal with back pain the next morning. 

This is seriously the worst room we have ever stayed in in Vegas. Even Tuscany Suites or Southpoint had better rooms. 

Definitely the last time we will ever book a room in New York New York. 

One bonus: the cleaning lady there, Marisela, was super nice as she patiently gave us directions and information around the hotel when we flagged her down in the hallway. Subpar rooms with nice cleaning lady.  The one extra star is for her.

Thankyou for reaching out, I was visiting las vegas hotels to research where my next visit will be most accomidating for my guests. Is there anything that can be done that will make me want to stay for my large party in march? I'll change my review apon your response

Great place.  Nice room.  We were upgraded to a spa suite (and mysteriously charged less - go figure).  

Hotel is a little bit older than some of the others we stayed at on the strip, but well maintained.  Views are great.  

Only gripe with this place was the fitness center check in clerk.  A little on the rude side.  One lesson for her would be to answer the question asked and to not assume things.  We asked where the pool was.  She responded that the fitness center was only for 18 and up.  I said "my son isn't going to the fitness center.  Where is the pool?).  I was going to the gym while my 11 year old and my wife went to the pool.  The pool looks like it is undergoing a renovation, so we weren't able to use it while we were there.  

It is also a kid friendly hotel.  There is an arcade area for kids right by the roller coaster.

Resort fee reasonable compared to other spots on the strip ($17 compared to $25+)

I would totally stay at New York, New York again. We upgraded our room  so we could have a view of the strip. Although a little pricey, the room was big for a hotel room with floor to ceiling windows which gave us amazing views. Not a lot of time was spent in the hotel room, but the views at night left amazing memories. 

I was warned by a friend that the roller coaster is noisey but it was actually pretty silent, it was never loud enough to bother or wake us up. The friends we went with were pretty stoked to hear that you can ride the roller coaster for free if you stay at the hotel (i think its about $10 to ride the roller coaster normally).

The beds were really comfortable with super soft sheets. I never sleep good on hotel beds but I actually had a really amazing sleep the nights we were there. The room was always nice and clean, as well as the rest of the hotel. 

As for downstairs, theres a Espn sports club as well as a Coyote Ugly. Dont forget tons among tons of slot machines and card tables, but since its NYNY there are New York facades that have breakfast and lunch foods for pretty reasonable prices. Its really cool to walk around down there before adventuring onto the strip. On the same floor as the arcade, theres a Nathans NY Hot Dogs that has amazing chili dogs, hamburgers, chili fries etc. 

NYNY is definitely worth checking out.

Just left after an amazing weekend! Mu husband and I stayed in the Spa Suite, and it was awesome.  Nice view of the mountains out of the window, and that hot tub was spectacular.  They even put a nice card and a Hershey's chocolate bar in our room for my husband's birthday.  Customer service was great, the decor is phenominal, and Zumanity is THE BOMB.

Seems ok from the outside (I mean, the fake buildings are pretty amazing), but inside it's totally inauthentic. 

At times the decor seems a lot more like 'jack the ripper' era London than anything in New York. 

New York might be the greatest city in the world. How they managed to turn it into a totally dull casino is beyond me.

We looked at different hotels before choosing New York,New York our last visit in 2016 we stayed at the rio and the only problem was having to take a shuttle to get to the strip.This time for our week stay wanted a hotel right on the strip and with New York,New York we had the luxury of being able to go out the double doors to the strip.

The room we choose was the "spa suite" and glad we did,very spacious and thick walls,didnt hear anyone next door only when there door opened! 

We did enjoy room service this trip and I believe it from "America" the restaurant downstairs.

Few thing that I dislike and so did my husband was the toliets they are so tiny and They also need better pillows, I was tempted to go to the spa for a massage after a few nights.

Has a lot of charm and enjoyed out stay.

They ruined the casino! 

The character of the "Central Park" Casino is gone. Their casino is now a cheap looking attempt to go, I don't know, modern? Tacky and boring. The shops of New York streets seem oddly out of place now. Once again, they could not give me the king size bed I requested. The girl at check in did upgrade us to a huge corner room on the 35th floor with a great view of the mountains. Opening the drapes upon check-in, we found 2 bachelorette party balloons on the floor. There was a tarry substance on the table when we got there, and was still there after they made up our room during our stay. 

New York New York has definitely seen it's better days, and unless they do some major upgrading, we'll be going elsewhere.

This casino and other MGM Affiliated Casinos charges $10 to park in the garage even if you're a local. Will never come here again. I'm spending my money in this establishment and they can't even offer free parking.  Never Again MGM!

We've stayed at NYNY before and always had a good time, but this trip has been the exception and so much so that I feel compelled to write this.  
Check in took 45 minutes - a huge line of people waiting for just 2 front desk employees working.  
Checked in on Thursday - no hot water.  Took 2 days to get it fixed. 
WiFi was intermittent at best.
Room temp could not be regulated.   
 
The icing on the cake was stopping into the 'dueling pianos' bar tonight for a drink and being driven out by the blasting pianos and screeching piano players\/singers that apparently thought screaming lyrics was a good way to overcome the fact they were so hopelessly off-key.  

I gave NYNY two stars because we've had a good experience in the past, but it's obvious their services have gone down hill.

I know I should write a review only if I stayed there or played.. Bt I couldn't resist.. this resort looked so cute from the outside when I passed by....Tacky and corny sure, But I found it quite adorable the way they tried to copy the skyscrapers here..

ARGH. Difficile d'évaluer le New York New York. Il est tellement beau de l'extérieur! Le détail est bien travaillé : on a vraiment l'impression d'avoir un petit New York a côté de nous: la statue de la liberté, le Brooklyn Bridge, le Chrysler building... Tout y est ! 'J'étais émerveillée en arrivant devant.

Mais en y entrant, un peu comme le Paris, je n'ai pas vraiment trouvé de choses ressemblantes comme à NY: dans le concept oui, le fond est respecté: les immeubles et les escaliers a l'extérieur, les pizzeria, les vendeurs de hot dog, mais voilà rien de ressemblant sur la forme. J'ai été très déçue.

If you had to be snowed in at any Las Vegas Hotel\/Casino, I think I'd want to be snowed in here. Thankfully it's the middle of the fucking desert so that's not likely to be a problem but my point is, this place is fantastic. There is so much to do on The Strip but you could easily never leave the New York New York and still have something to do at basically all times. Don't do that, that would be crazypants, you're in Vegas for Christ sake, go out and experience Vegas. But you COULD.  

The registration and casino side of the ground level is this beautiful, art deco inspired decor and the other half is like a mini idealized New York City, there are shops and restaurants at ground level and above those are little fake apartment windows. It's like a permanent stage set of New York City and it's adorable only in real New York there isn't a bar that has pre blended frozen margaritas and daiquiris on every corner. 

The staff was super helpful and friendly across the board, I ended up interacting with a lot of them for various reasons (none of them having to do with anything negative about the Hotel itself) and every single one was exceedingly professional, helpful and friendly.  We ended up in a corner room and it was enormous, way more room than we needed for a 2 night stay and we had an awesome view of the roller coaster, I was a little concerned about the noise but I could barely hear it and it stops running at 11 anyway.  The plumbing was a little weird, in the first room, which we ended up upgrading from, had some weirdness with the sink faucet, nothing catastrophic, and then in the upgrade room the shower wasn't draining properly so by the end of the shower you're up to your ankles in water. Definitely not anything major, just weird. 

I'd definitely stay here again. 

(I'll review each of the bars and restaurants that I visited inside the Hotel individually so as not to clog up this review)

WORST HOTEL SECURITY EVER! They treat you like a delinquent! So unnecessary!
They do not allow hover boards (understandable) and even when you walk in and they don't say a thing to you about it at first, they kick you out with your whole family including a newborn (even when you say you will leave without causing issues) along with 7 security's all the way to the garage. Kids were so scared. So humiliating and unnecessary. No one should be treated that way. Horrible place.



*Again, security didn't seem at all professional, should be kicking out drunks out, NOT families with children. Very bad security personnel.

****BUG BITES****

Reasons for the low rating:
0. Bug bites in the room.
1. Drunk old guys passed out in the hallway, crapping themselves. (See picture)
    I would have gotten a closer picture - but I didn't want them to wake up and try to make a 
    drunken attempt to charge at me and rub their crap shorts on me.  Safety first. 
2. Dirty floors in the bathroom.
3. Toilet paper had a brownish stain on it.
4. Vending machine took six bucks for water and didn't work.  Front desk wouldn't help.
5.  Room has dust all over the place.

Now let me just say this... the restaurants weren't bad at all in New York New York though. The restaurants I went to were as follows:

Gonzalez y Gonzalez:
Service: 5 out of 5 stars.
Environment: 5 out of 5 stars.
Food: 5 out of 5 stars.
Drinks: 5 out of 5 stars.  Margaritas were 2 for 10 dollars and were mixed amazing. 

Toms Urban:
Service: 5 out of 5 stars.
Environment: 5 out of 5 stars - great modern decor that is fun for dinner and just chilling at.  There are three bars, two inside and one outside along with plenty of seating to relax and chat with your friends.
Food: 5 out of 5 stars.  I had the tri-tip french dip which was excellent. 
Drinks: Not sure. Didn't order any mixed drinks. 

Il Fornaio:
Service: 5 out of 5 stars.
Environment: 5 out of 5 stars.
Food: 4 out of 5 stars.
Drinks: N\/A - only had coffee and it was good.
