We also met a host on the floor who gave us our mLife Cards right there and helped us out with advice.


CONS
*Location - More towards the south of the strip, but still not a bad walk if you want to travel to other surrounding casinos.

I think it is finally time to submit a review of the NYNY Hotel & Casino. 

There are really only a few reasons why I have or would ever stop by for a visit to the NYNY and the following are:

Zumanity (Cirque Du Soleil show)

Tom's Urban (Restaurant)

Hershey World (Only to take my tourist friends)

I have stayed in a room once in the past and was not impressed compared to all of the other better options for lodging that Las Vegas offers.

Valet parking is a plus here though as it is super easy to access the hotel to get in and out.

The casino is small and dark, they have some decent quick bite options and a good pizza & pasta joint called New York Pizzeria which is open 24\/7. I would not make a special trip to eat here however if at the NYNY and in the mood for pizza I would. They sell whole pizzas, stuffed pizzas, pizza by the slice, Stromboli's, calzones, salads, etc.

There is just not enough going on at the NYNY to keep me there or coming back. 

That don't impress me much!

I LOVE New York, but in this case... New York New York.  Just walking around the eateries inside the hotel was enough to remind me of New York.  The plus side is that I also won at this casino compared to the others.
Great food options. Casino is very nice and has a fun atmosphere. The location is A+. The staff is also friendly.

I did not like the room. The service was great and the food in the hotel are great but the room was not. The bed and pillows were horrible they had lumps in them. The tub\/shower was full of hair and there was trash in the room still. I would not stay there again.

Super bummed we booked room here. Thursday with my husband and teen for $185! Room was dirty, remote to TV didn't work. I called house keeping and they never showed up.  Check in was at 3, and pool closed at 5. I have never been so disappointed.  Finally housekeeping MAN came at 11:35 pm and actually tried to enter room without permission! thank goodness my dead bolt was locked.  My husband and daughter were asleep and he kept banging until I opened. I told him it was too late and he insisted giving me another remote. I took it and the sad thing is it STILL didn't work. I can't wait to check out tomorrow. I will never stay here again.

This hotel has always been unique, and because of the way the building was built alot of the  rooms have a different layout than most hotels.

Check in: Was not that long of a line when i came, but this hotel is busy so expect long lines around check in time.

Room: The room was nice, had a unique layout and I felt the bed was very comfortable to sleep in. The bathroom was very large and the shower head had 3 different settings which i found to be an enjoyable feature.

Pool: NYNY has ALWAYS had the perfect pool water temperature the only word i can think of to describe the water temperature is 'beautiful'. The pool deck was hot.....but definitely not as hot as other hotels thanks to the buildings and garages surrounding it.

Service: My keys got demagnetized & wouldnt work and 99% of hotels in town will send Security up, verify your identity and let you in sparing you the front desk line again....However some Security person on the phone named "Corey" (Graveyard) bltantly refused to send someone up to assist me and displayed quite a condescending attitude over the phone until I reminded him that i could make a phone call to his director to find out why assisting me would be a problem. I went to the desk, got my own keys and mysteriously Security arrived when i got back in which i thanked him & told him i had resolved it myself per 'Corey'. The front desk agent i spoke with laughed with me and stated Security is rude to them alot too.....lol

All in all it was a good stay, but its strange i cant seem to go to this particular hotel without encountering a rude employee (Last time it was a front desk agent) . **Shrugs shoulders** maybe someday.

This place is nothing like the real New York, New York!" snorted my good New Yorker friend in disgust. Well, for someone who has never been and has nothing to compare it to, this is as good as it gets.

Spacious, clean rooms, well stocked bathroom and updated decor grace this hotel so I am never disappointed in my stay here. Was able to get a Park Avenue room with a great view of the strip this time so I was a happy camper. Location is prime as you are within close proximity to neighboring hotel\/casinos. And thank God for walls that aren't thin!! You can actually get a good night's sleep unlike at other locations...ahem, Silverton.

If you're craving a slice of pizza, they have a spot open til the wee hours of the night or you can hang out a the Bar at Times Square and watch the dueling pianos belt out crowd pleasing tunes. I'll usually do both. Grab a slice of pie and watch the show unfold from seating outside. Kill two birds with one stone! They also have a Coyote Ugly bar if you wanna kick up your heels and potentially leave your bra hanging from the ceiling for good measure after you've had one too many.

Customer service left a little bit to be desired. It used to be much better years back but hey, can't win 'em all. The only other caveat? The additional resort fee that most hotels on the strip add on per night. Lame.

I stayed here on a random weekend.. the room was okay, I've stayed in better places. But for the price I paid for (around $70) it was A-OK!

However I am giving a 4 star rating because of the quick and friendly service (easy check in and check out!) and the hotel itself. I think it's a cool place for both kids and adults alike. They have Shake Shack, Nine Fine Irishmen, a big arcade... I also like their area for their full service restaurants, where it feels like you're really in a New York neighborhood.

The location is also in the Strip, not super close to the center but it's still a good walking distance from everything.
dislike the area of the lower floor food court, very slippery. the ride was amazing! kinda sad they dont have that many rides. i love the $5 min roulette

This time around in Vegas, we stayed at the New York New York. We loved every second of it. We were there for 5 nights and stayed at the Century Tower on the 22nd floor. The only complaint was that we were in room 2279 and it was such a long walk from the elevators. Also, when I booked it, we were supposed to be given a king sized bed. As you can see from the photo that it wasn't. I specifically told the guy at the front desk, when we checked in, that it was supposed to be a king sized bed. I even showed him the itinerary. I was disappointed to see that it wasn't when we walked into the room. However, the room was nice and we didn't feel like going back downstairs, and standing in that line for another room. There is a $29.00 a day resort fee and a 12% tax for $3.48 a day.

The hotel was built to resemble the New York skyline. The have replicas of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building. There's also a replica of the Statue of Liberty and a roller coaster on the hotel premises. If you ever stay at this hotel, park on the 3rd floor. Drive around and park closest to the hotel entry to the lobby. 

This hotel is home to the Shake Shack, Tom Urban, America, and a bunch of other eateries. It's also home to Hershey's Chocolate World. They have this huge Statue of Liberty that's made out of chocolate.

I really liked walking through Greenwich Village. The facade of the buildings are just like New York. They have a bunch of eateries there. 48th and Crepe, and Fulton Fish Frye, were 2 that we tried. I also wanted to try the bakery there, but didn't have time for it. 

The housekeepers were so friendly. They would say good morning to us, every morning, when they saw us. Check out was really easy. The hotel sent this email, where you could just do it on your phone. They also have these independent check out centers where you just enter your info and you're done.

1st time here and to Vegas in 10 years.
Room was clean, nothing fancy. It was a Madison room. No fridge or microwave. Probably best to go with the basoc room and try a $20 sandwich up check in and ask for a complimentary upgrade.
At first the main floor gaming and food areas are a bit overwhelming, but once you get the hang of it is all good.
The Times Square Bar has dueling pianos nightly. They charge a cover after a certain time, but the music can be heard (loudly) from outside. You can grab a slice of pizza and a beer for $7.77 next door and listen for free. The times square bar also has video poker at the bar. Put in $20 and slowly play the 25 cent game. Bartender said you have to start with $20 to get free drinks (don't have to play it all though).
Plenty of restaurants inside. Il Fornio had 2 for 1 breakfast entrees with a decent selection for around $10.
Starbucks has small coffee for $3.50.
Beers to buy anywhere inside are around $10. There is a CVS about 5 min walk North. Go there and stock up if you don't plan to gamble consistently. The shop in NYNY is super expensive.
There is a slushy bar inside. You can buy a glass and get discounted refills (still not cheap).
There are at least 2 $5 blackjack tables at all times, but are pretty packed at night. I never saw a craps table less than $10. Take the attached crosswalk to Excalibur for $5 craps and a much better sports book. The sports book at NYNY is pathetic, but serves the purpose of being able to place bets. One bad thing about Excalibur is it smells funky inside...
Don't be afraid of Zumanity. It was a funny show.

It was very cool to stay in this hotel in Las Vegas after a recent vacation in New York City. It is incredible how well designed the outside (and inside) is to resemble the actual city. Our room was nice, but not over the top; and there were several great restaurants inside or connected to this hotel\/casino. It is not as centrally located as some may like, but being my first time on the strip I was happy to be at one end to encourage us to walk up and down the entire length of the strip.  I would recommend this hotel\/casino to anyone.

My favorite place to stay in Vegas. 
Good restaurants. Good shows. The piano dueling bar isn't my thing but an arcade, a roller coaster and good East Coast eateries sure is.
If you are not already an M Life member, sign up to become one as soon as you get your hotel key. 
The rooms are not flashy and nor is the pool. But I'm in Vegas to gamble, walk the strip, see shows and drink heavily. To me the hotel is a starting and ending place for the day.

Another great casino on the Las Vegas Strip.  It's a combination of everything.  They have a great amount of gaming, restaurants, bars and a Cirque shoe.  

Gallagher's for dinner then the Nine Fine Irishmen  for live music and dancing with some good Irish beer. 

This casino is within walking distance to the T-Mobile arena and that's the best arena around for shows and the Las Vegas Knights NHL games. 


Can't say enough about this place.

My second favorite after MGM. Have had moderate success at the tables. Dealers have been friendly and it is easy to get a cocktail. The village eateries are a good go. Pizza place is open late. Sometimes get a slice and sit outsite the Apple Bar and listen to the dueling piano entertainment.

We were first drawn here by the Coyote Ugly Daquiri bar upstairs. Now we go because we like the casino. We have stayed her a couple times, rooms are comfortable but nothing special. Only negative for us has been a couple of loser waiters at the "we are better than you - italian restaurant." Hey we just walk on past and enjoy the rest of the property.

I had a tourist come up to me and proclaim with excitement "this place is exactly like New York City" I told her she was right except NYNY Casino was clean, didnt have garbage everywhere and didnt smell like pee.

The only reason they get 3 stars instead of 2 is because we got an upgrade to a jacuzzi suite.
   Drove in from S.D. & stayed three nights. First our room was given away to someone else so we actually stayed in a one king size bed room & we got walked in on. That's when we had to call down to complain. 
   We were hungry & went to the Irish pub. Our favorite thing to order at Hooleys are the Irish nachos..well these were more like potato chips w\/ cheese. My hubby took one look at them & shook his head. I attempted to eat them however, they got soggy from the cheese. The waitress seemed nice & we sat outside to watch the night life.
   The restaurants are overpriced, even for breakfast its like $10 at the cafe.There are 3 Starbucks in the hotel but again we ended up sharing..too pricey. If you like carbs come to this hotel..they have pretzels, pizza all the NY things you could ask for without the smell lol
   I did like the Hershey store better than the M&M store. M&M was too child-like but the Hershey store had gifts for every age. The treats were delicious as well..I bought two different fudges & hubby bought a gift for his best man. I also like the M LIfe card which gives you discounts in some of the stores. The jacuzzi suite was amazing..we used the jacuzzi every day.

On our Vegas stay we decided to change hotels and casinos each of the 5 days here. NY NY is by far the best hotel. We upgraded to a King Spa room with whirlpool tub. Extremely worth every cent. Huge room super clean and quiet.  I think this may turn in to our main stay hotel.

Not a bad experience on the Vegas Strip.

Pros: Friendly customer service.
          Clean rooms.
          Fun atmosphere.
          Good selection of restaurants, shops, and souvenirs.
          Good selection of casino games.
          Nice selection at the bars.

Cons: A lot of nickel and diming. (Example: I don't think hotel guests should have to pay for parking every day.)
           No "cheap" food choices. Everything is more pricey than it should be.
            Housekeeping leaves a lot to be desired. Yes the rooms get cleaned but there is a lot they don't do that other hotels do. Example, if you leave clothes on the floor, it will be exactly where you left it.
             Bed not very comfortable.

Pros: Cheap. We paid about $400 per person for round trip airfare plus 4 nights stay. You can't beat a price like that. Good Location - across from the MGM Grand and next to some of the best hotels and Casinos on the strip, such as the Aria, Cosmopolitan, etc. Nice casino - small, but good blackjack tables, and if you go early enough in the morning only $5. 

Cons: They didn't have a king bed available when we checked in. Frustrating, but they upgraded us to a strip view room with two queens and we managed. Maid service forgot to come twice. This was sort of shocking to us. The first time it happened I complained as it was 4pm and the room had not been cleaned. The next day it happened again and I was very surprised. Eventually they fixed the problem.

Cant really say too much good stuff or bad stuff about this place. Overall the rooms are very standard, the type of thing you'd find at a Hilton or Marriott. Very basic. Clean. And there were enough little bars and restaurants to keep you busy if you wanted to stay in instead of going out. I wouldn't stay here again but I'd go back to gamble!

My husband and I booked a long weekend in a Marquee Suite over the 4th of July.  We requested a non-smoking room specifically due to my sensitivity to cigarette smoke.  When we arrived in our room, I was extremely upset.

The first thing we noticed was that there were two ashtrays on the table next to the door.  One of these ashtrays still had cigarette ash in it.  We also were hit by the waft of stale smoke smell from the room.  My gut reaction was, "Oh great, they gave us a smoking room."  However, upon moving further into the room, we saw the advertised no smoking signs with associated fine for smoking in the room.

I immediately called the front desk to express my concern.  The first concern was my discomfort, followed very closely by the desire to not be charged for smoking in the room because of the evidence left by the previous guests.  The front desk's only solution was to send someone up to "freshen" the room.  

In addition to the ash trays, we were also greeted by what appeared to be a heavy duty fan of some sort.  When the bellman delivered our bags, he expressed extreme concern as this was no ordinary fan, but was a machine that, if it had been running, would have been harmful to our health.  Luckily, housekeeping was already on their way to attempt to cover up the smoking smell so the bellman didn't have to call to have this item removed.

When housekeeping arrived, they pulled out an air freshening spray to assist with the smell.  This simply provided a different strong smell, which didn't last.  Over the three day stay, the smell of smoke lingered and was noticeable even on our clothing that we had not worn when we returned home.

Finally, when we had started to unpack, we opened the mini fridge and discovered leftover food from the previous guests.  

Overall, I was shocked at the overall disregard for our safety and comfort.
had a great experience gambling here, tables didnt cost much to play and the cocktail lady kept the drinks coming! One of the dealers at The pai gow tables was cute and fun to talk to while playing.

First time looking for an outlet to vent frustration. Room 1 found blood and dirt on the sheets. Called talked to the deck they moved us to the 2nd room and gave us 30$ to spend at one of their restaurants. 2nd room found either red wine or blood on the pillow. 

Won't be back and are still deciding if we want to stay tonight. 

Don't stay here

I have been @ NYNY several times per year for over a decade.  Excellent clean rooms.  Never an issue with anything.  It has everything except a poker room but for that I can cross to the MGM or Excalibur to get my fix.  
My experiences have gotten even better over the past year due to the MLIFE rewards program.  If you are not signed up, you are missing out.  The one thing I enjoy about this property is, over the years I see the same faces working there.  To me, it is a comfort to return to a place where I can deal with the familiar faces of the last numerous trips.  One time and only one several years back I decided to try Planet Hollywood for my trip.  Even though the casino experience was nice, the rooms were not.  I will never make that mistake again.  Other than poker, All my needs are met @ NYNY above expectations.  If I want to wander a little I can cross over either street and still be able to use my MLIFE card in both of the neighboring hotels.  And WTF is yelp asking me if they have gender neutral bathrooms?  
Good grief.  This world is getting crazy....  complaining about parking? get a rewards card and it is complimentary at the 2nd stage (Pearl).  What does it take to get a Pearl card?  A pulse and a couple hours at the slots.  In the mean time you are probably drinking enough to cover any parking that is being complained about.  I read some of the reviews and it cracks me up.  They pay under $100\/night on any of the travel sites and stay in an amazing hotel.  You can't get that in any other city boys and girls! (oh and excuse me...gender neutrals)...

I am not impressed with New York New York. It's cute, New Yorkie, but there's not much to do there, Coyota Ugly sucks, and it feels cramped when I walk around.

Never have been impressed, but I will give them a few stars for their efforts. They put alot of thought and money into trying to make it like the big NYC. It's cute but no cigar.

I went down for a conference about a week ago and found this hotel to be a decent place to stay and eat, but for the price paid you can do better in Vegas. 

There is an added price to just about everything they sell. If you buy a Starbucks coffee, expect to pay another dollar per cup. If you want to use the Internet in your hotel room, you pay 15.00 a day extra resort fee. The resort fee is suppose to give you access to the fitness center and hot tube, which were closed for maintenance during the time I stayed there, so I think this is a complete rip off. I think for $150 a night, the extra nickel and dimming fees are a crappy way to treat the customer.  

The night clubs and entertainment stink at this place, Rok is a crappy club and Coyote Ugly Saloon is all hype and no real entertainment. 

I stayed two nights in a hotel room that was considered to be an upgraded room. The hotel was clean and organized. Compared to other hotels in Vegas, the ventilation system stinks and the casino and hotel air smells of smoke. I stayed in a room on the 33rd floor and the view was great, but the fresh air and ventilation was terrible. When you blow your nose and see a bunch of black dust in the tissue, it shows all of the crap  you are breathing in by staying at this hotel.

If you want a better experience I would recommend taking your business and staying pleasures somewhere else. Good Luck

Stayed at NY NY on a trip to Las Vegas and found it to be nice, but not my favorite las vegas hotel experience. Although I do adore the art deco designs incorporated into the look of the hotel. The rooms are nice and the hotel is convenient to many parts of the strop. The food options here, were also not my favorite, but I did enjoy a hot dog and we frequented the Mexican restaurant, Gonzalez y Gonzalez, twice because my husband loved it. When you check in, you get coupons for free cocktails from the bar (yes, you get "free" drinks when gambling, but the bar drinks are a little higher quality & a little larger, and I enjoyed a really tasty bloody mary), so that was a nice perk. The pool was decent, although nothing fantastic and the arcade can offer a little fun if you need a break from the gambling side of the town. The newly renovated store fronts\/facade looks really nice, and I enjoyed the new Starbucks. The Hersheys store is also a fairly new addition and is a nice treat for the chocoholics out there. My favorite thing, other than the bloody mary, was probably the mini massage area on the mezzanine level. They offer walk up chair and foot massages at a pretty decent rate (I mean, its a better use of your money than feeding it into another slot machine after a long day on your feet). I actually frequent this feature of the hotel every time we visit Vegas.

Pros: 
The room was cheap 
I wasn't sexually assaulted 
I didn't get food poisoning 
They never tried to throw me out 

Cons: 
Crappy bars 
The room smelled kind of funny 
Affliction t-shirts 

Overall I think it was a pretty positive experience. When I go to Vegas I try to not get stabbed and make my flight home, I accomplished both on my last trip. 

Keeping in mind that this hotel is on the lower end of the pricing spectrum I think is is pretty decent. I just wish they had better food and drink inside the hotel but that can be rectified by going to any of the adjacent casinos.

I love the theme of this hotel.  The Park Avenue rooms were really nice, especially the corner room we got, nice and quite place to pass out in.  The location is okay on the strip, but i still end up cabbing everywhere anyway.
Love this hotel check-in is at three the roller coaster is cool and the atmosphere is really nice ! It is one of the older hotels but is cute  ! The shoping and food is hella good !

Usually enjoy my stay here but this time I decided to save a few bucks and book the Run of the house deal. Big mistake although our room was available when we arrived around 10:00 am we ended up with a 2 queen room with a view of a roof top and empty pool, we were woken up every morning around 6am due to noise from the room next to us. We tried to enjoy the Super Bowl with some friends in our room but our cable would keep glitching so we got frustrated and turned it off. Also our last night here we tried to just go to the room early and watch tv before bed but again we're unable to. Really disappointed, for the price we paid we should have at least been able to get a good night sleep and watch tv not so sure I'll be back here again

I guess it is fitting that a casino based on New York City, it is nearly impossible to navigate through it. The casino and the hotel as a whole is very hard to navigate, especially with a few drinks in you. Each historic tower of New York City, which has been reincarnated are the rooms that make up the hotel. However, unlike most hotels where the elevators for each section of the hotel are close together, the elevators at this hotel are spread out. 

The rooms themselves are a little awkward, the normal rooms are a bit small. There were two of us in our room and sometimes when we walked past the bed closet to the window, one of us sometimes would scrap or bang our knee into the entertainment center. Ironically the bathroom in the room was huge and very nice. It almost seemed that the money was spent on the bathroom and not on the rooms. The standard rooms are best suited for a one-person party or a couple's weekend. 

I have stayed in what is known as the Broadway Deluxe room that is a little bit larger, I would recommend spending the extra money to have a more comfortable room. 

The customer service, however, is very helpful. I receive offers from the resort on what seems like a weekly basis and it is nice when you call them that they will go over all of the offers with you and let you know which offer is the best.  

The pool is not very large and the roller coaster goes above it so if you are bothered by noise, it could bother you.  But one thing that I did like at the pool was that the cabanas are only around $100, which is a good deal. 

The casino itself is large and offers a wide range of games. I am a blackjack player and have really never done well at NYNY nor know anyone who has ever done well. Once in a while you get a good game of Craps, but that is about it. However, if you plan to do any gambling there, I strongly suggest the sports book. 

The restaurants at the resort at mediocre at best and can be downright bad. Gonzalez Y Gonzalez made half of my party sick. The ESPN zone is like any other sports bar that has mediocre food. Nathan's is not bad but you know what you are getting. 

The nightlife with Coyote Ugly is fun but the venue itself is small and when it gets crowded, you may not have any room to breathe. Rok is fun if you are a fan of rock music, which I am so I enjoyed the place more. But be prepared to pay, even girls, at the door.   

I also do not like valet parking system they have, instead of giving your ticket to a person, you check in at a machine and more than once that the machine lose my parking ticket and had to wait up to 45 minutes to get my car back. 

Overall, it is not the worst place to stay in Vegas, but it is for sure not the best.

I went through several casinos during my recent visit to Lost Wages, and NYNY stands out as the most . . . um . . . different.

When I saw pictures of the exterior, I always thought "cheesy".  When I saw it in person, I thought "cheesier".  If I would have booked a room, I might have thought "cheesiest", but I'll leave that to people who did sleep here.

I love roller coasters, so I planned to go on this one.  Then I got to the entrance, and found that it's $14\/ride.  That is beyond steep.  I didn't ride.  My coworker, who was also in Vegas at the time, told me that she did ride it a while back, and it's so rough and throws you back and forth so much that it hurts.  At my advanced age (I've been 29 for many years now), I don't feel like booking a chiropractor after riding a roller coaster.

Now for the good:  The Hersheys store.  Like World Of Coca-Cola and the M&Ms store, this one is overpriced.  But you can get a Hershey bar customized with your name on it.  And it has a chocolate Statue of Liberty at the inside entrance;  cool.

New York New York:  a good resort hotel to walk through if you want an "only in Las Vegas" experience, and if you want to hope that what's built in Vegas stays in Vegas.

The hotel was nice, the room price was great for a weekend with a lot of big stuff going on (CMA Awards, NHRA, Final Four).  Housekeeping was on top of everything. Late check-out was easy & free.  The pool is just okay. It was clean & warm, but the bar ran out of beer by 1:00.  All the other MGM Hotels have 2-5 pools, this just has one.  

However, I travel a lot for business. I've stayed in 5 star luxury hotels and Roach Motels. I have NEVER stayed at a hotel that didn't have a coffee maker and\/or a fridge in the room. NYNY rooms were newly remodeled and didn't have either. No coffee maker? No fridge? All the resturaunts serve huge portions, but you can't take any leftovers with you because you don't have a fridge. You have to go down to the casino and spend $6.00 on a crappy coffee because there isn't even a single-cup maker in the room! I guess this is typical now of Vegas.

I've stayed here twice within the last year during my 1st and 3rd stay in Las Vegas :) Before my first trip I was skeptical to book this hotel because of the mixed reviews but my bf and I were both sooo pleased. 1st time we stayed in a basic park place room I think and the more recent time we stayed in a marquis suite. Both were clean and up to par. Overall I like this place because it's fun and the food options are great (and totally reasonable for Vegas).

2 dollar minimum craps and some strong comp long islands is enough to make the NYNY my favorite stop on the strip for a poor college student budget Vegas weekend. Throw in the dueling piano bar and I'm sold! 

Seriously though if I were to be asked what my favorite hotel was before I got to Vegas, I don't think I would have answered with NYNY. I really like the Cosmo, and Ceasars, and hotels with better more modern decorum, but NYNY wins out because of their drinks and casino alone in my book.

I enjoyed my stay. It was pretty on-par with its peers on the strip. The dining was enjoyable; I ate at Greenberg's sandwich shop, Chin Chin, and America Restaurant. Separate review for those.

Overall it was a great, stress-free stay. The hotel is in a great location, easy to get to. MGM and m&m factory are just across the street. I didn't ride the rollercoaster but it looked like a lot of fun.
Our stay here was fabulous. The staff treated us like family. The resort was very clean. The food was outstanding. I will definitely stay here again.
Walked there for the roller coaster because I thought it was cool.........it was kinna short, I've seen better.

What a fun and visually appealing hotel and casino! The rooms are nice size and clean. Could use slight updates. We had a room by the roller coaster. I would not suggest that area to anyone. The ride came around quite often an ran until 11 or 12. The roller coaster itself was loud enough but all the screaming put the noise level over the top. The hallways to get to your rooms goes on and on and on like a never ending maze. There are adequate elevators though so you shouldn't need to wait more than a minute for one.

The casino area was the perfect size, not too big not too small. Makes it easy to find  one another if you prefer different areas. There is a hood variety of slots. There are also table games.

The area surrounding the casino is very fun. There are mock city streets with a pub, pizza parlor and several other eateries. Except for the casino noise, you would feel like you were strolling through a neighborhood. 

One side of the casino is open to several stores and a bar. The "I Love New York" is great for forgotten items and souvenirs. There prices are on point or lower than similar stores in the area. The Hershey store is also here. Oh my, the tummies offered there are amazing. However, the prices are very inflated. Fun to look and get that something special but on the expensive side. Good news, you get a free sample with your room card!

Overall, it was a great experience and would stay here again!

Fabulous stay over New Years. Great for kids with the arcade and roller coaster. Asked for a birthday card and chocolate for my sons birthday but never got it but all in all a wonderful stay. We will b back

I had a conference at Paris Las Vegas, but I was unhappy with the group room rate, a price I was able to beat by a couple dollars by doing merely a few minutes of e-searching. After a couple weeks of on-again, off-again digging for cheap prices, I came to the conclusion that NY NY was a good option for me. Although Paris seemed to brag about not having a resort fee and NY NY has a $20 daily fee, I was still able to save ~$40 a night by staying here. After talking to a fellow conference goer, I found Paris charged extra for internet access anyway, so the wifi included in NY NY's fee made the deal even sweeter. The fee also included use of the fitness center and the ability to print out your boarding pass in the hotel's business center - be sure you have your confirmation number with you.

Overall, I was very pleased with the space. I was given a basic "Premier" room with two queen beds - meh, I don't need a king - on the 14th floor in the "New York Tower," with a view of the roller coaster. I found the bathroom to be quite large and stocked well with towels. There is no desk in the Premier room, so if you need one, you'll need to obtain a more expensive unit. No refrigerator, microwave, or coffee maker. I did use the ice bucket to keep my yogurt chilled, which worked well for me.

Not having been to Vegas for 10 years, I was surprised at how much the Strip had changed. Remembering the major pain it was to cross the street way-back-when, I did a happy dance when i saw there was a pedestrian walkway from the mezzanine level across the Strip toward the MGM Grand. From there, it was a 10-30-minute walk to Paris. "A 20-minute difference," you ask? Yes, 10-30 minutes. A 10-minute walk at 6:30am if you walk fast, but otherwise, if you need to get anywhere quickly during the day, forget about it, unless you're assertive\/borderline aggressive. There are just too many slow, alcohol-infused bodies.

NY NY offers express checkout, perhaps predictable since establishments in towns 1\/10 the size of Vegas often do so, as well. Because my workplace is partially reimbursing me for this trip, and because I work for the state government, I had to go through the traditional checkout process for paperwork reasons. Front desk staff, as they were at check-in, were friendly and helpful. My only issue with NY NY was that, upon asking where I could pick up a shuttle to the airport, a staff person said I needed to call in advance. Um...what? In Vegas?? When the airport is such a short distance away and there are a bazillion people coming and going at all times? Sheesh. When I picked up the house phone to make a reservation, the operator connected me to a shuttle company that didn't come for me on time. Luckily I was able to get to the airport via another shuttle service. So, if you're making reservations in advance, you may want to clarify the shuttle issue--unless, of course, you win big and score a limo.

Our number one favorite place for price, location and the best suites,the marquis has a full size 4 seater jacuzzi tub and room to spare. The NY pizza (downstairs) has the best pizza and for a little class you gotta visit the Nine fine Irishmen.
Oh my god, people still stay here?  What hobos? Traveling circus folk?  How could you book this place.

My wife and I always make this a stop on our trip. The casino is spread apart pretty well and there's always something going on in the evenings. The food area is full of choices and it's very reasonable. 
New York New York casino pays much tribute to NYC fire and police as well as 9\/11. We thinks it's tastefully done. 
Awesome place.. Take a look for yourself.
Great times at New York New York. Always clean, staff is friendly, love the location and proximity to MGM is a plus. No complaints.

I stayed here for 3 days while I had friends in town, and the rooms were decent but not great. Just typical...The hotel\/casino itself is soso and really more enjoyable from the outside than in. They need a real sportsbook, better pool, and a way to get into the parking garage driving east.

Considering these guys hooked me up with 3 free nights, I hate to only 3-star em, but I gotta call it like it is...  

POSITIVES:
+Clean Casino
+Plenty of TVs by the tables to watch the game on
+Great deals for being part of the Players Club
+Friendly employees
+Self Parking had spaces right by the bridge to the entrance
+Good variety of restaurants
+Good location on the strip

IN BETWEEN:
-\/+ Craps dealers lack personality.  They're friendly and professional, but they've got no soul.  Made for some lame action... especially considering I was winning.
-\/+ The ice machine in the room didn't make ice....made a decent fridge though.
-\/+ ESPN zone is cool, but could definitely use expansion during football season.  LONG wait.

NEGATIVES:
-The Park Avenue bed is on par with a Holiday Inn Express
-Rooms are clean, but the furniture seems like it's in need of renovation.
-Obstucted views in the center of the Empire State Building
-Pool is pretty small
-Pathetic sports book.  No seats unless you're watching horse racing.  Your neck will hurt like hell if your game is on the top screen.
-Dont bother with room service for breakfast.  Big letdown.  I've had better breakfasts at Denny's.  
-Come on...  no free wi-fi?  In this day and age?
-CRT TVs...  

Bottom Line:  They're clean and they're professional.  I'll keep coming back as long as they keep offereing me free rooms, but they're definitely due for a renovation.  There's better options around though if you're a sports fan.

Great hotel!!!!!..If you get a chance to see a show pick Zumanity it awesome!!!!!.  The waitress kept the drinks coming and I kept hittig.. We ate at the america  restaurant and the food was very good.. My next visit is in august and I'm coming back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!.

Stayed here for 3 nights when in Vegas for a friends birthday....here are positives and negatives

Pros
1) We had a good sized room with amazing views of the strip, but we were in a corner room so thats probably why
2) Was clean and classy without trying to be too swanky. Its Vegas after all...cheesy and cheap reign here
3) The staff were very helpful in trying to make my friends birthday a memorable one
4) My friend won $800 on the nickel slots

Cons
1) DESIGN!!! who ever designed this sucks. You could hear the rollercoaster in our room which is not exactly welcoming when its 9 am, you went to bed at 4 am, and are a little hung over. Actually, its really really really annoying. AND the rollercoaster goes right over the pool area. I like to relax and zone out by the pool, which is hard to do with screaming people going over you every few people. 
2) Speaking of the pool....I was underwhelmed. Really generic and small. 
3) Needs better night clubs. Coyote Ugly is the only option, and believe me, you'll pass on that!
4) The hotel is better for families or business people (which who was primarily there)... our group of 20 somethings girls felt out of place 

Next Vegas trip, I'll look elsewhere.

I stayed at this hotel recently for several nights for a convention.  It was a good hotel, especially for the location and the price.

Service from the front desk was good as was help from the bell hop and other employees.

We were disappointed there was neither a frig nor a coffee maker in the room, however we learned many (all?) of the hotels in the area do not have a coffee maker - they want you to go downstairs and go to their restaurants or order room service.  A friend in another room was smart and brought a small 2 cup coffee maker - I will do that next time.

We enjoyed their restaurants - Nine Irishmen and a pizza place.  And found their slots to be more kind than those at other casinos.

This place is a bit older than others and not as flashy but it served us well.

Worth checking out!

This has been one of the south-strip staple locations to see for years. The main attraction here is actually the roller coaster and the game room for kids. 

The casino floor itself is not huge but its not too small - it does have some modern touches after a recent renovation about 2 years ago and they are currently working on redoing something near the entrance that is near the sports book (I was here the weekend of Nov. 21-23 2014) The casino can be a bit hard to figure out as it can circle you around a bit. The upstairs attraction is the Coyote Ugly bar which can get crowded quickly and seems to turn into a mess of young people - not exactly one of the more better established bar\/clubs that are on the vegas strip but it has been a staple to the New York New York for about 10 years or so.

I have never had much luck in the casino here - not sure if its what I was playing but I have seen winners come out of this place so it may be a place to try if you feel like bank rolling some of the table games. A nice touch here is the lack of smoke in the casino itself compared to some of the others in the area. 

Give this place a walk through the next time you are in.

My husband and I stayed here for a week.  Our room was larger than expected, quiet, and exceptionally clean.  Our room was cheap and we were even upgraded  for free to a bigger room at checkin. We never had to wait long for an elevator and it was a quick walk to the strip.  I did not gamble or eat at NYNY except for a pretzel. I will definitely stay here again.

We used to stay at the MGM only. But their prices went up, and the place is just to damn big. So NYNY is our new favorite place, love the closeness of the Hotel, the prices, the service. So far we have not had any issues that were not always resolved. I will see you in 6 months NYNY.

As I'm originally from New York, my husband thought it would be fun to stay at the New York-New York Hotel. Let's me just say that it didn't disappoint! There was even a small city within the hotel that highlighted all of New York's best food and entertainment. From pizza to Italian bakeries and Irish pub music to dueling pianos at the bar, you are in New York.

The hotel is reasonable for being on the strip, the T-mobile arena and the park is right next to the hotel. The hotel is dated and hallways were messy with people's glassware that they left in the corners.  The maid woke us up when we forgot to put the do not disturb sign on the door.  This is Vegas people stay up late and expect to sleep until 10:30, not before 10a.  There is a big starbucks on the first floor as well as on the mezzanine level. The casino floor is not that big, so its easy to get out onto the strip.

Better than I expected!  

After stopping by a few times, I actually stayed for the first time.  The Tower rooms are pretty nice - newish, plenty of drawer space and free if ineffective wifi.

The casino is usually lively at night - plenty of craps tables.  And really tiny but functional horse-racing space.

Plenty of cheap food at night as well.  Il Fornaio for breakfast was fine (basic breakfast stuff:  pancakes, etc), but I'd probably go to MGM across the street for more interesting choices.

It is one of my favorite hotels in Las Vegas and it has an amazing atmosphere. The cons are that the "Roller Coaster" (used to be Manhattan Express) is very rough and very expensive, not worth it. Also, I didn't like how they removed the Central Park section just to expand the Casino. NY-NY is also very family-friendly.

I made my reservation over the phone and the person on the line was very friendly. As was the woman at the desk for check-in. I particularly appreciated the bowl of cherry-filled Hershey Kisses that were sitting out. That made me very happy and certainly earned them bonus points. 

Our room was very clean, quiet, comfortable and decorated nicely. 

We particularly enjoyed the pool! Most pools on the Strip close at 5p, but this one was open until 8p! We went around 5p and most of the area was in the shade. Don't plan on tanning. But you can plan on having fun with the family! It's not the biggest pool, but it wasn't super crowded, so we had plenty of space for a family of four. 

This was a fun hotel to visit and we would absolutely stay again!

Cheap place to gamble. 
Great Bathrooms. 
Cheap Drinks. 

They have a little mini New York with all sorts of restaurants and shops. 
Indoor Roller Coaster. 

They got alot of things going on for them.

I've never stayed at the New York, New York, so this review is for the main level which includes the casinos, restaurants, etc.

I'm from New York myself and I have to say I love the restaurant level with the cobblestone walkway. The restaurants there are always crowded but they're all definitely NY themed. I also like the piano bar which also gets crowded once the music gets going.

I've never tried the roller coaster there, so I'm definitely gonna have to go back!

$285 for 2 nights and 3 days for me and my hubby to stay in a suite.

We stayed in the spa suite and loved it so damn  much. I was so sad that we did not stay there for a week. We went during the summer time when it was blazing hot. luckily we had a decent size spa tub that could fit the two of us along with my two year old. Our room was big, over looking the roller coaster & the strip. At night, we'd lounged in the spa tub in warm water (since it was hot) & turn on the bubbles. My daughter loved it so much! Being in vegas does not mean you have to gamble, drink, and party. Heck, i'm 21. It was my first time in Vegas & I truly had a blast. I think it was because being in our suite made things feel so relaxing. Can't wait to go back to the New York New York again!

BTW, we also had a special deal with our hotel room purchase. We received a free buffet for the 2 of us at any of the participating hotels :D

I am really only writing this review for the Irish bar inside of New York, New York. I am surprised to be able to say that it really felt like an authentic Irish bar. Great live music, people doing their cute little Irish dance, and great decorations.

We had a great time here.

I was debating between 3 and 4 stars for this, but the service was all generally quite fantastic, so 4 stars it is.

Location: 
Very south - be warned you will be walking a lot unless you're heading to the adjacent hotels. Having said that, you're very close to the MGM Grand, which is the largest hotel on the Strip.

Rooms:
We had a Player's Suite on the 24th floor. The suite is a great size and layout, good for entertaining the other people that came down with us. The bed was comfortable, and the room had great black-out shades. The room is EXTREMELY outdated, I was shocked this hotel wasn't built in the 60s. Paint was peeling off everyone, furniture was old and stripped, bathroom fixtures barely worked because they were so old. Also, (and I know this is a small thing) the television cable package is an absolute joke. I'm a bit confused why all MGM properties wouldn't have the same? Room service was great, always cleaned our room (REMEMBER TO TIP YOUR ROOM ATTENDANTS PEOPLE...  :))

Restaurants:
Not much in the fine dining category, but definitely great late-night eateries. Lots of them. Also, no real lounge or club on site. There is a Coyote Ugly, but be warned it's very small.

Casino:
Has all the standards you would need for some gambling. I found the drink service at this MGM property to be quite sub-par compared to Aria, Mirage, Bellagio or even Monte Carlo. Still though, the Casino isn't bad by any means.

Overall: it was a good value for the price, which is one of the other reasons it gets 4 stars.

I have now stayed at this hotel about a handful of times and each time, I've never had an issue. 

The roller coaster is super fun and def worth trying. They have a number of restaurants, quick bites and bars in this hotel so if you really don't want to travel far, this is the place to go. 

I haven't really had any issues with any of the hotels on the strip. It really is all about price. You do get what you pay for, but New York New York almost always has amazing rates. Service at the front desk can be a little spotty, but that goes for any hotel you visit.

The place itself is starting to show its age here and there, but the New York theme is drawn out heavily in every aspect- except customer service and cleanliness. Friend and I were once trying to find the spa to retrieve our wives, but we couldn't locate it. Upon asking someone, that someone actually accompanied us all the way to the waiting lobby of the spa itself- including the short elevator ride! I don't think that's typical customer service policy and it's actually somewhat overkill, but my friend and I definitely appreciated that gesture! Other staff we encountered along the way in our wife-searching adventure were courteous and respectful. We might consider staying at the New York-New York based on that alone.

Also, big arcade is definitely a plus for the young ones and young ones at heart.

This is a great place to stay if you want to be on the Strip! I got two comp nights, but we ended up checking late so they were out of the room that we wanted, so the concierge lady was able to upgrade us to a Marquis suite for only $40\/night. Nice!

The Marquis suite is really nice; it's 700 sq feet and comes with a nice jacuzzi. The bed is super comfortable, and there's a fridge (but no microwave). We were able to get a strip view, which was really cool. Overall, a nice place to stay since you can just walk downstairs to Shake Shack, and you're super close to M&M store, Coca Cola world, and shopping stores.

$20 to valet park your vehicle even when you are a guest staying at the hotel. Check in was fast and friendly and bell service was great and friendly.  Casino was fun. Dinner was fabulous at Gallaghers. Wanted to go for swim after dinner about 7 pm and the pool had closed at 6 pm, very disappointed in that. Let's hope that changes!

I absolutely love this hotel!  I usually try to go with a less expensive hotel in Vegas since you get gouged everywhere else, but I made the reservations during a special.  The decor was nice, I had a view of the roller coaster, the bed was comfy, and the staff was very friendly.  Free wifi is a definite perk, too.  I think this will be my regular hotel for Vegas trips from this point on.

Review #911

   Owing to the fact that NY-NY featured a Memorial to the victims of 9\/11 by the Statue of Liberty up to 2013, it is appropriate that this is going to be my review 911. Likewise owing to the facts that my family and I vacationed there for a week in March and that it is frequent spot to hang out at, the time has come to review New York-New York.

   New York-New York and the real New York share something else besides landmarks. Both are exciting and have Pizzazz!  

  The first time I ever set eyes on New York-New York was on a summer afternoon back in July 1996 when the MGM was the hot new property on the Strip. Because it was being built, I couldn't set foot in it. The next year when we returned to Las Vegas, it was my first time in the casino. Nearly 20 years later, the property has not aged. The thing about theme casinos that some bean executives just don't understand is that a great theme never gets old. Additionally fantastic themes are so exciting that it puts the reviewer at a disadvantage of streamlining to avoid the character limit. For that reason this review from this point forward separates it by category. 

Hotel Rooms:

  Our hotel room up in the Columbia Tower was clean and comfortable. The neat thing about the theme is that the towers resemble the New York skyline. Because my dad paid for it the few things I could say about pricing is that it is competitively priced before the resort fee. The view from the room overlooked the Statue of Liberty and southeast Valley. The roller coaster would careen up and down the track outside the tower. 

Drinking:

   The coffee fan in me appreciates that it is easy to savor the beverage. By registration, Fornaio serves a delicious Cafe Americano and desserts. There are two Starbuck's with one that has seats overlooking the Brooklyn Bridge. 

  The alcohol fan in me appreciates the variety of bars. There is the Irish Bar near the Strip. Upstairs for a different drinking environment is Coyote Ugly. In the casino is a central bar and sporadic cocktail service at the slot machines. The pizza place has a $7.77 special including 2 slices and beer. The Times Square Bar is a fun spot for a cold one while listing to Dueling Piano players duel it out. 

Dining:

   There is a nice choice of places to eat. The themed streets of Greenwich Village are a unique spot to enjoy a bite while taking in the attention that is so detailed that steam rises out of a manhole replica on the walkway. The restaurants include a fish & chips place, a crepe stand, Greenberg's Deli, Chinese restaurant, hot dog stand, Broadway Burger and pizza place. Way out in Coney Island there is a Nathan's that is the only one to serve super cheeseburgers on the Strip. Near the hotel registration America is the casino cafe. Upstairs in the menazzaine the restaurants include a pizzeria and Haagan Daez. Out in the suburbs are Tom Urban and Shake Shack. 

Entertainment :

   The theme is the major entertainment. It makes this a unique place that is unparalleled at a New York theme. Before I step foot in the casino, there is the New York skyline, Statue of Liberty, and the Brooklyn Bridge. The theme continues inside. Even Hershey's World gets in the New York mood with a towering chocolate Statue of Liberty. There has been some detheming in the Central Park casino where the trees have been replaced with contemporary furnishings. This causes the eye to look across the casino to the perimeter. Usually my eyes lead me to Greenwich Village. At night the sounds of the Times Square Dueling Piano Bar bounce across the Village. Throughout the day and night the New York roller coaster cars fly along the tracks above. Above Times Square there is entertainment to be had in the Coney Island arcade. In back of the hotel, there is a resort swimming pool that overlooks the roller coaster and Monte Carlo. The hotel us also the home of the Cirque Du Soleil show: Zumanity. The entertainment got even better with the newly opened Park connecting the casino to the T-Mobile Arena. 

Conclusion:

   New York-New York is the quintessential proof that well-run  properties with fantastic themes never get old. They remain exciting places that never get boring. Fantastic themed hotels in comparison to hotels that try to be hip or overluxurious alleviate the negative energy of paying to park, obnoxious resort fees, and other expenses. New York - New York puts me in a New York State of Mind.

Bf and I stayed here for 5 days last week and we had no problems... there were little things like no bathroom fan and high tub, but not a big deal. 

Friendly staff, good coupons, good shows and a good variety of places to eat.  

The pool tends to get crowded, so you have to show up early to get a seat because they are first come first serve. When we finally made it down to the pool with decent seats, we walked away for a few mintues to get a drink only to come back to our stuff moved to another chair by 4 old cougars....apparantly they "went to the bathroom to change" but didnt leave anything on the seats to let people know it was occupied. I decided to be a lady and let them be since they were bitters old women anyway! ahahahaha. But if your willing, you can fight for your chairs cause it was hell finding seats after that! Luckilly the lifegaurd was really friendly and helped us find seats:)

We also we to ROK vegas which was only ok because of the music (and music video playing on a huge panoramic screen) and me being drunk! Crowd sucked. They were lame and alot of people didnt dance... (uh?). There were also older people there too. wtf! lol If you happen to be walking around the casino there will be promoters giving away free entrance to ladies and reduced for guys ($10)


Saw Zumanity too. A M A Z I N G! very intertaining. If you stay at NY NY you must see this show! They had a 2 show\/$100 deal so take advantage. We got pretty good seats...maybe we were lucky!

Okay so we stayed here for a few reasons... 
1. They have an arcade and roller coaster for the kids .. Well the crap thing is they don't tell you height for the roller coaster so after having bought tickets for it we get up there and he's too short so yeah have the damn measurements out FRONT!
2. Different variety of food .. Pretty decent but the americana sucks
3. Location the location is decent 
4. The gambling was good
5. Front desk doesn't tell you what the "deposit" is for. 
There's a few other issues such as we had 2 rooms ... Credit card was linked to one but not the other... Dumb!!! So my mother had to go get cash to pay for room services at 10pm. 
So they are ok... Would I stay here again... Possibly but I've stayed several locations in Vegas this one is ok probably won't stay here again until my son can ride the ride.

Upon arriving in our room we first step on a big wet spot on the carpet. My husband goes to take a shower and sees inside the shower dried up blood on the inside of the shower curtain, which he calls them to replace the curtain and several hours later they did. Next day we get a message on our room phone that there is something for us to pick up downstairs. We proceed to get what it is, which is flowers for me from my husband BUT he specifically asked and cleared with the staff to have them delivered to our room. My husband at this point is very upset. Later that day the manager comes to our room w\/new room keys for an upgraded room. Nice gesture but my birthday has already been ruined.

We stayed in the Park Avenue room for 5 days, this was my first time staying on the Strip in Vegas. 

First of all when I booked the room I asked for a (non-smoking) King bedroom for me and my GF, but when we got there they told me they only had 2double rooms left. I let the check-in guy know that I had booked a king bed almost 2 months ahead of time, and he actually got annoyed with me and went on a spiel about how they don't guarantee anything when I book. After I started getting annoyed myself he finally told us we could have the wheelchair accessible room, which had a King sized bed, and the only difference was it had railings in the bathtub. Fine.

Also, 2 nights in a row, around 6pm we had hotel staff walk right into our room without knocking. Even though the room was already clean. We went straight down to the front desk and he let us know that sometimes management comes to inspect the rooms to ensure they've been cleaning properly. Thankfully it never happened again after that.


Pros
Very Cheap to Stay in
Nice sized room, very clean and big
Great View
Very comfy beds
Roller coaster didn't bother us with noise
Good selection of fast\/cheap food in the lobby
Fun but expensive piano bar in the lobby

Cons
They Don't Guarantee the Room you Book  
Sometimes Rude and Disorganized Staff 
Ancient TV, with bad reception
$15\/day Resort fee, which gives you Internet and a coupon book.. Sounds like a scam.

Maybe I'm being a little too harsh because the first time I stayed in Venetian, and that was a godly awesome hotel. This one isn't bad, but...I definitely enjoyed Venetian more (and I believe this place was only $50 less or so).

I liked this hotel in terms of accessibility. Compared to Venetian, this is the heart of The Strip. Since we depended on public transit, we wanted a hotel close to the express stops, and this was one of them. This hotel is also close to the airport express route, so I didn't need to transfer at South Strip (or take one of those unreliable hotel shuttles). I also liked the whole "New York" feel, but I only really felt it in the main floor, with the whole Little Italy\/Greenwich Village feel.

The rooms, for the price we paid, were decent at best. I can't complain much considering the beds were very comfy and everything went relatively smoothly in terms of checking in and out, and they even offer complimentary computer access for boarding pass printings! However the rooms were only about 40% the size of the Venetian rooms, and for $50 less I somewhat rather pay a bit more for a larger hotel.

The wifi was also quite weak sometimes. Without the ethernet plug, the speed felt like dialup at most times.

hotels.com is your friend when searching for Vegas hotels. Honestly most are the same, but this hotel is good for what its worth.

I really enjoyed our stay here! Our room was nice & clean. The shower was a little small but it served its purpose. We had the most inexpensive room but still had "somewhat" of a view. Good choices of restaurants and shops. Spacious and not overcrowded casino! I would recommend.

This place is pretty neat, It's new york themed of course and it has an awesome Roller coaster on the top as well as a game room.

The pizza place is pretty expensive I got a large coke for about $4 and some change. One of the many perks about Vegas over paying for a simple item.

The atmosphere is nice, they have cool gift shops as well.

This was our first time staying here and it was okay. We stayed for 3 nights in the Spa Suite. I'll just make a list to make it easier to scan through.

Check-in: there are about 6 people working and a huge like, took longer than expected. 

Room (Spa Suite): 
We changed rooms because as soon as we walked in to the room it smelled like smoke and it was a non-smoking floor.
Not very different than a regular room, a little bigger with a spa against the wall away from the window. The bathroom has a door for the toilet and shower but the sink part has no doors.
There is no fridge, no snacks and no drinks for purrchase in room. You have to order them through the phone.
The view was horrible, you'd think that the extra money would give you a better view...nope...both rooms had horrible views.
Super long hallways. If you're room number is in the beginning numbers such as 1605, 1610 expect to have a long walk. It took us 2 minutes to get to our room from the elevators. 2 minutes is nothing but walk at a normal pace for 2 minutes, it's a pretty good distance especially when drunk. Lol.

Service: customer service was good, they accommodated is immediately when we told them out room smelled like smoke and the other one has a funny smell.

The in room dinner service was great and affordable, it was probably the cheapest dinner we had during the whole stay lol.

I did not stay here... but I did go for Zumanity [great show, btw] and to ride the NY Roller coaster. The roller coaster is $12, and the wait was about 30 minutes. not sure why it was taking so long, but that's besides the point. After waiting in line for 30 minutes, I nicely asked one of the employees [the guy taking pictures of the people on the roller coaster] if he can get me some water from the water dispenser they had. Mind you.... I could've easily grabbed some myself, but it had a big note that said EMPLOYEES ONLY! So, out of respect, I asked! He not only said NO! but was flat out rude about it! I had been coughing in line for almost an hour, and needed to drink something. He was a f@#$ing jerk... walked over to the dispenser, and served HIMSELF some water, and drank it in front of me.

Funny thing is... this isnt a big deal. but, I am HUGE on Customer Service.... and simply because of this... not only will I not EVER stay in this hotel, I will not even walk in there! If they can't spare on glass of water, then I dont need to give them my business..

NY NY, sorry... but, you give my birthplace a bad name. Shame on you & little Asian kid... I hope your water was great! You have a lot of growing up to do, Schmuck!

I have never stayed in one of the rooms at the New York New York Hotel, but I have visited, shopped and hung out  in the casino part of the hotel and it's actually one of my favorites on the strip.

The downstairs casino part of the hotel isn't very crowded and is easy to get around in. You never get all turned around and lost like some of the other hotels and the ceilings are high which helps to lessen the cigarette smoke.

I came to the New York New York one afternoon to have a few beers at their Pour 24 bar upstairs, which is actually quite nice and a great place to people watch! They have a Coyote Ugly Club\/Restaurant next to it, as well as a New York Pretzel place and a New York Pizza place which I never tried, but it's supposed to be really good.

What I did try was Shake Shack which is attached to the casino, but outside and downstairs. It's AMAZING. Definitely go if you have the chance! It gets crazy busy during lunch time, so definitely make sure to go on an off time to avoid the biggest rush. 

There is also a Nine Fine Irishman Pub (which is supposed to be good) and a Tom's Urban which I heard is OK. For shopping they have a Hershey's World Store which is interesting to look at, a Stupidiotic Store which is hilarious and also interesting to look around in, and a Swatch Store which really brought back the memories for me!

I will definitely keep coming back to the New York New York and maybe ride the roller coaster next time! Or just stay in one of their rooms.

Nice hotel the bed are comfy and the price is right. The chin chin was kinda lame though. 

Also

Las Vegas smells like shit ! ugly fat women think it's ok to wear skimpy clothing NO IT ISNT ! 
And the Fukin assholes out on the strip keep hassling you to go to the damn strip club. There are some ugly TV show belonging to ass clowns in there. The people you see are straight out of Gran Theft Auto !

I very much enjoyed our stay here. They check in process was really easy and the guy was really nice. We had a very spacious room with a decent view. We had a comfortable bed, staff was great, food selection was great, everything was really, really nice. I'd stay here again.

2nd time this year we have been tricked by the NY NY hotel and America restaurant.my wife and I called the concierge and planned to have the dinner special rib eye from 12am -4am. In fact we planned our whole evening around it. After a call to the concierge and to the restaurant to confirm what time the special was served, imagine our disappointment to find the Restutant closed for cleaning. Why wouldn't they just tell us that. We were told to go to some burger joint that was serving Americas menu. However once we got there we found out that they did not have even half of americas menu and no rib eye special. Please know that we are extremely disappointed with this and the poor quality of food at the other Restutant. The waiter was nice and the hostess was ok. The food was bad, my wife's garlic fries had almost no garlic, the menu states O-brian potatoes come with the NY steak and eggs, but they actually come with hash browns. The eggs were runny, not over medium and the mozzarella triangles were sticks. WTF, I can't believe how disappointing all of this was. It ended our night of fun and gambling. Concierge, if you want to make this right we are in room 854 staying until April 29th. Hope to speak to somebody soon.

This hotel is ok except the slot machines in this hotel never pay back.

I think NY NY should have a better show than Zumanity.

Without a doubt, I always end up spending a lot of time in NY NY when I'm in Vegas. 

I have enjoyed the Mexican restaurant, the Jewish deli, Chin Chin Asian Fusion, and the frozen yummy drinks at the stands. No complaints on any of those restaurant trips. I especially enjoy the Chin Chin $13.95 breakfast buffet which comes with $1 mimosas at the bar! 

On top of that, NYNY has a particular casino game that you can't find in many other hotels -- I'm referring to the Roulette table that is a cross between real-life and virtual. A real ball spins and stops in the center of the table, meanwhile, you can play on the screen and not through a dealer. I think this is the wave of the future of roulette.

NYNY place seems to be at an intersection where I tend to linger around the Strip - by Excalibur, Luxor, MGM, Monte Carlo, and now Aria. It's also one of the closest Strip hotels nearby McCarran Airport. They'll hold you bags for free if you ever have a late night flight and need to check out earlier in the day! 

NYNY is pretty rad, and I'm sure I'll continue to make it one of my regular Vegas visits.

Well it is a sad story. Girl likes casino, casino doesn't live up to her expectations anymore, girl moves on....

NYNY is not the worst and not the best. It is mainly for families since it has the roller coaster and arcade area. 

They do have lots of restaurants that are sit down and fast food. 

Booked a non-smoking room but right when I walked into the room I was hit by an invisible wall of smoke smell. The bed mattress was very uncomfortable and the horrid scratchy sheets didn't make sleeping any better. We booked the hotel for three nights but after that first night we jumped ship and went to another hotel for the remainder of our trip.

The fitness room is a joke. All of the cardio machines were ancient and half of them were not in service. Small free weight area and a water cooler. 

Had an hour wait at the box office picking up show tickets at will call. Two people working the windows but took their sweet time and later blamed their computer for having issues. 

Oh well, NYNY thanks for the fun while it lasted but I bid you goodbye.
The hotel was not as impressive as I was hoping for. The casino makes up for it though. All of the decorations and bells and whistles went into the casino, defiantly not the hotel.

#30DaysOfYelp: 17\/30

My first time playing slot machines in Vegas! I only lost $6! (From $23, haha.) Woohoo! 

This casino sticks to the cheesy NY-NY theme really well. Statue of Liberty outside, cool art deco art & structures, the restaurant area fashioned to look like streets...all in all, I was impressed with all the sights! Had some pizza, & Reuben sandwiches for dinner. Prices were ok, considering the area. There are some sit-down restaurants I'd consider trying in the future. We passed by a dueling piano bar that would be fun to hang out in - I always wonder how they remember all the songs! Also, they have a roller coaster upstairs in the "Coney Island" arcade! We didn't go on it, but I suspect it's expensive or has a long line. 

The casino part was pretty standard, but I don't know much about casinos or gambling. They all kind of look the same to me. Hourah Ghostbusters & Batman game though - high tech visuals & vibrating chairs! Hostess came by 3 times & each time we got our "free" drinks...got a bit hammered so I was having fun. I think it would be cool to stay here one day, especially if rooms are themed too!

Check in dragged, but we got there right at three. Staff was pretty friendly.

We had a suite room with a hot tub for our week long stay. The hotel could use a face lift, but our room was well updated, clean and large. The bed was incredibly comfy! The casino is the same as most the others on the strip, and it was sadly not lucky for us but we didn't spend a lot of time there. The spa at the hotel is great, and it you wait till the second day of your stay they leave you a voicemail with deals for services (I got 20% off a pedicure- by the way one of the best I've ever had!). The location is great and right in the middle of town. If you're going to be there for a bit, buy a pass for the Monorail. It really pays off.

Coyote Ugly was fun for us, but the drinks pretty bad. We went in around 8'before going into Zumanity, and it was dead, but we got our hands stamped for free cover the rest of the night. We came back after the show, and it had livened up a little bit. The drinks were awful and expensive so we got drinks at the bar next door and went back. I wouldn't go back and back for it but it's something to do while being able to stay in the hotel. The pretzel stand outside it pretty amazing, especially after a night of dancing.

New York New York is a great place for the price.  It doesn't have a poker room but Excalibur next door does.  The place is clean and well kept.  They have a bar in the middle of the casino that turns into a nightclub at night.  The only problem is you end up paying nightclub bar prices $22 for two drinks.  We would have been better off putting $20 in a machine and waiting on the waitress.  The food is really good all the way through.  Club sandwich check, NY style pizza was good, I had a steak in the America restaurant really good for the price a bit thin for me.  The room was really nice and had a great view.  We bumped into two waitresses at the table that killed our buzz a bit.  They were a little rude.  This is a place to come for fun and we tip a lot better when people try to make us comfortable instead of being a bit mean.  I would definitely stay here again.  I will steer clear of the tables those two waitresses are working.

We stayed here Thanksgiving Thursday and Friday nights. The past few times we have been to Vegas, we ended up staying close to Flamingo\/Las Vegas Blvd. So, this time the Mrs. wanted to stay near Tropicana\/Las Vegas Blvd and check out the casinos nearby. As I always write in my reviews, the Mrs. puts in a lot of effort into looking for cool things to do for Ian. NYNY having an arcade for kids, made this an attractive proposition.

Pros:
It was very easy to take the exit from the freeway onto Frank Sinatra Drive, and enter the parking structure of NYNY. I cannot believe that I did not have to drive on Las Vegas Blvd this trip. Easy walk to Aria, MGM, Excalibur etc.(+1)
A very busy arcade for kids\/youngsters. There were hundreds of kids the night we went to entertain Ian. Roller Coaster is also cool. (+1)
Lot of variety in dining. Pastrami at a Deli, Tacos at Gonzalez, Steak at Gallagher's, different kind of cuisine at Nine Fine Irishmen, Shake Shack, Bruxie's, etc. 

Cons:
No buffet. (-1)
Both the Pizza places had horrible tasting Pizzas. (-1)

I really enjoyed my stay here. I would not mind staying at NYNY again in the future.

Affordably priced and located in the most popular area of the Las Vegas strip, New York, New York is my go-to place when planning a quick getaway to Vegas for the weekend. You literally will never have to leave the hotel\/casino! It offers a pub, a steakhouse, an Asian fusion buffet, two night clubs and a dueling piano bar. They also have cheaper food items like deli sandwiches, hot dogs and other diner food upstairs. 

Pros: Affordable, practically never need to leave the hotel, clean, great food and atmosphere, not a lot of children, located in an area of the strip that is easy to navigate around, free parking.

Cons: TINY pool that seems like it was an afterthought, $15 a night amenities fee for a gym that is impossible to find (Seriously... I couldn't find it) and for wifi that doesn't work.

Try the breakfast buffet at Chin Chin or a Tiramisu at the Greenwich Village Coffee House. Yummy!

I'll give this place 3 stars because it was a comp room from M Life. The main complaint I have with this hotel is that the room keys did not work several times. They actually have a "key replacement line" near their hotel registration area which tells me that this is always a problem. Customer service was nice. The rooms aren't too bad. The King room we had was spacious and clean which is deserving of 3 stars. This wouldn't be my first choice hotel when we return again but if it was free I wouldn't turn it down.

I must admit I am a bit of a hotel snob. For those traveling on a bit of a budget this place is great. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. This hotel seemed to be catered to the party-crowd but was at least quiet at night while trying to sleep. There are lots of restaurants and dining options.

Customer service(on the phone) needs to be trained better!

Don't need to explain to much just that it was a call on a card that was missed charged but with policy  it was non refundable :( ....but hey it's a business and I understand 

Just some feed back 
-learn to relate and give assurance to the customer
-active listening ( she was just trying to pass me along quickly instead of interacting and listening to my situation)
-ask for my feedback

I've been to Vegas countless numbers of times before and this past week was my first time staying at the NYNY. I used my Myvegas points to redeem my free 3 night stay (excluding resort fees) and it was a breeze. There was no complications and the front desk person who checked me in was really nice. 

My room was great. It was the Park Avenue with 2 queen beds in the nonsmoking section of the hotel.  Clean and quite comfortable. It was big enough for me and 3 other members of my family to stay in. Housekeeping did a good job cleaning my room. I was concern about the noise since the roller coaster is right outside my room but it was not a bother at all. Besides, I'm usually out the whole day and by the time I get back to my room at night, they've already closed the roller coaster. 

The hotel is very convenient in that there is all sorts of places you can eat (ie pizza, hamburger, ice cream.)

Hershey's world is awesome too. Love their giant cupcakes.
We stopped in here for lunch, which was absolutely delicious! Our sandwich was called "The Italian Stallion

I'm not very picky when it comes to hotels but I can't recommend this place. First of all the staff is rude, on the last day of our stay (which we needed the sleep the most) our door lock broke and had to sit outside of our room for 30 mins after they said they'd send someone up to our room (The room keepers were suppose to radio it in). We had to go down to the desk and tell them again and the guy i talked to gave me a bad attitude for no reason. Then luckily a security guard we met in the hall tried to open it for us but no luck. Finally the guy showed up and opened it. Another thing i found to be quite annoying was I kept waking up because of the rollercoasters rumble and the screaming of the passengers, which I kind of excepted but at the same time, not the best experience when you're tired the entire trip. I won't stay here again!

It's okay. Not great. Rooms pretty small, older looking. We stayed in the Empire Tower. They have nicer rooms but it will cost you. spa is nice, pool
Is nice. Nice casino. I just think the hotel needs some updating especially for the price. Location is great. If you're going to Vegas and aren't planning to spend much time in the room, it will work. Luxor is quite a bit cheaper and Tower rooms are great

New York needs to get its act together. And by that I mean the city, not the casino. Because this place puts NYC to shame. 

Why don't we have a roller coaster roaring above the Chrysler Building?
Why isn't all pizza $4.95 a slice ($7.95 with a side salad)?
Why can't we just combine 'hoods so we can shop in "SoHo Village?"
Why is our Brooklyn Bridge so big and unwieldy?*
Why does our United Nations have to have ALL those flags?**
Why can't we have tourists staring upward, taking pictures and getting in everyone's way? 

Oh wait. We have that last one.

But if you take away all the hackneyed, gimmicky attractions, the casino itself is classy, modern, and a lot of fun. And that Irish pub is actually pretty solid ($6 appetizers at happy hour). 
___________
