Pool: NyNy's pool is more closely compared to those of lesser caliber hotels. No wow factor really just that the roller coaster can be seen and heard from above. Pool is on the small side compared to other hotels on the strip. 

Grounds: If you have a car, you use your room key to get in and out, unlimited, and also includes other mgm properties for the parking fee paid. So you pay the required parking fee and you have access to other mgm
properties parking garages using your room key.  Also if your room is to be accessed through the new yorkers tower elevators you can also get to your room via the arcade on the 2nd floor. 

Overall: I was really impressed by the room size and the friendliness of the staff. See ya again, NyNy!

I should probably mentioned that I have not stayed on this hotel.  HOWEVER, I have been to Las Vegas twice and I always make sure to stop at this Hotel and Casino. 

The layout and decor is Epic! Plus, there is so much stuff to do. How about eating legit New York Style Pizza? Feel like walking down the streets of NY while visiting shops... Yeah, they got the look.  Serious feels of Manhattan. 

How about that Roller Coaster? I always ride it like five times in a row. Fast, furious and give you a chance to view The famous Strip form a great view (day or night). All in all, even if you are not staying over, hanging out here is a blast... I mean, there's even a huge arcade!  

Needless to say that they also have plenty of creative shows, foods and cocktails (make sure to check out their Chocolate cocktail bar).

I wonder if this is what the real New York feels like...

Comments on casino and roller coaster only, not hotel. 

The casino itself is worth a walk through. It looks like pictures of new york. A cool concept. The dealers were hit and miss (ha!) with friendliness, let it ride was a hit, roulette was a miss. 

The roller coaster, which I seem to recall was $7 per ride, was pretty intense! Really. It was frightening because we were stalled at the bottom for a good 5 minutes before it started working. The ride itself was fun but intense, not for the weak of stomach. 

The casino has a dirty feel, "dirty new york" feel. I haven't been to New York. Maybe it's a clean place, but I've watched enough TV to believe it is a dirty place. Like this hotel.

So many things to do here, shops, restaurants, and gaming. Only issue was I ordered a drink while playing video BlackJack, waitress never brought it to me, pushed service attendant button on the machine after half hour still never came, probably waited a total of 45 minutes

Decent service but they kind suck about timeliness will take About 20-30 minutes to get one drink!!!!! Fun environment with good energy! Good places to grab dinner or a drink... But would prefer all participates to get a few drinks before coming to this casino it's not the best definitely needs some improvement! I dunno who to say other than it's not up to my par there add plenty more things about New York. New York' lol.. I love here I know what's up you shouldn't have to pay to get into any club! Zumanity is the greatest show on the strip and the best cirque!

I love how they updated so much of the outside to make it more like New York. The Hershey's store reminds me of when I stayed in Times Square.

Every time I come I see a new NYC food spot open here. Hopefully when I try Shake Shack, it lives up to the NY locations. And hopefully chicken and rice comes next!!!

I was walking The Strip at night, as one does, and I happened to walk by New York New York. Being a New Yorker, I decided to explore the Casino.

-- OUTSIDE --
Outside the Hotel\/Casino, you will see miniature replicas of New York monuments, one being a mini Brooklyn Bridge on the sidewalk and the Statue of Liberty at the front of everything. There's even some random roller coaster called The Roller Coaster that you can actually ride.

-- CASINO --
I didn't spend too much time in here; I mainly wanted to see what it looked like inside. Inside you'll find bars and sections named after New York landmarks. There was nothing particularly memorable that stood out.

What did stand out was me trying to get out of this casino. Now I know they are built to keep you lost, and I have a pretty firm sense of direction, but this casino was the only one in Vegas that confused me on how to get out. I initially entered through one set of doors, explored around, and then tried to find that same set of doors to get out. I went out one area to be greeted by the car pickup area. I used Google Maps on my phone and it took me to the parking lot, which only circled me back to that same car pickup area. I gave up and just used my intuition to find the street again.

-- SUMMARY --
That was my limited experience with New York New York. While it was fun seeing the homages to New York, the casino layout could be improved with clear signs as to where to go (minus one star). I'll no doubt revisit this place in the future and maybe stay in the hotel.

If I could be Katy Perry I'd start everyday waking up in Vegas! 

Since I can't the, occasional vacation will have to do! This was the case in April when my friends and I took a trip to sin city! 

We were greeted late at night upon arrival by a very nice concierge who graciously upgraded our room from the standard to the next level, it was quite nice with a view of the roller coaster right outside our bedroom window. 

The hotel itself is centrally located and they have easy access to whatever your heart desires including Cirque Du Soleil's Zumanity show which we watched. It was also great. 

All the staff we came in contact with were great and the hotel has all the amenities you can ask for. 

When I go back New York New York will be at the top of my list of places to stay!

On our trip to Vegas we visited all the lush casinos and hotels. They were often extravagant in a Vegas way...and they were all kind of cheesy.  None of them impressed us more than NYNY. New York isn't exactly exotic, or perhaps my first choice for a theme, but I thought the hotel was beautifully done and the theme was much more prominent than any other hotel we visited. 

Our room had an amazing view of the end of the strip. The room itself was nothing amazing, but it had a very nice touch of class, and was a good place to lay our heads between trips to the casinos--and certainly wasn't badly priced considering the alternatives.  

The hotel is just a convenient walk away from the monorail behind MGM.  The casino was large and dark, with bright neon signs everywhere- echoing the look of Times Square.  NYNY is also known for its miniature Statue of Liberty- which is fun to take pics with- and fullsize rollcoaster. 

The casino itself had a gorgeous bar in the center, and the tables were always hot.  We met a very nice couple one night that taught us how to play (and win!) in blackjack, and it quickly became my favorite game.  The vibe was fun and not stuffy like the Belagio or Paris. The buy-ins were usually comparable to hotels around us, if not lower (exluding Hooters).

Overall, it was a very memorable hotel and a trip I will never forget.
Fun Casino to tour.  We enjoyed visiting and waited there for our Zumanity Show. I'd recommend going to the show and getting a slice of pizza.

We booked a smoking room at this hotel months in advance, received no information that they were going to turn into a non-smoking hotel, and it still didn't say it anywhere on their website when we discovered this (after unpacking and everything and then looking around for an ashtray). 

The amount of trouble this caused everyone involved in this trip was astounding. It really did pretty much ruin the vacation, as ridiculous as it sounds. Even if you're not a heavy smoker at all, like a few cigarettes a day, when you're staying 25 stories up in a hotel and are ready to go to bed, but you need one last smoke, and you have to change back into your shoes and clothes and you're not wearing any makeup because you didn't think you would be up for long enough to have to come all the way back down here and you're around hundreds of people milling around, looking like a slob... it's really the fucking worst and it makes you very very very angry. 

I guess I'm never staying at an MGM property again, since they've done this to all their hotels. Even in California you can get smoking rooms. 

And the fact that they made this change less than a week before our stay without telling us beforehand just shows it was ill planned. I hope at least some of their properties revert back, or have outside smoking areas placed on every floor in some hotels. 

Also the hallway was ridiculous. We were at the very end of it and it was like if we had to make ONE MORE twist and turn it would had to have been a joke. Not only do you have to wait for an elevator and go down 25 floors before you smoke, you also are at the whim of whoever places you in a room. The walk down the hallway takes 2 or 3 minutes, not an exaggeration. 

On top of everything the air in this hotel was just bad. I had watery eyes and an itchy throat and severely stuffed up sinuses every morning, maybe from the heater, which had to be on, otherwise it was too cold. I could go visit other hotels on the strip, even other MGM properties, and my eyes would eventually clear up and sinuses too, but five minutes after being back in NYNY it would all come back. Our last day there I woke up with straight up laryngitis, thinking I must be sick, but sure enough it cleared up a few hours after leaving. 

There was good food in here and the roller coaster was fun, the arcade was amazing and had sweet games, but I would never ever ever recommend someone stay here because this experience was just torture, and even if you're a non-smoker the air is SO TERRIBLE in here it's not worth it. I don't know what it is. Old ventilation? Mold in the walls? Not emptying their vacuums enough? Whatever, just don't stay here. Ugh.

The hotel was great just got back from the UFC Expo and fights the hotel and pool was amazing, but they'er one bellhop left alot to be desired his name was iggy. After we tipped him he made a sarcastic remark an knocked our luggage off the cart. Other than that it was fantastic.

This one is mostly aimed at the outside sights.  From excellent photo ops to just it being "informative" at least pictorially for non-NY resident, it is quite awesome.  We walked South on the Strip and came up on what I believe was a Brooklyn Bridge replica which made for some cool pictures.  From across the street you can take in each of the buildings and if you know your history you'll be able to identify them.  Around the corner you can take a picture with a Lady Liberty replica and there's a very nice memorial for 9\/11 public servicemen.  It is worth the walk to and the time to take it all in.

We booked the penthouse and found out that there are many many different layouts for the penthouses and the one you get is not guaranteed. So anybody who sees the videos on YouTube or the pictures on their site, trust me they don't all look like that & some are a lot smaller than the one they advertise. I tried calling in a few days before to ask them to block me into one of the penthouses with the balcony and every person I spoke to was unhelpful and sort of robotic about their speeches. I felt like nobody really wanted to help me.

At check in I was really nervous that we'd get the small penthouse. I needed the large one because I was having a gathering in there and needed room for my guests. We were so lucky to have Daylinda as our check in agent because she was so helpful and patient! We got checked in to the penthouse called "The Ritz" and while it was nice it wasn't what we were looking for. I went back to the desk and saw Daylinda again to see if she could help us out. She offered another option to us and let us go up to see it before we made our decision. We ended up LOVING "The Regency" penthouse. Very spacious & wide open. My boyfriend tipped her for being so accommodating. We really appreciated her help!

The penthouse easily fit a lot of guests. The jacuzzi tub is the very best I've seen in Las Vegas. We had a nice view of MGM out of the bedroom and of the Excalibur out of the living room. Also if you have an iPhone or iPod, they have a docking station with speakers set up in the ceilings of every room including the bathrooms. Party mode is awesome it plays the music EVERYWHERE! The only thing I didn't like was there was no microwave. It's a penthouse it should at least have that (other models do).


Room: 4.5 stars (very nice but could use microwave)
Service: 2 stars (this includes everybody I spoke with except Daylinda)
Price: 3 stars (you easily get money's worth but it entirely depends on the luck of the draw with the penthouse you get assigned to. It really shouldn't be the same price for such huge differences in size. I would have gladly payed more to guarantee the larger one)
Daylinda: 5 stars (she deserves a raise!)

Overall: 3.6 it could be a good experience if you're lucky like we were, but there are a lot of chances of a letdown. You won't beat the price but is it worth the risk ??

I was invited to Vegas for CES and put up at the New York, New York. I've never stayed here before, but assumed the service and atmosphere would be close to other MGM properties I've been to. I was wrong.

Let's start off with the room:
I asked for a non-smoking room but clearly got a room that smelt like smoke. Sure, maybe a guest smoked in the room when they weren't suppose to, but it's still up to the cleaning crew to notice it and take care of the situation. I had to talk to two managers before they would finally swap my room. Unacceptable.

When I finally got into a room that didn't smell like an ashtray, I decided to take a shower. The shower was filthy, with remnants of the last guest's hair. Trying not to be negative and cause more issues, I just rinsed it down the drain and sucked it up.

WiFi:
Now, I know many of you reading this might laugh at me for even mentioning wifi when I'm in Vegas, BUT, like many of my other colleagues, we were here for CES to work. That being said: MGM properties had no WiFi. This makes it really tough for me to do the work I was sent there to do, which was cover the conference.

It took a total of 2 hours and 3 front desk managers to finally come up with a plan for people like me trying to get some work done. Apparently there were meeting rooms up on the second floor that had wifi. So that ended up being their solution.

Staff:
There seemed to be no authority. I spoke with multiple staff throughout the week which included managers, front desk, bell desk, etc, and all seemed as though they were part of the same pay grade. Like neither of them had the authority to make something happen. When speaking to managers about issues I was having, they all look dumbfounded like they have never had a concern or an issue presented to them before. It was a disaster.

Not once was I offered any sort-of comp or kind gesture for the trouble I was having. I'm not one to ask for anything, nor do I look for free things, but when you travel as much as I do, you know what good service is, especially in hotels.

Ok as for the hotel...pretty decent I kept winning in that HUGE slot machine that only pays out in coins so i liked that

as for the food! do not eat at that one resturant by the main elevators CAFE USA or something there's a big map of the US...DO NOT eat there!! FOOD WAS DISGUSTING! SERVICE WAS SO BAD...

First off the wait to order the food 20 mins food comes out...COLD
we asked for the check and the guy ignored us and walked away! YES HE HEARD US! MADE EYE CONTACT and threw up his finger like wait a second...that second turned into 30 mins...we paid and left

Ive been in a few Vegas Hotel, but this just become one of my favorite. 
Customer service great, price ok, room are nice and big, modern and clean. 
Plenty amazing restaurants, eatery, bakery, and bars. It does resemble NYC, especially Tribeca ad SoHo. 
Music was nice, inviting in the casino. I do wish the shops and restaurants or the roller coaster ride offer a little discount to hotel guest, and the waitresses come around the casino more often.

Newwww Yorrrrrrk, concrete jungle where dreams are made of....

I had so much fun gallivanting through this hotel. Piano bar, pizza by the slice, themed towers for the rooms...who knew you could go to Vegas and end up in New York? 

The room was great: clean, great view, comfy beds and good lotion.

Room service is tricky, they include the 18% gratuity and then they ask for additional tip, I got duped and tipped more.

I gambled some hard earned cash at roulette and played some nickel slots too. The cocktails were flowing and the cigarettes were burning. The club in the hotel, Rok offered an open bar from 6-9 with Vodka and Sapporo beers... lets just say we had our share and we partied in true Vegas fashion.

I had somewhat lower expectations for NY-NY, mostly because I had heard that the rooms were on the smaller side, and the hotel was slightly dated.  I guess it's good to keep your expectations low, because I was pleasantly surprised by the contemporary look of the room itself, albeit small, but not so small that I was tripping over my own feet.  

I had made the reservation several months ago, and had requested a room on a higher level floor, which they noted at the time, but again, I was surprised that they actually honored the request.  I went with my boyfriend- our room was on the 28th floor.  Yay for heights!  My only complaint about the room was that the walls were thin.  Really thin.  Either that, or the people having sex next door were being really loud.  I had to turn the T.V. on halfway to full blast, and I could still hear them.  Geez.  I realize it's Vegas, but still.  

While the room itself met (possibly even exceeded) my expectations, the stay at NY-NY was not without occasional inconvenience.  When we first arrived, before we even checked in, we went over to the Zumanity box office to purchase the $25 Passport Coupon Booklet, which is featured on the hotel's website, but as we would soon found out, was nothing but a big annoyance and produced what appeared to be lousy, pointless coupons.  Passport highly NOT recommended.  Unless you want to do some running back and forth throughout the hotel, in which case, you'd be better off walking the strip.  

After we had purchased the Passport, we checked in, not after discovering that coupons in the booklet were expired by more than a year.  Bah!  We checked with the concierge to make sure that we could still use the coupons, and they gave the okay.  Yet, when we tried to use one of the "Buy One, Get One Free" drink coupons at the Bar at Times Square, the bartender wouldn't honor the coupon.  This led us back to the concierge, who asked us to come back in the morning to see if accounting would comp the 2 drinks we had just purchased.

We did a lot of back and forth from the concierge and the Zumanity box office that next day.  It was slightly annoying that we had to explain the story to every staff person at both places, even more annoying that the staff didn't seem to want to offer to either comp our drinks or refund us the money we had paid for the Passport, not until we asked for this specifically anyway.  Staff were friendly, patient, and apologetic toward us though, and we eventually did get a refund for the Passport, in addition to two free drink coupons, which somehow made the whole rendezvous worthwhile, and earned NY-NY a 4 star rating.  Good thing, too, because after all of that, we really did need a drink!

Overall, the experience at NY-NY was decent.  I would stay here again, but will definitely forgo any coupon booklet that I actually have to fork over money for.  Especially one that's expired.

Had this themed casino been in ANY other city, it probably would've earned a higher rating. In Vegas, I would give it 3* as a true pleasure seeker (single, with an SO, or with friends) and a 4* as a family-equipped traveler. Note that I've never stayed here and am only referring to the public areas.

Alas, it is in a city where the standards for tackiness and everything done in excess are high. Many factors including proximity to other trendy destinations, the restaurants, the shows, the casino's machines\/tables\/drink service, and the quality\/maintenance of the interior means the difference between attracting Giuseppe Zanottis or New Balances. (Not knocking the NBs here since I, for one, have discovered upon becoming a Mom that NBs are some of the most comfortable shoes in the world. Yep, I do fit the stereotype.)

New York New York offers nothing in the way of fine dining and high end retail stores but is home to the (delicious!) burger and concrete shake powerhouse Shake Shack and two of the better shows in Las Vegas: Blue Man Group and Cirque du Soleil's Zumanity. It's also home to a pretty thrilling roller coaster that starts indoors and continues outside for some high drops and one big loop.

The outside might make genuine fans of the real NYC like myself gag, but the interior is pretty charming and looks a bit like some of New York's neighborhoods and streets, with a cobblestone walkway and rows of what appear to be brownstone buildings with fire escapes and an area modeled after Greenwich Village.

Plans for renovation were announced last year. Can't wait to see what kind of changes they'll be making!

- shows\/entertainment 5* (2 good shows + roller coaster)
- restaurants\/dining 4* (it was once 2* for me, but the addition of the Shake Shack is enough of a reason to lure me into NYNY. Now all they need is the chicken rice cart from 6th & 53rd or 49th & 6th and they will have secured a visit from me on EVERY future trip to Las Vegas.)
- casino 3*
- interior\/theme 3.5*

I stayed here recently when I came for a friend's wedding.  The service was very friendly and helpful.  The room was spacious and faced the Strip.  When we checked in the woman at the front desk gave us a corner room on the 32nd floor and it was an awesome view.  We also had a blast in the Center Bar in the casino both nights we were there.  Definitely a great place to stay if you are on a budget and can get a deal from Vinnie!

You have to visit the Food Court at New York' New York. You have everything from Pizza by the slice, Steak house, fish & chips,  to Katz's Deli, etc. I recommend you stop here before you go to a Pricey restaurant. At least you feed your Craving.

Love our room. Very nice upgrade. A lot of good food options and slots. I only gave 4 stars because the pool is way too small and all the crosswalks and escalators are under construction. Sucks to walk around outside.

Hotel room was nice and clean. Staff was friendly. Check-in was fairly simple. Used MyVegas Rewards so our cost was low. Housekeeping was respectful of our do not disturb sign. 
Paid a fee for amenities which included wi-fi. It was slow and often did not work so the fee went to nothing we used basically.

We just got back from a three night stay in Vegas and the New York, New York has a fan for life in me!   I read through many reviews trying to decide where to stay when we are there and am so glad that I made the decision that I made!

Sure there might be swankier hotels on the strip...and if that is what you are looking for, go ahead and shell out the extra cash...But for me the NY NY was JUST RIGHT!  I love the restaurant options it offers...Really nice to be able to either eat at a nice restaurant or just grab a slice of delicious NY Style pizza and a beer for $6.50! 

We had a blast dancing at the Rok Nighclub... Saw Zumanity our first night and loved the show.,,,.The dueling piano bar entertainment is really fun...and Coyote Ugly offers another fun night time option as well. We rode the roller coaster and had fun playing volleyball in the swimming pool. I also love that it is a hop skip and a jump from the MGM and the monorail that goes up the strip! Very convenient. 

The housekeeping staff was warm, friendly, and non-intrusive...and we had excellent service at the check-in desk as well as w\/ the bell hop when we checked our bags after checkout for a couple more hours of gambling before heading to the airport...which is really close too! 

Look no farther if you are looking for a fun, hip, and welcoming place to stay on the Vegas Strip!  Be a part of it at the New York, New York! :-)

Room wasn't very nice, had a funny smell. Room had a lot of wear. 

Pool has no umbrellas. Really? 

Was told that the breakfast buffet was buy one get one free by the front desk, when I went for breakfast it was a different story. 

Breakfast buffet was 21.99 per person which was compete rip off, spread was really bad. They really didn't have any good choices and food was labeled incorrectly. 
Your better of eating at a different hotel for breakfast. 

 Charged me for resort fee for the day even though I arrived at 11pm. Just makes no sense.

After having visited several times, this has been the ABSOLUTE WORST VISIT and CUSTOMER SERVICE received.  I was coaxed into upgrading my room for an additional charge. I agreed to upgrade to a larger room, however, the room was slightly inadequate due to no refrigerator. BUT the worst part was the lack of room service for a period of 2 days.  Not only was our room not serviced (cleaned, beds made, towels provided), but our call to such matters have gone unanswered after 3 calls. While this is normally not a large issue, IT IS ISSUE ENOUGH THAT IT NEEDS TO BE ADDRESSED IN REGARDS TO CUSTOMER SERVICE! Definitely do not recommend staying at this hotel. My friends have expressed no interest in staying here for future visits.

Great experience at NY NY! The actual hotel part (hallways, elevators etc.) may be a little dated, but the overall theme and atmosphere is great! The rooms were very comfortable and clean - and the beds were extremely comfortable! The casino was nice and offeredany options and great price points for slots\/games. Hands down, the service was awesome! We had great customer service from check in to check out! The food options are ample, but as another reviewer said- a little on the pricier side. The pool was clean and had ample chairs- great atmosphere! A tip for pool goers- if you want a frozen drink, get it inside where the prices are almost half of what they are at the outside pool.

If you like noise, chaos and children running all over the place, this is the hotel for you. I love the restaurants and shows not so much the hotel. However, I was pleasantly surprised to know that they offered san peligrino on their casino drink menu. That added to the stars. Not the place to stay for quiet times. But it's so interesting that the very adult Zumanity is playing here lol. So, I guess take your chances. But I have come a few times now and the madness of folks children just being out of control is so not cool. Try the roller coaster and arcades for fun.

New York-New York was a myriad of contradictions to my personal preferences.  The facility is undoubtedly impressive in its stature and architecture.  The inside streets and layout of the casino are one of my favorites in Vegas.  There is plenty to do here, plenty to see and plenty of places to wander around.  However, with that comes an entourage of kids and families checking out the facility or staying here.  In my book this is a con not because I have a distaste for children in general but because it seems that parents never truly watch them appropriately to my standards.  

I'm a big fan of the casino floor here.  Everything seems to flow here and there is adequate space to move around which can be uncommon in LV.  There is not just rows and rows of tables and slot machines throughout.  Things curve, angle, etc and it makes for a nice ambiance and is aesthetically pleasing.  Plus we won a decent amount of money here which may have skewed my opinion.  I love the easy exits to the both the street level and the upper level that leads across to MGM.  This is pretty big benefit given that the actual location is a bit further from center then I would prefer.

Also the selection of beverages and food here is pretty decent and allows for some late night opportunities which is a plus.  We did not sit down at any of the restaurants here other then the little breakfast place which was uninspiring and provided less then stellar service. (And service is something I'm rarely picky about)

The other drawbacks of NY-NY are the lack of a coffee maker in the room on par with most of the LV Strip outside of the Monte Carlo at least.  The staff here was less helpful then at other spots and despite requesting close rooms six weeks in advance we were scattered down a few different hallways which I would have to assume could have been avoided with better planning.

All in all, it's my feeling that NY-NY is worth a visit\/walk-through when you're in Vegas but unless you are traveling with kids you need to keep entertained I'm not sure I would feel the need to actually get a room here.

This is as close as I'll ever get to New York haha. I love hotels that have interesting themes. Within this hotel you'll find cobble looking streets, "Italian" food, and like any other hotel in Vegas, a casino. 

We didn't come here to spend the night but to ride the roller coaster! For $14 bucks, you'll get to ride the roller coaster around the New York, New York Hotel. It was pretty damn steep, fast, and made me scream!

Sweet exterior and interior and a great place to walk around.

I have TONS of family who now reside in Vegas, so I rarely make it down to the strip to hang out. I'm there so often during the year that I'm considered somewhat of a local. However, I went to meet up with some friends yesterday @ this hotel & was quickly reminded of how cool it is!

First, we nibbled on affordable $5-6 pizza slices @ New York Pizzeria. The slices were big & tasty (I was hungry so I completely forgot to take photos of the food b4 we started eating). Shame on me! Then, we took a ride on the roller coaster. It's only $14 for a 3-minute ride with a minimal wait (we were in line for about 5 minutes). The ride is hella fun with all of the dips, twists, & turns! Since I was acting like a tourist, I decided to pick up a few items in the gift shop next to the arcades. I was long overdue for a new sippy cup (it's purple w\/the Welcome to Vegas sign on front) and yet another beer-opener magnet for my fridge (as if you can ever have too many of those, right?). After my brief shopping spree, we hit the slots & roulette table for a while. Unfortunately, none of us hit it big, but we still had a good time enjoying the ambiance. 

Overall, I had a great time & was pleasantly pleased @ my 1-day casino visit. Guess it's ok to play the tourist role every now & again because I ended up having a blast! :-)

Basing this solely off of spending the evening here, did not actually stay here. My best friend and I took a girls trip to Vegas, and coming from NYC, were beginning to feel a little home sick and coincidentally bought tickets to Zumanity which is hosted here. Of course, nothing will ever be actual NYC, and I'm pretty snooty about that, but I think that this resort came close and I was really delighted at everything that I saw. I was very impressed at how the building that comprised the resort were made to look like the Manhattan skyline. I was in awe of how tall the buildings were and how much they looked like a mini version of the real thing. There is a giant roller coaster in the front of the resort that looks thrilling, of course, I would never go on it! I was beyond happy to see the various shops and restaurants inside which mostly kept within the NYC theme. The Times Square Bar looked awesome and like any pub in NYC, the pretzel stand, the bars all were awesome and fit right in. Nathan's, the lobster roll stand, the Irish pub, the crepe place, all fit right in! Just what I needed when missing New York a bit! Would love to actually stay here. Concierge and staff were all very nice and helpful, which is nothing like the real New York. Casino was very busy and lively!

If NYC was this vacant, it'd be the beginning of a disaster movie. 

I feel like this is only fun when you've never been to NY and don't get what they're trying to replicate.  Or maybe it's not fun even then, I'm not sure.

The restaurants are 'meh' for sure, the service is oddly lacking (hellooooo????) everywhere you go and the whole place seemed to have lost it's appeal a year after opening.

Bathrooms were messy, bars close early (wha? in Vegas?) and food is scarce and bad after midnight.

I don't think I'd go back in unless dragged.
Pretty nice hotel. Although I love to stay in Downtown LV, I loved the ambiance of this place. I would totally stay here again.

I'm wondering why I'm giving 3 stars to a place I've stayed several times and then I remember that I had to stay there for company functions.  They put so much effort into making this look like a hokie little NYC, but the place is boring and pretty lame.  

I saw they had a Tavern on the Green and was hoping it would be as fantastic as the original restaurant in NY....it wasn't a restaurant at all, it was a high stakes one-armed-bandit room! 

Also, I'm not sure if they are trying to replicate the city, but the little restaurants sat their garbage out in front when they closed for nightly pick-up....that's not nostalgic, that's unsanitary!

The reason for the stars?  The rooms are very nice.  Exceptionally clean, nice showers, good bedding and very polite staff (not so much like I remember NY).  Good middle of the road hotel, but I'd spend a little more and step up to the premier Hotel\/Casinos.

I love the location on the strip you are in the middle of everything and the valet is usually fast and friendly. Check in is normally moderate as I always come on a Friday evening. I've stayed in nothing less then the spa suite and the experience has always been great. The last few times I went I stayed in the ziggurat suite and loved it very spacious and the spa in the bedroom is a great plus. The only downside i would say are the emerald green windows so looking out the window can be a bit hard on the eyes. The bed is soft and very comfy so your bound to get some great rest for the few hours you do sleep in between partying. Room service is timely even in the wee hrs of the night buffalo wings! The pool is normally active with a few children playing by the fountain other than that all adults drinking, sunbathing, and volleyball funn in the pool. Overall a solid stay on the strip without breaking the bank.

This is going to be our new go to!

I've been to Vegas numerous times and always try and stay at different places, but I think I may have found my new place.

Husband's company was having a conference and some were staying here and some were at the Excalibur.  We got the better end of that deal.

Our room was on the 6th floor and the elevator was close to the gaming floor.  That's one of my complaints about some places, it takes forever to get to your room.  Not us this time.

The front desk was quick and friendly, we were close to everything we needed, the taxi stand efficient and all the food joints were decent.  We typically try and have a nice meal while out of town, but that didn't happen this time.  We basically ate junk food most of the weekend - hanging my head in shame - and this place fit the bill; pizza and garlic knots galore, Nathan's hot dogs, crinkle cut fries at the Shake Shack and plenty of drinks at the bars.

We didn't have much of a view and you can't find a diet coke in the joint, but I'll let one of them go, since everything else was great.

Probably one of the nicest casino I managed to walk into during my trip to Vegas. I'm 19 so I wasn't able to gamble, but I have to admit that I felt the urge to because of how attractive the casino appeared to me. 

The arcade is amazing; spent a couple of hours there with my family and we found ourselves there for the ice cream a lot too at the entrance of the casino. 

I'm glad that there was the tram station about 3 minutes from New York, New York that was able to take me back to Mandalay Bay.

The first night, we walked the whole LV strip, and the tram possible saved my feet from bleeding,

If I could write a review and give New York, New York ZERO stars, I would. But that isn't possible. 

Let's start at the beginning. A few friends were spending the week in Las Vegas, and NY, NY was the right price. As a recent Vegas transplant, I have my regular casinos that I frequent, and NY, NY isn't one of them, but since our friends wanted to play where they were staying, we indulged them. On day 1, my husbands experience with a Blackjack dealer was atrocious. The dealer felt it was appropriate to roll her eyes and make condescending remarks to my husband regarding a conversation he was having with his friend about game strategy. When her relief didn't come on schedule, she became disengaged in the game entirely, barely keeping her eyes on the table. 

On day 2, we sat at different blackjack table for over an hour without 1 waitress coming to take our order. After an hour passed and my husband played through literally $500, a waitress finally arrived. The waitress took our friends orders and when my husband attempted to finally order a drink, the waitress tells us, "We can only serve casino guests who are playing." He explains to the waitress that he just played through literally $500 while no one serviced our table, the waitress puts on a pouty-face, shrugs, and tells him that she is refusing to serve him. When the waitress walks away from out table, we begin to discuss amongst ourselves how utterly ridiculous the service we have received for 2 days straight is. The waitress turns around, returns to our table, and asks us if we have a problem. She actually turned around, returned to us, and joined in our conversation. She then tells us that it's the company policy and suggests to complain to them. At this point, the waitress has refused us service after we have played for over 60 minutes, played through $500 and she is now being hostile to us as well. We decided that we no longer wanted to play at NY, NY and promptly went to valet to retrieve our car. 

I have never received such horrible service at any other M Life casino, or any other casino at Las Vegas to be honest. We are M Life Gold Card members and we were shocked at how terrible the staff at New York, New York treats guests. We will NEVER return to NY, NY and will definitely never ever recommend the hotel to friends and family who are coming from out of town. If they suggest staying there we will urge them not to. If I see someone, anyone on social media suggest they are thinking about staying at NY, NY, I will be there to strongly urge them against it. This wasn't an isolated incident with 1 staff member, so clearly this is a reflection of the standards New York, New York has for its staff, it's quite obvious there are no standards in place. Both of these women felt it was quite fine, probably encouraged to treat guests like trash. That speaks to their management. You can waste both your time and the managers time complaining about how rude the staff is, but they likely all have a nice laugh about it after hours. Don't give your money to an establishment that feels comfortable treating guests like a jackass. 

If they think treating guests like trash is part of their New York charm, as a native New Yorker, I can tell you that they're way off base. New Yorkers might be a bit blunt, but their M.O. isn't to make you uncomfortable or to embarrass. This is a lack of class. The staff here is on a mission to make guests feel unwelcome. Message received loud and clear, we definitely will NOT return.

First I was down $200 - if I could give it 0 stars I would
Then I broke even - okay 3 stars
Then I hit a hot streak and walked away with $930 - okay this place is awesome. 

Rode black all the way.

I reserved a room for around $36 a night from Wed-Fri. After doing some research I decided I wanted to upgrade to a penthouse suite. Mainly because the price online seemed to be a great deal with my Mlife! I watched some you tube videos, and the few that are posted showed the penthouse suites with balconies. So...heads up you must be specific if that is the penthouse type you want.

I was able to upgrade upon arrival. The employee helping me stated the price, however, he did not communicate properly that the price he was giving me would be in addition to what I already paid for the room. Not a huge deal, but something that I feel should have been explained in detail. I get to the penthouse suite, "The Drake", when I opened the door first thing I noticed was, it does not look like the penthouse suite shown on the website. Next, I do my walk through and notice zero balconies. So at this point I am a bit upset but overall the room was nice so I figured I would ask the front desk later about this. (which is how i found out if you want the balcony penthouse you must request it specifically)

On the plus side, upon walking in you have a 3\/4 bath to your right, closet on you left. In front of you is a sitting room with a couch, coffee table, chair, cabinet, wet bar with a small flat screen tv. Also included which was great, complimentary water, soda, and coffee. 
As you proceed you next come to the living room\/dinning room area. Full couch, chair, flat screen tv, and the dinning room table with 4 chairs and small flat screen in dinning room area.
Continue on and you get to the bedroom and next to the bed is a spa\/jacuzzi tub. Also has a small walk in closet, and of course another flat screen tv.
Bathroom has a huge shower, and dual sinks. Great bathroom toiletries which included toothpaste, toothbrush, shaving kit, etc. 
One thing I really loved was that audio system. You can use the remote control in any room and place it in "party mode" allowing you to play music in each room and adjust the volume.

On to the cons. Front desk customer service is probably the worst I have experienced and I have stayed at several other hotels as I travel to Vegas about once or twice a year.

To start, the tv in the living room would not change channels. I called and the front desk had some workers come up to look at it. They were super friendly and nice and did what they could to fix the problem. An hour later, there were 3 people trying to fix it. I kindly excused myself and went to concierge. I explained what was happening, that I had concert tickets for that night and what could be done. I was then directed to the front desk. 

The employee there checked the status, even after I told her there were 3 of them currently working on it. Asked if I would like to be moved but then noticed I was in a penthouse, so she came back and said nothing else was available. Her next option to me was, "can you ask them to leave and come back later?" 
She clearly was not understanding the principle of the whole thing which to me was...I paid for a upgraded suite and the tv doesn't work? Everything should work! The safe was locked, so I couldn't use that either and at that point did not even want to mention it. 
All i was looking for as a customer was for them to be understanding, and it came across to me as...deal with it! I basically lost an hour or so of my day waiting for them to fix it. When I went back up to my room about 30 mins later....still working on it! I checked in around 4pm, problem solved around 6pm. 

When I checked out the employee did not even bother to ask how my stay was, just handed me my receipt and said, "next".

The overall customer service is what made me give NYNY a 3 star. I was looking forward to staying here, but I do not know if I would come back. The only reason I would is because of the value of the rooms for the type of room you get. Also, the cleanliness of the room. My housekeeper was Maria and she did a tremendous job! 

The penthouse suite is listed on the website as "the ultimate in VIP living", which I did feel the room lived up too, but the front desk employees definitely do not make you feel like a VIP.

I also noticed after reading several reviews, that some people were allowed access to the VIP lounge with the purchase of the penthouse suite. This was never mentioned to me, I was never told about it, so did I miss out on something that should have been included? Once again, poor customer service communication skills.

I love vegas and the strip always has something fun to do. I found New York New York to be exactly what i need on my stay but nothing more. I got a great deal for a four night stay and thought i would book it. The hotel did mess up part of my reservation but they fixed that asap and were very apologetic. We had free beverage credits which i used at one of the bars in the centre of the hotel. The bar tender was extremely rude and the bar wasn't even busy, but he was rude to the ppl next to me as well so maybe he was having a bad night or even year, i could care less. 

Each hotel in vegas has its unique flair but found myself spending more time in other hotels rather than my own. There was also construction work being done on the hotel facade and restaurants outside which was disappointing. My room was pretty good everything seemed updated and i had a good view of the strip. I like to play poker in vegas and was disappointed when i found out new york new york does nit have a poker room. The roller coaster outside was fun but no discount of tickets even if you are staying at the hotel. 

I did not eat at any of the restaurants at the hotel so i cant comment on the food. But there was some cool live music over the weekend. Overall the room was cheap and had everything i really wanted. The hotel is located toward the south end of the strip and is a bit of a walk to get to some of the larger hotels but you do get to see a lot of eccentric people on the way!

I would say i went to Las Vegas more than 10 times already, not because i like casino but my grandma love playing slot machine, so when she come visit me here in the state, i'd like to please her by taking her there, and every time i visit the city that has never been sleep, i'd like to stay in different hotels. This time we went on Last X'Mas and stayed at NY. NY. in century side, the room was just FINE, nothing is special. But the restaurants are top-notch offering some of the finest international cuisine around which i really like to try something different. Also there are some sport bars here so while i drop my grandma playing her favorite machine so i can grab some drinks.

I really wanted to like it. I really did. But they made it so hard.

To begin, I stayed here in the late 90s and for reasons unknown, hadn't been back since. All of my memories of that trip were wiped with bleach-bit, since I went with my ex-wife. So I started fresh this time around with a completely open mind.

Since I generally stay at MGM places and play poker a lot, I've walked through the NYNY while heading somewhere else literally hundreds of times. (No poker room at NYNY.)  And for a long time, the only reason I had to spend any time there was Il Fornaio. Slowly but surely, NYNY kept adding places I like (Tom's Urban, for example, which is just phenomenal).  

It was time to stay there again, so I booked a Marquis Suite. Looked interesting. Plus the pics showed what looked a 4 person tub with viewing\/photography bench, if you're into that kind of thing. 

Check-in service was abysmal. The staff was 50% friendly, 50% incompetent. Not a good ratio. They had the VIP check in blocked off, so we had to check in at the regular desk area. But still, if you're platinum, (a) you probably shouldn't have to ask for the platinum experience at check-in, and (b) if you are forced to ask, the person you're asking should probably have heard of it at some point in their life and not have to go somewhere and ask someone what it is. Finally, if you ask someone to see if a higher floor is available, they should at least pretend to check the computer before telling you no. If nothing else but as a courtesy. Jeez, check your email, whatever. Just pretend you give a crap about my request.

Next, you can't just take an oversized room and call it a suite. That's all the Marquis suite was. A big-ass room with a big-ass tub and a lot of wasted floor space. Things you think of when you say the word suite: Separate living\/bedroom area. A place to relax in the separate living area, like a couch. Stuff like that. Like the Delano's suites. Or the Monte Carlo's suites. Or the Luxor's pyramid suites. Or even the Excalibur's suite, which had a second bathroom along with the separate living area. Nothing like that in the Marquis suite. Don't waste your money. Unless, of course, you have 3 other people, a bath bomb from Lush, and a photographer. Then, by all means book this room.

Other things I dislike?  No poker room. Having to wait forever for things like Pai-gow because there just aren't many tables of it. Sloooooooooow drink service at slots. The sports book.

Things I like about NYNY?  The uniqueness of the place. Walking down the hallways in the hotel is like no other place I've stayed. I REALLY like Tom's Urban and some of the other food options. Zumanity. 

It's like watching Hells Kitchen when a chef comes up with a fantastic looking dish, only to hear Gordon Ramsay reject it because it was raw.  NYNY is a beautifully presented dish, poorly executed.

First time in Vegas. 
New York New York is the only hotel I've been in this far and it's pretty awesome. There's little cities in here! This place is huge. Went to Coyote Ugly, (which is in this hotel) that super fun. 
There are plenty of food options and majority are open very late (woo!)
The rooms are nice. We got a suite and the bathtub is soooo nice. Great way to treat your feet at the end of the night.

Not the best first experience in Vegas. We got to our room and my girlfriend stepped on a tack in the room. We then went to take a shower and the water did not drain and also would not get hot. I called the front desk and they said they would send someone up to try and fix it versus exchanging our room. We'll see how the rest of this stay goes but it's not looking good.
I love the bar at the high limit here at newyork newyork,the service is really good and the crowd is good too.I will be back here tomorrow

First Time in Vegas and as with anywhere you need to stay in an area at least once to learn where to stay and what to do. I booked the hotel on a promo "Vegas Party Scape Package" which includes 'free' cover to four bars\/clubs and some other minor 'perks'

Well Rok, one of the bars was closed, Coyote Ugly was handing out free cover vouchers and the other two bars I believe didn't have a cover. Only thing we benefited from was a 15% reduced room rate of $68.  Some promotion.

Our room has a stunning view of a wall and the backside of the roller coaster. I tried to get them to bump me to a Strip View room for free, which they would do, FOR $15. Oh well I tried. Maybe since I had the "Vegas Party Scape Package" they felt I was already getting a deal. 

$15 resort fee blows. Sort of like getting a haircut for $10 and then paying a mandatory $5 fee to sit in the chair. No way around the fee, outside of staying at a 'resort fee free' hotel. But let's be honest - if they aren't out right charging it to you, it is most likely packaged into the price somewhere. 

I was less than blown away from this hotel\/casino. The location is on the South end of the strip. My wife was less than thrilled after the 1.5 hike down to the Venetian Casino. If I had to do it over I'd stay at a more centrally located hotel along the strip, then you can walk North or South and check things out. This is really my fault for not knowing the area. Lesson learned.

Rooms are meh, ok, I guess. Only two pillows on the bed. Their upgraded strip view rooms get more pillows...seriously? Has the feel of a worn Westin Hotel room. Decent but not what I expected for "Vegas Baby".  I'm cheap, so paying a premium wasn't a priority for a premium room, but IF I ever come back I'm looking elsewhere. We didn't spend much time in the room anyway, but do want to feel that you are getting the most BANG for your buck. 

I'd take a 'gamble' on another Casino\/Hotel if I was doing this again, took a gamble on New York New York and lost. Oh well that is Vegas and we all know the house always wins.

Just my opinion. Honestly I really can't say enough awesome things about this casino and hotel.

This place is really put together quite well

Especially the rollercoaster and New York  street dining area. It's very cozy and very well designed and put together. I'm very impressed

People in previous review rating this 1 star are complaining about a $25 hotel fee....did you book through Priceline, Hotwire, hotels.com, Travelocity??

Have news for you. ALL the casino hotels here on the Vegas strip have a hotel fee of between $25 and $35

Not sure why you would slam New York New York for such a typical charge.

This will be the very first place I come back to when I get back to Vegas.  Various  night stays here you don't even have to leave this place. It has pretty much everything

Oh I'm adding something: SIRRICO'S PIZZA in food area is hands down by far some of the best pizza I have ever had and I'm from Chicago I have had amazing pizza 

I ordered pepperoni and sausage with a cup of marinara sauce to dip in.....MY GOD!....HEAVEN.....

The food area is designed really really well and has kind of a warm rather "cozy" feel to it. The seating and the view makes you feel kind "at home". I don't think I have ever felt that way about a food court area except here

Oh by the way: Cordell in security is soooo hilarious!  That guy is awesome and really helped me out when I accidentally left my ID at the front desk during my 

My only tiny negative observation(not a complaint) is the thermostat for room temperature and fan controls is from like 1985

Love the arcade and the roller coaster!

Gotta love flying high above the strip in a plastic yellow taxi - make sure that you yell out something when you're slowly making your way to the top of the incline.

Put this on your list for "good clean fun" in Las Vegas - hehe.

My boyfriend and I stayed 2 nights (not in a row) in this hotel. The rooms we had was clean and cozy. The first one had a great view (room 1065) but the second view was a brick wall (room 777). Check in was not very quick but the service was perfect. This hotel is perfect for a short stay and it's very cheaper than other hotel in the strip.

I hate to admit it, but  I've lived in (the real) NY for over half a century.  I even had 2 children in Manhattan.  I have been uptown, midtown and downtown and have a real sense of NYC

The indoor mall in Vegas, gives you a sense of the downtown area of Manhattan and it was nice.  Upstairs was a roller coaster,  which we did not go on.  The Brooklyn Bridge was built, but taped off. There was a Pizza Restaurant there, I cannot recall the name, but their pizza was clearly forgettable, don't order it.  We bought a hat at one of the street vendors, but after being in Paris, this was truly a disappointment.  I would not recommend this as a site seeing destination.

NYNY casino knows how to treat you special.  The birthday celebration  with my 20 best friends was wonderful.  We had such a great time... Spending a week of pool, fun, sun and partying every night you can't beat. Special thanks to pool staff  Anna (pool manager), Mario (pool supervisor cutie cabana boy) Donna(pool staff) and all the staff .. Pool servers  Stephanie, Lily, Kit, Julianna and all the servers.
The hotel staff in restaurants, our World class high limit staff.. Beverage servers  Joni, Eva, Charolete Rachael. Floor\/gaming \/slot staff... Cathy, Carol, Chris, Tara, Catrina as well as the evening team... VIP lounge staff.
But most of all the best Executive Casino host ever...Tom C.  You always make ever trip special.  This is the only place to be in Las Vegas.

Very disappointed. We stayed here once about 7 years ago and were treated wonderfully. This time the staff were rude and even the manager didn't care about customer service or being a normal human being. My fiancée wanted to stay another night and the girl at the front desk said it would b an extra $150. Okay if this was a Friday or Saturday night I could see that but this was for Sunday. We paid $67 total with resort fees for Saturday night and now it's double to stay?!  The manager came up and said there was nothing she could do. She said they were completely booked up and that was all she could do. I find it hard to believe every room in this hotel was occupied!?  My boyfriend went over to Excalibur and not only did they have a room they let us check in at 9am an it was in a spa suite for yep u guessed it the same price we paid for at nyny!  I do not recommend here. They obviously don't care about having people stay at their hotel!
The hotels pretty cool. I mean after going to every casino on the strip its just like the others. The scenery is pretty cool yet  nothing great stands out about it.

The spa was amazing again kristina remember me all the time and she is like oprah dr phil and steve harvey all in one she makes me laugh and she does my toe nails really well and she always has my toe polish this spa service at the new york new york is the best on the vegas strip

New York New York had been my Hotel & Casino for many years till I stopped visiting Vegas for a few years, last year (September 2014) I went back to Vegas and I could not stay at a different Hotel & Casino than New York New York. Well, it is still awesome as it used to be and maybe more. Great and very clean rooms, good restaurants, good and not crowded bars, variety of shows, great customer service and clean and ample casino. The only star I am not giving to them is because the gentleman at the check in was really really slow, while other cashiers attended 2 or 3 people he just attended me; I would say it took him more than 30 minutes. Otherwise, NY NY is my place in Vegas and it has been for almost 20 years; and I will be back again this September 2015!

I was excited to stay at New York-New York for the first time ever, as it was one of the more noticeable theme hotels on the strip when I first visited Vegas.  Though, in an amazing location, this hotel it generally average, and some things just plain annoyed me.
We booked on Priceline, arriving to find that we were given a room with two queens, as there was no king option available....oh well. Our friends, who had already booked a king suite, were also denied.  I was further annoyed when I saw that my credit card had been charged a $349 deposit for our 3-night stay which would cover "incidentals" and would be otherwise fully refunded.  Well, I have no idea which incidentals they were talking about, as we were refused when we tried to charge our poolside drinks to the room, stating that we had not arranged with the desk to do so.  Further, our room came without a fridge, and they tried to ask for $30 per night to rent one.  We refused, and they still gave us the fridge.  The maid service was fine, except that they called each day at 1:00 PM stating that they could not clean the room because the "Do Not Disturb" sign was still on the door, which is fine, but a little early to decide they cannot clean the room at all. The final annoyance is that we constantly heard the roller coaster from the room, but it wasn't too loud.
On the bright side, our room overlooked the pool, which makes for a nice view.  As I said, the location is convenient, and there is a bakery downstairs right at the elevator, perfect for hangover breakfasts.  We checked in and out quickly and easily, and there was never much of a wait at the elevators.
All in all, it is not bad, but I'd prefer to pay a bit less and stay somewhere else, or a bit more and stay somewhere nicer.

Weekend a my Wife to celebrate our March\/April birthday's

Check in was fast and easy, the gentleman at the desk was friendly asked if we had any questions or needed assistance with anything, gave us a map of the hotel and sent us to our room.

Our Room was really NICE!  Park Ave w a Strip View, we absolutely loved it!  The view was a wrap around window so we got a view of Luxor\/Excaliber\/Mandalay Bay and the other window was a view of MGM and the strip.  We had no issue with the roller coaster noise.  We loved the bed and all the pillows!  

We were able to score 2 for 1 tickets to Zumanity (which was the whole reason for this trip) our seats were awesome and the show was A M A Z I N G!!!! The live music is always a favorite part of the Cirque shows for me, this was my 6th Cirque show and still haven't been disappointed in any. 

The Casino is much smaller then most on the strip but easier to remember how to find your way out!  This was my 2nd time staying at NY NY and I def will return.

The theme itself screams "tourist trap," with nothing terribly unique beyond the usual casino games, generic casino restaurants, and roller coaster, but when viewed as a cheap place to stay on the Strip, it does the job. The rooms were fairly conventional as far as Vegas is concerned, with nothing out of the ordinary in terms of positive or negative surprises. The very definition of a 3-star rating, in my book.

I've never stayed here but I have lost money here. A good deal of money and for that I hate this place. 

I am only reviewing the roller coaster. It kicks ass. I mean, goddamn, this isnt Knotts Berry Farm or Magic Mountain, its a feakin hotel, but that roller coaster was a welcome experience after losing a couple c-notes and drinking watered down cocktails.

This place is a little older, and it's starting to show.  Luckily for any travelers going to book a room here in the future there is tons of construction going on to make it look better.  As for me it was a bit annoying.  

I only stayed one night at in the Park Avenue room which is one step up from the lowest of the low.  It wasn't anything too special the room lacks many ammenities I've come to expect.  No robes, or mini bar and very liminted channels on an old tube TV.  
  
The casino was fun.  I got to play craps, rapid roulette, and a Happy Days slot machine.  Players club people were friendly, they found my account number and printed a new card for me even though I had not played at a MGM casino for at least three years.  

Overall it's a decent place to stay.  Lots of places to eat and it's in a great location.  The rooms are clean and staff seemed kind.
Most uncomfortable beds, rooms smell. Stay away from this place. You are also paying $40 resort fee, I still can't figure out what for? Avoid avoid avoid

This hotel is super cute. I love that it has the New York vibe. It makes me miss New York. I didn't stay here but I did go there for shake shack and other yummy goodies. :) the vibe here is young to Middle Aged people. I love the Statue of Liberty right outside of the hotel and the Brooklyn bridge :)

We came here w\/ friends for a weekend.  We would not return.  

Room - Don't bother staying here!  You can spend only a bit more and stay at a much nicer hotel.  The "non-smoking" room smelled like an ashtray, the tv only worked intermittently, and housekeeping knocked on the door at 8 am despite the privacy sign on the doorknob.  Nothing seemed very clean.  Comfort Inn would have been a step up.  

Casino - Two things happened within about 5 minutes of playing:  1)  a friend was told to "hurry up" when throwing the dice at the craps table (and he had taken all of 10 seconds... not an unreasonable length of time!), and 2) when the two of us (one playing, one watching) ordered cocktails, we were told that I wouldn't be served unless I bought some chips and played.  I have never heard that before, and I didn't hear it again during this trip at any other casino.  Very odd.  

Il Fornaio - We had salads, pasta, and steak - all were good.  

Zumanity - Worth seeing (just stay elsewhere).

The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because I have yet to stay here my review is based off customer service prior to my stay. 

My wife's birthday is coming up and we are staying at the New York New York hotel. I reached out to Jodi Bratton to help with some accommodations. She wasn't just good help she was great help! We now have everything squared away and I can tell that our trip is going to be wonderful thanks in part to the level of guest service that is being offered. 
I can't wait to stay here!

Not a fan of this hotel. It resembles more of Chicago than New York. They told us they'd bring 2 bottles of water to our room complementary every day, then when they didn't bring it in 30 minutes, I called and they said they won't bring it, which I felt showed disorganization and unprofessionalism. 

It's also overly smokey in the casino, and there are no good restaurants in the lobby. The shower in my room was also unusually loud and poorly built. It's a cheap hotel, and definitely not upscale. 

However, the decor is nice, and the exterior of the hotel is nice.

First of all when we checked in to our room the door didn't lock the lock was apparently broken. Really? Ugh I had to go downstairs and complain and asked the front desk to give us a different room. So inconvenient we had to carry our stuff to a different room. 

I had to ask them for and upgrade for the inconvenience. Room service is bad they charge for everything $30 for a robe per day $30 for a refrigerator. This was the first and last time I will stay At New York New York. Btw the rooms are old fashioned and creepy .
Too smokey but overall a nice hotel and casino. Great promotions and friendly staff, some are kinda dry but overall I enjoy it here. Best thing is the New York pretzels they have upstairs!!!

It's sort of hard to read a review about a hotel in Vegas.?I have stayed at this hotel dozens of times it's one of my favorite places to stay. It's right across from MGM and it's right off the strip. They have a very nice food court of different restaurants and a lot of little shops. Honestly all the employees I've ever run into here are all very nice. I don't recall ever having a problem with the service at this hotel they've always been very accommodating even giving us a discount on the rooms and things to do out in Vegas. One downside is coming off the elevator from the parking garage there's always a very odd smell when you're walking down the bridge. Parking here is free it seems pretty busy but usually can find a parking space. It's your first time here I would keep her car parked and take a cab or walk so much easier. There's plenty of cabs always waiting in front of the hotel. Rooms are really nice try to get a view of the strip . on the top floors is really nice usually a little more quiet. Staying on the bottom floors it usually gets pretty loud at night with people getting in and partying. Really really comfortable beds. nice flat screen TV. No coffee maker but there is a Starbucks downstairs.

This is our place, stay every time we go to Vegas and it never disappoints. The staff is super friendly. The rooms are clean. The restaurants are excellent and the number of restaurants tops the other hotels. The place is hopping at night. You really could just stay in this hotel the whole time and have a blast.

Really cool casino, love the atmosphere! Awesome scenery looks like NY. Great restaurants, lots of bars, one of the 1st places you see coming on to the strip that wows you. The outside is bananas, from the replica NY buildings to the roller coaster goin by the statue of liberty.

Never stood here but seems to be a good experience based on reviews, location is perfect. From Nathans, The Hershey Store and Shake Shack lots of great choices for eats.

I was writing this review as I was in my room at the NYNY...but now that I'm home, i can finish it properly. 

Currently in my room writing this review at 2:40am.

To get the main thing out of the way, is that it must be a policy for employees to be absolutely rude and condescending to the guests who are staying here. The NYNY employees have been some of the worst hotel employees that I have ever had to deal with in my life !!

This is my first time and last time staying at the NYNY.  For obvious reasons I had not stayed here before. I travel to Vegas at least 2 to 3x a year. It is an older hotel, and that was one of the main reasons that I did not want to stay here. I've stayed at the Cosmo, the Wynn, the Palazzo, the Venetian and Mandalay Bay. 

Unfortunately, I had to plan a last minute trip to Vegas and the deals I received through a friend's employee discount, I could not pass up.

Cons:
Called 3x before arriving to confirm with reservations that my total would be $198, all 3x the person who I spoke with on the phone said that the amount of $198 would be my total. Including resort fees. Boy was I in for a surprise when I arrived and got a whole whopping  $198 + 68.99 charge on my card plus the $100 incidental fee. The employees who checked me in were very condescending, the manager who I spoke with not much of a help at all either, and basically just tried to prove me wrong the entire time I was speaking with him. As if being condescending and belittling me would ever make me want to return to this dump?!?!?

The "drink girls" are snobby and absolutely rude!  One of them basically called me a liar out to my face and I did not get a drink because she said I was "not playing" when I clearly had over $50 in credit on the machine. She just walked away laughing and never came back with a drink. She brought my mom a drink, but not me. The manager whom I spoke with just apologize. No complimentary anything from this hotel. They are absolutely terrible at satisfying the customer, or trying to make up somehow for their rude, belligerent employees.

I was traveling with my mom, who has trouble walking around, and we needed a wheelchair. 

Staying at 4 and 5 star hotels, the wheelchairs are usually free of charge to use for the guests! Because of all the money you're spending on a casino already. The bell hop lady was so rude and said "nope, I'll need your cc if you want to rent a wheelchair, it's $40\/day!! $40 freaking dollars a day to rent a wheelchair when it has been comped to us in other hotels. Smfh!

The first room we were put in was a Madison Avenue corner suite and it was absolutely filthy. Dirty bathroom  dirty carpet. I called downstairs and we were moved to a higher floor 3434 same room. The room was cleaner, but the toilet clogged , kept making a loud squealing noise all day and night and the 1st fridge they brought us did not work. Had to call and get another one delivers to our room. (Fridge was "comped" or else they charge you $25\/night for it)

Just seemed like problem after problem after problem.

The heater and AC-Heater smelled really bad, they should probably clean the vents. I felt like my allergies got worse staying in that took I would wake up with a stuffed nose or coughing.

Will definitely absolutely not be staying here ever again!! because of the lack of customer service and care you would expect  from such a big hotel, and the lack of attention to detail they put into their rooms. Sure the hotel is older, but that doesn't mean it has to be dirty too.

Pros:

The fridge was comped 

The view was not that bad

I tried the  $20 " sandwich" and thats why we got an upgraded room and "comped fridge

Visually impressive.  Nice clean rooms at a fair price.  Gym was nice.  Pool was okay.  Restaurants are a little pricey for what you get, but you can find a few specials if you look around.  Wi-fi was very slow.  Check-in\/Check-out was relatively easy.

It was a fun place to stay, I really enjoyed the roller coaster!  Our room was the spa suite.  It was ok, however, for the price we paid it could have been more... We looked out over a lighting area and we had no view since they put us behind a false building wall.:\/. It was ok, but I was disappointed and wished we had a view.  Aldo, the water in our room smelled metallic as well.
I do have to say I was satisfied with my stay. I would stay here again. Easy access to the strip and freeway. Lots of great restaurants and a huge roller coaster. Prices on rooms are very reasonable.

I was pleasantly surprised to find our "re-decorated room" clean, quiet and comfortable and the price was pretty reasonable. The service was fast and good and the spa was very nice.  The gym was small, but well equipped  and clean.  The one last star I did not give them was because our "room with a view" was really the rooftop and roller coaster, which I do not consider a view and the pool is small and lame.

Stayed here for 5 nights with a group of friends. They were able to put our rooms close together so it was very convenient. 

This is a great middle of the road priced hotel. The rooms are very nice and the beds are comfy. There is a wide variety of stuff to do in the hotel and it is a great location if you want to do stuff at that end of the strip. 

I didn't use the gym but my friends did and it wasn't anything special but met their needs.

My girlfriend also recently stayed here and used the spa. She says it is overpriced for what you get. The spa at the venetian was a similar or cheaper price and had many more amenities.

It is also convenient in that it is close to the airport and the parking is also easy to access.

The wi-fi is also included which is a plus.

First time there as an Mlife member and don't think I'll go back. Requested for a crib when i booked the rooms months in advance. Upon arrival reminded them about the crib. still no crib arrived to the room. Called and asked about the crib and was told the hotel does not uses crib anymore so there's none. "Linda" said "mam we no longer have cribs and I don't know when you requested it because we stopped using cribs a long time ago." She offered me a roll out bed with six pillows and 4 blankets to use as a crib for a 9 month old. I relent and said ok. 

Well housekeeping showed up with 6 pillows and 4 blankets in a damn crib. He was using the crib as a carrier to transport the stuff. I asked about cribs he said they have tons and gave me the one he had. 

The other experience was my daughter asked for a late check out and they said yes. I asked for one they said no. I offered to pay the fee and Cecilia still said no. So I ask to speak to her manager who immediately came on the phone and gave me late check out without a fee since I'm a Mlife member. 

This place is getting to be a dump!

I loved my stay over here. Me and my wife went to the marquis suite and loved the view of everything. It felt very classy. I loved the location of the hotel and the atmosphere. Only thing I didn't like was the tv they give you. Its a crappy ass tube t.v. I guess I need to go up a few levels next time if I want flat screens. I feel as if a stay is as good as your room. You get better deals if u go during the weekdays. No drunk crowds its just real couples during the weekdays. I wanna go back soon.

Not all MGM resorts are alike. Haven't checked in and already having a bad experience. I called the day before to ask if we could check in early and I was told we could, depending on availability. Upon arrival at the registration desk we were told that our  room wasn't available but she could check us into a bigger suite to accommodate our needs. She went as far as telling us if we were okay with two queen beds instead of a king and also asked for IDs. Clearly making it seem like we were going to be able to get "a" room. She then makes a "phone call" to ask if it was okay for the upgrade and whoever she spoke with said no. Why wouldn't you confirm that you could upgrade a guest first? Instead of making them think they were going to be able to get a room and then tell them no. We are Mlife members and that didn't  help in the slightest bit. Next time we will continue to book our rooms across  the street at the MGM Grand, they have excellent customer service and we expected the same from NYNY. Too bad...so sad... now we know for next time.

Some would say that New York - New York is a little passe, but I would disagree. This is one of the most fun hotels in Vegas. This review is purely on the attractions and casino floor because I've never stayed here, but I'm seriously thinking about it for next time. It's a great location - right in the centre of the strip, not far from MGM, Caesars, Planet Hollywood etc so you can walk right on in. 

One of my favourite things about it is the little fake new york neighbourhood, with the shops and cafes. There is a mexican restaurant somewhere there which makes awesome guacamole and even better sangria. I forget the name. 

My next favourite thing is the goddamn rollercoaster. Which goes THROUGH the casino and is genuinely terrifying. Definitely buy the all day pass (it's like the price of 2 rides) because you will 100% want to go on it more than once, and then it means you can skip the queue for second\/third\/fourth visits. 

Love it here. I'm sure to swing by every time i'm in town.

This was my very first trip to Las Vegas and after reading a lot of mixed reviews about this hotel I didn't know what to expect. I made the reservation anyways and requested 2 beds with a view on the Strip. I had an amazing view of the Strip and it actually looked a lot better at night. 

Guest service:
They were very friendly and helpful, answered all our questions and most of all were very accommodating. As I said before, I called and asked for 2 beds and a view of the Strip and they made sure my request was met.
When it came for us to get tickets for shows, one of the front desk person was kind enough to tell us to check the prices online as they are always running specials or promotions. I thought that was very nice of him.
We were able to purchase tickets online for Zumanity at a lower cost this way.

The room:
The New York New York hotel and casino is an older hotel on the Strip and to be honest I was a bit skeptical making the reservation. I am glad I did though, the room was clean, the shower\/bathroom was clean and our view of the Strip was fantastic. If you are on a budget and are looking for a hotel on the Strip and walking distance from everything, look no further this place will meet your expectations. The only complain I have is room service. My friend and I had left to venture out on Las Vegas boulevard when we got back around 2 pm our room had still not been cleaned.

The casino:
It is pretty basic with slot machines, Craps table, poker and blackjack tables. What I thought was awesome and unfortunately didn't take advantage of are the poker, blackjack and craps lessons they teach between noon and 2pm daily. For people like me who have limited knowledge about Craps, this is a great way to learn the rules of the game. 
Also inside casino is the Hershey store where you can buy New York themed candy. It was so tempting because you can smell the chocolate and it smells delicious. As you know you can smoke in casino s in Las Vegas, NY NY casino in my opinion was one the least smokey casinos on the strip.
