If that doesn't convince you,  if you are a thrill seeker like me, you will LOVE the Big Apple roller coaster inside the casino. The roller coaster is supposed to represent a cab ride in busy NYC and it was truly fun and amazing. I loved it so much that I rode it back to back. 

You also have all these amazing restaurants on sites. From Shake shack, to NY style pizzas to Mexican inspired food, to Irish themed pubs, the choices are unlimited.

In conclusion, I was truly impressed by the hotel and like I said if you are on a budget and want to be close to everything (I.e the strip and stores) this hotel will not disappoint you. 3.5 stars. Overall great experience.

This was my first trip to Vegas and my wife's second.  I decided on New York New York based on price and reviews. And I think we got reasonable rates for our three night stay.  

We booked a spa suite since my wife's back has been acting up and we thought it would be helpful for her.  Well the spa was great and worked as we intended it to.  We both enjoyed the warm soothing comfort after our days out on the town.  The room itself (1615) was a bit underwhelming and I'd compare it to a Comfort Suites.   Just nothing exciting about it.   As mentioned in other posts, the roller coaster was near our room and was a bit noisy at times but nothing unsettling about it.  We were right next to the first drop so it was fun to watch as people began the first drop from 16 stories up.   

The casino was good and as slot jockeys we found a wide variety of games that we enjoyed.  I especially liked the two different Hangover  games they had.   We did spend a good amount of time in the casino and had fun which is what it's about.  Machines weren't bad for payouts so I wouldn't consider them tight.   

The New York theme of the resort, both inside and outside, is terrific.  I liked going for a stroll down the streets on the inside where you'll find a nice selection of themed restaurants and bars.   The scaled versions of New York landmarks are also impressive.   

The resort is on the south side of the strip and has easy access to other MGM resorts including the MGM Grand, Excalibur, Monte Carlo, and Luxor.  It's also a short distance from the airport.  

Service at the resort was good, Nuri at check-in was super friendly and helpful. The drink waitresses on the floor were always nice and pretty quick compared to other casinos.  Maid service was good.  We used room service twice once for dinner and once for breakfast.  Compared to other resorts around the country that we have stayed at, NY NY had reasonable prices and very quick service.

The only knock I can give this hotel is actually MGM wide.  They charge for parking both self-park and valet. However if you are Pearl Status, which we are, self-parking is free.  Gold status will get you free valet parking.   

All-in-all we had a nice stay at New York New York.

I'm giving NY NY 5 stars solely on Casino atmosphere. Even when we are not staying here we always seem to find our way back to this Casino & hangout for hours.  This time around we even found ourselves enjoying the Arcade. It's an easy walk to the MGM which is another plus. Definitely one of our favorites!

This review is for their deli they sell the best sandwhiches for a good price i would recommended to anybody that wants to try something new and fresh.



The casino itself its very clean employees are very helpful very good customer services

We recently stayed here meeting up with family for a long weekend.  It was a great place to stay because it did have quite a few things for kids to do.  The adults enjoyed gambling and the pool while the kids rode the roller coaster and hit up the arcade.  We also liked having great restaurants right there as well as a Starbucks.  Our only complaint was the bathroom which could be updated and have a fan.  We also had some issues with our TV but they did give us a discount because of that.  Overall, I think we'd stay here again if we brought kids.  Otherwise we may stay somewhere more centrally located.

Not bad. I was there just 1 night and I think is a nice hotel. Of course old fashion but is not so bad and have low price. Inside there several restaurants and the Irish Restaurant Galagher is really special.

The one star is generous. 
This poor poor excuse of a "resort". How dare you charge me a resort fee for wifi and other amenities when the internet NEVER worked, no coffee maker in the room, cable tv would digitize the picture to the point of making it unwatchable, and the rooms don't have a mini fridge. 
Sat at a slot machine for 40 minutes and never saw a cocktail waitress. I had to get up and pay for a luke warm Corona. 
Bartenders walked by us 3 times before we got up and left the bar. 
Wallpaper was peeling off our hotel room wall.
In the sports book, the chair I was sitting in looked like it had been chewed on by a dog. The stuffing was coming out of it. 
The players club perks are a joke. After gambling over 2000.00 we only earned 2.50 in resort credits!!! Man is that a perk or what?? This place stunk!!! Too many other places to stay in vegas that are much nicer and just a bit pricier.

We were very happy with our 3-night stay here.  Hotel was clean, and it was definitely less smokey than alot of the other hotels on the strip.  Rooms and casino were clean and the room was actually REALLY quiet, maybe because it was off-season in February, but we never heard anyone else being obnoxious in the halls or surrounding rooms at all.  We had a charge from a restaurant on our room that was not ours and I went to the front desk at checkout and they took it off no questions asked.  We will definitely be staying here again.

We're locals, and we went here for a couple's night out. This was our first night on the strip, even though we've lived here for a year now. First off, this is a huge hotel, so get ready to walk. You'll find that most people adopt casual wear for their strip experience, although some do prefer to dress up (think boobs and mini skirts). INSIDER TIP: Locals always are casual. We rarely buy into the movie version of what Las Vegas should be. NYNY should be commended on their staff\/service ethic. Excellent service started at check-in, and we never had bad service at all. Wait staff were kind, shop staff were kind...staff make the Strip Experience, and NYNY knew how to make us feel welcome. If you go there, take in the live music at the Irish pub, along with the traditional Irish dancing...what a treat. Get there early, by at least 8:45PM, so that you'll have a seat when the music starts at 9PM. The reason I didn't give it 5 stars was due to the lack of proper air in the hotel room. The room itself was very clean, but we sweated all during the night. And we're locals who are used to this weather. If I stayed at NYNY again, I think I'd stay during the Fall\/Winter, when the air could actually handle the load. Other than that, a great experience.
The food is wonderful.  We loved all the action, the crowd and activities apcked into an easy to find location.

Me and my partner stay'd here for are one year Anniversary the standard Park Ave. Room was clean and very nice looking. Currently a Mlife member we had a little problem when I checked-In the front desk didn't know I had a $50 Food & Beverage credit so it took a while to check in. On the day we checked out my partner mentioned to me that if you don't use the whole $50 food and beverage credit that they will take your $20 resort credit off. So we walked over to the Mlife Player card location the lady there told us that we needed to over to the front-desk to have them remove are $20 resort credit I'm not sure why the Mlife person couldn't just do it for us because I told her that I booked the room with them she wasn't that helpful. The food at the American Restaurant for breakfast  pancakes were tasteless and dry.

No amazing treatment for me, but I still had a great time at NYNY. Booked for the weekend of 4th of July during their 20% off sale awhile back. Room was decent sized with a view of the roller coaster. Bathroom is a little hard to manage with 4 people. Would have liked to see the sink OUTside of the toilet\/shower. Housekeeping was super nice - although we didn't request their service during our stay, when they saw us in the hallway they offered supplies of shampoo, soap and towels!

Additional facilities at the gym\/spa was AMAZING. I'm not really talking about the equipment, although they had a nice variety for bulking and toning, I'm talking about their facilities for when you're done exercising! The girls side had the sauna, showers, etc (there were some tubs, but it all had reserved signs). The sinks had a variety of make up removers, hair ties, face scrub, face wash, everything I was afraid to bring on the plane I found here. My bf told me they have a full on Jacuzzi on the mens side.   

The main highlight of NYNY was the awesome awesome waitress at the penny slots near Rok. Her name is Won, Yes as in winning! She was amazing at making the rounds super fast and ensuring that we always had a heavily dosed drink (or two) in hand. Tip her well and she'll take care of you!

Restaurants at the NYNY are also quite yummy. We especially enjoyed the Nine Fine Irishmen for their lamb burger special at the time and the Guinness chocolate float! Il Fornaio was a decent place to grab breakfast, especially since during our stay we could get 2 for 1 entrees. 

The rollercoaster was fun! Helps that they also had a 2 for 1 deal going on. 

Check out was easy, even at our midnight leaving time. Called and left a message. Then called the receptionist for the airport shuttle. Forgot the name of the company, but they sent a limo! What a way to end Vegas!

So overall, had a fabulous time staying at the NYNY. Would not hesitate to stay here again. But the bf wants to explore the other hotels for our next trip to Vegas!

What was once 3 stars is now 2. It's the natural evolution of hotels I guess. New York New York Hotel and Casino is only 15 years old, but it looks 25 now with worn carpet, furniture, and matching down-trodden atmosphere. I've had some of my best casino wins at New York-New York, but don't feel drawn back despite generous player perks.

Once you've stayed at a few of the nicer hotels in Las Vegas, it is hard to go back to normal-size rooms, motel furniture, and basic amenities. Even so, I don't hate New York New York Hotel. It is what is has become. A lower priced hotel option with plenty of $10 tables to work your gambling magic. It is convenient to MGM and most other places on the strip. 


If you're looking for a "reasonable hotel with a cool theme" for a first visit to Vegas, then New York New York may be a great choice. It also is probably a decent option for families since kids can hit the arcade, food court, and roller coaster on their own. Otherwise, if you are a Vegas regular, foodie, or have the $$$ to spend on something nicer then you can find better hotels in LV than NY-NY.

I did not stay at the New York New York, so I cannot speak for the rooms.  We stayed at the Aria, but went to the New York New York casino 3 different times during our trip!

We first stopped in just to look, and then were instantly sucked in by the pizza right by the front door. It was SO GOOD. Maybe it was the serious hunger that was taking over our group at that point, but it was delicious. 

The casino here was excellent.  While stuffing our faces with pizza, we noticed the "$5 Blackjack, All Day, Every Day" sign.  Blackjack was our game, and we couldn't believe that $5 tables existed.  ALL DAY.  We noticed that many other hotels began the morning with minimums at $10, then raised them during the day.

I wanted to write this review to specifically thank the manager that assisted us that day (June 21st).  The casino was busy, and we were walking around aimlessly for the $5 tables. We stopped to ask someone to direct us to the area where these tables were. We assumed we were going to get a quick point in a direction, but that we did not.  A manager (I'm sorry if that's not what they are called- the ones in suits who stand behind the dealers is who I'm talking about!) took the time to walk us ALL THE WAY over to the tables.  He engaged us in conversation the whole way over, and when we got to the tables he discovered that there was not 4 open seats for us to all play together.  He made his way over to an open table, a $15 blackjack table, and had the dealer let us all play for $5!  I was amazed at how kind this man was to us.  I did not catch is name unfortunately, but he was a shorter man who was bald and wore glasses! When there are plenty of gamblers spending WAY more money than we were, we were so impressed to receive this kind of service.

Next time we are back in Vegas, I will be sure to visit the New York New York again! (And hopefully win some more on those $5 tables!)   Thank you for the wonderful experience!

The room was small, but clean and they took a lot of walking to get to from the elvator. Bathroom was nice and clean as well. The theme itself isn't bad, it felt more targeted to the under 30 crowd and families. Has a floor of arcade games and attractions and a roller coaster, but not as kiddish as circus circus or Excalibur. 

 NYNY lacks any decent shopping, and it's the only hotel on the strip with no buffet (which i don't care about since I went to the bellagio one). It's too far on the side of the strip, and not the good side. Honestly if you're staying in Vegas for 1 or two nights I'd rather just get the cheapest room possible and spend the money elsewhere, since really you will only be sleeping there. I probably complaining because we paid too much for memorial day weekend, it wasn't a bad expereience nor was it great - just not worth the money. IMO if you want to stay at a decent hotel I'd spend a little more OR suck it up and spend a lot less on sleeping and more on fun!
Nice Rooms, good food options....would stay again. The in room dining special New York Strip Steak & Crab with Salad & Rolls $15 killer deal

Came back after 2 years and still love this hotel to spend new years eve on... only now 4 stars since 2 years ago the bridge bash new years eve party was free and now cost 150 dollars... OK it would've been open bar but when you have to pay for a 4 hour open air party people with non large budgets are not going to enter... we saw the party from the distance and we were glad not to have payed for it since the growed and atmosfeer  seemed boring.. 2 years ago when it was free it was a multi racial party like how you would experience it being in a Bronx club... now it seemed uptight with high class people.. not what I was expecting from the new York new York hotel... it would've been better to keep things the way it was. So inside in the middle of the casino was a free party with the same crazy ass people that were at that free bash party 2 years ago with also good priced drinks (mix drinks 10 bugs for new years is totally cool) we had a blast and it was great.. also we stayed at the hotel 2 nights this time since we had my Vegas loyalty points from the game myvegas and it was cool. Nice rooms all good!! Only no smokers rooms anymore which was a bummer for us smokers but can't have everything aight??!!

I am a local but I have been here on several occasions for different reasons with different groups of people. Rooms are decent and clean. Everyone who I've come into contact with that works here is helpful and friendly. I absolutely love the show zumanity!  have been twice and would love to go again. It's such an entertaining and beautifully done show. But be aware it is a very sexual show so if that makes you uncomfortable maybe not for you. Love the little duplicate New York downtown was fun showing my niece, and of course she loved the arcade and candy stores. The center bar is a nice chill area to grab a drink, and of course you have the new t mobile arena right by which has brought new life to the NYNY. One negative I will say the pool here needs a facelift stat! Also with the new paid parking which stinks there was a long line to just get into the parking lot.

I love this hotel. I have stayed here twice and hope to stay again. The hotel has great food. This place has the best junk food ever!!!!!!!!!! There is pizza until three AM. They have a great Italian place. The staff everywhere was all so friendly from check in, to the casino, food etc.  The rooms were perfect, clean and I liked that they met our request to have rooms close to each other. We requested on the Internet to have adjoining rooms or rooms near each other.  When we arrived they had us booked in adjoining rooms. Also it was no problem getting the rooms cleaned after  five PM in the daytime because we slept so late. I may be a bit biased because I love the real NY NY more than any place in this world and even thought the hotel is really nothing like it, I still would rather stay in a fake NY than anywhere else if I can't get to the real thing. There is only a couple reasons I didn't give this place five stars instead of four.

Charging to sit down at the piano bar? The guy at the door said we could go in but we had to pay if we sat down. Lame. I don't understand charging a cover when we are already going to purchase the over priced drinks. I didn't go in because I did not want to pay for drinks and a cover charge. Lame!

The TV has very few channels. Yeah I know Vegas is a party place but  I still like to enjoy being away and having a nice relaxing hotel room to rest in, and along with that I like a TV with lots of cable channels.  It was clear from the lack of TV, the idea is to keep you out of the room not in it, so you can spend your money downstairs.

Overall, I loved this hotel and I will come back.

A few years back, the wife and I came to see Zumanity, located in a theater inside the New York-New York Hotel & Casino.   Walking through the make-believe streets of Big Apple, I thought it'd be a cool hotel to stay at.

A few weeks back, my wife suggested she'd love to celebrate her birthday in Vegas so I got online and booked us a room for a couple of nights at this hotel.   It coinciding with CES, the rate wasn't cheap... $169 a night or thereabouts, but Planet Hollywood or Paris were even more expensive, so I figured this would be a good time to try the NY-NY.

Let's just say that the room we got for that price was absolutely tragic.   Yeah, it had a King size bed, but no, it wasn't a Cal-King, and let's just say that after the bed was placed in the room, it left very little room for you to walk around.  The TV is still good ol' Cathode Ray Tube, Pay-per-View does *not* give you the ability to pause or rewind your film.  The bathroom was actually pretty decent, but let's just say the Paris and Planet Hollywood both put this hotel to shame.

As for the casino, it was nice to see $10 blackjack tables.  I'm not sure if that's a result of the economy crash-and-burning, but it was refreshing to see minimum bets go back down to reasonable levels.   The drinks, though, were a complete fucking joke.  $14 for a Ketel One and Red Bull at the bar, and I ain't talking a double or stiff drink.   This was pretty much a 1-shot drink.   I had the same drink at the Venetian and, while it cost me $15, it was poured in a 16-oz glass and had a stiff shot and a half, if not 2.   Compare that to a minuscule 8-oz glass at the NY-NY.

While the Nine Fine Irishmen was a nice Irish Pub, and of course the America Diner provided much needed simple carbs at 3 AM to soak up all that excess alcohol, I must say I was not impressed with the NY-NY at all.   I don't plan on coming back here anytime soon, that's for sure.
Didn't stay at this hotel, but it was sooo cute.  Love the many food choices and wow, had the best chicken burger ever.

So, we stayed at New York New York in one of the spa deluxe suites in January 2008 and the whole time I was really wishing we had stayed at theWynn as originally planned. We had originally planned to stay at the Wynn however I thought that possibly the SUITE at New York New York would be more fun and just as nice plus I was excited about the Jacuzzi tub in our room, WRONG! I will list the reasons why I didn't like New York New York. The employee's are rude! I work in a large bank and know what customer service is and I can promise you that these people do not know what it is! If you want to be treated like a New Yorker, with Yes and NO answers and no warmth and friendliness stay here.

1. The roller coaster is loud and has fake screams, even if there is no one on the thing they still run it and the fake screams still sound. The damn thing starts running at like 9am and goes until 11pm. 

2. New York New York is way at the end off the strip and not near a whole lot of excitement which means you either get on the bus (the Deuce) or take the Tram or walk all the way down the strip. Let me tell you about the Deuce, that thing is slow and the people getting on are all of course tourists and are all confused on how the damn thing works which slows the thing down more, they stop every dang block! Grrr! 

3. The hotel is kind of old compared too many of the other hotels along the strip and could use some TLC. 

4. Even in the Suites you have no amenities, no coffee maker, no microwave, no small fridge or mini bar? What the! Yes, I know it is so Ill go downstairs and pay $5.00 on a cup of coffee. 

5. Our room had a view of the roof and a parking garage! How Romantic is that? Umm, we were on the 5th freaking floor and in a suite and got a view of a roof? Please!!!  

Ok, I'm done ranting... I will stop complaining now. If you are not looking for luxury and or customer service you may like staying here.

This is one of the many MGM-Mirage properties on the strip.  The casino and hotel staff are all welcoming and friendly.   The casino floor and selection of shops and eateries is  decent and complete.

The casino floor and shops are all looking very nice with the New York theme design and  layout (Obviously very well maintained). The hotel rooms, however, are starting to look a little dated and might be due for updating (My room had a tube TV, which seems like a ancient relic now in 2009 - especially for a large, reputable, mid-strip property).

I've never been to Las Vegas. I travel every weekend and I was running out of local destinations so decided to drive to LV. The hotel choices were  overwhelming but I read lots of reviews online for different places and decided to stay here. We do Hilton everywhere else we go because it's consistent. We get the same  excellent experience every time. I was trying to be in the Vegas spirit but I made a huge mistake. First I make the reservation online. I ask for a crib in the special requests section. We arrive, check in, and ask to ensure we got our crib. We get to our room and it's between 4 and 5am so we want to go to sleep. 30 min later no crib so I call downstairs and ask what's going on. I'm told my crib will be right up. The crib never came. I fall asleep and my special needs child has to sleep on the floor because she will roll off the bed. I wake up to discover there's no coffee machine in the room. Seriously? I stayed in a cabin in Big Sur with no TV or phone that had a coffee maker. The toiletries online are referred to as 'designer'. They're GARBAGE! There are no available outlets near the bed to plug in your phone charger. I can't believe I'm saying this but I truly believe we'd be more comfortable at a Motel 6. I wanted to leave after 1 night but I paid for 4 days. This stuff is BASIC.

We pulled in at 2am and all they had left were smoking rooms. My friend was tired so we decided not to shop around...

The front desk lady was pleasant and offered to change our room if it was too smoky. The room is pretty nice I guess... Big tv, nice view... I expected more but then again it was my first time in Vegas. I thought the hotels were supposed to be nicer\/fancier. 

The valet\/luggage service was pretty swift and they got our bags up to the room shortly after we got situated. We ended up going downstairs to their restaurant (American?) and I had a 3AM steak dinner and a lovely cocktail aptly named "all-nighter". The service and the food were both good and I left a happy camper. I shouldn't have stayed downstairs to gamble (only getting about 2 hrs of sleep) but hey, when in Vegas...

This place was just amazing! Ppl at the register desk were beyond helpful and so nice! I booked thru facebook and receieved a 50 credit which came in hella handy! Who doesnt like perks! Will be back for future stays for sure. Center Bar has great bartenders. Thanks to eveyone for making our stay wonderful

We didn't stay here, but went and gambled a few times and had lunch here! We are from the NY- Tristate area and think they NAILED it with decor. They set up NYNY like the suburbs of NY and did a killer job! Coney Island with the coaster and rides, staten island with the killer subs and delis and just everything else was really great. We ate at one of the deli's which was incredible. Hugest portions ever - enough to feed two.
The casino was dope. super clean, bright and a large selection of tables and slots! Go check it out, ESP if you've never been to NYC before because you totally feel like you're there !!

New York New York" isn't quite the class act it was a few years ago, but it's hard to get bored here. The food, the shows, the $10 gambling tables... elbows up, chin out, gut on the floor... more for slobs than Gatsbys. #maturity

I've stayed at this hotel many many times and I have always loved it. The rooms are nice and comfortable. All the variety of yummy foods is wonderful. This hotel to me has so much to give. It's great for kids also, it has a roller coaster and large arcade. I would recommend this hotel.

This is a nice hotel to check out as they have area designed as if you were walking on the streets of NY and they have dining options on that street from quick bites to upscale restaurant depending on what you want to pay and eat.

I went to eat their on my first night and tried The original Fulton Fish Frye... it was quite good and easy on the pocket. Plus the experience to be sitting on the streets on NY and eating Fish and Chips was quite good.

I have to tell you, I don't like Las Vegas a whole lot. I think the hotels always let you down, it's dirty AND people use it as an excuse to go nuts and dress slutty.

The room:
NY, NY, turned it all around. When we got there, we didn't like the set up of the room, so we asked for another one, but wanted to view it first to make sure it was OK (see headline, i like to complain).  So they let us view the other room, which we liked a WHOLE lot better. NICE
 
Room Service:
So later that night our friends came into town, we drank and needed munchies. The Room service made pizza for us even though it was after 2 am, extra chicken fingers AND they delivered free sodas = RAD.
Plus he told me Jay Z was staying in the hotel so that makes him RADDER.

The Pool: 
Yeah it was kind of small, but I wasnt there to be seen, just to relax. We had VIP service for the pool. Our own pool boy, our own floaties, free drinks and fruit and did I mention I had a pool boy to boss around? HAHAHA.

The Gambling:
The mister won a grand. Nuff said.

(i lost like $100, BOOOOOOOOOOO)

And another thing.... the towels were the worst I have ever seen in a hotel. This hotel is not inexpensive. The resort fee- which is such a scam but now you can't get away from in in Vegas, is 30.00 a day. This hotel is not really a "resort" destination. I won't stay there again. My sister's first visit to Vegas for her 60th birthday and we stayed at a bummer hotel. Next time the Mandalay or Venitian.

New York, NY is a nice casino that makes every effort to mirror the atmosphere of the real New York. They do a pretty good job of it, especially when it comes to food. There is a good variety of restaurants available in the "downtown", and upstairs, they offer a good selection of fast-food variants. Lots of character. I have been coming here for years and it never seems to disappoint.
The New York New York Hotel and Casino is one of a few hotels I like to stay at where I come to Vegas!!! Nice rooms and the front desk staff at checkin and out is really nice!!!

Every summer my husband and I drop our son off at camp and head for Vegas.  It's become a tradition and one we look forward to all year. We have been happy at Paris but for some reason I made the mistake of trying some place new this time.  Ugh.  The SMELL of the casino is AWFUL.  I don't mean cigarette smoke.  In fact I would have welcomed cigarette smoke because at least that's a normal Vegas smell.  This is an an overpowering stench of air freshener that you can literally smell from the sidewalk as you approach the building.  Actually it doesn't even deserve to be called air freshener.  It is a sickly sweet odor masker reminiscent of pet freshener thrown all over a wet dog bed.  Granted I am a little sensitive to smells but there was no denying how overpowering and nauseating it was.  My husband commented on it and he never complains about anything.

I don't know how anyone could eat at the restaurants in the casino, smelling that smell.  I got Starbucks and couldn't wait to take that outside.  

Unfortunately that completely cancelled out the rest of the positives for me.  But I will say, in fairness, that somehow they managed to keep that smell out of the hotel room itself.  I don't know how they pulled that off; that's an amazing feat.  And the room was clean and in good shape.  Room service was relatively prompt and friendly.  Asked for extra towels and they were nice about it.  The bed was comfortable.  So for all of these reasons I have to give them two stars in spite of the olfactory assault of the casino.

I stayed at NyNy for my birthday during labor day weekend. This was my first time staying here. The hotel was great and didn't smell like smoke like a lot of hotels in vegas do. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful starting with Miguel,  the guy who helped with my check in. He made my bday great by upgrading my room without me asking and wishing me a happy birthday. Next we had a really nice bellman bring our bags to the room and compliment us on bringing our own beer pong table to vegas. Then the house keeper brought me up a bday card and chocolate bar from the hotel. The room was amazing and the bed was divine. The pool was great especially since it was so hot. And coyote ugly was a great bar to dance the night away in. I will definitely stay at the hotel again. Thanks NYNY.

Great entertainment at NYNY.  The gambling pit is awesome and lively, and their minimums won't gouge you.  It is home to a genuine Shake Shack (NYers will be pleased to hear this) as well as future home to Halal Guys' famous chicken and rice.  If you are feeling adventurous, there is also a rollercoaster for you adrenaline junkies above the hotel.  Prime location and  great architecture on all the hotel rooms.

My review is not for the rooms @ NYNY. It is for the Casino floor and surrounding food area only! 

OMG - the attention to detail in this place is freaking awesome! They even have a unpaid parking meter and grafiti on the walls to bring the whole NYC experience down to Las Vegas - one city that never sleeps to another! 

We ate @ the Broadway Burger on Greenwich Village and I tell you, I am a fan for life. I am never going back to LV without having one of those 3.99 burgers. I would say - go inside NYNY once and have a look around - it might not be the hotel for you but the casino's interior decorator deserves a round of applause!

Only in Vegas, can you have France, Italy, Africa and seemingly every other theme.  So why not place a hotel which highlights the civilty of The Big Apple...Thats right...Place the city which never sleeps, in a town, which frowns on resting...add some gambling, booze, shows,  food and you have yourself a casino

I like NY, NY, especially since Vegas is so under capacity, its darn cheap to stay really in any casino.  The benefit to this casino is location, its reasonable minimums and pedestrian, yet enjoyable food....

Rooms, service and amenities are on par with the rest of the other themes
Our room was clean. Price was fair and the smoke smell was at minimal. Can't ask for too much more in a Las Vegas hotel room.

I'm going to admit it -- I'm not a huge Vegas fan, though with Fix, the Bellagio fountains, Star Trek Experience, and a few other things, I would definitely go again.

This hotel is the place to be.  It's got fun and whimsical theming, and they constantly are e-mailing me with specials for $79\/night, Sunday-Thursday.  Works for me.

The interior is lots of fun and I really, truly enjoyed the experience.  I don't think I'll stay at anything older than this place, because now I'm spoiled! ;)

Stayed in the spa suite! So worth it! The room was HUGE and the spa was a good size! My Only reason for taking away a star is the water in the shower took 15 minutes to get warm. And also, the view is of the parking structure. You'd think with a high paid suite like this you'd get a better view. Either way, I loved it

September 2016: my first time back in Vegas since 2005. After 11 years I was expecting a different place that wasn't nearly as fresh, new and clean.
I was wrong, The New York New York was like an archaeological finding that was left exactly the same as when you buried it. You open up the Time Capsule and it's still glistening Lights wonderful customer service, clean and classy. 
The best hotel in Vegas, hands down.

We have had so much fun here. The rooms are nice and clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. There is so much to see in this hotel not to mention surrounding areas.  We ate at the America and the food was excellent.  The tram is available to help you get around.  We also had a massage at the spa and it was well worth the price. Their staff is friendly and very good at what they do would go again.

These people are deceiving & cheats! They promise you certain deals then do not honor them. We had to spend our limited time by going to the front desk 3 times to fight for all their hidden charges. Read the fine print!!! They deny they ever said things! Record them if you go here, we will never stay here again!

Booked their Marquis Suite room, for the in-room jacuzzi, which was fine.  While the room itself was spacious and quiet, it looked quite dated.  Overall disappointed in the hotel class- I guess my fault for thinking it is higher than it is.  Smoky casino \/ lobby area.

One and done.

I want to give it 5 stars but they really hurt themselves. When we showed up Sunday the check in was smooth but then we were alerted the elevators were down and that we had to wait for a single elevator to take us up, I wasn't too upset the first time but that happened again two different times and it going really old. My girlfriend missed an online meeting one day because it took her 30 minutes to get up stairs to our room from the casino. Also being 22 I was stopped by some type of security guard saying that I wasn't supposed to be in the stairs and saying I wasn't a guest here and when k said the elevators were down so I just took the stair instead he told me they weren't down and that I was wrong and asked to see my room key. Otherwise though the location is good the food was good and it was a great time in Vegas!

We came to celebrate my niece's 21 bday. We had a blast. The hotel is family friendly and has everything you need. Pool is great..3 1\/2 feet to 4 1\/2 feet. Ashely by the pool was always friendly and great service. We only drank one day at the pool and the service was the same. So she is down to earth and there to make sure you're having a good time  hope to come back soon

One of my favorite MGM properties.

I haven't stayed at NYNY since 5 years ago, so I can't really say anything about the rooms, but I love this hotel for the feel and for the main public area and the restaurants!

First off, my favorite steakhouse anywhere is Gallahger's.  It's is the same Gallahger's as the one in NY and when dining inside, it does feel like a NY steakhouse.  It's not the fanciest, yes, but it is just good steak.  There's a display fridge showing you how they dry age their beef and shows you that's exactly what they serve!

There's also plenty of other eateries that's legit.  It's overpriced, especially for pizza, but having a pretty authentic NY pizza at 2am in the morning is awesome.  Also others that's a little more "fast-food-ish" but they all have something to do with NY.

Lots of bars, such as the Irish pub\/piano bar.  It gets packed on the weekend and the crowd is a little older, but the pub does offer a good Guiness on draft.  Probably due to the crowd and moving through kegs faster, it just tastes fresher, or maybe it is the psychological effect :P

One thing is that the casino floor is a little dark and a little random for me in terms of the placement but it's still "new" enough compared to some of the other hotels on the strip!

As a themed hotel, it does a pretty good job in presentation, albeit corny, but c'mon, can't expect real NY in Vegas!

Upgraded from Park Avenue room to Broadway Suite, for $15 a night. Worth every penny and more!

What a room, not that fancy (compared to Wynn, at least) but WHAT A VIEW!!! Floor to ceiling windows all around the room, really amazing.

And the other thing I just fell in love with was the VIP elevator, everyone else waiting in line to get into the "normal" elevator and us just cutting in line to use our own, score! Just 4-5 rooms per floor.... did I say S-C-O-R-E?!

Love the location, walking distance to my fav hotel - MGM.
And love the drinks at Coyote Ugly and the Beer at Pour 24.

Things didn't start out so well but they did improve.    Upon arrival we were told that though we reserved a non-smoking room none were available.  We had to upgrade rooms to get a non-smoking.  The room we received was really nice but nowhere near the elevator as promised.  I spoke to a manager the next morning and had the upgrade charges removed and enjoyed the remainder of our stay.

The casino part is super cool, along with the decor and zumanity. Nine fine Irishmen is a super fun pub with love music. The actually hotel part, not so great. The pool has been closed for 3 days, and not 20 minutes ago we went to pick up our bag from the bell desk (leaving today), and after we noticed pool is finally open (either that or they have weird hours)!!! AND, then, they wouldn't let us in with our bag!!!! I told the attendant we've waited 15 min to put our bag up this morning, another to get it so we aren't going to go through it again. So upset after three days we could t relax there for the remaining 30 minuteS we have left in this hotel. After not getting the requested single bed (got a 2 doubles, no availability to switch which I thought was a joke), and the bathroom was totally run down with a shower head that stung like millions of needles, my husband and I will visit the casino but we won't be staying at the hotel ever again.

To start cocktail service in the casino is crap! By comparison Mandalay bay, their sister property is amazing! Rooms are OK, beds uncomfortable and shower tight. Down stairs in NYC restaurant area had nice atmosphere, service there was better. Slots were tight, compared to Mandalay bay.. Over all Mandalay bay their sister hotel is a much better value. More bang for your buck!

So I received an email offer for free room comp.  I call to schedule a visit and I encounter a rude woman who basically lectured me on the amount of expected gambling during my upcoming visit.  I was taken back by her rudeness as she next asks if I can meet that expectation.  Wow! So I tell her this is new information and she then tells me to call back tomorrow to schedule the visit; that she is not comfortable booking my visit at this time.  What a shame.  Little does she know that I brought a group of ten with me during our last visit and this information doesn't show up on my players card either!

Hey, this is a good enough place to stay if you plan to primarily use your room for resting only.  I love it because of its proximity to CVS and McDonald's for those times when I am not in the mood to spend $10 for a bottle of water or $20 for a snack.  We usually go to CVS, and stock our room with a case of water, whiskey, Coke and healthy snacks.  If you want to eat in the hotel, there is a Nathan's, traditional diner, and a Starbucks with prices on par with New York City proper.

Depending on the time of year and your package, WiFi may be included but if not, prepare to possibly have to pay an additional $10-$20 a day. Weekends are sometimes 3 times more expensive than weekdays but that applies to all of the hotels\/casinos on the strip.

The location on the strip is convenient for walking to the other popular attractions and on the bus line which will take you straight down the main drag to the mall with a Nordstrom.

I didn't stay at this hotel but did gamble here.  I had a good time, won a couple hundred bucks so I was happy.  

It did take forever to get drinks but I guess thats how it goes.  I'm not gonna hate cuz it took a while to get my drinks.

The roller coaster is awesome.  I didn't ride it this last trip but when I did I had so much fun.  I can't wait to go back.  Maybe I'll stay here and see how the rooms are.
Not safe to stay, no cameras to the hallways.....so you do not know who will attempt to enter into your room. It was June 2016 when we check in to this hotel and some of the valuables were stolen.
Terrible, we've stayed at other MGM resorts and they were all better (regardless of price) than this one.

It was an okay hotel. We checked in and ran to the car. I had plugged in my converter (charger) and came back to the room and it was missing!! We called downstairs and they were going to look for it. I was worried so I called to double check and the manager Margaret Chan started to yell at me saying that it would take longer than 5 minutes. I was bothered because my belonging went missing after check in then I got yelled at for asking about it. We also had a coupon code that was suppose to include 2 free roller coaster rides and they refused to honor it even after I gave them the code again. The housekeeping staff, the valet, and the bellhop were amazing. I don't know that I would stay here again. I feel like they took advantage of us. The location isn't bad and try the cronuts at the donut shop.
Worst service ever.....or shall I say "Can never get service here." Where are all the drink waitresses???

Fachada espectacular, decoración interior como el verdadero NY.
El personal súoer amable y dispuesto para atenderte en todo.
La suite, como que necesita una manita de gato, sobre todo, el baño. Un poco pasado de moda; el mármol parece sacado de un mausoleo.
La ubicación de este resort es inmejorable, lejos del ruido, y cerca (a pie) de los mejores hoteles de Vegas.
Buen precio y buena experiencia. Altamente recomendable.
One of mine and my wifes favorite places on the strip. Many games and places to eat inside many good shows going on all the time fun place.

One of my faves on the strip. I love everything about this casino. Everything from  the options of food to all the bars to the new Hershey Chocolate World! If you have never been here its definitely a place to stop at. Even the arcade, I am a big kid when I am here. I love the pin ball machines :)
Had a good time at this place I feel it was located in a good spot for us Game tables where good and food options where great

Only worth coming to see if you want to ride the rollercoster.  I mean I am sure the average tourist wants to see this place,, UMM hello I did!  I certainly would not stay here.  It felt cheap and seemed dirty. I felt like at any moment Snow White would walk around the corner just returning from her smoke break. I wish I could "heart" this NY, but my heart is with the real deal.

Stayed here with my girl for her birthday. Excellent vibe but restaurants, cafés and bars and extremely experience. I spent $35 bucks for 2 sandwiches and 2 lattes at the Starbucks. Casino was very weak. Spent $500 on slots between myself and my girl and didn't rake anything in. I think our largest win was $25. Low rating for slots being so tight, and lack of good restaurants at decent price points. Also lacks a buffet, which really should be the norm at an upscale Vegas hotel.

Never stayed here, but I always play here, and NY NY is always good to me. The dealers are always super nice, friendly and will actually talk to you. I want to keep the good juju coming, so I always make it a point to stop here while I am in Vegas to play a couple hands of Blackjack. Plus right on the outside they have Shake Shack and I will always stop there for some burgers!! Keep it up NY NY and you will have a life long customer!

We arrived at 2pm and were told no rooms were available until about 5pm. Some of us got rooms around 5pm, others had to wait until ~7pm. My room was pretty dirty: smudges, grime, ages of dust in corners etc. I didn't find signs of bed bugs, so that's good.

I always like NY NY every time when I visit LV. I was excited to stay in NY NY this time to attend friends' wedding during the busiest weekend because of CES. 

The service at the front desk was pretty good. However, the service on phone was bad. When we asked can we call valet from the room to pick up the car, the lady said she didn't know if it's ok or not. The lady didn't wait for me to finish the conversation and just hung up directly. 

The room "Broadway Deluxe" was old, and not come with the ipod play which shown on the amenity list. Therefore, we decided to stay in "Park Avenue Deluxe", it was small, but newer. The last night we upgraded to SPA suite, it was good. However, all the rooms we stay, they didn't come with coffee pot or kettle, and when I called the room service, they told me they don't provide any coffee pot or kettle. If I asked for hot water, they charge it. My boyfriend got down stairs to buy a cup of cafe, and he got me hot water for free! 

The last thing I was not happy about is that they charge for Internet. I can understand everything costs money in LV. However, who wants to stay in hotel room and surf online? I just want to get online and get some travel information and book tickets. Last time I came to LV with travel tour and stayed in Four Queens, and they had Internet for free! I thought it's the basic thing for business people or someone who always search online even when they come to LV. 

Overall, I still like NY NY, but I don't think I will stay here next time to LV.

It's showing its age.  The place smells of cigarette smoke and is need of a renovation. Most people don't really spend much time here. It's usually just a quick walk through for most visitors getting to and from the MGM Grand form other MGM Properties such as Mandalay Bay, Luxor or Excalibur. The roller coaster is still fun but a little rough. Still a good and fun place to visit.

This is a definite bookmark for those that have kids.  The arcade looks small from the outisde but when you enter through the hallway it proves to be formidable gaming facility.  Nathans hot dogs is located right next door to it so after the kids finish with the rollercoaster and games lunch is a few steps away.  The pool is however a little lacking.  I'm sure the rollercoaster makes up for it though.  I have not been to the coyote ugly bar but for a universal good time guys and girls (adults) my choice is the piano bar on the weekends.  Get there a little early and save your seats other wise there is a cover charge.

The beds: not so comfy

The Room service: Pizza at 2am? 3am? when they dint even make it then super cool

VIP Pool: AWESOME!!!!! we had one personal pool boy and like two other waiters
I had the best turkey club at the pool
I also got the best tan
We had floaties and drinks what more can we ask for
actually the whole service came with two buckets of an assortment of juices, fruit, waters and chips

I didn't really gamble but i will next time

they have a crispy creme doughnut shop here to be careful

Housekeeping kept wanting to bring me towels but honestly we were in Vegas for 40 hours and we had plenty:)

3 stars cause the bed was not comfy

Had reserved a spa suite, they ran out so upgraded my room to a marquee suite. Very very nice room, clean and spacious! Loved the jetted tub, the entertainment system, and especially the view of the Vegas strip! Could have used a coffee maker in the room but with all the shops conveniently located in the casino, wasn't a big deal at all.  Friendly staff at registration, bars, restaurants and shops, made our stay that much better!!

Flew in and stayed two evenings.  The GOOD lots of centralized restaurants, game tables, slots,  -  we played video poker mostly,  our kids played crap tables, too expensive and lost.       The BAD, we arrived at 4:30 PM waiting in line 20 minutes to find out our rooms were not ready yet - our bathrooms had dim lighting, no fridge in room.  We were issued two gaming rewards cards, but both were in my wife's name and I could not get any info on how to use them without her presence - I spent 45 minutes getting this fixed.   This was our 2nd and last time to New York NY.
I've never stayed here but visit every time and the staff is always really nice here. I can definitely see staying here by the kindness of the staff alone.

Wait times to check in are very long. 30-60 minutes. I then had to wait another hour in line when one of my room keys didn't work.

The room itself was quite outdated. The thermostat was so ancient you had to manually turn off the A\/C when it got too cold in the room. It was impossible to find a happy medium, so you were either sweating or freezing in the room overnight. They nickel and dime you to death for everything. $10 a night for parking. Mini fridge is $25 a night. Bath robes were something like $20 to rent for the room.

The spa in my suite was of decent quality though, and the price wasn't too bad during the week.

Their wait staff are in short supply as well, it took so long to get drinks here while gambling, even at table games, that I couldn't even get tipsy and the variety\/setup in their casino was lacking. I ended up going to other casinos to gamble and had a much better experience.

Stayed here for my 1st time in Vegas like 10 years ago, back then I was 13 and didn't have much to do. I remember hanging out by the pool and the roller coaster. This time we went in just to waste time and gamble before the NYE countdown. I loved walking by the dueling pianos, those bars are so cool in a nerdy way! And the hole in the wall hot dog shack, those hot dogs were huge! We saw a Michael Jackson impersonator do some cool moves and at midnight we were right in front of the Brooklyn Bridge. When we inquired about tickets, the vendor said it was  $170 each, that's kind of crazy... For free beads and you still had to buy your own drinks. View was just fine from the street, although I'm pretty sure I remember getting hit in the face by some beads (at least I got to keep them). At one point my drunken claustrophobia hit and I did start pushing, SORRY! It was still fun. And NYNY is right next to where we stayed, Monte Carlo.

We had always wanted to stay here, but I am very disappointed.  The room was very small, and I know your just there to sleep but I was just very unimpressed with the room.  Think I will stick to down town

Decor\/Location = OLD and dim.  :(   The location is good and close to a lot of things.  It is across from the M&M store.  Small casino area within hotel. 

Service = $13 Resort fee per day with the pool closed :)   what resort???

Food\/Drinks = The food court there is good.  It has better food selection than other places.  The Italian place and the fish & chip are awesome for the value :)

Value =  about $100 a night for the regular older room.

Kid Friendly = They have a tiny arcade for older kids.. not for the small fries.

Recommendation = I will go somewhere else next time.  :(

For people who left negative reviews about the extra fees assessed, that's every single hotel on the Vegas Strip.  Pipe down and head back over the best Western south of the airport.

What a great deal for a hotel on the "strip."  Sure it's maybe a 5 minute walk south of the absolute ideal location, but it has absolutely everything you need downstairs.  

Room is not excessive but not trashy.  Great if you're just looking for the Vegas experience with a decent room in a great location, without immediately leaving you broke and weeping (the casinos will take care of that for you).

Pool is nice, DJ was excellent.  Did I mention there's a roller coaster RIGHT AT THE CASINO?  And it's really cheap if you're staying there - BOGO baby!

If you're looking to ball out of control and need a super fancy room exactly in the center of the strip, this isn't it.  Personally, I loved it for the price and location and will likely stay here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

This review will be based on everything that I encountered during my stay at New York New York.  I will focus on the rooms, restaurants, slot play, table games, M Life desk service, front desk service, and much more.  

Front desk- I checked in at 2am, and the person who helped was not in the least bit happy.  It was clear he did not enjoy his job, and he would rather be doing a thousand other things, than to help me check into my room.  I asked him if he had any complimentary upgrades available.  Most helpful people I have encountered before have upgraded me, or at least attempted to upgrade me in any way.  He immediately shot me down, saying I would be lucky if I were to get a room right now.  What an ass hole.  He checked his system and seemed surprised that he found a room for me, like he had to do more than just scroll through the computer and magically find an empty room.  

The room was nice, but there was definitely no wow factor.  The view from the window consisted of pipes and ventilation systems equipment.  The room reminded me of Luxor rooms, which were dark and had no natural light.  However, the bathroom was modern and clean.  

There are quite a bit of restaurants located on the casino floor.  I dined at two, and overall was not satisfied.   (See my reviews on Il Fornaio bakery and Nine Fine Irishmen)  One lacked quality foods, while the other lacked good service.  

The slots at New York New York were on the tighter end.  For looser slots, I would head over to MGM or Monte Carlo.  The selection of slots were also less than that of other neighboring casinos.  No one seemed to be winning much here.  

The table games were good.  Everyone that sat down with me at the blackjack tables knew what they were doing.  The dealers were friendly, and quick in knowing how to count to 21.  (You won't believe how slow some dealers are elsewhere).  The only downside to the tables were the lack of attention from the pit bosses.  I would throw in my card countless times to get rated, and they would come by ten minutes after I had started playing.  

The service that I received at the M Life desk was disappointing.  No matter what time of day it was, the line was so long.  Redeeming myvegas rewards took an incredible amount of time, and definitely slowed the line for everyone.  

If my rooms weren't free, I would not stay here.  New York New York is in the middle of The Strip, and you just simply cannot beat that.

HOTEL STAY:
Enjoyed staying here with my family. Everything was fine! Food selection downstairs is great too.

CASINO:
(June 2016) HORRIBLE. Never gambling here again. When I just turned 21, decided to try NYNY out. I played at one or two blackjack tables and the dealers were incredibly rude and unhappy. Their vibes totally killed my vibe and I didn't have any fun. I wish I could take back my money and time I spent there. When I went home, I told my parents "I'm never gambling at NYNY again" and they immediately asked "the dealers huh?" :O they already knew! Then they told me "yea we never like gambling there, we always lose too." I wish they had warned me earlier.

My GF booked this place, and I thought it was just going to be a mediocre place. But it turned out to be pretty nice. The room was nicely decorated, and had a nice big Samsung Flat screen TV, and nice big TV consul \/ chest of drawers. I enjoyed that we were right on the strip, because I felt like there was always something to do, and it was never far away. It rained one night we were here, and it was nice to not have to go out in the rain. 
We really enjoyed our room. It was on the 10th floor, with an easterly view. I believe towards the strip. I could see the hooters casino from our room. 
We enjoyed going to the Greenberg deli (killer Ruben sandwich). As well as walking around the casino. 
In all I really enjoyed our stay here!

Was a pretty good hotel for getting it comped.  Just know that there is no fridge and NO COFFEE MAKER. They did have a safe which was nice. The water was very hard and I couldn't take my make up off very well at all. I had to scrub with a wash cloth and I only wear mineral powder makeup on my face. Other that those downers, the pizza and mexican food down stairs was good! America restaraunt was good, but they took a little long to make the food and it wasn't packed. Bed was comfy and bathroom was clean. I would stay again, but would bring a mini-coffee maker and some makeup remover.

Checked into the hotel around 11:00am. With MLife it was awesome. They even let us have our room early ... way early! Even though it is the Park Avenue; it's comfortable! Who stays in their room anyway. Jamie Lee @ the MLife reservation desk was great and so was the concierge. We booked an awesome 6-1 trip to he Grand Canyon without any trouble.
ホテル内にジェットコースターがあり、いつも乗ってみたい！と思いつつ、乗らない･･･。

New York, New York will always hold a special place in my heart because, well, it's New York. :) 

I'm a serious sucker for themed re-creations, and New York is Vegas' prime example. Their little downtown shops & restaurants, complete with phony upstairs apartment windows and fire escapes; their Coney Island;  their Brooklyn Bridge. Just charming.

I've stayed here before, and I'm definitely a fan. Prices are reasonable, and this hotel maintains a high level of quality, even though it's not brand new. The inside just sparkles - it's completely mesmerizing, and you can totally get into the NY vibe.

If you haven't checked this one out, it's a must visit. I love New York!

So much to say about this property! Recently remodeled, the rooms are quite decent and at a 4 star standard. As you can clearly see by walking around the entire property, they defiantly invested  into the renovation. Where they lack updating is with their systems. Obtaining a simple players card at the M-life desk takes at least 30 min. The elevators are all out of whack and I wasn't the only guest having the same issue. Certain floors require a key card to get to but if you place your key card near any credit card or your cell phone that key would no longer work. The biggest mess at this resort is all the signs! It's really just like New York, chaotic and confusing. They point you in wrong directions and some simply just need to  be taken down. Example: The sign in the elevators say health spa and pool access from the 3rd floor. Wrong! There is NO POOL access from the 3rd floor! By the conversation I had with the spa receptionist, they redirect guests all day long because of that elevator sign being wrong. Only one pool access point and that is from the main floor. Once you are at the pool, hope that it's not a windy day or you will blow out of there. The placement of the pool is the worst! Horrible architectural design and a major over look. Once that wind starts blowing there is nothing shielding the pool from all that force. It's a mess!  The 5 star quality about this resort would be its employees. They really take pride in their guess services! The feed back I got from them on this property  is more valuable than any review! When the employees are having the same frustrations as the guests it's a clear indication someone is not doing their job. I will not be returning to this property at all. A complete mess. If the New York cluster vibe is what they where going for they defiantly succeeded there!

Just checked here and the check in process is messed up. We were told our room was not ready and to call a number and they will assign one when one is available. We then called the number several times in the next 2 hours and still no room? Another one of our traveling partners checks right in and gets the same room right away? What's up with that? We finalky get a room after contacting manager who was un professional. Management was less than helpful and non customer service oriented. We will see how the rest of the stay goes? Very dissapointed so far.

One star because it takes forever and a day when we request for something. The request for the crib took two calls. The request for someone to come help us with our room card took.... Well, no one ever came so we juggled the door for thirty minutes. We brought our baby and the room smelled like cigarettes and weed the entire time.

We still have not received any responses. Lol. Smh.

I'm in the casino right now at the craps table and three different servers walked by me. I tried to ask for a water and they just cut me off, said they'd be back, and never returned. The service here is beyond rude. They are losing my business forever as I write this. Do not bother wasting your time here. They obviously don't care if you're here or not.

I went here 2 times with my friend to ride the roller coaster. Both times, FAIL due to rain. They shut down the ride when the weather isn't so cooperative. Whatever. 

Went down to get a drink. 
Me: Hey man, let me get 2 waters, and 2 long islands, and a patron shot. 
Bartender: Say please. (And no he wasn't joking, nor it was funny). 
Me: I love the minimum wage attitude but how about our drinks. 

And that was all I could stand from NY NY. Screw this place. Wouldn't EVER stay here just based on my 2 BAD experience. Wont be a 3rd. Especially when Vegas has options coming out the hizza! 

You're probably pondering... why 2 stars then Mr. John Tucker?! Well, I'll tell you why... I met some really GREAT people here. And I loves my people. 

Oh and you gotta pay $0.50 for a small locker. Rides are $15.00\/person. *subject to change* Ha! 

Hope you have a better luck than I did.

This is definitely one of my favorite casinos!  Ahm..there's a roller coaster that goes through the casino..come on what else can you ask for!  There's tons of little restaurants that looks like a little New York street!!  We ate at a New York Deli that was awesome!  Pretty expensive..but, everywhere in Vegas is!  I just love the whole layout of this casino..and I love the fact it was right across the street from my hotel The Tropicana with very easy access from all the bridges!
We were in NY NY for dinner, and passed thru the casino.  Guess I am not a fan of the city, and this is modeled after that ... so ... meh.

Great place if you don't want to actually stay in a room.  The rooler coaster is way fun, the design of the building and casino is great and the location is perfect.  Just the rooms suck.  I stayed at a suite here one time and it was a complete disaster.  Go for lunch, gamble, ride the coaster - then leave...

I didn't stay here, but my bf and I came by to hang out and humble a bit! This place was bumpin!! They had the best music at the center bar!! Also at one point, there was a Michael Jackson impersonator, he was AWESOME!!!!! Makes you wish, you had a chance to see the real thing in concert! The only thing about this hotel that I would change, would be that there was more then 1 restaurant, that was a nice restaurant, to be open longer at night. There was only a steak house open and I really wanted something else, oh well. We'll be back, so fun!!
What a dump! The rooms are small and in need of a facelift.  Shocked that they now charge for parking.  And one of the bars demands a cover, I'll stay home thanks

One of the bigger themed casinos on The Strip. Never slept here, only ate and played here. And of course: the rollercoaster. Not my experience. I just watch. Believe me, better for everyone. I would have screamed whole of Vegas together.

What I like about New York New York is:
- The Bar at Times Square (duelling pianos, great atmosphere)
- The Italian Bakery

Perfect, spotless toilets. Also important.

This year I saw that they face lifted the exterior on The Strip side. Looks better. More like a promenade. Not yet European, but better than before.

Happened to stay here a total of 2 nights for a Bachelorette weekend (not by my choice). Was really dreading it, thinking of how old the property is. 

Turns out, they've done a half way decent job of doing some small renovations here and there in the public space that make it feel a little less outdated; but there are some pros and cons: 

Pros: 
-Good selection of restaurants from a cultural and price stand point. Loved me some cheddar burger at the Irish Joint and the NY Style Pizza was FAB. 
-Pool has a DJ 
-Cute theming carried out throughout the property. Loved the middle section with the cobblestone and big signs. 
-Roller coaster! 
-Couldn't hear our neighbors on either side.

Cons: 
-Bad pool scene. Where did all the white trash float in from? I saw several people smoking in the pool and then ashing in it, having adult-like relations, letting unattended kids swim about, plus they rent out the cabanas (for $400 a day, mind you) and each cabana gets it's own sound system. Kind of defeats the purpose of having a DJ if you're sitting next to a cabana that is BLARING country music! Not enough chairs either. 
-Standard rooms are circa 1997. I swear, the bathroom fixtures, purple leather & leopard chair and blush colored wall paper must be originals. The comforters also looked to be showing some age. 
-Room could have been cleaner.
-Couldn't check in until 3:00 PM.  Not sure if that's a Vegas standard, but an early check in to ditch our luggage would have gone a long way in my book.
-No ammentities in the room.  Hello mini bar?
-Tub and sink were very slow to drain.
-Bad cell service in the rooms and in the hall ways of the room floors (although it wasn't bad inside the casino area).  We tried both AT&T and Verizon with no luck...

Eh, I'm not sure I'd pick it to stay at again if it were up to me....but overall, it exceeded the low expectations I had for it. 

What else can you expect, it's Vegas baby!

will NOT be staying here again. Did NOT expect it to be sooo mediocre...
This hotel is for the loud, roudy, and uncouth...As if the constant screaming outside our window till late at night from the dinky overpriced rollercoaster that was stupidly placed waaayy tooo close to guests' rooms (like ours) wasn't BAD enough--We were startled awake at 3am by a LOUD, SHREAKING group of idiot girls and their blaring tv... Come to find out the next morning, my parents who were on a completely different floor than I was, were also awakened by some lunatic who banged on their door screamin' "security" "security" also in the wee hours of the night!! Wow. never again. You get what you pay for. Pay just a little bit more, and stay with a little more civilized group of folks.
Awesome decor!!!! They make it look just like New York....

As a New Yorker, it is nice to see the Brooklyn Bridge and the Statue of Liberty in the middle of the desert, when I visit Sin City.

While I never stayed in a room here, I have frequented this casino's floor, and played at the many great slot machines, card games and roulette tables.

Also at this hotel is Nine Fine Irishmen, which imports the black gold (aka Guinness) daily for the patrons to enjoy. Also on the top floor is the "Manhattan Express" roller coaster and arcade. I was a tad tipsy on one of my Vegas trips, and a friend and I wound up on the coaster. We sat in the front row and away we went looping around the hotel's facade.

Friends that stayed here said they enjoyed the rooms. So check it out, and if you get a good enough deal go for it. It is located right by the monstrous MGM Grand and badly out of date Excalibur.

They did an awesome job recreating the streets of New York. I mean, I've never been to New York... But if this is what it's like. I can't wait to visit! If New York isn't like this... please, don't burst my bubble.

This was one of the first of the new generation of themed hotel\/casinos in Las Vegas, I was around when they first opened... It was and still is sort of a big deal.

The additional mystery charges listed as pending have since been removed from our bill. We're not sure why the charges were applied in such a haphazard fashion. While we are glad they are gone, we remain puzzled by such indifferent customer service, both at the Resort and by telephone\/email. With acknowledgement that the room was fine and the kids experienced friendly and helpful staff in the arcade, we're amending our review to three stars.

The New York New York Hotel gets 1 star for cleanliness and service. I check in and the first room they have me in reeks of smoke, even though its a nonsmoking room. No big deal, I went down to the front desk to get another room. At this point I'm running late for my dinner after going up and down and waiting in line for registration, so I drop off my bags and don't take a good look around the room. When I come back and go into the bathroom, I see there is an old grungy yellow loofah right there in the shower! Someone's elses moldy shower accessories are in my bathroom, like they didnt clean the bathroom at all. I go down to the front desk again and tell them about the issue, they say they will send housekeeping right up to take care of it. I leave and return again several hours later - it is still there! I call down and they put me in touch with housekeeping who says they never got the request from the front desk. I ended up having to share a bathroom with someone elses gross toiletries and an unclean bathroom for two days until the night before I checked out, they finally fixed the issue. When I checked out, I asked about how the issue happened, got no explanation or attempt to make it right besides waiving my resort fee. 

Only stay here if you don't care about having the bathrooms cleaned in between guests.

You can't go wrong here for the price quality and service I would say I had an overall awesome stay. Received 2 tickets for the roller coaster, which is amazing to ride at night so cool!!! I also received a 50$ bar credit. They are remolding it and updating it to make it look hip. There is plenty to eat, drink and gamble inside. 

Stayed in the Park avenue room it was great, the bed was a pillow top, and pillows were soft to get your zzz's in and refresh. The water pressure was good and the maid service was great and up keeping our room and giving us fresh towels daily she was a sweetheart. I will definitely consider staying here in the future, they always have good deals or promotions going on and for the value you can't go wrong.

The rooms are old and rundown , a motel 6 I stayed in was better! Also note valet for hotel guess are being charged $18!PER DAY!!! 
And self parking $10 per day !
What BS is this ....
New York New York still has a nice casino and great and plentiful dining options but the rooms are starting to show Their age. It's time for a makeover if they want my business !
New York New York was great. From the time we checked in the staff was friendly and very accommodating.

I've stayed here a few times and have always enjoyed my visit.

I've stayed in their standard room as well as their spa suite. The spa suite was enormous. Six people could have stayed there comfortably. Only down side is hearing the roller coaster cruise by.

The hotel is clean and the staff if very accommodating.

The casino is large. The cocktail waitresses like most in Vegas aren't the quickest but what do you expect for free? Note: tip them first and stay out to speed up the process.

Zumanity is here and I've seen it twice and loved both times. A great show but definitely not family oriented.

Lots of great dining options and if you want, take your mom to coyote ugly on the second floor and have her dance on the bar- don't ask them for a water.

Overall it's a great place. Budget friendly but not so budget that you regret staying here.

Loved it! We were looking for a hotel my son would enjoy (he is 12) and that we would also enjoy so we decided on this hotel.

The roller coaster was a blast

Rooms were clean and fine (although they need more outlets for technology

Loved all of the shops downstairs made to look like new york restaurants.  

Pool was beautiful and a lot of fun for kids and mom and dad. 

I would definitely stay here again with out son, you can't beat the deal you receive.

I was at the NY NY  fro 6 nights  from the 9th to the 15th.  It was a great time. M life is a great rewards program.. for what my parents and I spent.. I got comp'd  2 nights, 2 meals and 4 resort fees!   Oh yeah! It was awesome and I am very happy with the room service, front desk, registration service etc... It was a great experience for my family as well. 

On the weekends instead of the girls dancing near the tables, there was an awesome Michael Jackson Impersonator.  It was awesome.

For being one of the older Hotel\/Casinos on the strip, The NY NY is holding its own.
Its always plenty busy, which I assume is due to their fair prices for both food\/drinks as well as descent hotel rates.
It's location is good and the restaurants are set up like at the Paris with a mini old school NY feel to it.
Always worth a walk through, not the nicest but not the worst.
I do think its getting time for a facelift though, its looking a bit darkn and worn out in there.

This review is for the casino only and not the hotel portion:

I was rather torn between 3 or 4 stars for New York New York. I remember my first visit to Vegas in the late 90's when the NY NY was still relatively new. I really liked it and really enjoyed nearly all the themed casinos of that time. 

Now, after having lived here all these years and having been in NY NY countless times for shows, dining, and playing tourists with friends, family, and visitors, I have a more balanced perspective of this casino.  

- They do house the Cirque Du Soliel show "Zumanity", which I think is one of the better Cirques in town
- I do love the theme all decked out with streets of NY, the outer facade including the Statue of Liberty replica, etc.
- It is definitely one of the more affordable options on the strip without having to go to the "low roller" casinos
- they do have plenty of affordable and higher end food options to choose from
- fantastic location on Tropicana  and the Strip and close walking distance to MGM, Tropicana, Excalibur, Mandalay Bay, Luxor doesn't hurt either.
-they recently added Hershey's choclate world, which I need to check out soon


- Some of the staff could use a brush up on their customer service skills. Especially security and some of the cashiers at the cage.
- Those slots are tighter than a frogs a**! We're not talking about 1 bad outing. I just do not have any luck at this place.
- The sports book is pretty small, but gets the job done.

This is yet another example of a 3.5 star business. I enjoy coming here and feel its better than a 3 star business, but something in the back of my head just doesn't feel I can push it to 4 stars yet. Maybe in the future.

3.5 stars.

Stayed here one night on my last trip as I extended my stay one night and couldn't extend the rate on my other reservation.  My wife and I have debated staying here but never did so it was a good chance for me to evaluate for 1 night to see if it was worth staying at on our next trip.

While I do like the high ceilings of the casino I don't like the fact that checkin is basically in the casino and there is not a dedicated lobby like other places.  Other issues are I arrived to checkin at 12:40 and because it wasn't 1pm they charged me an extra $20 for early checkin.  I've stayed at 4 or 5 other properties in Vegas (mostly MGM ones) and always checked in in the morning and have never had to pay this extra fee.  In fact a week earlier I checked in at 9am at the Monte Carlo and it was not a problem.  That in itself will keep me from staying here again but beyond that this is just a very odd building.  My impression is that great strides were taken to focus on the exterior of the building despite what it would do to the interior.  What it resulted in is very long (even by Vegas standards) halways with countless crooks and turns and overall a very disconnected feel to the building when trying to get from point A (your room) to point B (anywhere else).

Room was nice but the other things will keep me from staying there again.

First time staying here and it seems a bit dingy and not well kept here. TV channels were pixelated because of overload in the network. Not the greatest but again I was expecting anything relatively close to a 5 star quality services here.

The NY NY overall is a decent hotel. The casino isn't huge, which makes it easy to navigate and there are still plenty of slot machines and gaming tables. There are many small restaurants in the hotel where you grab something quick to eat. Although the hotel is on the south end of the strip, it's easy to walk to the middle of the strip. The downside though is that you have to walk outside to do that. In fact, you have to walk outside to get to any other hotel from there. That's something that would be nice to avoid when it's 110+ degrees in the summer. Many Vegas hotels are connected to other hotels inside. The pool is also small and there aren't many chairs around it.

On this trip, I decided to upgrade to the strip view. I found that to be a waste of money. Not only was the window dirty, the view wasn't great. The rooms aren't bad but I think they're a little outdated. The room I was in had a popcorn ceiling, the bathroom felt old and had only one sink, and although the TV was an LCD TV it didn't receive HD TV.

This Hotel is not as overwhelming as others in Las Vegas.Easy to navigate and easy to find ones way around from The Front desk,to Casino,to The Strip.Nice dining options to.Did not stay here this trip but went to Gamble and paid $7.00 to Park.It is tacky to charge for this for Casino guests and Dining patrons.Downtown Hotels do not.I hope they reconsider this policy.It will hurt their dining business as locals (I know some) will dine where parking is free.

Price were decent especially on a busy weekend when I went. The room were nice and clean. The only problem I had was room service. It took them over two hours to get to get clean towels.. Imagine if I had a hot rendezvous in another hotel and I couldn't dry myself..

They messed up my reservation and not only charged my for the day I was both here but was going to charge me for another additional night. I WILL NEVER COME BACK TO THIS HOTEL\/RESORT OR ANY HOTEL\/RESORT ASSOCIATED WITH THEM. Just what I needed after driving all afternoon from Ventura. I will be going somewhere else tomorrow for the rest of my vacation
