My work has had a sales conference in Vegas every year, and traditionally, my roommate and I get placed in the worst venue each time. Last year, all our friends got but in Mandalay Bay, and we were placed in an unrenovated, dingy tower at Caesars. I think god is trying to punish us for our sins. First of all, I hate Las Vegas and casinos especially. I think all the lights and sounds and masses of people tend to drive me insane. I also found navigating this hotel really confusing. Its like a maze and it took me forever to find the exits. As usual, we checked in and got placed in one of the smoking towers, and the week went pretty much downhill after that. The ambience of the room was similar to a best Western, or maybe Motel 8, and reeked of smoke and stale mold. All that for $140 a nite! Also, there was a shooting here recently which I think adds to its "hood" credibility. The restaurants and bars in this hotel leave much to be desired. There are a lot of fake new york pizza and deli places, and some stands that feature some pretty unappetizing looking "new york" hotdogs. The pool is not the greatest here either....its small, with limited numbers of lawn chairs. Also, the room service at this place sucks. Its slow, and the food is pretty crappy. But hey, I was in Vegas, where I typically drink things that i should not and eat nasty food late at nite, so there were a couple nites i went on eating binges . The lowest point during the week was when I woke up at 8 in the morning in a plate of fried chicken and mac and cheese. I hope to never repeat that again.

2009 I stayed at MGM and thought this year I would stay at New York New York to try something different.  I was not impressed with the rooms at all.  It was a maze to get from the elevator to the room due to the fact of the design of the hotel (just look at from the strip).  The rooms were very average and bathroom small.  I don't have any complaints, however I wasn't really impressed.  The inside of the hotel\/casino\/bars was nice.  The different places to eat and the New York theme inside was cool.  A nice place to visit and eat, but very average to spend the night.

The food at Gonzalez Y Gonzalez is awesome!  Love the guac! My salad was SO Good!
The house vodka is mixed with Gin, I know my Vodka I Know my dirty Martinis that "Vodka" is mixed with Gin. Period! no bullshit! it's Mixed with Gin. If it quacks like a duck? wattles like a Duck?  and tastes like a duck? it's a DUCK! And that is GIN and stop being a condisending jerk! Thank you for 6aking it off my bill, be aware of the vodka Gin problem with this place.

I absolutely love New York; it has been my spot since I turned 18.  I had the opportunity to go to New York last year and I cannot wait to return w\/ the boyfriend in the future because everything from the 24 hour subways, food being delivered (bagels, Chinese food, Thai food, etc.), and the freedom to live w\/o a gym membership because w\/ all the walking (no car required [I hate driving, too]) is the life that I used to envision for myself.  Now that vision has dissipated because it's not just me, myself, and I anymore.

Walking into this hotel brought back good memories and I love the pizza that my boyfriend and I shared at Sirrico's Pizza.  The architecture, the atmosphere, the food.. everything reminded me of New York City so kudos to this hotel for creating that experience!

This hotel needs to upgrade their pool area. The room was nice, stayed inthe Century tower on the 22nd floor facing the MGM Hotel. I love the exterior, because they made it look like New York, duh! Didn't ride on the roller coaster but I had a great view of it, looks like any ordinary roller coaster. The hotel doesn't have any posh restaurants but atleast MGM is just across the ways. Oh, I wished that the rooms had a mini-frig so we can keep water cold.

Rooms are decent enough. Part of what you get with the resort fee is free WiFi, business center use, etc.  WiFi was pretty much useless as streaming music wasnt able to be smooth. Had to print a PDF three pages long. Turns out your resort fee pays for you to print their boarding pass only. Got charged about $6 to print 3 pages. I understand they are here to make money but they are almost victimizing now

Loved the hotel. Loved the staff. Loved the room. Loved our view. Loved the late night American restaurant. Loved the location.

Hated the smoking in the casino as I walked through. Hated the soliciting in front of the hotel by the time share people. Hated the prices of using the services of the business center.

This place a very well rounded Casino to hit up! The views are amazing, get photo ops all around and inside the Casino. It has something for everyone! Everyone Raves about the coaster, although I stayed in the Casino while my party lined up to get on the coaster. One thing I absolutely LOVE, LOVE is a bar with a digital Black Jack game on it! BOOM, I hit it and played my rounds and loaded up on the booze all at the same time! Plenty of eaterys inside while you walk around what seems to be a downtown new York burrow! Never a lame moment at NYNY!
This was a great place to stay. Plenty of food options, nice open and airy casino, comfortable and clean room, very good all around.

I was pleasantly surprised by the jacuzzi tub and the housekeeping staff were unbelievable. ..seriously they deserve a raise...my only complaint was our room location 17th floor room 1705..I think...anyway the maze to get to the room was crazy lol eventually I sang Chariots of Fire while on my trek each time...the staff at the desk at check in were very polite and personable. .lol I love that they shared information on where it's most haunted. .yes I'm one of "those" kind of people lol...would definitely stay here again.

My junk email inbox seems to get bombarded with the most amount of spam from NY NY hotel throughout the year. This time they enticed us with a $49 weekday rate, along with $25 of freeplay and 20% off one of their restaurants. If you visit Vegas regularly, the best thing you can do is sign up for their Player's Club card. If you don't gamble, at least you'll have access to some of their lowest room rates.

With our "upgraded" Park Ave room, we not only had a view of the rumbling roller coaster with screaming riders, but also a partial view of the Strip. If you ever find yourself with a loss of memory after a night of debauchery, there's little doubt where you are when you look outside the window and see the MGM Grand and Excalibur across the street. If that doesn't jog your memory, then the tissue-paper thin walls should remind you that you can hear EVERYTHING from next door. 

What happens in Vegas, just makes you wanna take a shower 5 times a day in Vegas.

I enjoyed my stay here while I was in town for work. 

The pricing is what first caught my attention when I was looking for a hotel, plus they have a roller coaster so that was some incentive as well. 

I was able to get the spa suite with king bed to fit in my budget which was really cool and seemed to be a better offer than some other casinos that I looked at. 

The room was clean and on the newer side and the jetted hot tub was a nice touch. If I wanted to be picky I would say the bathrooms need some improvement but in reality its not a huge issue. I did notice you can hear the jetted tubs running in other rooms but I don't think there is much you can do about that. 

Service was good for the most part and they helped me out when I had to extend my stay longer than expected. One gripe is the line at the front desk would pile up and it seemed like they should of opened more counters when it gets backed up like that. 

Overall this was a really fun hotel and when I didn't feel like walking in the 110+ heat, staying within the casino was still very entertaining. 

I would stay here again and for the price I feel its worth it to go with the spa suite.

I remembering driving down to Vegas one night and heading here for a concert during the new years. The design of the hotel was horrible because only certain elevators went to part of the hotel where the room is at. 

Hated coming back to the room after a few drinks. Really made it hard to find the elevator.

Really cool inside...resembles the streets of New York (great pizza place there). Very loud with great bars. Try the American Restuarant for breakfast - you won't be sorry. Sportsbook is too small, no seats, but the ESPN Sportszone is right next door and that has plenty of seats.

The rooms are nice,  nothing fancy. Ask for an elevator room or else you will be walking 1\/2 mile to your room from the elevator. One other negative, is that it is at the far end of the strip, so you may want to get a cab to go to the other end.

Great! Happy early thanksgiving. My friends and I visited Vegas over the weekend and it was amazing! Always better than expectation. Thanks for the great service and wonderful facilities. Hope I can visit here next month for celebrating Christmas.

The staff was polite. We were assigned a room that we discovered had someone else in it already. That was corrected quickly enough. The excitement of the casino was fun. Lots of people on the 4th of July. No coffee in the room. The towels smelled of cigarette smoke, nice shower though. The decor is current and the big screen TV was nice. The view from room 3026 is amazing at night time. All in all it was pleasant enough.

Overall, I had a great experience at this hotel. Their staff is friendly, and they were very accommodating to my non-smoking needs even though I had a late check-in.

The rooms are a bit dated, but then again, this hotel doesn't charge the same 5-star prices as some of the other high end places on the strip. Rates seem relatively reasonable, and the hotel and rooms are clean and well maintained.

Going here isn't like going to NYC (that would be unreasonable). Then again, you don't feel like you're in Italy when you stay at the Venetian, nor do you feel like you're in Egypt when you stay at the Luxor. I think some people may take the "theme" a bit too seriously.

All-in-all, friendly staff and service do it for me. The clean rooms and well-maintained atmosphere are nice too.

I am sorry... this is my Paris Eiffel review as well....

Utter Ambivalence, but this place is pretty bad regardless with it's strip malls and lousy casino.

One side:  fun & cute replica that is sort of fun.

Second side:  Baudrillard's Simulacram.  People actually come to this place, see this thing, and *actually* believe, in a repitlian part of their mind, they have been there.  This is a long conversation of fun yet esoteric nonsense.  Still... I can't get it out of my mind.

This place is awesome!! The room is beautiful and clean! So far all of the staff have been extremely nice and not fake and very helpful. This is definitely our new place we will stay when we come to Vegas!!
Quiet, decent slots and table games, variety of food all around, and clean room. Will stay again.

I will never stay here again. Checking in the employee  at the counter told us there was know way that the travel agency that we used paid the resort fee and wouldn't even look at the email of our bill.  ( he was incorrect and made our inconvenience) the only friendly employee was the manager at the Amercia restaurant. I have never felt like a unwelcome guest at a hotel.  My expactactation is a smiling face and may I help you. ( not at New York New York ) When I left my credit card at the restaurant my phone call was transferred 8 times,  until I was told to send an email. When I called my car for valet I was told " sorry bro we can't bring out you car until your at the valet ". And called Dude at the valet. 
This is by far the worst resort experience I have ever had. 
This "bro" wasn't impressed ...

Unsafe and unsecure. Do not stay here.
I stayed here for one weekend and my room was burglarized. It occurred in the morning when I stepped out for a coffee. Puzzled at how this could happen, I found that the electronic entry door to the room did not lock behind you when the door closed, as it should. I promptly filed a report with hotel security and demonstrated how the lock did not activate. He acted like this was a surprise and promised he'd have maintenance look at it and the security dept would follow up. After weeks of me emailing and calling and leaving voicemails to their security and cust service with no response, I received a generic letter that the hotel was not responsible for thefts occurring in the rooms. How can this be? The locking mechanism was malfunctioning. Even the security personnel admitted so. What if someone attempted assaulting someone in the room? What if someone's child was in the room. So unsafe it's scary! I never received so much as an apology from the hotel, let alone an explanation or promise to prevent it occurring to others in the future. I am very disappointed that the hotel treated a guest like this. Again, do not do business with this hotel, unless you want to check your hotel room door actually works. 
Update. Hotel send letter saying not responsible for thefts. Did not undress safety issue on malfunctioning door locks. Sad!

This was my first time staying here! As I checked in I was offered a upgrade Park Avenue at the 25th floor. My room was also near the elevator so I had save some time. The room was good. It was a bit neat but enjoyed it. I didn't dine at the hotel but ate somewhere else. I wasn't satisfied that there wasn't a buffet. I had to walk from NY NY to Excalibur eat there. The arcade was a bit bad because the employees seem to say bad words so I wasn't happy with that. The worker are like "Uhhh can we have break now.. I hate going from here to there.." It seems that I can't access the elevators floor 30-36.... It said that you need a card key but it didn't work......
Overall Exp.........4        Rooms..........4.5   Location: 5
Food....................N\/A

While we encountered a few small problems, this hotel offers great "bang for your buck." I'd definitely stay here again. 

The room: It was fine given that we didn't spend much time there - reasonably priced, decent size, and we had a nice view of the strip and roller coaster. However it had a very faint smoky smell even though it was non-smoking and our toilet malfunctioned - first world problems but still worth mentioning. 

Casino: Seemed like one of the smaller casinos on the strip, but still fine. One thing worth noting was that when a slot machine wouldn't give back my cash-out ticket, it was very difficult finding staff who could fix it - everyone kept passing the buck and it took a long time to get my money back. Other than that our casino experience was pleasant. 

Restaurants: There are great restaurants and bars at this hotel -- most were reasonably priced. Goldberg's Deli and Nine Fine Irishmen were the best-- absolutely top-notch food and service at both. 

Other: Staff was friendly, check-in was fast, and the location was great. We particularly enjoyed how easy it was to get to five of the south-Strip hotels with pedestrian bridges, moving walkways, and a tram from the Excalibur (across the street) to the Mandalay Bay. We didn't explore the entire hotel (e.g. pool, spa, theater, etc.) so I can't speak to all of the other amenities.

We basically go here for the dueling pianos. We see dueling pianos every where we travel, we are total junkies! That being said, no place has yet to top The Bar at Times Square piano guys. No matter how many nights we are in Vegas, we end up here  every night, sometimes just for an hour, other times for the whole night. They are the best!!!

Stayed in the players suite ....the atmosphere is great...so much to do...the suite was about 800 Sq ft....lots of room and great place 2 take the kids...although that arcade is overpriced and so expensive $20 will burn in a few minutes with the kids!!!

*on the marginal side of awesome vegas style but OK
*pretty cheesy, literally, cheese pizzza, hot dogs and kinda fast foodie
*the DJ and mini rave in the bar were strangely cool
I was glad that I stayed here, our room was clean and quiet. Also being close to the Excalibur, Luxor and MGM is a huge plus. Lots of penny slots here too.
Spa Suite was awesome, very clean room. The only reason why I don't give 5 stars is, they didn't tell us that they charge a spa room deposit and I was already worried that they charged us twice.

This was one of our places to visit while staying in Vegas. We went in through the right of the hotel where the restaurants are located and wow! As soon as you walk in, you may get the impression that you are walking in the very own streets of New York city!! The walls all around you are decorated like the buildings in New York and they even add cool features like fog coming out from the sewers! There are lots of food places here, so you have much to decide. We chose the Burger Bar. The service was quick and excellent. The food was also good and I thought their lemonade was a must try! After having a large burger we decided to try out the famous roller coaster!!! Pay $15 a person and then walk through the quickest line-wait ever to climb aboard the coaster. Scream! It is really fun and I recommend this attraction while you are here! 
So, after you walk through the streets of New York, you will find yourself back in the casino and realize you were in Vegas the whole time.

Had a great time here!  Spent a majority of one day gambling at the blackjack tables in NYNY.  I loved the decor of the casino, and all of the authentic New York eateries.  Unfortunately we were still super full from breakfast so we did not partake in the deli, which smelled amazing.

The free drinks were nice and strong and I got a pretty good buzz while gambling!  The dealer was funny and witty and it was nice to have her engaging the table rather than just standing there dealing like most of the places.

My only gripe is about the roller coaster.  We wanted to go on it, but I had a small cross body purse with me.  I needed to put it in a locker but I had no quarters.  I went into the roller coaster gift shop and they refused to break my $10 - I had to buy something (which I refused to do).  So, if I wanted change, I'd have to cash in my $10 all to quarters, which was out of the question.  I ended up getting annoyed and pulling hubby out of line and we just left rather than dealing with that pain in the ass.  For the money, I can't imagine it's really worth it - we live 2 hours from a real amusement park so I'd rather just go there!

For one of the new hotels in Las Vegas, it didn't hit all the right buttons for me.

Sure, the guests are younger that at other casinos and the gambling area seems smaller and there where lots of non-gambling things to do (they've got a roller coaster).  

They fail on some of the basics.  They wanted really wanted me to take a smoking room with one bed - I want non-smoking, it doesn't even need to have a bed!  My room didn't have a desk, only a side table the size of my laptop and the same height as the chair.  How is that for ergonomics?  The fitness center wasn't open 24 hours - who ever heard of something closing in Las Vegas.  Plus I had to pay $35 for the privilege of using weight machines probably from the mid-80's, albeit refinished to match the brown decor of the weight room.

The restaurants had good food, but that is for another review (as are the not so good parts).

We did get a really good room rate and a lot of attentive service from our meeting coordinator (yep, it was a work trip), but I don't think the NY NY is a better place to visit (to quote the Beatsies).  You can see the transplanted NYC landmarks - you can look up the statue of liberty's windblown skirt where she adorns a row of slot machines (I'm not sure of the socio-political metaphor) - but it doesn't call to me as a place to stay again, unless my company pays for it. Again.

I had a horrible experience with the hotel. The room was in a bad shape. The bathroom was rusty and the shower tub door was wiggly because a little part fell off. The light turned off when I plugged in the blow dryer. They sent a mechanical and it took 30 min to fix them at night. I had to wait till he left. There was no apology or anything. It was a bad service. I expected more than that. I totally don't recommend staying in the hotel.

Not clean. 
Where the wifi guys???
Happy with location and easy to find but the room need upgrade. 
Room and resort fee RIP.

This was our second time visiting NY NY. We had a blast as we did the first time. We enjoyed how the crowd skews young and how there is always a buzz about the place.
This time we upgraded to a Spa room and it was worth every penny. The jaccuzi tub was amazing and the room was a perfect size for a couple to feel pampered. The housekeeping service was efficient and did a great job tidying up for us. One downside was that there was an aroma of stale vomit beneath a bedside table that sorta detracted from sleeping on that side but, hey, it's Vegas, these things happen. The sheets and bed were luxurious although the pillows could not handle my big head and were rather uncomfortable.
The table games are great in a fun environment. Dealers are hit and miss but when you get a good one it makes for a fun evening.  
We rode the roller coaster this time and it was enjoyable (for my wife, not much of coaster fan myself, had to make up for the time she spent escorting me at the blackjack tables) for a really decent cost. 
Gallagher's is a must for a fancy evening. One of the best steaks I have had in my life and some really decent vegetarian options for my wife. The wine list was great. Our server, Preston, really added that something special to our evening and is really good at his job. 
Had a really horrible corned beef sandwich at the deli, the culinary low point of the trip. But Il Fortino was a great meal when we first arrived.
All in all, a great Vegas experience at a decent rate! We will be back.

Website glitch booked me twice for a room and took out two deposits when I only booked ONE. Customer service put a note suggesting an upgrade for my troubles and was accommodating (over the phone.) 
I checked in early around 2:30 and Sally at guest services did upgrade me one room up for my inconvenience. 
She then said the room may not be ready and to come back at 4 (check in time is 3pm) . I was slightly annoyed because I had been driving for hours and wanted to be in my room by 3. So I asked her if there was anything she could do for me in the meantime since my room won't be ready for another hour and a half (drink tickets? Anything.) She said no and didn't seem to really want to accommodate for the inconvenience. I had tipped her too so I would have thought she would go get a manager to see if they could do something for me since I had to wait longer for my room.
While heading all the way back to the car, she calls me and says the room is ready now so I walk all the way back.
Checking in was a hassle...

May sound like I'm nitpicking but there was a rolling tray filled with half eaten food and dirty dishes that stayed parked near our room elevator for two days. Just seemed like no one bothered to take care of this mess and left it in plain sight. Dirty. Aside from that, hallways are nice. 

As for the room, i would give it 4 stars. Stayed in the park avenue room. The room was pretty nice and clean. Marble bathroom floors. Spacious bathroom. No fridge or coffee maker :( I was on the 32nd floor with a pool view. The shower knob was starting to fall apart and took extra turns to get the shower running but aside from that, the room was comfortable .

They charged a $20 convenience fee per day and provided mascara stained sheets, no in room coffee maker, an undersized pool (not enough seats for everyone), and weak restaurant options.  I'd recommend staying elsewhere on the strip for the price.

The wait to check in on a Monday evening was ridiculous. It took us almost half an hour to check in to our room despite the fact that it wasn't busy at all. They even charge $10 a day for self-parking which would at least be justified if they had fantastic amenities or incredible customer service. But nope - strike out on both accounts. 

The facilities are super beat up and the hallway walls look like they've been run into multiple times. I saw several holes and major dents in the walls when I went to fill up the ice bucket. Security and staff seem to have very little sense of customer service. We are definitely never staying here again.

Stayed here for a job. Free room, and frankly though it wasn't huge it did the trick, not smaller or larger than many rooms I've stayed in.
Pillows were kinda un-comfy and the AC was loud enough that I turned it off to get some sleep.

That being said, the staff was very nice and helpful upon check-in, and the call-in check out is great since I forgot to check out and just called it in upon my leaving town.

The whole being able to hear the police cars on the strip despite being 24 floors up was kinda a drag, and I heard from friends you can hear the rollercoaster riders screaming at 11PM or 10PM or something like that if you're in a room that faces that thing.

The restaurants are fine, and again the staff was great.
Would i seek this place out. Likely no, but I'd stay here again.

Once, a long, long time ago, my first time in Sin City, I happened to walk into NY NY with my girlfriends to do some gambling.  We happened to stumble upon a slot tourney and thought "What the hell?..Why not join in?"  So we signed up for our NY NY cards, plopped down in front our assigned slot machines, waited for the bell and then started pulling that lever in the likes of giving a hand job, just get off already.  My friend made it to the finals and ended up winning $250 bucks.  

Then we headed over to the piano bar.  A man that kinda resembled Yanni was playing the piano and a good sized crowd was drinking booze and listening to him hammer out tunes.  I walked up to him and asked him to play "Piano Man" by Billy Joel (I'm sure he gets this request all the time)....he obliges....I ask if I can lay on his piano...he obliges...I get on the piano and sprawl out like some old school lounge singer (think Michelle Pfieffer in the Fabulous Baker Boys sans the gown).  Yanni's twin, aka the piano man, starts to sing "Lady in Red" to me....ah, shucks.  Maybe because I'm turning red.  A few dudes from the crowd join in and all are singing this song to me.  I'm the center of attention, drunk, hysterically laughing and being serenaded by Yanni and a bunch of tools.  Then Yanni sings my request "Piano Man."  The bar crowd is singing along and my friends are in the corner of the bar, bent over laughing.  The mustache man with locks of Jew finally finishes the song, I hop off the piano and we go on our merry way.

Thank you NY NY for the lovely memories.

BEST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!

Stayed here twice once w\/ friends and once w\/ my  girlfriend, both times were very enjoyable. The location is perfect, walking distance to anything on the strip, lots of places to eat from fast food to fine dining. The rooms are clean and are fairly priced, just book early because they tend to sell out esp on weekends. 

If your going to vegas and just need a clean place to stay thats centerally located on the strip and just need a cool place to perform the 3 S's w\/o all the glitz and glamour of the usual Vegas spots, this is the place

The front desk just called and said we were using too many towels! They said we can have three sets, yet the reservation was made for my wife and three little kids in a large room. We had asked for enough towels for each one of us--five sets. 

I've never encountered this kind of pettiness in a hotel. Never! And I've stayed in many, many on business. 

With all the choices in Vegas hotels, why would I ever come back here? I recommend the Venetian or Paris, where I've had great experiences.

This hotel was super cheap to stay at during the off season. Came here with my girlfriend in November and it was $45 a night !!! Great atmosphere within the hotel and I loved the interior design. The main floor is a casino but if you go up to the second level, there is an arcade. That is also where the entrance to the roller coaster is located. They had some great games at the Arcade too. You can also find Hersey's Chocolate World attached to the hotel. I think this is a new attraction since I don't recall seeing it in the past before.

We booked the most basic room you could find and it was very welcoming. Had all the amenities we would expect, AC, Cable, Free Wi-Fi, King Size clean bed, Sofa and great window view of the roller coaster.

My only gripe with this hotel as with any other place in Vegas is that the food was very expensive. They did have a Pizza place that was super cheap to eat at. All the other places charged on average $15-25 per person. That's what you would expect to pay if you went anywhere on the strip. I won't knock the hotel down because of this though. 

The hotel had a very family friendly atmosphere and I would definitely stay here again.

I travel to Las Vegas monthly. I've stayed at every hotel  on The Strip. This was my first and last stay at New York, New York...I used to think that Luxor was the worst even worst than Bally's or the old Imperial Palace. New York, New York takes the cake. From the old dirty room, the yelling people on the roller coaster or the rude people that work @ New York, New York.

Stay Away

Beware...made a group reservation to include Penthouse Suite...they don't explain that they will give u whatever they have "listed as Penthouse suite". The pictures\/description at the counter and on website do not explain this. I expected what was described on the website and not told the casino manages the suites for "high rollers".

I've always wanted to stay here ever since I was a little girl, but always got around to staying at other hotels. All I can really say about this place is that once you stay here, you've stayed here and there's really no incentive to go back. 

One thing I did not like is that when you call to make reservations, you have to pay for the room up front, NOT pay for it when you arrive. Cardholder must be present with the actual card. If you use your bank card, they have to take $100 deposit, which I thought was bullshit. Then I was told that it takes between 5 to 7 days to be refunded that $100 if you don't use any of the room service, etc. 

We were given our room keys (hotel attendant was extremely nice and professional) and went up to the 23rd floor to our room. Something I don't understand is that they have separate elevators for floors 1-30 and a completely separate elevator for floors 3-38. Maybe to divert traffic? Who knows. It was just a pain in the ass to have to take our elevator to the 3rd floor and then get in the other elevator to go up to the 31st floor to visit our friends in their suite. 

We got up to our room and our rooms keys didn't work, not only that, but it sounded like the room was occupied because the tv was on very loudly. It was such an inconvenience to have to go all the way down to the lobby to have to see what was going on. 

The same hotel attendant helped us and apologized for the inconvenience but offered no comp whatsoever. I still feel that the maids were just hanging out in the room. When we got up there, the tvs were on, but they were on very low volume. A far cry from how loud they were 15 minutes prior. The attendant then called our room and told us that we were comped the ridiculous $20 something resort fee.

The suite was gorgeous, I thoroughly enjoyed it. It was nice for the price we got it for for just a night. I just wished the spa tub (that had whirlpool jets) had been in a place where we could have looked out to see the Vegas lights. That would have been awesome. We had a mini bar, two tvs, a killer place for me to do my makeup. The only things that sucked, the windows were tinted green, they barely had any toiletries, the water pressure in the shower SUCKED, the air was recycled, and the bed was extremely uncomfortable. 

Now for the actual casino part. I loved that this casino was not a smokey mess. I wasn't coughing and gagging profusely. My husband enjoyed the slot machines until it was time to call an attendant over, which took almost a good hour. This place has like four places to eat, two or three shops to shop in, and they offer one show. Oh, and an arcade and a roller coaster. Other than that, they have nothing special to offer Vegas goers. 

The receipt that they send to your email if you do the express checkout is so hard to read. From the looks of it, it looks like they over charged me and then comped me the entire stay. I still need to give their customer service a call so I can confirm the charges that they made on my card. I did, after all, not sign for a few of those charges.

Like I said before, once you've stayed here, you've stayed here. Time to venture off to another hotel on the Vegas strip.

Live the New York New York Experience...

On Tuesday, October 6th of 2015 I arrive to Las Vegas, NV for a business trip to attend to one of the most important trade shows of the nutritional industry, SupplySide West. Even though this trade show was held at Mandalay Bay hotel, my coworkers and I decided to stay at New York New York hotel due to the proximity to the venue and the rest of hotels and restaurants in the Strip. Unfortunately, I lived a true NY NY experience, where you get ROBBED and no one is held responsible for what happened. Let me tell you my story! On Wednesday night, I decided to change my 14K gold personalized University ring for a more simple ring to go out for a dinner with a supplier. All my fake, non-expensive jewelry were in a clear plastic bag, including my university ring in my open suitcase next to my bed. On Thursday, I did not put back my ring back; it was one of the busiest days of the trade show between breakfast meetings, more and more meetings throughout the day, my 14K gold personalized University ring was the least of my worries. It's important to mention that every day the room as cleaned by the housekeeping staff from the hotel. On Friday morning, getting ready to check out I noticed that the ring was nowhere to be found. I searched multiple times, underneath the bed, in my suitcase, all over the room before I decided to open an Incident Report. It's important to understand that the loss of this ring is much more than monetary. I graduated from a country outside of the United States in 2011. This ring is unique and customize for me, it had my name, the graduation year (2011), the Country's flag shield and the University shield. The jewelry store that makes these university rings no longer produces the 2011 ring because some many years have passed. This means that this ring was irreplaceable. After a few weeks I still had some hopes that the ring would appear. I called the Risk Management department every day for an update. The first two weeks I was told that it's still under investigation, that they will call me as soon as they interview the housekeeping staff. Today, November 3rd (almost a month a later), I finally received a call from the Risk Management Manager, explaining me that they talked to the person who was responsible for cleaning the room and section of where I stayed. The person claims she never took or saw a 14K gold personalized University ring. In my opinion, it is obvious that they will not admit they robbed something. Nevertheless, the manager explained me that the hotel will not be responsible and will NOT refund the value of my 14K gold personalized University ring because they don't have any prove that it was actually stolen or if it even happen, UNBELIEVABLE!! Definitely the worst hotel experience ever! If you're planning a trip to Las Vegas, please try to avoid this hotel. The service mentality of this hotel is that no one is held responsible if something wrong happens with one of their guests. This hotel definitely ruined my Vegas experience, but now I understand why everyone says "what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas", my 14K gold personalized University ring stayed in Vegas!

My husband and I traveled to Las Vegas for the second time and wanted to stay on the strip for a inexpensive price. After a lot of searching, we settled on New York- New York due to decent reviews and price. Honestly,  I did not want to stay here because the hotel pictures and theme seemed so cheesy and it was upon arrival. We got a standard room with a terrible view of a roof and back side of roller coaster. The biggest issue we had with this hotel was the very cold temperature. Our room was freezing and we had to use the heater a lot. It's cold everywhere because they keep the air conditioner on full blast. My poor husband had to wear a jacket on the  casino floor. Our room was spacious but had a lot of dead space. No coffee machine in the room,  no bath ropes and cheap tolitries. For such a large hotel,  the pool area is small and closes at 7pm.  Not sure what the daily resort fee is covering but just another way to get more money out of guest.  Upside is the variety of restaurants, roller coaster is fun and housekeeping was prompt in fulfilling our request. Btw, all the food here is over priced. $4.99 for a cup of orange juice, $4.00 for a small cup of coffee, etc etc. Fun slot machines but you won't win much; I lost every penny I gambled and so will you. This hotel is close to the airport but on the far end of south strip, so it's far from the more expensive center strip. But right across the street is the upscale and beautiful MGM Grand where jerk off Floyd Mayweather boxes at. We do not recommend this hotel and will never stay here again.

Where it asks would I recommend this hotel to a friend, I must say absolutely, positively not.  My very first night at the hotel, my father and I went down to the casino and the strip for a few hours starting at about 4 PM.  I had brought enough money for me to be able to safely play for our three day trip, and I hid it in a book in my suitcase and placed that book under another book.  I told my father out loud only in our room what I was doing in case I forgot where I had put the money.  We returned at 10PM tired from the flight and our time in the casinos.  The next morning, I went to replenish my money for the day, and I noticed that the books were reversed from what I had last left them.  The wrong book was on top, and the money was gone.  We searched the room and found no trace of the missing money.  It is my opinion that it was an inside job and that some sort of listening device was placed in the room.  Security came up to check and verify the report we made, and despite saying that ""these things tend to have a happy ending," nothing was done to either compensate or show that anything was actually being done.  I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, and I will personally never stay here again.  My advice to travelers thinking about his hotel is to enter at your own risk.  I only have an opinion of what happened, and based on my story, I will let you decide if you think I am right or wrong.
The hotel and casino itself was not bad.  The economy room reminds me of a slightly nicer courtyard by marriott, and the casino is about average size with normal games and several five dollar tables during the daytime.
It would have been fine to have lost the money in the casino, but the fact that it was stolen out of my room made me spend most of my time elsewhere on the strip.
casino was fun, food sucked, roller coaster was the shit, and i met omarion from b2k.

***Review Is For Casino Floor Only***
This is one of the better places to gamble. Your money will last longer and the cocktail service is good even when the casino is packed. While I certainly know gambling is all luck, your money does last longer here. There are lots of very appealing food options on the casino floor from casual to upscale. Greenberg's Deli pastrami sandwich.....Yum! Next visit we are going to Gallagher's steakhouse which has excellent reviews.

Ok it's not the Bellagio, Wynn etc. for the price nothing wrong with it. 

Clean, furnishings ok etc. did not use the pool but seems small. Check-in fast and efficient.  

Would actually give it five stars but so sick of resort fees just build them into the price.  Resort fees were originally suppose to be for if you took advantage of amenities the resort has to offer and it was always a choice.

I have never stayed at this hotel, however this review is based on visiting and the roller coaster.

I remember when this hotel opened and all the hooplah that goes with any Vegas opening. It's alright. Nothing too wonderful to rave about, but not a complete dive. The exterior is awesome, and I remember seeing memorials post 9\/11 around Lady Liberty. Definitely moving since I'm a west coast gal and can't make it to the real thing.

The roller coaster is "eh." It's expensive (what isn't in Vegas) and super bumpy. It's one of those things that I've done, check, what's next on the list. I do like that you feel kind of gritty and really in the city or underground. 

I'm not anxious to return to this hotel, but if the price is right I would consider actually staying here.

Hotel is older and very dirty. Casino is small, cramped and dark. Also we went upstairs to visit the world famous Coyote Ugly bar. This was a terrible experience. While waiting in the line they inspect your purse, this includes opening up your Advil bottle and snooping trough it which is disgusting. If I was going to sneak in pills I would have just put them in my pockets. The bar is small, cramped, only the front bar was open with only two bartenders. The "girls" we're not singing or doing anything other then talking about people into the microphone and they were less then appealing to the eye. The entire place I think may have been a waste of time.

Conferences in Vegas make me a frequent visitor to this once awesomely fun city.  These days, I'm not as jazzed as I used to be for these visits.  Is it age?  Sigh...probably.

Anyways, my coworkers and I decided to stay at the New York New York.  It wasn't like one of those new sexy hotels that you see on the Strip, but it also wasn't one of those gross, insect-infested 'way past their prime' hotels either.  This was a nice, happy medium.

First off, I would like to mention how easy it is to park in the parking structure, take the elevator, walk about 100 feet of the walkway, down the escalator, right to the front desk.  There is nothing more I hate than trying to navigate through acres of casino with all my luggage, trying to get to the front desk, especially after a long road trip.

Check in was a breeze, and the front desk folks were very polite and accommodating.  Our room itself was nice.  The bathroom looked like it could use an upgrade, but everything else about it was great.  One of the biggest annoyances of this hotel had nothing to do with the room, but the light fixtures in the hallways.  I know...'who cares about light fixtures?'  Well, when you have to walk around 7 different corners to get to your room from the elevator, you notice things like light fixtures.  They were pretty large and bright and directly at eye level.  How about smaller, dimmer, and higher up?  Maybe those stumbling around with a hangover wouldn't be cursing the hotel for making the walk of shame so painfully miserable.

As for the rest of the hotel, they had a good number of $5 tables, which is right up my alley.  The quick food options were plentiful, and the sit down food options were pretty good too.  They had a great dualing piano bar that was very popular.

For being one of the older hotels, I actually liked this one.  I stayed here with my family during the after-Thanksgiving weekend.

Check-in was 3:00p (check-out 11:00a), and we arrived around 3:30 or so.  We all parked in self-parking (3rd-7th level for customer parking), which was pretty easy to do (and during our entire stay, never found it completely full).  My parents tried to valet their car initially, but was given a hard time and ended up having to self-park anyway (something about valet being full so they needed a confirmation number or some kind of proof of stay, which my parents didn't have then since my BIL booked the rooms).

The check-in line was looong though.  Probably because of the weekend that we went, but it sure took at least a good 30-40 minutes!  Somehow we were all able to get a room on the same floor (3 separate rooms on the 4th floor via the New Yorker elevators), which was convenient.

Room was clean, definitely has been upgraded.  We were in the building with the pink windows, so our room glowed pink...especially because it was late afternoon and the sun was setting.  It wasn't a big deal though (the kiddies thought it was cool).  The beds were surprisingly comfortable.  There was a safe, iron, hair dryer, free Wi-Fi, but no fridge.  The closet was on the smaller side compared to other hotel rooms, but then again, we brought our puffy jackets AND regular jackets (was really cold at night but warm during the day).  There were only 3 sets of towels (is that normal nowadays?) so had to get more from housekeeping.

The New Yorker elevators were conveniently located between Chin Chin Cafe & Sushi Bar and Gallagher's Steakhouse, which were near the food court and other eateries.  We only went to Il Fornaio's Bakery Cafe during our stay, but would've loved to visit Ben & Jerry's and Nathan's too if we had more time.

This is a pretty kid-friendly hotel with an arcade, roller coaster (minimum height 54"), and Hershey's World.  They also have a walkway to MGM and Excalibur so we didn't have to cross the busy streets.  With resort fees and all other fees, our 2-night stay came out to about $340...obviously hiked up quite a bit during this busy season, but still cheaper than the other newer hotels.
Visited Vegas for the first time and stayed here. It was great I'm glad that I picked this hotel. You *have* to see Zumanity if you stay here too!!

Not as impressed with this hotel as I used to be. I don't feel it was a good bargain like I used too. I would sacrifice being at the far end of the strip for a good value and good safe place. Every night we had hookers hitting on us in the casino and bar areas. Had some street thugs trying to play a game on us one night at a hotel bar. Didn't work out and once I made the hotel aware they escorted them out but it should not have taken place in the first place.

I stayed in here when I came home for my 2-week R&R from Afghanistan (gf of the time was supposed to be there too but the cooze dumped me before I got home - way to show your support for a Soldier, eh?).  Not a bad hotel but certainly not one of the best on the strip.  A couple of highlights:

1.  Won several grand on the craps tables.

2.  Had a floor give me a dinner comp to the steakhouse.

3.  Almost hit megabucks (first two on the line, the third, long ass spin ended one position above the line - what a cock-tease).

Not a bad trip - helped me forget the war for a few weeks.  Going back now though after being spoiled by the Venetian\/Palazzo, Bellagio, and Wynn has changed my expectations though.

*review of lobby\/casino\/restaurants* 

visually stunning. the inside is designed to look like central park. I love the high ceilings, and the way the restaurants and shops live around the perimeter of the casino\/machines. Good spot to play the penny slots. Take out your cash in advance, or do cash-back from the Walgreens across the street-- the fee at the indoor atm machines is $5.99. Whaaaaaa??!!! 

Jello shots at Frozen Daiquiris upstairs is cool-- cheap, but not strong enough. Tasted good! 

Indoor roller coaster is cool.

It was a good experience. I enjoyed it. The only negative is that I reserved a room with a King bed which when I got there was unavailable. Why then give me the options when I reserved if there are going to give me whatever they want.

Customer service training is desperately needed. I called to book 2 rooms for 3 nights for my daughter's 21st birthday party. When I relayed the amount to my husband, he said "huh, Paris had a better deal". Before I could say anything more, the NY NY agent hung up on me!

**This review is a review about the amenities\/structure that New York New York Hotel and Casino has.**

As part of my first trip to the Vegas Strip, I wanted to see the Brooklyn Bridge. For some reason I was envisioning an actual bridge you get on, but this was not disappointing. It definitely makes for some good photos. The outside of the casino is pretty cool.  I've never been to New York so not sure if they are spot on, but it definitely gave the vibe of New York. Hats off to the Statue of Liberty. Beautiful! 

The roller coaster is probably what brings people in here, Coyote Ugly, or even Hershey's Chocolate World. I chickened out for the roller coaster, but enjoyed cooling off from the heat by walking around inside. I'm not going to lie, the cigarettes and cigar smoke will hit you if that's not your thing. The casino is right in the entrance so be ready.

OMG ! grossed out , only stayed one night I got up to shower and hanging from the shower curtain rod were 2 crusty and stiff washcloths 
 yuck ! crusty and stiff . we loved the room the bed was nice .
 The food was good ,but if we had been staying longer I would have asked for another room . Just wanted you to know
Horrible! Rude Now I can understand free alcoholic beverages while gambling. But asking for a water and they cannot accommodate. Good luck! We will not return.

Stayed in room 2734. Park Avenue Suite. Non-smoking, two queens, no adjacent door, away from the roller coaster, great view of the Statue of Liberty, yes you'll here helicopters but they're not loud. Roller coaster stops at 12 therefore so does the screaming. Room was clean. Towels did smell a little funky but I'm sure it's just the industrial bleach they use. Room had air conditioner but even set at its lowest it was still somewhat warm in the room (I really think the hotel controls it to control costs but whatever). It was livable. 

The hotel has everything you could want or need. Really no reason to leave the place.

Stores, restaurants, clubs, drinks, shows... it's all there. I'll definitely be back soon and hopefully get to experience everything I missed out on this time.

Resort fees apply at almost every hotel so people need to stop b*tching. Most places charge more. Get over it. Wi-fi was good but as is in any high rise building it comes and goes. Parking wasn't an issue, always plenty of it and no damage to our car.
 
Overall, I enjoyed our stay.

This is quickly becoming my girlfriend and I's favorite place to play blackjack and eat on the Strip! The last two trips we've come here more than anywhere else to eat at Nine Fine Irishmen, Chin Chin, the pizzeria, and the sandwich deli.

The casino doesn't stink too bad because of high ceilings, it's fun to get around, cashier is quick, and the dealers are very kind. Joe at 5 dollar blackjack with the bald head and glasses was especially helpful.

Such a cool hotel, love the NY vibe and the roller coaster. Would love to stay here and check out the pool and rooms sometime!

Solid 3 stars,
  New York , I Love You
But you're bringing me down
Like a rat in a cage
Pulling minimum wage
New York, you're perfect
Don't please don't change a thing
Your mild billionaire mayor's
Now convinced he's a king
New York, I Love You
But you're freaking me out
New York, I Love You
But you're bringing me down


  $5 black jack

New York New York is a cool hotel\/casino for not being in the  middle of the strip. Our room was super nice and reasonably priced. I appreciate the overall air filtering, customer service, and cleanliness of the place. The pool and jacuzzis were fine and inside, there are places to eat EVERYWHERE. I went to the spa last year and that was lovely.

Their 2 major clubs, Rok and Coyote Ugly are complete jokes. Didn't wanna stand in line forever for Rok to have my bf pay for himself to get in. We got into Coyote Ugly for free but left after 2mins bc the "host" was so loud an obnoxious and there really wasn't anything to do at that point - not even get a drink!

The bf and I have been wanting to ride the coaster for a while - and we finally did. Verdict: Never again! It was just painful and not smooth at all. Not worth the $14 ticket. If you want a good coaster, go to Speed at the Sahara.

Overall this was good place to stay at - it's manageable and there's plenty to do.

No rating on the hotel rooms here, just the casino area...

I love NY NY's casino, the dealers are always super friendly and helpful, if you sit at a table and don't know the game, they'll explain anything and everything to you.  Also, when I drunkenly explained the table that I was looking for (I told where it used to be located and what the game consisted of) the dealer was helpful in telling me what game it was, where it was, why it was gone and similar games that I might like to try instead...

Great people, tons of resaurants to choose from with cool themes, the NY  Pretzel hotdogs are so good, I always get like 3 and take them back to my hotel room and then when I wake up hungover, I'm a tad bit more happy.

Skip Zumanity, just make the trip to Monte Carlo or MGM for a Cirque show.
I like this place alot. Trying to go to all the casino's on the strip made me leave this one. For late night it had good live music going on.

This review is not for the hotel suites themselves, as I did not stay here. Being from New York, I can see how they are trying to portray NYC, and it's pretty cute. They've built rows of stores with the look of brownstones and street cafes. I might like it more if it weren't for how dark it was every where we went. The arcade was great. The prices for the games were quite reasonable. I don't know how many tickets they require for any of the rewards, since my goal was simple to enjoy the games, however, they were plenty fun. LOVE ski ball! Their DDR pad had one arrow that didn't work, so that game was a bust. The coaster was OK. While it was plenty long, and had decent turns and bumps, it was not smooth, and it reminded me of the feeling you get on the Cyclone in Coney Island. Just not smooth. They have lockers that you can use for 50 cents to store your items while you ride. I would not do the coaster again, though I wouldn't be opposed to playing the arcades.

Nice cheap hotel to stay at. Nothing special. But still good place I mean who stays in their hotel anyway...? They have the Hershey's factory here. Hotel is clean. Room was clean. Service was great. Nothing bad to say. Comfy beds and comfy pillows. Nice view out our window.

I've never stayed here. I've played here. I've lost here. I've gotten ripped off by Haagen Daaz here. I have gotten stinkin' drunk here. I have seen debauchery here. I will visit again, for a sandwich, gambling and frozen alcoholic drinks.

just recently got back from my first stay here.....throughly enjoyed ourselves.......would definately come back to ths hotel.........loved that pizza place in the food court......just wish they had a poker room....but besides that loved loved loved it there

I really had such a good time at this hotel.  We loved the interior of the casino, the small restaurants are laid out like new york neighborhoods and has a really cool and fun feel.  We ate at Greenbergs Deli every morning for breakfast and ordered the Nova Scotia smoked salmon platter and it was amazing.  I would say they give you too much smoked salmon but I don't think that is possible.  The Nine Fine Irishmen pub has a pretty good happy hour and handsome bartenders with Irish accents!  Chin Chin was a decent place to go to for some sushi. 

The rooms themselves were pretty nice.  We upgraded from the cheapest room that we had reserved and it was very clean.  The TV would mysteriously change channels on occasion, honestly that is the biggest complaint I have for the room.  

The pool isn't that big and it doesn't get deeper than 4 feet and that is only close to the volleyball net.  The pool area does stay shaded for a good portion of the day but I am so fair skinned that I didn't mind though my friends who were looking for a tan were a bit disappointed.  It was a great way to stay cool in the 100+ heat plus you are allowed to take your drinks with you in the pool.

I'd definitely stay at this hotel again and again!

My friend booked the hotel because she wanted to try it. It was my first time in Vegas, and I would definitely recommend this hotel!

We had a bunch of friends staying over at The Luxor, but oh my goodness, please just book at NY NY. Compared to Luxor, we had wi-fi, much thicker blankets, and a cleaner\/newer room (not moldy and damp like Luxor). Our view was okay; we could see the roller coaster. At times, we could hear people going down the coaster and screaming, but we weren't really in the rooms that much, and at night by the time we got back to the room to sleep, the coaster wasn't open so it wasn't a problem. Compared to Luxor, we also had a fantastic variety of places to eat on the main floor. The front desk was helpful and brought things to the room promptly (we requested more towels and hangers). The room service was also great (nothing was stolen ha!, they gave us enough towels, replenished and gave us a whole bag of toiletries, and tidied up our room well). We stayed in the New Yorker Tower, and the shoe-shiner was very pleasant and greeted me whenever I walked by. There is also an Italian restaurant on the main floor next to our tower (II Fornaio) that had happy hour specials (4-6pm?) that was pretty good. $7 entrees (pizzas) and entrees (we got calamari), $7 wines, and  cheap domestic beers. No complaints about this place!

Although, we didn't stay here. We came here to play and eat and let me tell you this place had a lot more going on then the Luxor which is where we stayed (borrrring!). We had dinner at the sit down Italian place which wasn't the best but was pretty decent. I got the Asparagus bisque and a huge salad. My table ordered a pretty good pizza and some seafood pasta dish to share. I thought it was well worth it and satisfying. This hotel can be a bit overwhelming though with the over the top trying to look like New York feel, and the amount of kids running around loosely without parents. Other than that, it was a good time.
Favorite casino on the strip! Probably because this is where I won the most money lol love the little shops, restaurants and bars in this Casino, as well as the atmosphere!

This was my first stay at New York New York and while I really like the casino and the wide variety of games and amusements featured, the hotel rooms were sub par at best and I was very disappointed at the lack of attention to detail and cleanliness.  The beds, nightstand and all moveable furniture need to be occasionally moved so that the vacuum cleaner can be used behind them.  When I went to open my draperies so that I could see my 360 degree view, I had to reach behind the giant wardrobe where the TV is housed.  It was disgustingly filthy.  Same situation behind the bed and nightstand - old garbage, papers, etc. shoved back there among 3 inches of dust.  It was digusting.  

We stayed in a Madison Avenue Deluxe Room in the Empire Tower.  While the room was huge with 360 degree views of Vegas, the room was also very nasty and dated.  The decor looks tired, worn and everything from the carpeting to the draperies and bedding need to be replaced.  Very, very well-worn in every respect.  The bathroom was in really rough condition and needed to be remodeled. The faucet handles and sink were not ADA compliant, despite this being a functioning "handicapped accessible" room.

While I doubt that I'll stay here again due to the questionable rooms and the lack of cleanliness I experienced, I definitely love the casino.  They must have an awesome smoke filtration system because I never smelled smoke in the casino. I also enjoyed the many and varied options of restaurants to choose from and the new Hershey's Chocolate World store.  It's a great location and a nice, family oriented environment, but the rooms need to be upgraded ASAP and the upkeep improved.

Great stay. Our first time staying at this hotel. This was a few days of partying for my wife and I. Check in was very smooth. The desk clerk offered us a free room upgrade. Our room was spotless and had  a strip view. We ate at the America restaurant. The food and service were very good. On the last night we ate at Nine Fine Irishman, an Irish pub. There was a band playing while we ate. Again, the food and service were very good, and the ambiance with the live music made for a very memorable evening. 

Overall the entire stay was excellent. The reason for only four stars would be the limited hours on the pool area. It does not open until 10 am, I would prefer to get my swim in way earlier than that. 

We will definitely stay here again.

We stayed here for our wedding. The biggest disappointment for me was no coffee in the room, and nothing opens downstairs until 6. We're early risers anyway, but we also had a morning wedding to get us going, so good coffee early is important. I thought every hotel and motel nowadays had coffee in the room, or at least a good cafe open 24\/7.

The New York, New York hotel and casino is a great choice for your Las Vegas stay.  The hotel has a wonderful assortment of restaurants - Il Fornaio, Greenberg's, Gallagher's (amazing steaks!), etc.  The employees are efficient and friendly and the rooms are very comfortable and reasonably priced.  Beware of the $25 per night "resort fee" which is to cover telephone, swimming pool, and in-room WiFi (which was down most of the time we were here).

The dealers are friendly but not overly so and the general feel is not as hip as the Aria but not cheesy like most of the downtown hotel\/casinos.  And the location on the strip is ideal - convenient to stroll down Las Vegas Blvd., and close enough to the trams and all many of the other Casinos - Excalibur, Luxor, etc.

The swimming pool was closed during our stay but I took a peak and it looked very nice.  Parking is easy and the cigarette haze is about average as far as casinos for.  All in all a solid 3 1\/2 - 4 stars.

Booked the Marquis Suite for my birthday weekend just to relax with some good company. The room wasn't as fancy as the newer hotels on the strip, although it was very upkept so the price was still worth it. Our suite (Rm 2254) had the view of the roller coaster more than the strip itself. The bathroom was pretty casual and most of all, squeaky clean. Beds came out more comfortable than I expected. I was way too comfortable watching the Warriors get ready and blow another 3-1 lead this season. Mini fridge but no microwave. And of course my favorite amenity of the room had to be the jacuzzi itself. I damn near fell asleep in that thing about 5 times!

A couple reasons prevented me from giving this hotel 5 stars. Even though they stated that the final decision is made by housekeeping, no birthday greeting was put in the room as I requested over the phone. Room service wanted $40 for two champagne glasses (without the champagne). You now have to pay $10\/day for parking which was a waste due to the fact that they were just letting people leave without inserting the paid ticket. I tend to crave coffee in the morning after long nights and was kind of surprised to see that there had no coffee maker in the suite. I guess you can call me lazy for not wanting to stumble all the way down through the casino floor with a hangover looking for a barista.

I'd definitely recommend this suite to people who enjoy bumming out and relaxing.

Pleasantly surprised and I will be open to coming back "if the price is right".

Got a $118\/night rate on Priceline for Thur - Sun. My last time through Vegas I stayed at Caesars Palace but needed a place on the south end of the strip for a conference I was attending.

Gotta love the digitization of gambling: no "cha ching, cha ching, cha ching" deafeningly pounding into ear drums, no dirty coins to mess with for the gamblers in the crowd and video game looking  machines that almost tempted me into giving them some electronic cash (but not quite, lol).

The hotel, casino and shops were all clean (not a given in some of the place on the Strip), the staff were consistently friendly and attentive and the room was great. The wi-fi was free, if not super fast. The pool was well attended, although we didn't have time to do more than walk by the lucky sun worshipers. 

There we a couple of kids in strollers at New York New York, but no more than anywhere else on the Strip.

I wouldn't pay rack rate but if I can get a reasonable nightly rate, preferably $100 or less but up to $130 in a pinch, I will be back.

Oh New York New York, I am so glad we did not stay here, I am writing this review solely on the casino. 
The casino gets SO confusing after the while because of the layout, there is a bar in the center and all the tables are around. Every time I went to the restroom, I would come back and have no idea where my friends were and I have a great sense of direction, seriously. It's just like New York City, so crowded. 
One waitress was a BITCH, we were tipping her all night and I was getting change to give her a tip and she walked away Rolling Her Eyes at me, I guess I wasn't fast enough..effing wait a second!! My friends and I asked the dealer why she didn't like us and her reply was, "You didn't tip her", we've been tipping her all damn night!!! 
The drinks were shit too, and the dealers had on gross t-shirts or something. 
It's a cool atmosphere but the waitress and dealer just turned me off.

The one thing I love about this place is cheap food and the MANHATTAN EXPRESS, if you haven't been on it, goooo, but not after drinking a lot. You might throw up.

:)

Great party atmosphere. 24 hour lobby buzz. Not too big. Not too small. Not going to find some exotic flower garden. Not going to find a marble water fountain. Lots of other cools stuff that you will not find in the other fancy places. No 20 minute walks from bar to bar. Excellent place to stay if your young and looking for a party hotel.

First time staying here. Liked the convenience of their location, central to what I was looking for. Checked in late at night and just beat the crowd, getting there before midnight. Rooms are nice, nothing out of the ordinary. Clean and comfortable what else could you ask for? Food options are not great but I really enjoyed the Nathan's pretzel dogs. Nice sized casino with all the games you could want. Cocktail servers were attentive and kept the drinks coming. Nice fitness center that apparently doesn't seem to get much usage. Daily resort fee includes daily USA Today from the gift shop, free fitness center access, free internet (wireless and wired.) Would stay again.
I don't know if I ever stayed at this hotel but I always go here for restaurants and the piano bar. It's a fun place to walk around and the dueling pianos is lots of fun with a group of people.

In the land of Vegas, New York looks beautiful but the casino inside is meh.. There's a decent food selection and the rooms are nice and clean. But I've stayed at several hotels in Vegas and I know this one is one I won't be going back to. 

The highlight of this place is the Piano Bar. Its located near big hotels, but its not even close to the central part of the strip. Everything is being build around Venetian and expanded out the opposite way, so to get to the Bellagio or Caesars requires a cab. And their sports betting area is just a huge disappointment.

They charge for daily parking $18 bucks .. got a simple two queen bed room and no fridge provided.. nice hotel so I expected more. The room was average I feel like even Excalibur  provides a better service... but the pizza is amazing

Smokey, dirty, run down rooms and cheap I mean cheap toiletries!  Horrible customer service on anything related to the hotel room.  I paid a premium for weekend rates and should of stayed at The Signature Towers at MGM that I could of got much cheaper!  Reason I mentioned the Towers is because I ended my Vegas trip staying at them and wish I would've booked my whole trip their to begin with.  I do not recommend unless you like smokey, dirty rooms with a high price tag.

I've been wanting to stay at NYNY for a couple of years now, ever since wandering in late one night and having a slice of pizza while listening to the dueling pianos. It's one of my favorite Vegas memories. 

So I finally booked it for an overnighter this weekend. There were pros and cons. 

On the pro side, I love the atmosphere. The designers really did a great job of capturing the vibe. It's one of the reasons I wanted to stay here. 

I used the mobile check-in when I got the email, and estimated our arrival as 12:30 p.m. I got a second email at 10:30 a.m. saying our room was ready, and to go to the keycard kiosk at arrival. So technically  I was able to be in my room at 10:30 a.m. had I been there, which is really impressive considering check-in time is 3 p.m.! I did not pay for early check-in, but it is available if you want to guarantee access to your room by 11 a.m.

Our room number was 772, which ended up being a fair view. It was part roof, but had a great view of the hotel's front sign and the MGM across the street. At NYNY I'd rather have the roof than the noise of the roller coaster going past my window. Our room was very quiet. 

Another thing NYNY gets props for is quick valet service. I have never been at a hotel with faster car delivery. Also, when you are a guest of the hotel, you get in and out valet service at all MGM properties (most of the Strip) until almost midnight of the day you checkout for $20. That includes the Bellagio. That's a great deal and they have it down to a science. 

On the con side, there is no security stationed at the elevator area entry points. I would highly suggest they rethink this, and have security checking guest key cards as many other Strip hotels do. 

Even though the hotel is non-smoking, there was a noticeable amount of marijuana smoke on our floor, in the casino, and outside the property during our stay. 

The dueling piano bar was not nearly as much fun, or as good, as the night that made me want to stay here. It was a major disappointment. The new area called The Park, however, is a very nice space. 

My main negative experience was the lack of a comfortable pillow, which led to no sleep and a sore neck. I didn't contact housekeeping because it was 2 a.m. when I realized the pillow was hard as a rock. The hotel needs to provide a medium firm pillow option in the room. Two for a king bed. 

I'm happy I stayed, but it's one and done for me.

First time to Las Vegas, and first airplane ride since I was an infant (1985!!!) - lots of emotions, but landing in this city, and staying at this hotel made the whole trek so worth it!!  The initial reason for the visit is to celebrate a good friend's birthday. Lots to visit inside the building as well - from playing the machines, getting your chocolate fix at Hershey's Chocolate World, or being sun-kissed at the pool.

Sidenote: we spent 2 hours in the pool area (103 degrees that day)- it was so refreshing! One of (many) highlights of the trip was to actually enjoy, being confident!, when entering the pool- there was no finger-pointing, nor rude jokes, or fat-shaming. Unfortunately I've experienced that back home a time or two.  Everyone was enjoying the desert heat, visiting with others, the DJ music was AMAZING! The best Sunday Funday ever!

THANK YOU! I'm having Las Vegas withdrawals, and looking forward to my next visit. We all had a fun time!!!

We booked many rooms in advance and they took our credit card but when we tried to check in they were overbooked and we had zero rooms.  They sent us to Monte Carlo but we had to check out at 11 and had to wait another 4 hours to check in.  Been going there since it opened and referred many players but will not go back after this.  They basically told us they overbook rooms and if you are not a big player you are out. The

We stayed here for one night last week and I would definitely stay again. We booked a cheap package that included an upgrade to a strip view, a few free drinks and a buy one get one free breakfast. Couldn't get the check in girl to upgrade us any extra but the room was close to the elevator, pretty & new looking and had a decent view of the strip. It wasn't amazing but for the price ($90) it was perfect.
I give them extra stars for paying for our trip. Yes, we actually left with more money than we came with. The boyfriend kept coming back with black chips from the blackjack table and I was having a grand old time with the penny slots. First I won $75 on some insane bright flashing penny slot, then I won $200 on one right by the door. Yes, $200. On a $2 bet. Good times!
We saw Zumanity while we were here too which was awesome though alot of the audience seemed really uncomfortable. Look, it's Vegas! Where else can you see hot naked flexible people!?! Anyway, it was one of the less expensive Cirques we've seen and I'd totally see it again.

NY NY's pretty decent.  The registration process was smooth, the staff was friendly, and my room was upgraded for free.  Score.

There's a lot to see and do, restaurant and bar\/club-wise, and between Nine Fine Irishmen, Rok Vegas, the ESPN Zone, and the Bar at Times Square, there's a wide variety of places to throw away your hard-earned cash.  None of those places are especially good (minus Rok Vegas; didn't make it there), but there's still variety.  And there's a roller coaster.  Woot.

On the downside: 1) The layout makes it really easy to get lost; 2) Its end-of-the-strip location sucks; and 3) the water in my room smelled like sewage.

I'd definitely stay at NY NY again, especially because the rates are so low these days, but there are definitely several other hotels I'd want to try first.

The GOOD- Rooms and Price- for the Price I was very happy with the room- our floor was quiet and our room had a great view at night! Very clean and bathroom stocked and the linens looked clean- nothing smelled. 
The Good- Valet for car- quick- never waited more than 10 minutes to retrieve the car- 
The ok- no in room coffee- of course and Starbucks only choice in the Hotel\/Casino
The Bad- no HOT water for drinking- unless you want to pay $9 plus tax plus tip for some to be brought up via room service... 
Lots of smoking in casino.. I know.. but I am not a smoker.. seemed smelly in the casino.. but again that's part of the atmosphere.. 
SO what did my $15.00\/per day "resort fee" cover??? Guess I should have made use of the coupons in the book.. but none of the eating choices seemed to be on my list... everything quit serving breakfast at 11 on Sunday... that seems early after Saturday night but... 
For the price and the room though I would stay here again-

We got the room with the Jacuzzi which came in handy! I just wished they provided some bubble bath stuff... guess we coulda used some shampoo but instead we purchased a highly overpriced small bottle down the street at CVS lol! Guess we live and learn right! 

But no fridge???? Really??? That was the worst thing about the room. My friend picked and purchased this room which was fine so I don't have much room to complain but what they charge for a somewhat upgraded room compared to the average room you'd think there'd be a fridge. We managed with ice but still a mini fridge would be great! 

I had fun spending some time at the swimming pool. Service was great, music was perfect & I just had a great time relaxing by the poolside! 

It's a clean hotel. Beds are comfortable. I probably wouldn't choose this hotel when I return to Vegas compared to some other places I've stayed.

Easy to navigate casino.  The center bar was a fun spot to hang out while I was waiting for my friends to get out of a show.  Some good places to eat, but didnt try anything.  Big plus is they had Stone IPA in bottles, yum! :)

I will not stay at this hotel again. When we got to the room it smelled like weed. The room was also very dusty, like they hadn't cleaned the room all the way. We called down to the front desk and complained. They sent someone to spray air freshner. The smell was so strong we had to leave. The next morning the room still smelled like weed again. We called down to the front desk again and they said they would make a note on our account. They said they would send someone up to ozone our room. Which next happened. We left for the day and came back to our room still smelling like weed and also now like cigarettes. I have asthma. It was so bad I had to use my inhaler. We continued to call down and ask what our options were and they said air freshener. They said they would leave a note about the smell so we wouldn't get charged because it was a non-smoking room. At check-out the lady at the desk said that we only had one complaint on our account and should have been moved to another room if we had been continuing to complian.  Which was never offered. I will not be returning to this hotel. She only offered to take two of the resort fees off our bill. But that's all. Worst service I have had in Vegas so far.

The glamour and the lights of the face of the hotel gives it a "wow", looks like a great hotel. However, it isn't as "wow" as we thought. It is okay. I am disappointed to say this. From the time we checked it was frustrating. They "guarantee" you a room by 3:00pm. You are encouraged to use the mobile check-in, which we did. Once confirmed check-in by mobile, they tell you that they send you an email in which you then take to the mobile check-in kiosk to scan and create your rooms keys. What really happened was----I did not receive an email and it was 45 minutes past my check-in time. The check-in line was outrageous so I went to the gold M line and inquired. I was assisted immediately---"sorry, yes, Housekeeping is running behind, but let me check to see if your room is ready. Oh, yes, it is ready. I will help you check in." This person, which I regret not getting her name, was so helpful. 

When we get to the room in the , it is spacious and clean in appearance. The carpet was freshly vacuumed. There are few amenities. No coffee or tea, no water, 1 shampoo, 1 conditioner, 2 soaps and 2 body lotions. There is a $35 in resort fee, claiming to support the amenities that they provide. For $85 a night, plus $12 parking fee, plus $35 -----ummmm, this is not worth the money. The eateries and shops located within the hotel are descent. The best part is the roller coaster. But, you don't have to stay here for the roller coaster. 

It is in close proximity, walking distance, to Luxor and Mandalay Bay---which was a plus for us since we booked several shows there. Overall, 3 stars.

This hotel I stayed at a few months ago.  The staff there is great and the trip booked through expedia.  Upon check in there was a line of about 5 or 6 people with the 2 open lanes both customers had problems about the rooms.

I just waited got my room.  The room was nice and clean and stayed that way the entire time I was there.  3 nights it was quiet as if no one was next door.
