The casino has gaming just like any other.  It's located at the end of the strip but wasn't a problem.  Parking my car in the lot was no problem and no charges for doing that.

I ate at the Italian restaurant which wasn't as good as I thought it would be.  But the sports bar in the hotel I have a review for that later.

The check out was optional and I just texted message my check out.  No hassles no fuss.  The room also had a small safe which I used and had no problems.

Second stay this year. Easy check in. Rooms are nice. Great dueling piano bar. Valet parking was easy both in & out. Beware of the chocolate martini bar. Evil. Casino staff are friendly. Coffee shop by the elevators are really fast. In the the words of that famous philosopher, Arnold Swartzenegger. I'll be back.

My husband and I have never, in our ten years of marriage, taken a trip outside of Oregon. We decided to celebrate our 30th birthdays in Nevada, and booked the New York New York for one night. We were excited to get away and have fun.

We booked our reservations in February and arrived for our stay on July 12th, right at check in time. The man at the front desk said our room would not be ready for TWO HOURS because there had been a lot of guests the night before who had not checked out on time, and they needed time to clean the room. I'm sorry - the last time I checked, a reservation secured a room for the exact check in time listed!

He was unapologetic and actually seemed very bothered by us being there. We stood and waited and told him we'd need to be in a room as soon as possible. He put us in the next room "up," which was the Players Suite. 

How awesome. It was directly off of the elevator, so all night long, we were woken up loudness. Not only that, but there was a $22 "Resort Fee" that was supposed to include wi-fi, and no one gave us the password. Even better was the roller coaster outside of the window, which was a cool concept until we realized that every time the roller coaster departed, the reception on our TV went out. 

The one and only perk was that the bed was comfortable. But this was NOT worth the hassle or the money we paid.

I always stop by and get a massage at NyNy. Right by the escalators very convenient. Good stress reliever.

I like the sports book here even though it's kinda small. There's a snack place right behind it with the best popcorn.

Always gotta try the $5 Wheel of Fortune in the high limit area. $20 investment and got a "spin", won $200! Yay!

We didn't stay here this time but always make time to visit, we love this casino!

I stayed here with a friend when I visited Vegas for the 1st time ever in 2006 for my 21st birthday. I love it's New York City theme and you really get your money's worth here. It's right on the Las Vegas strip so it's close to everything, the rollar coaster is great too that they have here!!. Stay here when you come to Sin City!!

We stayed at the nearby Monte Carlo but kept coming over here because the scene was much more lively with the singing at the Bar at Times Square and other things going on.  Lots of traffic flowing thru too so we stayed and played the slots.  And just like earlier in the year when we came here, the waitresses were pretty good at finding us and hitting us with the "free" drinks.    Also yelling from the rollercoaster as it slides in from the track outside make for a loud but fun feeling place.  Too bad they closed down the ESPN place though.

Never stayed here but have visited a couple times - don't like it. My mom is from NYC and even she didn't like it. Not to be snobby but maybe it should be called new jersey, new jersey. the layout is crappy. walkways are small & always blocked by slow walkers chit chatting. the decor is a little dorky too - it's like nyc overdone. the gambling is good though. the coaster is good too

My boyfriend and I stayed at NY, NY for total of four nights and had an overall satisfying experience. The first two days our room faced the pack of the strip where extensive construction work was taking place and continuous jack hammering started at 6am. After addressing the issue, we were moved to a different room facing the front of the strip, and we were very much pleased our concern was addressed. The hotel had unique charm with variety of restaurants that we got to enjoy day and night. Must say my favorite drink was the Hurricane at the Big Chill Bar. The sales girl in the America Donut Shop had "the best attitude".The crowd was well balanced with visitors from all ages. We will definitely consider staying at NY, NY on a future visit.
Très sympa de l'extérieur, un peu plus décevant de l'intérieur, mais qui est très sympa quand meme, un bar "Coyote ugly' comme à NY, des tables de jeu de partout, du Las Vegas pur quoi!!!

This place is great!!! We came here for Spring Break and really enjoyed our stay, and did not have a problem while we were here.

You exit the highway and you make a left to enter the New York New York. If you miss the left, you can go right up to the light at Las Vegas Blvd and make a left, turn left again into the Monte Carlo lot and make another left at the 1st stop sign. It sounds more confusing than it is.

Anyways, I wasn't sure how the parking would be since the parking structure wasn't very big in comparison to the hotel and it was spring break. We had no problem finding a spot, and I recommend that you park on the 3rd floor of the garage so that you can go directly into the casino\/hotel w\/out having to hassle w\/ a lot of elevators.

Once inside it was very lovely, and had a pleasant odor. It's pretty straightforward to get to the registration desk...my only gripe was that you had to take an escalator to get down to that level, we did not see an elevator nearby. The line was really long since I got there right at check in time, but it moved super quick. The girl at the desk was very sweet and was able to answer any questions that I had. She asked me if I had a players card, I said no and she was very polite about it and did not try to pressure me in to signing up for one. I asked if it would be possible to have 2 beds (I booked on a 3rd party site and bedding was guaranteed above 1 bed) and that's what I got.

Our room was in the Century A, up on the 19th floor. The only thing I wish the girl at check-in would have done was explain the elevators better. There are 6 elevators in the Century set, but 2 of them you cant take if you are on floors 19 and under. I realized after that the elevators are marked above, but at the time I did not see that sign.

The elevators are SUPER SUPER FAST!!! We were on the 19th floor and I thought it would be a pain waiting for the elevators and then the ride would be slow, but I was wrong. I dont really care to ride in an elevator, and I will always prefer the stairs over one, but these zoom up and down. I used my timer on one ride, and it took less than 27 sec to get from the ground floor up to the 19th w\/ a stop at the 18th floor.

We got to our room...after walking around corner after corner after corner and ended up almost to the end of the hotel. We arrived in our room and it was one of the cleanest rooms. The beds were made very nice, the bathroom was clean and everything was in working order. My only gripe is that they only provided one tube each of shampoo and conditioner, as well as one tiny bar of soap. And the toilet paper that was on the roll was 3\/4 used. I don't mind that so much, but I would like a whole new roll for my stay in addition.

Our room had a nice little view of the pool and of the rollercoaster. I wasnt sure about how I would feel about the coaster, since I read in previous reviews that it was a source of noise, but we didnt have any problems. We actually enjoyed looking out the window as the coaster would zoom by. 

The sucky thing is that the pool closes EARLY, like around 5-6pm. My kids were bummed cause they wanted to go swimming, but we didnt get a chance to try it out cause we didnt want to waste the day exploring Vegas.

We really enjoyed our stay here, and would def go back. The facilities and rooms are very clean and the employees we encountered are friendly and helpful.

First, got a great price on the room through bookit.com.
The room was nice and clean, no issues with the room. Really liked the downtown area that looks like old school New York City. The only issue I really had was the wifi. I couldn't connect because of their slow Internet connection.  So no Internet during my stay.

I have stayed here a few times and have enjoyed my stay each time. It IS Las Vegas and it's expensive and there are resort fees and extra charges just like every other hotel on the strip. We got in pretty early and I thought I would ask if they had an available room. They did, but there was an "early check-in fee" of $24 (I think). We went ahead and paid the fee and checked in. It was on the 5th floor and we had an okay view of the mountains (and the roller coaster and roof). The sound of the coaster isn't bad and never bothered us. Maid service was great and never had any issues. It was a smallish room, but very functional. I thought the bed was quite comfy. The casino is large and the have plenty of restaurants to choose from.
Notes to self: don't go back. Surfaces in the room were dusty, there were cracks in the grout of the marble tile in the tub and when I stepped on the fiberglass tub bottom it made "squishing" sounds.

I heart New York-New York! 

The skyscrapers, Statue of Liberty, roller coaster, the Fire Dept boat and harbor all make this an  incredible icon on the strip. I even love the bathrooms here, they have a real subway feel, just without the smell. The interior of the casino is electric. Lots of food choices, lots of bars and clubs. Rooms are okay, and you can get pretty good deals to stay here. Service on the casino floor is a little slow for drinks, but our waitress brought us two at a time. (Yay!) The best thing I can say is that the strip wouldn't be the same without it, and I will always lose some of my money there on any visit to Vegas just to make sure they keep the lights on.

We did not stay here, only gambled and hung out. We decided to check it out because we heard they had $5 minimum black jack tables all night. Well they do, but they only have two so good luck trying to actually play at one of them. We ended up at a $10 minimum roulette table and had a great time. My husband played and I watched, we were there for maybe 30 minutes and were offered one drink, the service seemed slow. We then headed to the little pizza place right by Coyote Ugly, I can't remember the name but it was delicious! It was actually better then pizza I had in New York City! We then headed into Coyote Ugly, we got a "special pass" so in before 9 you get free admission all night and 2 for 1 drinks till 9. We then headed back out to the casino for another hour or so, and then got to cut the line to head back into Coyote Ugly. Overall we had a great time here, the casino and bars are a really good time!

Good cheesy fun!  Decided this was a 'no' on a place to stay since we've been to NYC, why would we stay in a hotel dedicated to it?  But I must admit we had a lot of fun eating Brooklyn style pizza, taking pics with fake mermorablia and wishing Coyote Ugly was open to have good sleazy fun!  This place made my partner from NY miss home again.  Didn't do the rollercoaster b\/c that was about a 3rd of the price as going to a Six Flags, and didn't look so fantastic.  Clean hotel, fun hostesses and all around good fun for a classic Vegas hotel!

We chose New York NY this time for our annual trip & we are glad we did.  The rooms were nice, service was great & the gambling was really good.  I will review some of the individual eateries within New York NY separately but great options there also.  Overall very happy with everything.

Stay at the Monte Carlo. The bars and casinos are better. The casino at NY NY is too busy, the layout of the hotel is confusing, and service is slow. The restaurants have great food though. 

I rarely take the time to write reviews, but I felt compelled to write about how terrible our room was. The sink had the smell of sewage in the pipes, the TV kept changing channels by itself, there was a cigarette burn in the bed spread, and they only gave us two flat pillows. I had to ask for them to bring more and that took 30 minutes! And, the concept of being "environmentally" friendly is a load of crap, like all hotels. 

Find a hotel where resort fees are included if you're not going to use any spa or fitness services. Paying extra money for things I didn't use was a waste. 

The food at all of the restaurants were great. I recommend staying at another MGM resort hotel and then go to New York-New York for food or drinks. Seriously, you'll see the difference in all of the hotels when you visit and you'll find the layout and gift shops are A LOT better.

Stayed here two nights, had a ton of fun, a lot to do, casino was great (lost money though #cry) and the dealers were all very fun. Check in was a bit of a disaster but everything was sorted out eventually.

There was an arcade which was great and a roller coaster!!! A f***** roller coaster which is just like #yasssss. The coaster was a little rickety, but still had two awesome loops, great view of the strip, and fun times around. 

Plenty of options for food, was a bit pricey in some places, but ate at a couple of places and it was really great! Parking was okay, the garage is huge so make sure you remember where you park. You have to pay which is kind of a bummer, feel like parking for people staying in NYNY should get free parking, but whatever. Overall great stay, and had a ton of fun!

In the center of this casino, there are three well-lit signs advertising restrooms. Do not believe them. Because after this hellhole of a casino takes a good chunk of your hard-earned cash, and plies you with watered-down drinks, for good measure they enjoy having a laugh at your expense by making you wander around looking for restrooms that don't exist. No men's room, no women's room, no gender neutral washroom, just three absolutely bs signs leading to nowhere. This place is a toilet

Would definitely stay here again. Wished we were on a higher floor, but great place to stay. Best part: fantastic, comfortable bed! When we came back at 2am, it was nice to sleep in such a great bed! Loved the rollercoaster and all the great restaurants. The pool was nice and the staff was great! Just wish housekeeping didn't replace the bathroom towels each day as we were trying to be green... ya know conserve water and energy and such!

So for my 19th Anniversary we booked a suite at this hotel. Upon arrival to our room there were no toiletries.  No soap,shampoo, etc. I had to call THREE times and waited over an HOUR to receive the basic necessities at a hotel.

There is no refrigerator, no coffee machine. Why is this called a suite I ask?   Totally unacceptable. Very disappointing

The Good, The Bad and the Ugly..

My husband and I stayed at the NYNY from July 13-16th.  I earned one night free stay by playing MyVegas on  facebook plus $75 in free play; which is a great reward for just playing around on facebook and not actual spend in the casino. 

We arrived around 2PM and the check in line was pretty long but nothing overwhelming. I was expecting a bigger crowd because when I looked on line, there was zero availability in the hotel that day if you wanted to make a reservation.  When we were finally called , I casually asked if there where any upgrades available and was told that for $15 I could upgrade from a Park Ave King to a Madison Avenue comer suite with strip view . so we took it (or a tacky spa suite for an extra $45 bucks-No thanks) . Upon reflection, I should have asked it any  FREE upgrades were available since if the hotel was showing ZERO availability and there are upgrades, it means they over sold the lowest category (the one we were staying in) and would have to upgrade folks anyway.

The room was nice, clean and spacious..the down side is that we were right across from the roller coaster, which we could hear at night. If you are a sound or heavy sleeper, it would probably sound like being in a wind tunnel and not too bad. If you are a light sleeper, you could also hear the screams of the riders and it probably sounded more like being in a hurricane. 

I think a $30 PD resort fee is pretty steep, especially when they don't even have coffee makers or mini fridges in the room.  We tipped our house keeper $5 per day and she did nice job of straightening our room up when we were out, even if it was later in the afternoon.

All the cocktail waitresses were very nice and genuinely appreciative of tips. Another plus for the hotel is they hired folks of all shapes, sizes and ages. From an HR perspective, I think that is awesome . especially when the image of Vegas is show girls galore. 

Over all, the employees be it in the shops, casino floor, or restaurants were pleasant and\/or engaging. 

We stopped by the players club on the way out and were happy to learn we earned enough points to have a nights stay and resort fees comped...so be sure to sign up for an Mlife account and if you like to play, stay within MGM casinos to get credit for it. ETA Make sure you do this before you check out or  otherwise the bill is finalized. Also remember, if you booked your air and hotel as a package from a third party site, there also isn't a lot of comps they will be able to offer you after the fact since you have pre-paid with another company. 

On the down side, as someone else on yelp pointed out there is a huge transient problem on the walk way that connects the NY NY to the MGM. I would think this private property and they could have security clear it out.  Going from one casino to another shouldn't feel like crossing the river Styx where guests are subjected to 'bum fights' (it seriously happened)..aggressive pan handlers and disgusting signs asking for money such as "Need money for PXXXX " if you want to know what the p-word is..think of kitty cats. 

PS A really touching gesture was in remembrance to the victims of the terrorist attack in Nice, France, the US flags outside the hotel near the statue of Liberty were flown at half staff.

Stayed one night, check in was easy and we ended upgrading for a fee.

Inside, the room is starting to need updating. The edges of the tub faucets etc have mineral buildup i think thats what it is etc which i find alittle concerning, it just makes the sink and tubs dirty.

Everything else was ok, night stands were dusty. And could of used a wipedown. Tv had premium bose sound system which was nice. Two windows with view were awesome.  We were up on the 34th floor new yorker tower. The elevator was sort of like a private one and there were only 3 other suites on our floor. In room service was a bit pricy but its Vegas, to be expected. Overall good experience, good service
First place I ever stayed in Vegas it was like 13 years ago. It has aged well. Roller Coaster rocks!

Went to Vegas for the first time back in February for a conference and stayed at the NY NY. The conference was at Mandalay bay and I found the hotel good in that sense as it was close to the conference but also not too far from the rest of the strip. Check in was quick. We had a strip view room which was clean and had a very comfortable bed. There was no fridge in our room and we wanted one to keep alcohol in. Asked for a fridge and had one brought 10 minutes later which no questions asked or no extra charges! Lots of dining options in the hotel, a store (for buying drinks, snacks etc) and the hershey's store which was pretty cool. There is also the roller coaster which I could see from our room but never got a chance to go on - hopefully next time! Overall good value for your money and would definitely consider staying here again next time!

Never come to the america restaurant inside of new york new york. I waited 30 mins for a tuna sandwich and it tasted like shit. A tuna sandwich??? Really? I got better service like everywhere else ive ever been. If your drunk in vegas please go to mcdonalds. It will piss you off a lil less.
Great hotel! I love the atmosphere. Restaurant section on the casino floor is so cool!

First time at NY NY Vegas, umpteenth time in Vegas. First, good choice for our family, one teenager and pre-teen. They liked the shops and proximity to m & m store, coke store, etc. Good selection of restaurants...we went to America, Nine Fine Irishmen, and Starbucks. See my other reviews. As expected, be prepared to pay through the nose, and slots and gaming not very loose (you are on the strip, don't forget). The roller coaster was a blast, thank god it was 2 for 1 with our room key. The arcade seemed fine, but because our kids had their electronic devices, they didn't really need it. I thought the layout was good....easy to get to everything. We got a great room deal, BUT and this is really my only complaint...the room "run of the house" was so so. Small bathrooms, but really big foyer. No microwave, desk, or coffee maker or fridge. Just lacking in some basic amenities that almost decent hotel room would have now. Next time, would probably aim for a suite. Otherwise, fun hotel. Would stay again.

The New York New York is now one of the older hotels on the strip and is on the Tropicana, Las Vegas blvd. intersection. This hotel is far less glitzy than the newer luxury hotels and I can't speak of the rooms other than they are decent and nothing special or bad. The best thing about NY NY is they house Zumanity!! Taking a night to do a themed evening and hitting Zumanity and the Piano bar would be about the only thing I would recommend but this is definitely something fun to see on the inside.
Really lousy service people at the rollercoaster. You know the kind, that don't have any power in life, so they take it out on their customers and threaten to call security if you roll your eyes.

Paid $20 for a taxi, $14 for a roller coaster ticket, waited in line for 30 minutes and was told I couldn't ride because I had a cellphone. They told me I should have put it in a locker half an hour ago. As I leave I see other people carrying cellphones and asked an employee why someone wasn't warning these people. The girl replied 'As long as they don't get caught, it's fine.'

Good hotel\/casino to crash at out in Vegas. Nice location. Across from the MGM and near all the cool shit on the strip.
Got a chance to catch the show Zumanity... That was sexy!!! 
That roler coaster was one of the best I've ridden. I'll ride that ride every time I go to Vegas. Left my neck sore the next day but I don't care :)

Awesome roller coaster

And amazing M&M world

All I know is that this place is entertaining

The resort fee is one of the biggest rip-offs in the world. The rooms are old, with a 1970 style thermostat. The internet is terrible, and you don't need to be paying them for printing your boarding pass

I was there for a convention and had a very bad experience.The room was so dirty I couldnt believe it, there were hair all over the bed spread and dust all over the room.The bathroom had no ventilation and the room had the smell of sewer at all times.I dont get it the hotel was built only eigtheen years ago not fifty years ago how can there be no ventilation in the bathroom.
There a few good things there the black gentelman who is called the Sax man was great,the hotdog place and the shower head.
I will never go there to this motel like place again.

Second time staying at this hotel in the past few years. A better experience the first stayin 2009. We stayed for 3 nights this past week in the Broadway Deluxe Room. Check in on a Thurs afternoon was painfully slow, the temp in the room was not cold enough, bad cell recept in the room, and very slow wi fi. Now for the yucky parts...the pool appeared to have vomit or something of the same consistency in one section of the pool and as we dove into bed the first night, there were crumbs as if someone had just eaten a sandwich. Blehhhh!! We requested housekeeping to exchange out all of the bedding, both beds which they did so.
We did not go back in the pool the rest of our stay. Duh. 
A few things we DID enjoy: the arcade had a great variety of games. The restaurants throughout the hotel was fabulous and we love walking through the shops and deli\/cafes admiring the decor of old New York. Slot games - good variety too.

Very big casino. Clean rooms.  Moderately priced. Location is OK. It's on an extreme end of the strip. Takes about 12 minutes to walk to Belagio, Ceasar's etc.  1 mile away.  

The theme is NY city so there are a ton of little deli's and chinese restaurants and pizza stands etc.  Cool place.

However, they had no problem taking my money at the dice table at 4 AM on my way back in from the bar.
Rooms are big but empty, lack of furnishing.  It is located in a convenient part of the Strip.  Easy access to the airport and I-15.
new york new york never disappoints. Love the theme and decor. love the rollercoaster ask for the 2 for 1 deal. love nathan's hotdog. room is clean with comfy beds.

The hotel isn't bed, the rooms are a little boring, but the casino floor and restaurant areas are great.  The person I shared a room with is a MGM properties VIP but for some reason we got stuck at the last room tucked in the corner with no view.  Our walk from the elevator was a longer walk than any of the walks in the casino.  It was kind of a bummer.

This review is strictly for the Concierge. I called today at 9p to ask if America is still 24 hours and when they serve their rib-eye dinner special. The Concierge is friendly, asks to place me on hold and she says she's going to call America and provide me with the information about the rib-eye dinner as she is unsure, but she is able to confirm with me that America is 24 hours. She comes back on the line after no more than 20 seconds and says "The ribeye dinner special is served between 4p-7p and 12a-4a." Great! I tell her that my husband and I will be going tonight to eat and we end our conversation. My husband and I then plan our whole night around this late night, early morning dinner and go downstairs to eat and gamble for about and two hour. By now, we have had about 5 Washington Apple drinks each while gambling and are starving. At 11:56a we decide to walk to America to get in line and what do you know?! They are closed for deep cleaning!!!! WTF NYNY Concierge!!! Why wouldn't you tell me this when I'm on the phone with you?! My husband and I constantly stay here, partly for the America steak dinner special and the fact that we have an awesome casino host name Dean who takes care of us! We are extremely pissed and disappointed with you! You will be getting a complaint from me tomorrow when you open and you will be comping my husband and I dinners to America because your service was utterly disappointing today. Just be ready tomorrow, because you're going to get a much bigger earful that the poor hostess at the Burger Bar who had to hear our complaints or better yet, why don't you contact us? We are here until Saturday, 4\/29 and in room 854. Maybe redeem yourselves a little, because I don't even want to write about the cockroach we found in our Marquis Suite bathroom!! I'll just focus on your Concierge!!!

Stayed three nights in their spa suite- room was clean, bed was super comfy, water pressure in shower perfect and free Wi-Fi actually worked, big plus in Vegas-view of coaster and new T-Mobile arena, could hear riders at times as mentioned in other reviews but it was by no means disturbing, floor was actually pretty quiet vs other Vegas hotels. Property is easy to navigate, staff is very accommodating and friendly, bell hop even remembered my friends name from the day before! Pool area is bit small, but not my top priority for an early spring trip- nice selection of shops and restaurants, moderately priced and good food. I realized I left my favorite leather coat in the room as soon as I got to the airport (of course) and called the hotel. They found my coat within the hour and sent me a link to have it shipped back to me, reassuring me the whole time- and wow, coat was delivered within a week. Will definitely stay here again, 5 stars for the price and excellent staff!

Ótimos custo-benefício e localização. Bom pra famílias, casais, turistas em geral. Talvez ñ seja a melhor pedida para os solteiros que estejam atrás do glamour das baladas. O clima aqui é de Vegas sim, só que mais confortável. Me senti à vontade e recomendo! ;)

It's affordable and well located. Ideal for families, couples, tourists in general. Maybe it's not the best option for singles who are looking for fency & glamour of Vega's nightlife. Anyway, I felt free there and recomend it. ;)

Stayed from 4\/23-4\/25. Checked in around 12:30 am thanks to a delayed flight. Obvi, there was no one in line and it went very smooth. They upgraded our room due to being sold out of the rooms we originally paid for. Upgraded to Marquis suite on the 34th floor. Required a credit card for "incidentals", luckily I had one because apparently a debit\/credit card wasn't sufficient. Good thing I had mine with me, not sure what would have happened otherwise.

Room was huge, had a nice king bed and a couch, 2 TV's in the room and a Jacuzzi. Everything was clean from what I could tell. The room was non smoking and did not smell like smoke at all to me like some "non smoking" rooms tend to do. The Jacuzzi was big, but once it filled up the drain thing would not pop up so we couldn't drain it afterwards. Hope they were able to fix that..

The view was not bad. Looking out our window to the right you could see the Monte Carlo and the Aria off in the distance, plus the lights of the streets and buildings down below. In the daytime, you can see the roller coaster (and could also hear it). Meh

Wifi (for those who care) worked just fine on my phone. 

The casino and the restaurants and shops were cool. Tons and tons of slots, tables, etc. The inside was made to look like the streets of New York city, with different places to eat and shop, Coyote Ugly was upstairs although we didn't go in. There seemed to be enough to keep you busy for a while at this place, before you ventured out anywhere else.

 The only thing I hate is that the casino was SO SMOKY but I guess that's to be expected. Also, the first night we were there we were playing slots, and one of the waitresses came and took our drink order and pretty much never returned. When we did finally spot her again, she asked me if I needed anything...umm yeah I've been waiting on you for almost 30 minutes...you don't remember? She said she'd be right back and never saw her again. We gave up eventually and went to bed. Didn't have ANY luck with the slots here either.. so boo on that.

All in all, I enjoyed the stay, and because it was my first time in VEgas and I don't have anything to compare it to, this place gets 4 stars. I don't know if I'd hang out here though. Maybe...maybe not. There's too much to see and do to stay in one place too long :)

Great hotel, and casino. The casino is not enormous like other places it's just the right size, with plenty of bars and a big variety of restaurants to please most. Also the several Starbucks are all easily accessible, you don't have to hike a mile in the morning to get your coffee. all the staff is friendly, and helpful. Had a fun time a the roulette table, while enjoying good music, loved the atmosphere. Hope to return.

Rollercoaster = OMFG!

During a recent trip to Vegas, I didn't book a room at NYNY because they were more expensive than nearby Luxor and Excalibur.  I did, however, do the iconic Manhattan Express rollercoaster ride here-- which made for one of the most memorable experiences of my visit to Sin City!

Admission is $14 a pop (half price for a repeat ride), which is kinda steep for a thrill ride that's over in a couple of minutes.  We figured, 'what the hell, we're in Vegas!' and went ahead with it.  All I can say is WHOA!  This thing loops, twists, and plunges it's way along a skinny metal track high above the Las Vegas Strip and alongside the faux New York skyline.  It was a blast, but I was happy to step out of the roller-taxi alive and without tossing my cookies.  What a rush!

No cameras are allowed on the ride or in the loading area, but they'll sell you photos from your ride for $15 each (of course).  There's also a large arcade\/midway located just outside of the rollercoaster loading area

As for the rest of NYNY, it was pretty much the same as all the other mega-casinos on The Strip: lots of overpriced food and drink options, and of course tons of gambling.  As far as I could tell, the rollercoaster is really the only thing that sets this one apart.

Oh yeah- we also bought a 32oz daiquiri here for $16.  Not exactly a great value, but pretty damn tasty!

Soooo traveling from the Kansas City Missouri area, we visited this casino due to the Zumanity show, decided to spend some time and several hundred dollars. While I apparently have a daily limit of withdraw from my bank (unbeknownst to me because I don't normally do withdrawals) I had an issue with a cashier by the name of Debbie (older lady) with a "MAJOR"  need of some humanity and customer service skills...while she proceeded to talk to me like I was three simply because I didn't understand what the atm machine was saying by needing to go to the cashier to finish my transaction (for which I was trying to do and explain to her) upon my third or fourth attempt (my bank texted me asking if I had done said previous attempts, to which I responded yes, the bank texted back that I can resume to use my card again to which I did and OMG the look on Debbie's face as she sooooo reluctantly cared to help me with and btw the casino gets a heftier fee for doing so.....I could have been sooooo rude, crude and socially as unacceptable as she was to me...but I didn't..."management needs to put her back through some customer service skills where she doesn't treat people like second rate citizens"  for which I will never....ever come back to this specific casino again....I sincerely hope the next person she treats like this she gets fired or at least wrote up....customers are there for a reason.....till you give them a reason not to be your customers anymore....

Very nice. Went on the roller coaster - it was awesome. You were able to get a nice view of the strip. It was $14 - worth it.

Loved the casino - I won some money there, also lost some. Food is good - lots of options.

We stayed 3 nights here starting this last memorial day. Check in didnt take super long, maybe 30 minutes or so. We ended up upgrading the park avenue room to a spa room for an additional $29 per night as advertised through the email we recieved prior to our stay.

So we get our keys, go up to our assigned room, open it up and notice that peoples belongings are still in it. So we're like what the hell.. its no wonder there are reviews of peoples stuff getting stolen.  This is probably the majority of the reason why.

My husband goes down to talk to them and they say sorry and give us a room on a different floor and as far away from the elevator they could possibly give us, which was annoying. The room was nothing special. It was nice enough for what it was. The spa tub had a bunch of hair in it, so i didnt even want to get in it, and mold or crud around the jets that came off when i wiped it with a baby wipe. So housekeeping pretty much does a piss poor job cleaning, if they even do any at all.

My daughter had black feet from walking around for 10 min on the carpet. So gross. I washed her up and instantly put socks on her. Shampoo your carpets once in a while!

The following day we are out and about and go back up to our room to find that we're locked out. So my husband again, goes back down to get our keys fixed. They said it wouldn't happen again but it very well did the following day. This time i was pissed and went down there to the guest services desk where no one is to help you. All the other service people are checking people in and ignoring us standing there, so finally, i went up and interrupted someones check in to get help. She looked irritated but i didnt care. If they did their job right the first time, they wouldn't be bothered by crap like this and then i wouldn't be angry.

We didnt get a sorry, no resort fee comped, nothing for this irritating hassle. This hotel is one of the most unorganized ones i have stayed in.

The only thing decent was the bed. It felt comfortable.

The pool was like warm bath water. Wished it was colder on 100 degree days. I really hope they dont heat their pools?  That's pretty dang silly for the Vegas summer heat if they do.

The machines are tight, but the location and hotel is fun and entertaining which is why i give it 2 instead of 1. I will never stay here again, but i will probably pass through.

After a rocky start this AM when someone came into our room at 6:45 AM the assistant Front Desk manager, Robert S, a customer service superstar upgraded us to a bigger better suite in response and sincerely apologized - we had a stellar day at the pool and then at the Blackjack tables! 
Starting to love New York New York Las 
Vegas again.

This has been my go-to casino each time I'm in Las Vegas.
Why?

++ The casino itself is large, spacious and offers a ton of table games!
++ CASINO WAR! (let me tell you, as redic as this is, I won so much!)
++ Staff is ultra nice, friendly and so talkative - as many gamblers and guests are out of town visitors!
++ Free drinks on the casino floor when gambling!
++ EVERYTHING is NYC inspired - down to the food (NY Za' or Shake Shack anyone?), various neighborhoods featured throughout the casino (times square, the Village, Manhattan, etc), the Statue of Liberty along with other monuments, and the hustle and bustle of the city!
++ Roller Coaster - that goes both outside and inside!
++ Location is perfect as it is right next to Monte Carlo and directly on the strip!

We found ourselves here multiple times throughout our stay next door, and know we will be back! :)
I like the casino and would go back again.

Stayed here for two nights over MLK weekend. Got comped rooms so I can't speak to the rates. They do charge an $8.99 per night resort fee ($10.07 after taxes)... includes two drinks per stay (as opposed to per day), local and 800 calls, free newspaper (not delivered to your door, you have to pick it up at the convenience store) and 20% off at a couple restaurants (3p-7p only, however). 

Rooms are nothing out of the ordinary. What is out of the ordinary is the long ass walk to your room if you happen to get one at the end of the hall. Sure, it's a long walk to the end of the hall at any hotel, but this is a haul. It's a trek. A journey. I'm talking 146 paces from the elevator (yes, I counted). My stride is probably about two feet, so you're looking at about 300 feet, which is a football field folks. 

Another con: no poker room.

You can take a tram to luxor, excalibur and mandalay bay, not that you'd want to visit the first two anyway. Be warned though, the tram stops running at 10 or 10:30 most nights. I had to walk from Mandalay Bay to nyny at 4:30am, which while probably less than a mile, is not what you want to be doing at that hour. The only saving grace was the krispy kreme in excalibur appears to be open 24 hrs. 

Didn't have any meals there this trip, but I recall the pizza joint is pretty good.

Pour 24, a bar on the mezzanine, offers a decent selection of craft brews, beyond the usual bud, miller, coors colored water.

Stay away from this hotel!!! Customer service is the WORSE. Maid service don't show up. The whole trip was a disaster at this hotel!!! Takes forever to check in. Front desk I think are trained to be rude

Good visit - good staff.

Fluid flow of arrival to room to casino & eateries.

I enjoy a good craps game . . . Perhaps not highly recommended here just do to the lack of reminders to new players of table etiquette ( seems more like they need players over experienced players )

Poker room - again go elsewhere . . . Just no to little game here

Blackjack - play here ( roulette was also good ) . . . $ 5 blackjack & clean tables . . . Pluses

Rooms are comfy - staff accommodating - good location

Would return - given the competitive nature of the casino's needing customers it does reflect the stay was better than expected

I got a chance to stay here for a night in a complimentary room. I LOVE the interior decor, it has flare =) There's even street names! Some places to check out: Sirrico's for pizza (big slices of pizza for less than $5!), Fulton's Fish for fish n chips! Il Fornaio has good Italian food, but it's on the pricey side. Don't forget to take a ride on the roller coaster at night! Great views and fun!

Wifi comes with your room too. Big bonus in Vegas, where you usually have to pay for wifi!

Truly lived up to the reputation and its 4 star rating. I'm here because it's my birthday today and we got an incredible deal on rooms. $60\/night and $30 for reservation, which is something that covers the meals or something. This has been an awesome stay so far and the wifi is fast and four 4 devices is helpful. I'd definitely come back if the deals and prices are right.

I came here to gamble for a while and have a couple of drinks. I played Craps and placed several football sports bets too while I was here.

Nice casino, but I have yet stayed here while in Las Vegas. Someday...

Vegas Strong!!!

I attended a birthday party in Las Vegas on the last weekend of July 2015, and my girlfriend booked a reservation through LasVegas.com. We drove in from Los Angeles, and arrived at approximately noon to check in. 

The first surprise was that there was a $25 early check-in fee. We wanted to check-in and use the gym, but we were surprised we were being asked to pay a fee to get to our room early. We could also understand if our room was not ready, but it was. They were simply going to make us wait to check-in until 3pm, unless we were willing to pay a fee for the key.

When we got to the room, we were surprised that the Madison Avenue wing does not have any refrigerators.....unless you are willing to pay an additional $30. For THAT fee, they are more than willing to have someone roll a mini fridge up to the room right away. There is a space for a fridge, just no fridge. I gamed the system by trekking down to the ice machine, located at the very end of the floor, away from the elevators, near the fire escape, and loaded up the fresh trash can liner from the bathroom with enough ice to fill the sink and keep snacks we brought from home. Crisis averted!

We learned from other friends who booked rooms for the birthday party at NY NY(out of convenience) that NOBODY had a fridge in their room. One couple had a huge Jacuzzi tub, but no icebox. The running joke during the weekend was how NY NY was going to change the rooms in the future. Would you like a door on your room,....there is an extra fee for that! Perhaps in the future NY NY can improve their bottom line by having a dorm style bathroom, with a fee to unlock the private bathroom in each room for the day. Sounds like fun, doesn't it.

The casino is great, with lots of tables, and lots of free advice from the dealers. I have always played blackjack "by the book", and I found most of the advice given by the dealers was in the house favor, and I watched many people lose a boat load of cash from the advice. I came home ahead, but it was a greater fight to stay ahead than at other casinos, as most of the players at the blackjack tables think the dealers are "there for them", and they kept making plays based on intuition, or how much money they might lose if they were to double down or split when the dealer is showing a bust card. Regarding the environment, beware. There is a noticeable smokiness to the entire venue, and after a few hours in the casino I was feeling the effects. The smokers are not noticeable, but the filtration system in the hotel must need to be updated or serviced more often. You've been warned!!

The food at NY NY is fabulous. I would recommend this hotel for a destination resort, where you stay and eat at your casino, and only go to other locations for shows or events. This keeps your trip within budget, as taxis are expensive and filthy, and there is still a great deal of construction on the strip which slows down any commute to other venues.

If you are going to stay at NY NY, price your room with the amenities you need. If you go through a third party to book the room, be sure you have a fridge, and a view, and a Jacuzzi tub, or proximity to ice or the elevator. Without the amenities you need, any room at NY NY can blow your budget PDQ.

My brother and I meet each year in LasVegas for a week before Christmas. Today was the start of our annual 'games'! We stopped into the new  BierGarden and it was great! Fresh beer, solid bratwurst and great service.... we the went in to NYNY Casino to kill some time before our NHL game started ..... my brother went to craps tables... I went to roulette table...the video roulette game.... all of a sudden my ame crashed after 40 mins of playing..... I waited another 40 mins for mgmt to return my cash... no cocktail waitress the whole 1.5 hrs.... Worst Svc ever....
Make no mistake, me and my brother spend money... and gamble... mgmt at MGM resorts are the worst ....

This is the second time I have stayed here at NYNY. The staff was great. We arrived early and were given a room I asked for immediately. This kind of service alone makes me want to come back again and again.

After arriving to our room, we noticed it was very clean. My girlfriend ended up having bad allergies after the first night. I also woke up with allergies and I hardly get them. I'm an hvac technician, so my first thought was to check the filter for the a\/c and heating system. I looked inside the return grill and noticed the filter was clogged and filthy. That was the culprit of the allergy issues we were having. I called maintenance and the issue was addressed within 5 minutes. This is amazing service. 

This is the kind of service that all places should have. Overall we had a great time and we will definitely be coming back to NYNY.
Got a good rate from the players club. I will always recommend getting a players card for any casino. Any who, room was great with a view of the strip. The casino had great slots and was clean.

Came across an excellent deal on a JetBlue vacation package to Vegas and decided to give NY NY a try. I tend to go through Priceline for my hotel bookings, so it was nice to actually pick a place on my own for once. I am not too fussy about hotel accomodations, but I wanted to splurge a bit this time since it was Vegas and there are many great hotel resorts throughout the city.

Check-in is probably the hardest thing to do when you are staying a Vegas hotel. The lines tend to be very long. NY NY is a good hotel, but not one with the best profile so the line was not too bad here. Checkout is super easy though. You can even checkout using the TV!

I checked in at around noon so the room I wanted (king bed\/non-smoking) was not available. Rather than wait for a room, I checked into a 2 queen bed\/smoking Park Avenue Deluxe room for my first night.

However, I was able to change over to my desired room on the following day. I just called reception to request the change. Once the new room is ready, you will get a message from them about where to move. No need to go downstairs to change your key card though. Just use your current card to enter the new room. I have to say that staff was very professional and handled my request with grace and patience.

The rooms here are stylish. The marble tiles in the bathroom are classy. It really does have a New Yorker cosmopolitan vibe to them. The Park Ave rooms are quite spacey at 400 sq ft. and are located on a high floor. Because of that, you take a different elevator to get to your room than guests staying in a Skyline room.

The room amenities are kind of basic though. Expect the usual of fragrant toiletries. But no coffeemakers or mini fridges. There is Wi-Fi access here and it is included as part of the $15 a night plus tax resort fee. That resort fee gets you a daily newspaper and access to the pool and gym.

As for hotel attractions, the casino here is okay. The slots are kind of stingy. Knew I did not like Monopoly's Mr. Moneybags. Restaurant selection here appeals to a general audience and priced moderately. There are a quite a few cheap\/affordable fast food options here too. And they have several places here like Nathan's in which you can try NY food as well.

Location is on the south end of the Strip. I would have liked to stayed closer to the middle so I did not have to walk so much. There is a free tram at the Monte Carlo next door that you can take to the Bellagio if you want to rest your feet a bit and the Monorail is across the street at MGM.

Overall, I liked NY NY and enjoyed my stay. Though I think that I would stay a little closer to the middle of the Strip next time.

This isn't the fancies place on the strip but it gets the job done. Sides, you're only there to sleep, shower and change right? After all you are in Vegas. Our 2 double bed room was very roomy. Enough space that 6 of us were not stepping on each others toes. A good price for the room size you are, but nothing over the top like you'd find a Bellagio or Wynn.

Stayed here for 3 nights, and I'd say it's average for the Strip.  My overwhelming impression of NY NY was due to the color of the hotel casino's ceiling.  It's painted black.  Although of soaring heights, this depressing overhead color lended the entire place a dark, oppressive vibe that was enhanced by the pervasive smell of stale, 15-year old filtered cigarette smoke.  It was definitely smokier than other casinos because I could tell my asthma was close to flaring up, which didn't happen at the other hotel casinos.  NY NY also appeared dated, especially compared to its competitors.

The hotel staff deserves 5* (not including the restaurant workers) and honestly, I would've given NY NY an overall 2* if it weren't for the staff.  There was a long line to check-in, but our frontdesk guy was helpful and friendly, even witty.  Our flat screen TV's cable box did not work when we arrived, so they sent a workman up TWICE.  He was super nice and appeared that he truly cared about the problem, and he fixed our issues quickly and followed-up within two hours.  Impressive.  And the dude who worked the afternoon shift at the 24-7 convenience shop near the pool was always eager to smile and made us feel welcome each time we were in there.

Our room was in the Century Tower directly over the pool and maybe 20 feet above the very top of the roller coaster.  Elevators were pretty quick.  Great views of The Mirage and surrounding desert canyons from our large, tinted window.  Bed was clean and comfy, and this basic 400 sqft room had enough space to move around in comfortably.  No fridge or microwave.  Plenty of drawers to store clothes, and I especially liked that the cabinets lit up every time they were opened.  The bathroom was ok, but it needs an update.  Hot water was always available with good pressure in the shower.  However, I found a disgusting live earwig under our bath mat.  Other than that, we found no evidence of cockroaches or bed bugs.  Room was tidied up everyday when we returned.

My boyfriend's conference was held in one of the smaller rooms on the 3rd floor of the Century Towers.  It's a soulless, windowless room and he said it just sucked the life out of him for the 8 hours each day spent inside.  The catering left a lot to be desired as they didn't leave utensils one time and provided no healthy fruit options; over-processed pastries and brownies were offered.

Speaking of food, lots of available eats inside NY NY, but none of the options are what I'd call healthy.  Gluttony is a good sin to have in Sin City!   Il Fornaio and Gallagher's are probably their nicest restaurants.  

Didn't get a chance to ride the roller coaster, but that arcade area upstairs is full of teeny-boppers.  Also didn't use the pool on the first floor, but we took a closer look and it is TINY.

The unique thing about this hotel casino is the "mini old Manhattan."  Blocks of recognizable New York street names formed a maze in the eateries portion near the Zumanity theatre.  And the "Brooklyn Bridge" is just outside.  Overall, it's sort of cool.  
But if we got to choose where we stayed on the Strip, we would not have chosen NY NY.

I would not recommend this hotel at any price, any rate. They have the WORST customer service of any hotel I have ever spoken with. I made a reservation in JUNE 2010 for reservations in OCT 2010, my rate was 105\/night. Great! I called to see if I could change to sat\/sunday night stay instead of friday\/saturday night and was told that my new rate would be $250 per night. Seriously? I am staying the same night, but am asked to pay more? I asked to speak to a supervisor, was not allowed to actually speak to one and was told there was nothing else that would or could be done. 

This is a terrible place for customer service and I refuse to frequent a hotel that treats its customers in this fashion. NYNY: learn how to treat people with dignity and get some real managers! 

RECOMMENDATION: DO NOT STAY HERE!

Mehhhhhh

Expect a New York experience at New York, New York.

Shouting people, crowded floors, rude service, no views and depending on what you do, an expensive experience. 

Think I'll stick to more lavish Hotels in Vegas if I'm looking to gamble my money away.

I stayed here for almost 1 week. The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable but the bathroom was just horrible!!! The shower hardly had any hot water. I tried to tell housekeeping and no one was able to do anything!!

First things first- it's not as cool as before they un-New Yorked some of the interior. 
I miss the trees!! and miss "Central Park". At least they kept the exterior. I'm not really liking the weird metal design things that adorn the casino. The arcade is still near the roller coaster, and it's nice to see these "old school Vegas" elements are hanging on. Closeness to The Park and the arena make it an attractive place to park. Though it is a busy place, it seemed less so due to the more open layout of the casino.

I like The Village eateries, and 48th and Crepe is yummy and priced right. There's a great variety of restaurants at The Village, including pizza, fried fish, crepes and a deli. I plan to return for more crepes! There are two areas of eateries, which is confusing, but more choices for dining is good. There are also more restaurants Strip adjacent such as Tom's Urban and Shake Shack.  Overall, NY NY is a great location with many amenities and a relatively easy to navigate parking garage.

In preparation for a Vegas list I am putting together for future reference, I am back tracking on this review from a few years ago when I saw U2 and spent a few days in Vegas. Never stayed at the hotel, however, love browsing and spending time here 'cause my kid at heart is at play. I haven't done much time in NY, therefore, cannot comment if this properly emulates the feel of the city, however, for what it is I had fun. If you're one of those people whom can't stand children, I would stay away from this hotel. There is a fun arcade in the hotel. I have yet to do the roller coaster. The souvenirs are cheesy "I love New York" souvenirs, however, more in it or the laugh than actual retail therapy. Not a lot of interaction with the staff personally but they looked all happy serving people at the front desk.

From reading the reviews on NYNY I've come to the conclusion that people just expect too much from mediocre hotels on the Vegas strip. 

With that being said, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. I had the pleasure of being in the Park Avenue room and it was perfect sized, it was actually bigger than I thought it was going to be. The beds were super comfortable, the IPOD docking station definitely came in handy and we even used the two chairs set up near the window. Our view wasn't the greatest, we got to stare at the starting tracks of the roller coaster but whatever no big deal. It was too hot to stand close to the window anyways. The bathroom was good sized, toilet worked great, shower had enough water pressure and the mirror in the hall outside the bathroom helped when girls were getting dressed in the bathroom and you needed to do makeup. 

As far as the rest of the property goes I was happy with everything. The amount of restaurants and eateries was more than sufficient, the casino tables were awesome, especially our guys at the craps tables! You know you're home when the craps dealers know your name or face by the second day. The pool is meh but I also didn't expect much from it because I looked at pictures before going. I do like that they allow you to drink while in the pool.  Most places will not let you do that so that's a plus in my book. 

The front desk clerk who checked us in was a little on the beyotchy side. She felt it necessary to point out that check-in wasn't until later in a not so nice tone. Yeah we know, hence us asking "We wanted to see if it was possible to check-in early" But we got our room early and it all worked out. 

Tip: The room keys suck! They get demagnatized very easily so try to keep it away from your cell phone. I tried to keep mine in my wallet and that worked for the most part. During our stay we had to get the key replaced twice which can be a little frustrating, especially when it's 3am and you're drunk and just want to eat food and go to bed. 

I would for sure stay here, the price is too good pass up.

Obviously one of the better hotels at Vegas everything is koo i think they and Paris have the best "inside" to the hotels i love the steam stuff comming out of the wells with the pizza and pasta resturaunts alike. The one bummer man $20 to sit on that dumb rollercoster isnt all that cool. But you have to do it atleast once, so spit out that $20!

TFR

Didn't really spend that much time in the hotel as my friends were staying at MGM but they had good food, footbridges to MGM and Excalibur and good gambling. The roller coaster is fun but a bit expensive ($16)...but hey, it's Vegas. Everything is expensive! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay on the strip at a hotel with everything you need without completely breaking the bank.

i know its corny, but living in nyc i really wanted to check out this casino\/hotel.

the replicated ny streets are fun to walk through, and the outside facade very well done (in a super tacky\/awesome vegas way).

that said, i prefer my neon fanny-packs to be on hipsters - and not fatties from nebraska.

My third trip to Vegas and the New York New York, hotel and resort is by far, my favorite hotel experience that I have ever had. As with all the resorts on and off the strip, you can tell so much work went into the construction of this resort and it's hard to believe that some people consider this place to be a budget hotel on the strip.

The representatives are so friendly and helpful and it all started with the young lady, who gave me a free upgrade to a much nicer room than the "run of the house" Park ave. room and placed me in the New Yorker tower, that had the Madison Ave. room that was very big, clean and comfortable. I was so delighted and impressed and I didn't even request the upgrade.

There are no end of dining options here and many of them are open late, with the America Cafe, open 24 hours a day. I met some really nice servers and bartenders in Tom's Urban and Nine Fine Irishmen. Everyone was very friendly, including the housekeeping and maintenance staff. Even the guests were easy to get along with and most definitely having a great time. Once I got to know the place, it was easier to navigate than I thought it would be.

Just a very fun and exciting place to stay on the strip. I love the southern part of the strip, as it has so much more breathing room and much less congested than the coveted "heart of the strip". So easy to get to the airport. Young, or still young at heart? I very much recommend this wonderful hotel. Such a great idea to build this resort! Stay and play!!

I will NEVER go to this hotel ever again. I was promised a room with a view of the strip but when we arrived they said that it was changed to a pool but when we went to the room there was no view but a stupid wall and a piece of the sky. The service was bad they left the food in the hallway for more than 2 nights it was horrible. Seriously the spa suite that  smelled like a garbage dump. 

Next time go to Monte Carlo were they have better rooms and service for the price.

This was so disappointing for A strip hotel. I booked the room and Zoomanity show on line with all the locals discounts. 

3 pm came and time to check in. There was a huge line of people checking in on a weekday and only 2...TWO people to check them in. Not a good start. Once we made it to the counter, the lady checking us in was rather...rude. No welcome to the nyny, no pleasantries. Just Name please. After check in, she had nothing nice to say. I have been to alot worse places that had a much more friendlier staff.

No one even offered to take our luggage. LAS VEGAS!!! WHAT HAPPENED TO SERVICE HERE!?????

The room had a great view of nothing we wanted to see. Disappointing. We headed out for dinner (see my review of Joe's Stone Crab) and then came back to see zoomanity. The show was fun even though this was my 2nd time.

Back to the hotel. The morning came and was shower time. The bathroom was not the cleanest or most pleasant I have seen in a Vegas strip hotel. The shower had very Little water pressure. I love alot of water pressure!!! The floor tiles were old, chipped and the grout was kinda gross dirty.

All in all, not a very pleasant hotel. Next time, we are back to Belagio!

Didn't stay here.

This place has a great arcade, that my teen loved.  Dump the teen in the arcade, and gamble here.  

Great drink girls, that kept the beers coming.  Lots to look at, and very clean.  

Also had a slice @ the pizza place.  It was good.  I would stay here, because I like the location.

I really like New York New York, the rooms were a little small but I like the vibe in the casino and the way the gambling is set up is different and gives good vibes. It's the only casino that I have been in when somebody won a lot of money I forgot how much she won but some guy just gave up that seat and was super bummed smh but she won a couple hundred thousand. I also like this place because it's in the mix of things. It's been awhile since I stayed here but it was really nice and clean when I did. I still need to hit up their buffet one of these days.

Voyage to New York, New York 
Day One:
Scaled down city streets are charming. I love it! Burger place is very good. OMG ZUMANITY!! Not much cigarette smoke in the casino on a Monday night, yay! Spa Room is large, can't wait to try that tub. Went to the Lush store just for the occasion. The pillows are like clouds of chewy marshmallows - can I buy one in the gift shop? Only one side of the bed has an outlet for charging a cell phone (I had to unplug a lamp). It's 4ft away from the bed & my charger has a 3ft cord. Ok I can deal with that, I guess...
Oh but now it's 3am and NYNY just lost a point with me. My better half stole all the covers. That's not the hotel's fault, but I'm explaining why I went to the closet to get a spare blanket. But when I got there, the cupboard was bare! It's *standard* for hotels to put an extra blanket & pillow in the closet (she wails, quietly). You put a telephone next to the toilet, but no blankets in the closet? Come on, are you really going to make me turn on lights & get dressed & call room service & wait around, for a blanket, at 3am?

Day Two:
In the morning, called room service for a blanket. They delivered. Went for a long walk for sightseeing. I like the location of this hotel. Send a note to your architect: there is ALWAYS a line at the elevators, even on a quiet weekday afternoon.
In the evening, I got ushered out of the NYNY gift shop after 5 seconds because they close at 10pm. I suppose they have their reasons, but I was sad. Consoled myself with bubble bath in the spa tub. Tried to do work on my Surface, but the hotel's wi-fi Internet was too slow to open files. Had to use cell phone data instead. 
Seriously, my phone has been mostly dead for 2 days. There are lamps for hotels that have power sockets built into the bases. The Hilton has them on the nightstands. Look into it, guys! 
Made use of the 24\/7 room service menu. Lady on duty was chipper, at 3am. They delivered a lovely breakfast in just under 30min, with a doily under my oatmeal. Thank you! 

Day 3:
Checkout time is 11am. Barely dragged myself out the door at five-of. Never did make it to the gift shop, but I'll be back! Those city streets are my favorite.
Thank you, New York New York!

I would possibly stay here again. We arrived Monday evening and the check-in line was ridiculously long. The first room we arrived in was unacceptable so they moved us. Our second room was better, but nothing special. This is the only hotel in Vegas I have ever stayed at that did not have in-room refrigerators. Housekeeping was odd; they left one of the carts in our hallway all day, so I found that to be odd. The pretzel place, pizza place, and Starbuck's upstairs were all wonderful. If the price is under $100 a night, stay here.

Completely true to its name. The casino decor is reminiscent of time square. The have taxi cab themed games and even a new york style pizzeria. There are a lot of slot and table games here. The minimums aren't too high. The drink service was on the slower side though . Loved the statue of liberty and the brooklyn bridge. I did not get to ride the famous roller coaster but it looked really cool. I got lucky on a Judge Judy machine here. A really fun spot.

Stayed here for this first time this week.  Bed was very comfortable, room was nice but VERY small and there was no exhaust fan in the bathroom which made the room very stuffy.  No water or coffee in the room was a little disappointing considering how long the walk was from our room to the elevator 2576.  With that being said it is Vegas so we didn't spend all that much time in the room.  The view was nice, Mlife rewards program is great, layout of the casino floor makes it easy to get around, very good dining\/drinking options and the staff was all very helpful.

I didn't stay here. Only reviewing the casino and arcade.

The casino itself was nice. A wide selection of slots to play compared to PH. I got to play Ghostbusters for a bit which was nice. 

As for the arcade

Wow....

Oh man how times have changed for the worse.

I remember the arcade being really awesome here when I was here 8 years ago. I dunno what happened but it seems they really cut down on the size of the place and let the machines rot away. They used to have a ton of those carnival games to try and win a stuffed animal but the few remaining had no one attending to any of them and for good reason. It's not packed here. I was bummed after hearing about Gameworks closing down and moving away from the strip. The variety of games is lackluster. You won't find a DDR, Beatmania or Initial D here. The only decent game I found here was ReRave which is similar to DJ Max Technika. Downside was you only get 2 songs for a dollar.

The claw machines here suck too. They have some Cut The Rope green monster plushies but mostly Angry Bird ones. Not a fan of AB so I didn't bother.

They have a few Key Masters with Ipads, Nintendo 3DS, iTunes gift cards.

Ticket redemption here is not worth it. Most of the prizes are crap.

Definitely worth checking out for the casino part of it anyway. Not so much for the arcade.
We loved the place.  It had action, good food and great room rates.  Roller Coaster and Irish Pub were the best

My son stayed here and really liked the hotel, although he said it's confusing to find your tower because the signs are pretty sparse. We visited the casino and I really do like the quaint little neighborhoods they have scattered around. You can get a huge, hot pretzel from a "street vendor" in Manhattan or enjoy a bagel at a sidewalk cafe in Brooklyn. I may just be attracted to well-done theme casinos, but I love this one and Casear's for their dedication to making sure that everywhere you look you are reminded of New York or Ancient Rome. 

There is an ENORMOUS, two story Hershey's candy store just inside the entrance. On the top floor there is a Statue of Liberty made entirely out of Twizzlers. As you exit on the bottom level, the Statue of Liberty is made entirely out of chocolate. If you want to take home some souvenirs that are not Vegas related, try the plushy soft Hershey's or Reese's throw blankets, clever mugs, or stuffed kisses. There is a wheel you can spin at the entrance and win coupons for $$ off purchases of a certain amount; my daughter won $10 off $50, picked out a Reese's blanket ($50) and was thrilled. The blanket was the perfect size for the flight home, just a throw to cover her legs.

Rooms are clean and large and very reasonably priced. Good restaurants. Good access to points both North and South and a short ride to the airport. Walk over the bridge and through the MGM to get to the monorail. It is a long walk so don't wear silly shoes. The roller coaster is not loud and they shut it down at 11p and it is a fun ride. Internet access is not very fast or reliable.
Overall just so-so. Our room, although it said no smoking... Was positively smoked in.

I stayed on my trip to Vegas, booking everything through Expedia, so I didn't know anything about Vegas and where this hotel was located in relation to everything else. 

The stay was ok.  I wouldn't say there was anything exceptional about this place but being that I didn't spend much time in the room, it was fine for a place to sleep and shower.

It is on one end of the strip so I did A LOT of walking.  The staff was nice here.  The rollercoaster was cool but not one of the better ones I've ridden.

And I certainly didn't win anything here in the casino.

Stayed in a nice corner room last time.  Nothing extravagant, but no complaints.  The casino itself is kind of small, and the biggest drawback for me is...no buffet!  Il Fornaio is fine, and Chin Chin has decent Asian food.  The pool is okay - they have a little net set up for some water-volleyball action.  If you can get a good rate, take it and visit the other casinos around the strip to complete your visit!
I've never actually stayed here, but I like it here. There is a lot to see and do. The casino has a wide variety of slots and other games.

They saved us from the dreaded Luxor! 

Liza at the lobby desk, Rich at the American Bar - the first two NYNY staffers my sister and I came across made us NYNYers for life. 

We thought we had better save some cash and try Luxor, got bad directions to our room and (an hour later) almost threw up walking into the room. GROSS. Dirty! SICK! WTH is this doing on the strip?? And who knew?? 

After getting our money back and heading to NYNY the rest of our trip was perfect. Every encounter with staff was excellent. The room with the view was more than we could ask for and the entire hotel had everything we needed we really didn't have to go anywhere else. Piano Bar and Pizza were our fav's. 

From the Slimko Sisters, Thank you for saving our trip and give Liza and Rich raises! Or at least a high-five for making you shine :) 

Cheers, k

I was just finish eating in the "Greenwich Village" and was about to throw away some extra fries when someone stopped me and asked, "Dude, are you gonna finish that?" Was he some tourist who had blown out already or an employee of NYNY hired to give that more "authentic" New York experience? Either way I hope he enjoyed the fries.

Some other observations: NYNY's pool has just one pond and is located under their rollercoaster. It's like tanning under the L in Chicago. I didn't visit Coyote Ugly but I'm sure it's just like the Coyote Ugly in your city: dirty but in a corporate-made way. And Nine Irishmen. I do like their truly outdoor patio but cmon, you did not come to Vegas to go sit at an Irish pub!
I liked the tall ceilings and wide open feel to the place, didnt seem as crowded as some of the more Ritzy places on the strip.  I would stay here again, great atmosphere

The hotel is in a great location on the strip and the rooms were nice. There are so many food options and the serve huge portions at an affordable price.  

The pool area is small and the sports book is tiny! If you're interested in betting on sports and watching the game, be prepared to stand or go to the restaurant next door.

We did not stay at this hotel but definitely spend a lot of time there.
The gambling was fun, the clubs (Coyote Ugly and Rok) were great. 
The New York Pretzel shop was delicious and open late-so we could grab something there even late into the night.
Over all the hotel was great and very pleasant. 
Next time we visit Vegas I will definitely stay at New York New York!!!

Oh, my. If you like all the dirty and decrepit parts of New York City, yet not actually be in New York City, this place is for you. It smells of a million un-showered people smoking cigarettes, combined with a vat of Fabreze sprayed over it all to mask the stench. There isn't a surface that isn't in poor condition, from the entrance pavement in poor repair to the filthy doors to the worn-out carpets, this place could not be more down scale.  And the people...no comment.

We went so my husband and daughter could ride the coaster. They seemed to enjoy it, but we couldn't get out of there fast enough.  Perhaps it is unfair to NY NY that we had just come from Luxor, which is very, as the New Yorkers say, "classy," and NY NY casino was like going to a third world country by comparison.

My husband and I have stayed here multiple times now, and we always have a great experience. Our only gripe was that the shower would get the whole bathroom floor wet, so we had to wear flip flops to use the toilet. Otherwise, we really like this hotel. They added a few new restaurants since our last visit, and the ones we tried were really yummy! The pool was the perfect temperature, too.

This was NOT THE BEST EXPERIENCE.  Arrived at 1:30a.m. on a Monday.  Waited in line behind four couples.  Not ONCE did either of the desk clerks say, "I'll be right with you."  We stood there for 25 minutes after having had a three hour delay in Atlanta and a four hour flight, plus another hour in baggage claim and in line at the car rental place.  When we got upstairs, I did my standard bed bug check.  THERE WAS FOOD BEHIND THE BED!!  The carpet looked like it hadn't been vaccumed.  I asked for another room and was DOWNGRADED.  This room had sugar or salt strewn all over a bench seat, which had pooled in the button.  The bathroom was not cleaned well.  I cried.  Then, the next day I asked for yet another room.  This room was slighly better, but had mildew buildup around the drain.  At that point, I just gave up.  Next time, we'll stay at the Luxor.

This was my first holiday to Vegas travelling from the UK. For the price paid the room was large with 2 big comfortable beds and a 40" TV, I thought it was excellent value and it's in a great location.  I had no problems with the hotel WiFi on my iPhone 5, I was required to log in each day though.

Plenty to do inside the hotel with the casino, shops, bars, gym, pool, restaurants, food outlets, amusements etc. overall I was very impressed.

Pretty nice hotel.  Conveniently located on the strip. The rooms were newly remodeled and the service was great.  It has a 24 hour restaurant, America.  The food is nothing to write home about, but it can be quite convenient after a long night of drinking.

Very fun! I felt like a kid in a candy shop because of all the shops they had. I ended up here after watching Zumanity (Amazing show BTW). I rode the rollercoaster which was 50% off with military ID. I'd definitely be back to ride it again and to wander around the casino.

Had a great stay here! The staff was great, the room was clean, and the bed was cozy! I would def. book here again!

Pro:
Great location
Very Clean
Nice beds!
Great food options inside and close to the hotel.
Right across from MGM and Excalibur.

Con:
Small bathrooms
Bad reception on TV 

I would stay here again!

Excellent place to stay, especially for the money. Booked on Priceline for about $60 a night. We were very pleased with our spacious and comfortable room. We had a great view looking toward the western mountains. Our room was clean and well appointed. I would have liked to see a microwave in the room or at least a refrigerator but there was an ice machine. The beds were super comfy.

It's up to youuu, New York, Neeeew Yoooork!

Ich liebe das Casino, hier könnte ich stundenlang bleiben, was irgendwie auch oft passiert. Das Casino hat das Motto Central Park, der Innenraum mit den funkelnden Slot Machines und den Roulette- und Hold'em Tischen stellen den Park dar, der gesäumt wird von Häuserfassaden, in denen sich tatsächlich Geschäft befinden. Die gesamte Fressmeile des NY NY besteht aus Häuserzeilen mit Kopfsteinpflaster und ist dem alten, charmanten New York der 20er (obwohl ich für diese Einschätzung nicht meine Hand ins Feuer legen würde), nachempfunden. Hier gibt es Fressalien zu ganz annehmbaren Preisen. 

Im Casino selbst spiele ich sehr gerne, da hier besonders gute Slot Machines stehen, die auch mit mehreren Spielern gemeinsam Spaß machen.

Zum Amüsement gibt es in diesem Hotel noch die Coyote Ugly Bar und die fantastische Show Zumanity. Der Pool ist hier allerdings eher kleiner im Vergleich zu denen anderer Hotels und liegt schnell in Schatten der Wolkenkratzer.

Die Außenfassade ist aber dafür einfach ein toller Anblick, man könnte glatt meinen, man hätte Manhattan vor sich. Gekrönt wird dieses noch durch die Achterbahn, die außen herum  führt (und die wirklich Spaß macht!). Auch die Freiheitstatue bewacht hier das Hotel, auf der anderen Seite kann man außen auf der Brookly Bridge an Geschäften vorbei flanieren, das alles wurde 2013\/2014 neu gemacht.

Wir hatten zu einem Schnäppchenpreis eine Suite inklusive Jacuzzi. Das Preis-Leistungsverhältnis ist unschlagbar (die Hotels finanzieren sich halt durch die Casinos), aber es ist alles etwas verwohnt und nicht so modern wie z.B. im MGM. Das sieht man schon in den Aufzügen. Ich würde trotzdem hier immer wieder einkehren, zumal man die Achterbahn so gut wie gar nicht im Zimmer hören kann.

I'v been staying  in several hotel\/casinos but for some reason I haven't stayed at New York New York so I had my Girl friend book us a stay at New York Newyork  and so far I had the worse experience .it took forever to check in and to check out huge lines and for some reason there elevators didn't work we were stuck in our floor for about 20 minutes trying to take luggage in and out and on top of that our room wasn't the cleanest it wasn't the room we booked on line I highly doubt I will be staying here ever agin .
