Even though I've never stayed here, I've been several times and I've never had a bad experience. I like that it distinguishes itself from the other hotels in that you know which one you are in because it's decorated as though you are walking through the streets of New York in some areas. 

I like that this hotel has a section for children to spend time in. I always see people walking around with small children and I can never figure out why they would bring them to the Las Vegas strip. Seeing places like this make me realize that there may be more places like this on the strip that I don't know of. This is probably the reason they added the Hershey store inside of the casino.

I went on the roller coaster, which was really fun, but when you're riding it you can tell that it's kind of old and hasn't been taken care of like roller coasters at regular amusement parks because the ride is very rough and jerky. I had a little bit of a headache when I got off. I probably won't ride it again, but I'm glad that I did. 

The only thing I didn't really like was the lack of variety in the food selection that wasn't a super expensive sit down restaurant. Their food court mainly had pizza and sandwiches. We were going to eat at the pizza place, but the food looked like it had been sitting under the light for a while so we decided not to.


#3\/100

If it were just Robert S, it would be 5 star.  This gentleman helped us where the other Robert was a smug useless *&#^%@$(1am 10\/12\/16)   This guy will NOT help youm. We are in the penthouse, I will add photos for proof, this other Robert (Robert s), He actually listened, was caring, he seems to understand how serv8ce works.  Im talking to my people at MGM, this guy is a rockstar. I dint want to get personal and intrusive, but Robert is the guy to talk to.   Amazing.

If you are on a budget but still want to enjoy the strip I would recommend this hotel.
I give 3 stars because the hotel room we stayed in didn't have a refrigerator or microwave. Even motel 6 has refrigerators!
The Rollercoaster is great. Went on it 4 times in a row. Thank gawd we weren't drinking before.

This is a really fun and casual Casino.

It has good pizza and restaurants in it. There is a strip of stores and restaurants on the outside so it's like your walking down a New York Street. ( but cleaner)  It also has the Hershey's store that has home made bakery goods, a chocolate bar and fun things to buy!

I gambled here too, it's a relaxing casual and just feels like your at home, not to fussy.
There is also a roller coaster outside which I didn't have time to try, I hope I can go back to Vegas to see more of this and other places!

I was a little hesitant to book our stay at this hotel due to the ratings, but my best friend mentioned her friend stayed here and enjoyed it, so we gave it a shot. I'm so glad we did because I loved our room at the NY-NY hotel. 

We signed up for the Park Avenue Deluxe room, and the room was exactly what was pictured on their website. We asked for 2 Queen beds in a non-smoking room, and the room was quite spacious, and the beds were extremely comfy with 4 pillows on each bed ;) We were located on the 6th floor, and had half a good view of the MGM grand, but the other side of the view was a part of the roller coaster. It wasn't that loud, except minor hearings of the riders screaming, which didn't bother my friend and I. The room had AC which we were able to adjust to our preference (very nice!). The bathroom was nice and clean, and not too small. I wish the bathrooms had double sinks, but we didn't mind the one sink. The shower was clean and did not have any mold (YAY!) You could tell that the room and bathroom had been thoroughly cleaned before we arrived =)

The only thing I disliked about the hotel was the smoking in the casinos. When we arrived through the front valet entrance, we located the registration desk, but we had to walk through the casino to get to our rooms. I was sick with a bad cough so the smoke did not help. Another thing that might bother someone is getting around the hotel. Do ask for a map at the registration desk. =) Also, be sure to ask which elevator to take to get to your room. There are several elevators with different names that take you to different sections of the NY-NY building. This will help you with your stay so you don't get lost! =)

We arrived at the hotel around 5pm, and check in did not take more than 5 minutes. Our receptionist was a young, pretty Filipino lady, who was extremely nice and helpful (Thank you Christine!). Check out also took only a minute. Partially because we did not order room service so all we did was return the room keys, and she printed out the bill (just the hotel fee per night). Beware that practically every hotel on the strip will charge you a resort fee per night. This  fee will include the usage of internet at the hotel so it didn't bother me too much.

We only tried one place to eat at NY-NY, which was the New York Pizzeria. The pizza was big, soft and crunchy. YUM! ^_^ Overall, I really enjoyed our stay at NY-NY and am so glad we had a great experience with the hotel. =D 
THANK YOU NY-NY!

I have stayed at most of the Vegas strip hotels and here are my thoughts.

What's nice abou this hotel is that it is in the middle of the strip and accessible to the other neighboring hotels like the MGM, Alladin, Paris, Excalibur and Monte Carlo.  This hotel usually draws a younger crowd without the arragance.

The rooms are among the smallest in size on the strip.  It is also among the darkest lit which doesn't help when you want to look your best.  The bathrooms utilize flourecent light, which I find a bit odd for a nice hotel.

If you are a coffee junkie, you will love this place.  It's one of the very few hotels on the strip which features an in-house Starbucks AND Krispy Kreme doughnut kiosk!

TIP: Ask for a hotel room near the elevator since they are not exactly centrally located.  You will appreciate the short commute!

This place is hell. Avoid at all costs. 

So tempted to elbow my way through the obese, slow people who can't get out of the way and give them a real NY,NY experience.

Stayed here because I got a good deal online. I liked the room, the hotel, the bars were great. There's a little area that's designed to look like the streets of new york with bars and some hot dog stand type eateries. Coyote Ugly bar! The restaurants located in N.Y. N.Y. were so so. Unfortunately the roller coaster was closed for maintenance when I was here. The location is good, I would have preferred to be a little bit more central on the strip but for the price, the room was right!

My girlfriends and I stayed at this hotel at the end of May.  We booked two rooms - one was an upgraded room.  The front desk agent was nice enough to upgrade the other room for free at check-in so that we could be on the same floor.  The staff were all pretty nice and the rooms were decent.  

So why the 2 star rating?  Throughout the entire stay, everytime we walked through the halls it literally smelled like shit!  Also, we purchased tickets to Zumanity and had planned to watch the show on our last night.  Just our luck, the A\/C was not working throughout the entire ground level of the hotel and they ended up cancelling the show. 

I guess it was just bad luck but next time I'd stay somewhere else.

Let me first say that generally the hotel in Vegas is not a big issue for me bc of the limited amount of time I use the room. Saying that, the review.  
First, we got here at 430pm.  Check in was at 3 but the room wasn't ready. Instead of apologizing, they tried to justify it bc we requested a "king room" it can take time. 
The room was suppose to be smoke free but clearly smelled like cigarettes. 
Calling the front desk was at least a 5min wait until someone picks up. 
You can hear the roller coasters from the room.  
Location was perfect for me for this trip and the price was decent.  Overall 3\/5.
Stood here for 4 nights. Not too bad with the pricing and in a good location on the strip. Would definitely consider staying get here again.

I stay here once a year for a convention at Mandalay Bay.  Great location to jump on the tram by walking across to Luxor.  Saves on cab fare and I like going outside for a breath of (fresh) air.  The casino is nice because it isn't huge or easy to get lost in.  It's fairly easy to find your way around and has enough amenities to run down from your room and get whatever you need without walking for 30 minutes.  The rooms are nice, always have been clean and spacious enough.  They always have decent prices and deals too.   If you have a room that faces the roller coaster, the noise can be annoying, but I think it stops around 11pm.  It usually interrupts an attempted afternoon nap but not that bad.  It is fun to ride although it bangs your head around.  Looking forward to staying there again in Jan. 14 and see what the construction improvements are.  All in all I recommend it.
This casino was really cool, like a little New York City village inside.  They have a huge Hershey's chocolate store inside and large casino.  A lot of food options but very expensive.

Came here to visit on my routine Strip visits since i wanted to stop by the MGM i decided to stop here since i haven't been here since they opened back in 1997. They were doing construction outside where the Brooklyn Bridge is it's all fenced up and looks like they were doing construction also inside by the sport book so when crowded can be a pain to get around.  Probably will comeback here again after the construction is done maybe another 10 plus years lol
The cashier can't print out your player card that's funny while another casino can do it. Big fail

I HEART NY! 
This is a fun casino! Going in, you see scaled down NYC roads, and key pieces of NYC architecture! Everything is sort of scaled down to fit into the casino, of course. But they really bring the atmosphere of Central Park to the Las Vegas Strip. I enjoyed the table games that they offered, a little bit wider list of games available than some other casinos. Table minimums were $10 when I went on a Monday afternoon. 
The casino was clean, and offered an average range of slot machines. The staff was friendly, but didn't see any cocktail waitresses around while we were hanging out. Maybe they thought we'd had enough already. 
There's a roller coaster on the roof of the place which looks like fun. Alas, I didn't ride it. 
Overall, it's a great casino with a cool theme.

Thanks to Kathy our waitress while playing 3 card poker with an amazing dealer Matt. They have made our trip amazing when we were suffering in our stay at our hotel. They made our night so fun. We planned to spend about 2 hours on the game floor and we ended up there til about 5 am. My fiance and I decided we will stay at this hotel next time rather then the delano.  Service was great, we ended up going back multiple times look forward to coming back. If everyone was awesome as Kathy and Matt... you guys would be the #1 hotel there. Keep it up

We haven't stayed at New York-New York, but we have walked through it several times.  The casino action seems more active and "fun" than many other places in Vegas.  We love the New York-style pretzels that are available on the second floor next to the bridge entrance.  I think we've eaten at the Irish pub, but it was so long ago I can't give it a proper review.  Having been through this hotel again just last week to see Zumanity, we were surprised to see the rollercoaster ride cost $14!  Anyhow, great vibes and a cheerful crowd can be found here.

My last review was written as a Vegas local, time to update my review.  Since I moved out of town a few years ago, we've stayed here twice.  In addition to the points I made with my last review, which still hold true, I'd want to add that the rooms are a little small  compared to other rooms at the hotels on the Strip.

Despite the small rooms, this is still a fun hotel to stay at because of the location.  It's close to the MGM Grand and Hakkasan and not too far from Mandalay Bay and City Center.  I'd stay here again if the room rates are at a good price.

Return Factor - 75%

My husband and I spent three nights in Vegas as part of our honeymoon. We stayed at NYNY and we had a great time here. When we first arrived we were greeted by a bellhop and they took our bags off our hands right away. They gave us a claim ticket and told us to call when we got to our room and they would deliver our bags to us. Check-in was quick and easy. We made it clear we did not a room too close to the roller coaster and they accommodated that. We barely heard it at all. We decided to upgrade to the Players Suite for an additional $90 a night and I am glad we did. It was a great room. When it said there was a spa in it I assumed it would be a spa bathtub but to my amazement it was an actual spa!!!! It was so relaxing and we enjoyed it. It had two TV's and a sitting area. Now I am spoiled and addicted to suites. LOL. They have a very extensive room service menu and the prices are not too bad. They are also very prompt and polite when you order room service. The only real issue we had here is when we first checked in our phone in our room was not working. That is why I am deducting a star because that should not be an issue at all.  I used my cell phone to call downstairs to have someone to fix it and the lady who answered seemed to not believe us. I also requested our bags at this time and they sent someone really quick for that. Then she had us push all these buttons and then she said she was going to try to call the room and of course it did not work so she finally sent someone up. It kind of took a while and we called back and said we want to go out so how much longer and they said we did not have to stay. As we were getting ready the guy arrived to fix it. Turns out the phone needed a new cable. Kind of annoying but it got fixed and that's all that matters. The casino was great and I love how they had it set up like NY. I thought it was cute. the outside of it looks really cool too. There is no shortage of games to play and we had a blast. We have a list of hotels we would like to stay at so we will change it up next time but I do recommend this hotel. I will stay here again one day.

So Much Fun will be had in Vegas this week! I figured the only time I will be coherent enough to write my own name I might as well get the review completed. We started off with some pints in the PHX airport and sat next to another HOT CHICK that let me touch her leg every now and then... And got word that we would be partying with Perez Hilton for his B DAY!

Great things about The New York New York staff is that they follow the Vegas Rule! Tip and be spoiled! We had a laugh with the desk clerk talked about our BFs allowing to have a GIRL WEEKEND and got the free upgrade!!! WooHoo!!!

The beds are amazing! I don't find us spending too much time in them though. The record label got us into pretty much into everything. But any resort that knows a gay man needs his cuddle pillow that goes between my legs is 5 Star to this Yelper!!!

Enjoy Life Everyone!

I happen to really enjoy the gaming floor here. I love Nine Fine Irishmen and make it a point to go every trip. The hotel itself is loud, but the rooms are pretty nice. I hate the roller coaster being right out the window though.

Spent 6 nights here on a business trip to CES.  Check-In time is offically 3pm but they will start checking in a couple hours early for an additional fee ($50 I recall) and you can store your luggage with the bellhop service if you decide to wait.  I arrived around 11am from the airport and was told by the very friendly and courteous attendant at the front desk that if I didn't care about a view, I could have a Spa Suite on the 3rd floor right away.  I wasn't there for the view so I accepted and went up to the room and immediately realized why this room was available......It's surrounded by large VERY VERY NOISY fans and other roof equipment.  The windows in the room (357) look out onto the top of the roof of another section of the hotel.  No big deal, like I said, I wasn't there for the view.  But the noise was insane!  Sounded like a diesel truck engine running in the room!  I went back down to the front desk and told them about it and they said "no problem, we'll move you up to another suite as soon as one opens"  which turned out to be a couple hours later.  The new suite up on the 21st Fl was excellent.  Same basic room layout as the noisy 3rd floor room, very spacious bordering on huge, king bed, 2 person hot tub in the bedroom, decent size bathroom, free wifi, nice TV, and a really great view of the West side of Vegas and the scenic mountains.  Only thing really lacking was a refrigerator.  Not even a small one in the room.  The next size upgraded suite apparently has one it but not  the Spa Suites.  Hmmmm I'm used to having a fridge even in a basic Hilton room!  Anyways....
The bed was very comfortable, tons of pillows, and really no compaints about anything in the room.  I was a little worried about noise when I first looked out and saw the big arc of the roller coaster where the coaster climbs slowly up to the big drop.....and everyone screams......but unless I was listening for it, I didn't even notice after a short time.   having the hot tub in the room was awesome too after some long days on my feet doing a lot of walking around.  So nice to come back and relax in the hot tub in the privacy of my own room.  
The casino is well laid out in a central location and most of the rest of the first floor is filled with eating establishments.  Being there for 7 days and 6 nights, I got the chance to try many of them and was very pleased with the variety and quality of the choices.  They run the full range from very cheap to rather expensive too so there really is something for everyone's budget here.  
They have a couple shows to see as well and my wife and I saw Zumanity with a nice discount from the hotel conceirge.  Good show for adults...a bit odd at times but very entertaining overall.  
I'd highly recommend not renting a car from the hotel's Avis desk though. They charge twice as much to rent from the hotel as they do from the airport which is a 5 minute cab ride away.  I only needed the car for one day so it was worth the cab ride over to save $100.  
So overall, I'd recommend the hotel and wouldn't mind staying there again but I'd make sure I got a room with a fridge next time and wouldn't even think of anything on the lower floors due to noise.

I enjoyed the casino\/hotel for the most part. Obviously smoking is something that is allowed in most casinos but it carries its way around the hotel as well which I'm not terribly a fan of. The casino was laid out nicely so it was easy to find our way to the exits, attractions, and elevators. 

Our rooms were very comfortable! The beds especially. I really enjoyed the large bathtub as well.

We had a great time!
My boyfriend and I stayed one night in a spa suite and never had to leave the hotel for the whole night! We started the evening at Gallagher's steakhouse. Yum!
Next, we went to Chin-Chin for sushi. Suck.
Next, off to Zumanity! Fantastic!
After a few drinks and a few songs at The Nine Fine Irishmen, it was back to our own private hot tub. What bliss! 
The Nine Fine Irishmen is one of my all-time favorite bars. It is so nice to get Magner's cider on tap and sing along to some of my favorite Irish tunes.

As long as you avoid Chin Chin, you'll have a great night!

Loved this hotel when we came here the summer of 2003. Me being 18 and not being able to gamble, the arcade here was awesome. Better than Luxor or Excalibur, not as good as Circus Circus. The family got an upgrade to a Park Place suite, I believe, and we stayed in the building with the pink windows. We got a corner room, so that was awesome. We had like 10 window panes in that room. The bathroom, as I recall, was alright and the room overall was good. There was no buffet, so that sucked, but we went to the expensive ESPN Zone, and the food was alright. I would come here again if it's affordable...for my parents, that is.

So me and my fellow yelper Mildred V stayed here for an industry conference, and we booked far in advance and got a great deal... $540.00 including flight and 6 nights at this hotel......  the only vice is this hotel is on the south end of the vegas strip...  if you want to be near just MGM, Mandalay Bay, Monte Cristo, and Luxor then this is the place to be at... 

It wasn't a bad room for the price and I would stay here again if need be.... but I'd rather much stay at harrah's or venetian....

The place is stayable. Good casino for families (arcade, roller coaster ride,  a chocolate store connected with the casino), everything is accessible without parents having to worry about their kids roaming outside of the casino. Kind front desk service, good and fast house keeping, and for the most part the casino is clean despite it being a pretty old hotel. 
HOWEVER, if you lose anything here or even need help or assistance from the security, don't expect good service. The security service is very rude, and do not have the intentions of helping out their customers. They judge their customers by their age and if you look too young, they will not take you seriously. Majority of the time I was being "helped", I was being lectured about their rules and such for finding an item I left in the rooms I was staying. They don't listen to anything I have to say, and just try to shoo people away.

We didn't stay at this hotel but will choose it for the next trip to Vegas. 

We were WOWed by the fact they had so many affordable food options compared to the other hotels on the strip.

The village eateries were inexpensive and good.  Sirrico's Pizza was delicious and they had a special: slice and beer for $6.50 - can't beat that in Vegas. 

America restaurant is open 24\/7 and they have delicious food too. 

The roller coaster is a good adrenaline boost.

We also liked the casino and dueling piano bar a lot.

Stayed here one night. Our room was in the empire tower. Faced the strip but the windows were tiny and didn't have a great view. The walls are paper thin and you can hear conversations going on next door!! Rooms were small and average but the price was good so can't complain. The casino was ok, I did like the fact that they have high ceilings though and the atmosphere is cool. We are staying at a new place every trip to Vegas....don't think we will put this one in our list to return here to stay.

This has got to be my favorite hotel whenever I'm in Vegas.  I know it's not as fancy (or "boojie") as others but they've treated me very well and below are my reasons.

1.  Affordable hotel prices.  I don't have to worry about giving one of my kidneys just to stay overnight.
2.  Great for gambling.  They don't take my $40 in 5 minutes *cough* MGM Grand *cough*
3.  So many late night places to eat whether you're only craving a pretzel or a full size pizza.
4.  The bars are so laid back.
5.  The rooms are clean and spacious enough that you won't feel cramped.
6.  It's located right off the strip so everything is within walking distance.  For instance, the monorail is right across (MGM Grand) so you can go to hotels that are not walking distance.
7.  Service staff is friendly, courteous and helpful.
8.  NYE - Has a great spot to see the fireworks.
9.  Members Program - A lot easier to accumulate points.
10.Casino-Invited Guest Lounge - You can get free bottled water, sodas, tea and coffee while snack on pretzels, cookies and trail mix.  It's not located at one of their sister hotels unlike The Palazzo and Venetian.
11.Essex Penthouse Suite - I was fortunate enough to stay here a while back ago and this place was simply amazing!  Master bedroom comes with bathroom so big, it's bigger than a studio apartment.

Bachelorette party weekend.. we got a suite at NYNY.  

Matron-of-Honor got ziggurate (sp?) suite.

Roomy, comfy, and awesome.  We had a view of the rollercoaster and a bit of the strip.. so that was nice.

Honestly.. I only used the place to sleep.. we were out most of the time.. I can't really judge it other than.. it's a great place to rest my head at the end of a fun evening. 

I'd recommend a stay there.

Great room with a strip view.  We were only here for a night, but our flights got cancelled.  The hotel manager extended our checkout time til 330 pm.  Super helpful, and it gave us a place to hang while we waited for our later flights.  Room service breakfast was reasonable, and the food was great. Highly recommend.

We're really getting fond of the NYNY - I have to stay the entire staff was top notch, friendly professional - the front desk, the pit crew, dealers, MLife staff, waitresses, maids, everyone we interacted with was great.

Our room, 2021, clean, working temperature control, super comfy king size bed, gorgeous flat screen TV, secure doors, plenty of hot water, working safe, nice view of Red Rock Mtns and the roller coaster, big table with large mirror (wife loved this).  It did have a faint odor (sorta like that old cigarette smoke coverup aerosol) but after a few minutes didnt notice it.  Internet worked good.

As a 'pearl' Mlife the daily parking fee is waived (or is supposed to, we got charged and had to work with the front desk to resolve, probably the only stumble here)

As in my prior post we enjoyed the Nine Fine Irishmen, the other shops, and placed a few sports wagers.  We like its location on the strip with easy access to the other MGM resorts.

The gambling here, like most corporate strip casinos, continues to be manipulated in the house favor (6\/5 Blackjack, 6\/5 Bonus Video Poker, etc).  However they do have a FEW 3\/2 blackjack tables here, so i was able to play a bit.  Craps is a game that refuses to be jiggered with so you can always play that without fear.  I did play some of my old school favorite slots Haywire and Wild Cherry and had fun, but when me and the wife want to do real gambling we hop in the car and head off strip sad to say.

We really like the NYNY Hotel and their staff - nice job.  We'd come to Vegas more often if the casino had better rules.

so to start i should tell you we stayed at the vdara for two nights (hotwire for $97) and then we moved over to NYNY for two nights (expedia $124 ) i tell you DO NOT STAY HERE!! it is like a going from a hotel by neiman marcus to a hotel by walmart. this is clearly one of those theme hotels they plan to tear down after 10 years or so. downstairs in the casino is fun and whatnot, but stay somewhere else! expedia gives it a 3.5 stars but it is not......

Was staying at NY NY while in Vegas and what can I say about the hotel but that it looks like they built a mini city inside the hotel.  

It's one of the bigger casino's in vegas with plenty of tables and slot machines.  Probably one of the advantages of NYNY is the food options.  You can get something reasonably price here (like under $10) or you can go to one of their high end restaurants for a night out.

I stayed in the Century Tower and I believe it was like the 32nd floor.  Of all the places I've been to in Las Vegas, this room had the best view.  We had a great view of the strip and the mountains and the strip looked great all lit up at night.

Besides the view, the room was nice.  Had plenty of room for 3 guys without being in each others way.  Things are a little dated in the room so no flat screen TV and some of the stuff here while in good condition was old.  The sinks were in a separate room from the toilet and shower which is always nice.  The shower was definitely high end and hot water was there quickly.

Overall, was impressed with my stay here at NYNY especially with the view in the upper levels of the Century Tower and would recommend it to anyone.

I decided to stay here with my lady because I had a conference right down the street and we had purchased Zumanity tickets. 

Truly enjoyed the stay, actually won at the casino, and became a Pearl M Life member during the visit. 

It's clean, well maintained, friendly staff, and perfectly located on the strip. 

We will be back in the future!
Stayed here for 3 days and had a great time.. My wife loves this place!! Just hung out by the pool!!!!! Great time!!!

This time of the year, vegas is at 106 f and its very hot. Still the streets are crowded with visitors from all over. We checked in at this hotel for 2 days just relaxing coming back from bryce canyon and zion national park. It is in the center of the strip and everything is nearby and walking distance. Rooms are bigger, sheets are soft and beds are comfy. Arcade is very accessible great for the kids. The pools is nice and family frienly too.

This hotel surprised me in so many ways. 

On my last trip to Vegas, over Memorial Day weekend, hotel prices were sky high. I was looking for an affordable hotel, and after seeing Zumanity at the NYNY during my last trip, I was very impressed with the casino and wanted to eventually give the hotel a try. 

Parking is very easy, and the walk to the hotel is very short. The casino is updated and clean and has such a kitsch vibe to it. The casino is also very well ventilated and when gambling the cocktail waitresses are friendly and fast with drink orders (unlike the cosmopolitan). Checking in was painless, their was no line and the front desk worker was friendly enough. 

When we finally reached our room, I was starting to panic slightly. The elevators and hotel corridors were outdated and I was wondering what our room was going to look like. Let me preface by saying the only 2 other times I have been to Vegas I have stayed at Aria and Bellagio, higher end hotels than the NYNY. When we got in our room I was a little shocked. It was outdated atheistically, and had bare minimum in terms of a hotel room. I don't know if it was the 8 hour drive from SoCal or my expectations being too high, but initially I was taken aback. 

However, after a solid nights rest, I really came to apprecitate and LOVE the room we stayed in. The rooms at NYNY are good sized. Our bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. No bed bugs and we arrived to a clean room. Our bathroom was HUGE! It came with a huge (semi-updated) vanity, and the shower was big enough for two people. All the appliances in the bathroom worked and were clean. Our neighbors were also very quite for our entire stay, no loud music or disturbances. 

What I also love about this hotel is how many awesome food and drink choices are available to you, a few minutes from your room. They have a pizza place, a pub, the Hershey's bar, and affordable restaurant places near the check in desk. Their are lots of affordable reassurance and I really loved that about this hotel. 

Another plus for this hotel is that within walking distance you can take the tram that connects to Monte Carlo to Aria and Bellagio or you can take the tram that connects to Luxor, Excalibur, and Mandalay bay. Being between two trams that take you to so many hotels was so great and saved a lot of time. 

Also, the pool is great here! 

Checkout is also very easy. I have noticed a lot of hotels doing this now, but NYNY also lets you check out via text. It is very easy especially when you need to get on the road to beat that godforsaken Memorial Day traffic back to CA.

Overall, after my initial shock of the minimalist rooms, I came to adore this hotel. It is clean, fun, and has that electric Vegas energy, no snotty attitudes found here. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are going to Vegas on a holiday weekend or you are looking to stay somewhere cheaper, if the rates at other hotels are exorbitant.

among the MGM\/Mirage properties, i've stayed at 6.  my favorite hotel rooms in order have been MGM, Aria, Mirage,  Luxor,NYNY, Excaliber.  looking forward to someday trying Bellagio & TI.   NYNYrooms very nice.  comfy beds.  most user-friendly hotel shower i've experienced.  outstanding places to eat.  clean everywhere.  beautiful, exciting casino floor.  pleasant & abundant front desk staff.  well done gimmick. 
my dealbreaker:  understaffed beverage service.  got 1 drink within 30min after midnight on a monday.  at 1am tues, i played craps for 10min with no server; i angrily scanned the entire pit area & didn't see a single server anywhere.  i got a drink from the bar & out of curiosity, walked around the pit seeing if drink service was there--nope.  i later played a tight slot machine & received a drink.   true story: that tues night, i encountered 2 prostitutes offering their services & 1 waitress offering her services. within the past year,  i have found beverage service has become intolerable\/neglectful at 3 MGM\/Mirage properties:  Aria, Bellagio & now NYNY .  once again, an improper staff to customer ratio tells me owners are cheapskates who don't mind torturing their few employees, & soon-to-be few customers.  but thank you NYNY;  from now on, i will buy in, then loiter at the craps table until i have a comp bevie on the way, then i will make my first bet.    i believe understaffed drink service is a jinx, & i will enjoy pissing off the pitboss as i wait for the comp drinks.

Me and NY-NY, I don't know.  It just wasn't as smooth as it should have been or as smooth as pretty much anyplace else I've stayed in Vegas.  The keys stopped working because they didn't program them correctly.  The wifi's download speed ranged from 0.14 to 0.36 mbps, which is sort of useless.  The cable TV went out one night and they blamed the cable company for that.  The alarm clock was so weird that I had to download the manual to learn how to set the alarm.  After 3PM no one works in the business center but when you call, a message says someone will call you back even though no one is there.  And the room could have been cleaner.  There were empty shampoo bottles in the bathroom and garbage behind the nightstand.  The good news is that there were no bedbugs.

I'll stay somewhere else next time.

After a terrible 2 days at Hard Rock ( you can see my posting on that expierence!) we checked into New York New York. This was my second stay there in a year and had as much fun as I did the first time. 

The place is full of life. Lots of music and a ton of places to eat, snack and drink. Their Jacuzzi suite was a fraction of the price of the Hard Rock and a hundred times better. 

If you have never been to New York New York, go! You will not be disappointed.

I had two free nights here and it worth every penny! Well, I still had to pay $14 a night for "resort fee" which basically translate as internet service. But still this was a good value.

Rooms are small but comfortable and quiet. The hotel layout is quite strange as it has to accommodate the pretend NYC skyline outside. Because of that, you may walk quite a bit to get to your room. There is no buffet here, so if that is what you like about Vegas go elsewhere.

Dirty, noisy and not a great experience! So glad we were able to go back to our hotel that was clean with respectful staff. I've never seen such grimy finger printed chrome fixtures and Windows and doors!

Each year my work takes us to Vegas, and each year we stay at a different hotel.  I must say I enjoyed my stay at New York New York.   The standard rooms are ok, nothing special, however we decided to upgrade to the spa suite for just $40 a more a night....This was worth the money.  The jacuzzi spa was wonderful after walking all over Vegas during the day.  The people that worked at New York New York were nice and helpful!  The restaurants on site were affordable and offered a nice selection of  different food.   I would for sure stay here again.
Didn't really fancy this casino.  Small and didn't have any slots that I wanted to play.  I really like the facade of this casino.  It is really swell.

If the MGM Grand across the street is Manhattan, this place is New Jersey.  The staff all seem to feel that it is a HUGE imposition to wait on customers.  Internet service is included in a $20 day "resort fee" and is every bit as fast as the dial-up service I had 15 years ago.  Television service is iffy, often pixelating or blinking on and off.  

The rooms are all rather boring; they don't say "Las Vegas Strip," they say "That Comfort Inn Out By the Interstate."  

If you step outside, expect to be accosted by hustlers, time share scammers, homeless people, whores, and more.  T

This hotel gets 3 stars. If you are expecting a luxurious hotel, this is not the place to stay. Book a room at the Mirage for that. They have much nicer rooms for the same price. We got the king suite. Very tiny. Not good if you will be spending most of your time in your room. But if you want a cheaper place to stay and will be out and about while you stay here, the NYNY would be adequate.
Haven't stayed in a room yet. But the casino floor is pretty big and entertaining. Both my bf and I like the old style new York new york!

This place is pretty ok!

NYNY is a nice hotel, but a little confusing. I've been in the rooms before, and they're typical. Sorta small but nice linens and beds. The casino portion is like a big circle surrounded by other eateries and stores. This is where you can get confused, or me anyway lol. The slot machines in the casino are very repetitious, and I like gambling so finding a good machine was sorta impossible. I did settle on Wonder Woman though, and it paid out OK... I still ended up leaving a few bucks in there.

NYNY houses many restaurants along with many stores, an arcade, and the beloved roller coaster. 

The only gripe I have is the parking garage to casino ratio. It's not unbearable, but if you had luggage and had to walk the distance plus find the check in desk, you're screwed.

All in all the casino and hotel itself isn't too bad. Just not my favorite.

Yay!

Stayed for one night and we had a great time. Spa Room was clean and loved the jacuzzi tub! We had a cool view of the roller coaster but could not hear it so that was great. Attentive staff, and quick check-in. 

Fell in love with 48 and Crepe! We had breakfast there both days. The casino is not cluttered like most and while my husband gambled I shopped at the Hersey store.

We enjoyed the pool for a couple of hours, for the price I would stay there again. It is in a  convenient location with just short walk to some of the larger more expensive hotels.

This Hotel needs to be updated badly!!! From their popcorn ceilings to their old worn out carpet!! Our room keys didn't work! They had to have security open up our room! Our "non smoking room" smelled of smoke\/cigars. Shower head sealed was broken! When we turn on the air conditioner in our room a big puff of dust flew from their vent onto our faces!! Their pool closes at 7:00 pm?? I didn't think anything closed at 7:00 in Vegas!  My husband & I like sitting in the jacuzzi at night when it's not so crowded or hot outside. The next morning we decided to check out a day early after our room key didn't work again!!  Before we left we ate at one of their restaurants (buffet) everything looked like it had been sitting their for along time, or they needed to replenish what was out! People were waiting for eggs and syrup.  Their pastries we hard as rocks!! 
We were so disappointed  especially since we actually had the weekend to ourselves without our kids!
Gave us a horrible room when we booked a room with a strip view and 2 queen beds in each room, then gave us 2 rooms with one king bed in each and there's six people
Like most strip casinos, expensive.  More geared for the younger people.  Still fun to walk the food plaza.

The check in for this hotel was painless esp considering that I was asking for quite a bit. You see why had about 15 or so people on the trip which require 4 rooms. The check in clerk did his best to get the rooms as close as he could. I was worried cause I had heard from other yelpers that when they had several rooms, they ended up in different tower, but we no such issues. In fact, all the rooms we really close to each other. And since we weren't going to use the wireless Internet in the rooms, he waived the resort fee! 

Navigating the hotel was pretty simple but could require a long walk. The towers of the hotel are at the back meaning that often times the are as far as possible from the entrance. 

The rooms themselves are pretty nice. I didn't notice anything that looked old or out of place. The only thing that might be considered "old" was the TV. It was just a regular TV and not a flat screen, but if you're watching a bunch of TV in Vegas you're probably doing something wrong, so that that didn't bother me 

Since we were in Vegas and getting wild with a bunch of people in 4 different rooms, our doors were often open to let people come and go as they please. I guess the doors have sensors in them, because several times during our stay security would come to the rooms and make sure everything was OK. Its a very cool thing for the hotel to do but it got annoying after awhile. But really, we can only blame ourselves for that, haha. 

Since we were there over the summer we decided we should check out the pool, which was surprisingly fun. They had a DJ and loud clubby time music which was exactly what our group was looking for! The only issue that we had there was that it was a little difficult to find seats.

Not all that impressed with this establishment. 

Room was nice and clean, updated, warm showers, Nice TV, clean linens and all that. You really don't get a view with the windows being as narrow as they are, and not your usual floor to ceiling window I've had in other hotels on the strip. 

Restaurants are not all that. STAY away from The America. How do you burn an English Muffin? and when it comes back, it's not really warm. Options are burnt or just out of the bag with some brown spots. The BF had an omelet and had stomach issues for a few days after. 

They have a cool Statue of Liberty made purely out of jelly belly's, now that was cool. Casino is a bit small. Now on to the pool. many of us go to Vegas to party at night, and lounge at the pool during the day and get a little sun. Because of its location, the pool doesn't get much sun unless the sun is shining right above. (buidlings are on either side of the pool blocking the rays. I've been to Mandalay Bay, Excalibur, The Flamingo, and this pool looks like your basic pool. Not a fan.

Rates are ok, but honestly, I'd rather pay a little more and stay closer to the heart of the strip than near the end. 

Would I stay here again? erm, It's not a terrible place, but honestly, I have experienced better.

came for the roller coaster and left...so didn't see teh whole hotel.  What I did see was typcial Vegas.  Nothing stood out for me.  I'd return and cruise the hotel again to see what else they have to offer.

Disappointed would be an understatement.

I stayed at the NYNY shortly after it first opened and in between that time and now, I've been staying mainly at The Venetian.  However, because I have a younger friend in from London, I decided to book someplace that might be a bit more fun and decided on the NYNY.  I booked a room that was comparable by price and so my expectations were comparable what I expect at The Venetian.  Not so. Not even a little bit.  The 1st room was as old as the day the hotel opened (the bedding, wallpaper and the antiquated TV) and the only word to describe it would be, dank.  I requested a move and it wasn't until the 3rd request that we were upgraded a somewhat more modernized room.  I use the word somewhat very sparingly here, as the the room was in disrepair.  The curtain rod fell right down when I went to open up the curtain.  The shower pull thing to activate the shower, came right out, the lid didn't fit properly on the toilet, the TV was yet another dinosaur (completely with crackly reception) and the internet SUCKED.  

I cut my trip short and left a day early.  I WILL NEVER STAY AT THIS SORRY EXCUSE FOR A HOTEL AGAIN. The price for the room is worth about $59.99.

On the way out, the only thing the hotel clerk had to say was, "you know you can't get a refund."  Refund?  Who asked for it? I made the mistake of booking the hotel and blame no one but myself for not being a little more thorough.

Warning to Parents: The NYNY doesn't know who they want to be, with the fact that they have a roller coaster and gogo girls right on the casino floor, makes this an inappropriate place for children.   

Advice: Stay at the Wynn, Trump, Venetian or Bellagio.

We recently stayed for my birthday from Feb 15-17th.  For the most part, the hotel exceeded my expectations.  I have been coming to Vegas every year for my birthday since I was 23.  In my 8th year staying in Vegas, we decided to stay at the hotel that we usually spend the most time in; New York, New York.  We love Coyote Ugly and the dueling piano bar so we figured why not make it easy and get a room here so that we wouldn't have to walk far to our room.

We stayed in their one bedroom luxury suite.  If possible, GET IT.  The room is ENORMOUS.  It comes with a whirlpool tub that we took advantage of one night.  The bathroom was incredible and having a fridge came in handy.  We were amazed to learn that the beverages in the fridge were FREE.  I had to ask our check in lady, a few times, "are you sure they are free?   Like it's not weighted and if we touch something you charge us?".  She assured us they were completely complimentary.  Pepsi, diet pepsi, sierra mist and water are all waiting for you in your room.  They even restocked them the next day!  They also have a keurig machine in your room with K-cups!  I tell you, you will not be disappointed if you get this room.

We ate at Tom's Urban for brunch and it was absolutely delicious.  Coyote Ugly was fun as usual and the dueling piano bar provided the entertainment for a couple hours. Fun tip, if you sit at the bar where there is a machine to gamble on, your beers and well drinks are free!  Just make sure to play a hand every once in awhile to be eligible to get those free drinks.

I do have to share one complaint though.  We were supposed to fly out of Vegas on the 17th but due to a storm back home, our flight was cancelled.  I was alerted to this at 7:30 AM on February 17th.  I was able to book a flight out the following day but would have to spend one more night in Vegas.  Nothing to complain about really.  I called down to the front desk and was helped by Gail.  Gail informed me that staying another night would not be an issue but we would have to switch rooms as the suite was already booked.  Fair enough, I asked her what room was available and the cost.  She replied only a standard room was available and it would be $150 plus the $30 resort fee.  I stated I was an MLife member, maybe there was an Mlife rate that would apply?  $180 for just a standard room seemed a little excessive.  Gail stated she would transfer me to Mlife and I could ask them about a better rate.  Gail accidently hung up on me.  So I called back.

Gail apologized and placed me on hold to transfer me to Mlife.  20 minutes passed on hold.  I figured it's early, maybe a full staff is not on board yet.  Gail came back on the phone and was not aware I was still holding.  She apologized and then transferred me to Mlife.  This time, the Mlife music was playing so at least I knew I was at the right spot.  The Mlife member came on the line, got my information and asked how she could help.  I explained the situation about not being able to fly out due to a storm and we needed to book another night.  The Mlife member then put me on a 7 minute hold.  She came back and apologized and stated the hotel said I would have to leave my suite.  I told her I knew that and I assumed Gail had told her.  She stated she doesn't who Gail is.  I said it was the New York employee that transferred me to her.  She said they don't communicate with the transferring agent....well that seems a little unhelpful.  I could have saved 7 minutes for both myself and the MLife agent if they were in the loop after being on the line with Gail for so long.

MLife informed me that the $180 rate for a standard room was the best they had.  I sighed and said that's fine, go ahead and charge me and let me know what I have to do to switch rooms.  She said that I would need to check out, then go in line to check in, share with the check-in person my situation and let them know I talked to VIP services and stated the $180 rate....Are you kidding me?  After spending almost an hour on the phone, the hotel expected me to do this all over again but in person?  Why didn't Gail tell me this when I first called?  That I couldn't extend my stay over the phone and that I should head down to the front desk?  Why waste everyone's time?  After this conversation, I decided we should switch hotels since it was cheaper at Excalibur and we would have to pack up anyways.  So we did.

Long story short, the hotel suite is incredible but the service was lacking.  I still give the hotel 4 stars because the room was great, the entertainment was great, the drinks were amazing and the hotel really offers everything you need for a good Vegas trip.  But the service issues should be addressed.

Been to Vegas bunches of times, but this was my 1st stay at New York New York.  I really wasn't sure what to expect, and was hoping it was nice.  I was not disappointed.  I checked in prior to our arrival using their mobile check-in service, entered our approximate arrival time, and then received an e-mail about 1 hour before notifying us that our room was ready.  Picked up our keys from the kiosk in the lobby and headed up to our room on the 11th floor in the New Yorker tower.  Our room was clean and well appointed.  We weren't in the room that much, but when we returned at the end of our adventures on the strip, the bed was very comfy.  My husband and I go to Vegas several times a year, and we will be adding New York New York to our hotel rotation.

We found a great deal on Groupon for this hotel, so my friends and I decided to try it.  So glad we did ... it was a great experience.  First, we pre-arranged for a special treat for my friend's birthday ... a cake, chocolate covered strawberries, champagne and balloons upon arrival.  They did an amazing job, even down to the smallest detail in decorating the room service table.  The room-service breakfast was awesome ... and the perfect start to a vegas day.  We enjoyed the casino, the wait-staff in the casino.  Late-at-night, the pizza shop in "downtown New York" provided a really delicious slice!  This was a great trip, definitely go back again!

A group of friends and I just got back from Vegas, where we stayed at the NY-NY hotel. 

We really liked the place. It aint the Ritz, but it's definitely not bad at all.

One of the best parts was that they offer free Craps "lessons" every morning at 10am, and if you attend the lesson (which takes place right on the casino floor), they allow a $5 minimum bet on the Craps table (usually, it's $10).

The cocktail waitresses come by often, though every now and then they will take your drink order and forget to bring it to you (even if you are regularly tipping them).

If you want cheap eats, they've got stuff like Nathan's Hot Dogs. If you want a nice place, I've heard Gallagher's steak house is really good (in the hotel).  They've also got good pizza place (Sirrico's, I believe) that's open 'til 3am, which is perfect after an evening of drinking.

The sports book leaves a lot to be desired, especially when you compare it to the ones at MGM and Mandalay Bay, which are in close walking distance.

The only downside was that there were some seriously questionable\/sketchy patrons along with us on the casino floor around 2-3am when we were gambling, but nothing too uncomfortable.

I'd recommend it.

We enjoy coming here because of the many fast food eateries, from pizza, candied apples and pretzels at the top of the escalator to MGM, to Dueling pianos, nine irishmen, a fish n chips place in the cobble stone walkway.

They also have low limits on their table and up to date slots, which we like.  Theres a lot of construction going on outside and its kind of confusion getting to the parking now.  It is also walking distance to our home hotel MGM, so that a big plus for us.

I give the hotel a 3.5, but a 4.0 for my experience. We only stayed for one night, cheaper, and they bumped us up to a suite for no additional charge. Sweet. It had a jacuzzi in the room, a living room area, we had two queen beds, and plenty of room space to play in.

We didn't play at the casino because they had construction going on. Parking garage was easy to find. Staffs and services were friendly and helpful. It was luxurious for a place to sleep in.

The theme is very well integrated through the hotel and casino. Unlike some casinos which have a theme for their lobby, or shops, but have a boring\/drab casino, NY NY seemed integrate its casino floor into the New York theme which I enjoyed.

If you do your homework and pull some strings you can usually get some free drinks and other coupons with your reservation.

For the money we got a great room with a view of the airport (awesome because I'm a plane buff) and the strip. 

I'd definitely come back.

I wasn't very happy with my recent stay. The fist day one of the maids walked into my room without as much as a single nock on the door. On another day despite the do not disturb sign hanging  on the door a different maid nocked until I woke up and answered the door asking me what time I want her to service the room. I'm not sure what do not disturb means to them. The gym that I am required to pay a daily service charge for had 2 scales and the batteries were dead in both. I informed the attendants but they just said sorry but didn't fix the problem. On the 3rd day I took my own batteries and put them in one of the scales. I'd write more if 8 had the time but overall it was just a bad trip.

It was a great hotel. The lineup was a bit long at midnight. Because it was my birthday, they upgraded our room. We got a $50 food voucher and we went to buy pizza, a huge one. My only complaints were that the hot tub was out of order the last day, but they gave a resort fee refund for that day. The other complaint was the roller-coaster kept me up late the night because it was loud. Besides that it was a great hotel. I loved the mini new york

This is a budget hotel, and at that level it would be more than satisfactory.  There were some problems with our stay. The plumbing was an issue throughout our stay. We eventually had to request a room change, for which the hotel was very accommodating. The reason for the mediocre rating is the MLife desk. When we were ready to check out, we were informed that our play was only sufficient to cover comps for the room and resort fee, and $13 extra could be applied to any purchases. Apparently, even though we were told the room was comped up front, there was a debit to the account which we are expected to meet during our stay! And, in the past, they helped us with checkout. But, this time he just pushed my MLife card and ID back at me and told me to got to the checkout desk. The Line was ridiculous because the kiosk was not functioning.  So, while I am disappointed that our 'play' is not up to expectations, I still feel that we should be treated with respect! Maybe that is too much to ask, but I don't think so.
Très bien placé.Accueil parfait. Check in un peu long mais sinon, super!

This is another one of the older hotels in Vegas that has a cool theme to it.  It's supposed to resemble new york city of course so as the hotel becomes outdated and nasty looking the more it looks like the real new york.

On my last trip out to Vegas we stayed here for a couple of nights.  I liked the room a lot since there was a jacuzzi in the middle of the room.  When the showers got backed up I just jumped in and took a bath!

It's not perfect but still has a place in my heart. 

Plus they have a roller coaster out front!

Strayed here many times. The cost goes up and the amenities go down. Still a fun place but used to be better. The piano bar sucks now and it used to be a place we would always go. Most dealers are not that friendly but they are the same in every casino now. Our favorite dealers was at NYNY but there was only one friendly one.

If you want an authentic NY, NY experience park your car here. I did and was robbed at gunpoint in the parking garage when I was going to leave. Doesn't get more authentic then that! 

When I got home I didn't leave my apartment for 2 weeks. Is that like post-traumatic stress? Yeah, I'm a wuss.

That was eight years ago and I've only recently been back . . . to the casino, not the parking garage.

PS - Watch out for white cars with 4 adolescent\/early-20's men with black nylons pulled over their heads. They are NOT the hotel welcome wagon.

Had a great time at this hotel. I come to Vegas regularly and first time staying at New York New York. Love it because it's so centralized to all the spots I got too.... Service is great rooms are roomy and cozy.... Love this spot.

I like the fact that its connected to excalibur and the MGM hotel. YOu can walk from one hotel to the other using the skywalk. Its a smoky hotel like all other. Nothing too special. There is a roller coaster ride around the hotel. I haven't been on it but according to my friend who has been on it says its just a roller coaster nothing too special. I have to say this hotel has been here for a long time. At least over 15 years and nothing really have changed.

Inside is smoky but its cute to see statue of liberty being so colorful when you walk in.

My friend and I stayed here from Wed  to Sun.  The NYNY hotel\/casino is in a convenient location to the other hotel\/casinos on the new strip.   FYI, our standard room with double beds doesn't have a fridge or microwave, but the room size is decent.   Early check in\/ late checkout was available. 

Entertainment wise- check out Zumanity while staying here, the show length is only a bit over an hour so don't spend too much on tickets, balcony seats offer perfect visibility for half price. Also buy them at hotel box office, they have the better seats available and they are just as cheap if not cheaper than others. 

FYI Latin night at gonzalez&gonzalez on fri  and sat sucks the music isn't really a Latin night, if your looking for copacabana style or Havana Atlantic City style salsa merengue  reggae reggateton etc.. you won't find it there.. mostly Mexican band music. - (sorry if u like that kind of thing)

The live piano bar - 9 Irishmen is cool because of the live music. however it's an older  crowd and turns into a sausage fest later at night. - coyote ugly maybe be a better choice by not by much

The round bar in the center of the casino is the safest place to pregame with good music.  

Avoid the monorail! - even though there is a stop at the MGM across the street- all the stops are really really far at the back end of the mega casinos  and are certainly not faster. A cab is fastest and another good choice is the RTC busses.  (I would choose the 24hr RTC busses which ride up and down the strip every 15min and there is no risk of getting ripped off by the cab drivers)

There is a big Starbucks at the hotel- great but slowwwww -expect to wait in line and don't expect the line to move efficiently like the Starbucks back home. But Still - slow Starbucks is better than no Starbucks. 

Breakfast wise if your not satisfied with the NYNYs selection- we found much better Diner just around the corner.  There is  small diner called Cocos which is about a 10min walk behind the Tropicana just past Hooters but before a Motel 6 sign.  the food is great and seems to be popular with locals too.  The walk is worth it.

Not as enjoyable as it used to be hotel rooms are very outdated. No smoking allowed in the rooms anymore. Rude staff when trying to get a drink almost as you we're bothering them. Time too look for another casino to play and stay..
I love the food court!  Where else can you get a corn beef on rye, slice of pepperoni or hot dog?  NY, NY if course!

I stayed at New York New York Sunday to Wednesday after 4th of July weekend for a mini vacation. The reason why we decided to stay here was that we got comped here for 3 nights. We got to the hotel at about 8 PM, and the check out line moved pretty quickly. After the long car ride from LA, all I wanted to do us was to go to my room. Our comped room gave us a standard room. Our check in guy was kind of pushy about upgrading our room. But, I looked at the upgraded room and didn't think it was worth the $20 per night. Once we told him we didn't want to upgrade, he was kind of rude to us. But, I was so tired by this time, all I wanted to do was go up to my room.

Our room was in the New Yorker tower. And, when I came into the room, it smelled like stale cigarettes. (We aired it out a little and it was OK after a while). Looking at the room, it was so small. I almost regretted not going for the upgrade. But, I just decided to settle in. I had one of the worst sleep night ever. There was an adjoining door and there must have been a small party going on next door. I can hear the conversation so clearly that it was almost like they were in the room with me. The soundproofing in the rooms definitely needs work. I didn't want to ruin anyone's fun so I didn't say anything that night. I decided to try to switch room the next day. The next day, the lady that helped us was so nice. She upgraded our room for us for free to the one that the pushy check in guy from the night before tried to sell us. The room was definitely better and bigger (it still smelled weird). Also, there was an adjoining door, but since our room was connected to the emergency stair, the soundproofing was not a problem for us. (I really appreciated the fact that the lady thought about it to give us a room that did not adjoin another room). 

All in all, I don't think I would want to stay here if I had to pay. The standard rooms were so small and smelled weird. The check out guy was rude to us. The pool was also on the small side. The only upside for us was the great lady that helped us and that we were on the strip. But, with so many other choices on the strip, I will be looking for other places to stay for next time.

Stay here with my wife for 2 nights over a birthday weekend.  The views were great but the room was so hot even after calling for maintenance.  Not sure for the price I would recommend it to anyone.  Casino is small but nice.  Location on strip is good.
Probably as close to the real New York as you can get here in Vegas. The highlight of this casino is the roller coaster of course. If you are a thrill seeker this is definitely the place for you!

I called and made it very clear I wanted to check in at 11:00 am and paid the $20 fee to secure that privilege.   I also made it clear not to put us in a room where I cannot hear the roller coaster and the screaming.  I was told my suite would have a couch for my son to sleep on.  Apparently, all that meant nothing to them. I arrived at the check in counter at 12:15pm only to be told my room was not ready and it would be a few hours.  After very long conversation with the manager on duty I was given a room after a 30 minute wait in which most of that time I was speaking with the manager. When I got to the room  there was no couch as promised.  I had to go back down and switch rooms which took another 30 minutes. They put me next to the roller coaster where the noise was annoying and a lousy view of roof. So all the arrangements I made with the hotel agent, when I booked the room never happened.  Lessons learn, get everything sent to you in writing that was agreed upon, because apparently they will give you what they want to give you not what you want.  Also, another warning. The 50 dollar worth of free drinks "coupons" offer was really a charge to the room that they would deduct on check out.  So I tried it. The drink costs 8 bucks that you get for free anyway when you play in the casino.

They've got a new circular bar in the center of the casino that plays awesome...AWESOME...music.  The table games are now set up to radiate out from that bar.  Love it. 

Blackjack paid.  Pai Gow paid.  The Penny slots paid.  Nice.

Shockingly, when we visited a few weekends ago the joint was pretty full...and the MGM was shoulder to shoulder.

Nice hotel.  Would definitely stay here again.  

The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  Everything in the bathroom was updated and modern.  We got a great rate ($60 per night), and felt like we got our way more than our moneys worth.  Our floor was pretty quiet, and they stopped running the roller coaster at a decent hour, so we were able to get a good night's sleep every night (not that a person sleeps much in Vegas!).  Great selection of restaurants and bars here as well.

My only complaint was that the folks next door ordered room service, and the room service cart was left in the hall for almost 2 whole days.

We will definitely consider staying here again when we come back.
Players Club representative, Alvin S. Super helpful, patient, courteous & good humored!

Mid-level hotel. The rooms can use some updating. The casino and property itself is pretty neat with a faux nyc indoors.  Pretty straight forward and far less glitzy than a lot of the newer hotels. It caters to the mid 30s and up crowd in my opinion.  Good location and for someone who has never been to vegas,  a lot of photo opps indoor and outdoor in front of the replica bridge.

First time staying here.  Not bad Its a Vegas Hotel so it does its job.  I needed to stay close to the MGM hotel and this is just a 5 minute walk.  I didn't got to interact with any of their staff but had to call guest services and they were very accommodating.  I have no problem coming back here.

I stayed here for one night with my fiancé. Over all the casino was better than average. The layout reminds me of Buffalo Bills down the 15. The have your standard games plus casino war which you find everywhere. The room was nice and clean and a nice size. We upgraded to a Madison avenue room for $15. With that said,it seems like Vegas is changing. I know its town about money but it's getting ridiculous. The food is amusement park prices charging to park even if you stay at the hotel. Will they start charging for drinks next? I went to a casino off the strip and it was like a breath of fresh air and it felt like the wanted my business.
I really enjoy going here and having drinks with friends.. Good times, and good people around in the casino
This is just a fun hotel.  I love how the design and layout.  And the rollercoaster is fun too.
Hotel room not so bad.. Some staff not very helpful..My daughter slip on water someone spilled and didn't report.. Two of the staff members look at me like what oh well..

My first time to Vegas. We stayed here. What to say what to say...

First be ready to be tricked into staying in the casinos hours on end.
No clocks in sight. You are unable to see exits and entrances without asking a million people and walking for ever. Free drinks, yep, so you keep gambling, No windows, so you can tell how long you'v been there. No cell reception in the rooms and wifi is a joke. TV channels are also a joke.  Ok that said, its probably standard for Vegas, i'm sure that's how they make their money.

The Good, pillows and beds were comfy. Bathroom clean. Lots of restaurants to choose from. Located conveniently near MGM Grand and Excalibur. I did win big on one of the slot machines my second night so that's a plus. My friend stayed in a penthouse. Beautiful, spacious, great balconies, and 3 televisions with DVD players (I couldn't even rent one from the front desk).

The Bad, A long rough walk to Venetian. WiFi is a joke. One night water was shut off until 6 am... yeah, either hold it or go to Casino, what do you know, the water works fine down there. Housekeeping cleaned my room while I watched TV, tired from walking, and had the balls to steal my heels right out of the bathroom. i had them on the sink to clean the heels from night before.... I had just put them there and they vanished. Hotel didn't care. Carpets are kind of grimy. $15 a night resort fees ugh.

The GREAT: Zumanity is shown in the hotel AMAZING show. Front row tix are over $100 but guests of the hotel get 2 for $100.

Was not impressed with the hotel or rooms. The hotel looks worn and the rooms are very outdated. If I would have brought my old IPod I would have had a place to play music and charge it. Only wall plugsare  available for charging devices. The bed was mostly comfortable but pillows were flat. The restaurant choices were plentiful and food was good. Service was helpful when requested and check-in and out online was easy.

We prepaid for our room over the phone, but when we got there in person they told us that prepaying didn't guarantee us a nonsmoking room, or a deluxe room, like we had wanted and paid for- those rooms have a view, and are away from the roller coaster, it just guaranteed us a room.  They really should tell people that upfront.  So we got to our "non smoking room" and it was so smoky it gave us both a headache after 5 minutes, so we went back downstairs, which from where we were was a trek, and got a different room, at the very end of a very long hallway.  When we finally were able to settle, the room was nice.

As for the rest of the hotel, I didn't find their service through the casino or at the restaurants great. It was nice that they offer a service to hold you luggage if you're checking out, but not flying home right away, and they did offer late check out which is almost a must in Vegas, both which were free services.  Would I stay again?  Maybe.

First let me say extremely clean hotel, and stag was amazing. The suite I got was huge for the price and I have to say room service was awesome. Getting around the different towers was a task but my view of the roller coaster and the strip was amazing.

I come to Vegas 2 to 3 times a year.  This place has great customer service and nice rooms.  The American Cafe has the best breakfast and lunch.  I eat healthy and I can always find a fresh Turkey burger or healthy selection.  The pool how ever was a different story...they have a couple of waitress taking orders for those who sit in the chairs.  They totally igonored my friends and I...she saw us sitting there and we had to go too the outside bar ourselves and get our drinks while the waitress took orders from everyone around us and ignored our section.  Too bad she missed out on great tips.  This would be one of the reasons I will not stay here again but will eat at the New York New York.  They will give away tickets to ROK the night club but when I asked for tickets to the Piano bar I was refused.  If you are a guest of the hotel and you ask for passes to a place your going to spend money at... wouldnt you think that a $100 bar tab over rides a $10 entrance fee?  We are returning next month and we decided to go with Luxor which has great service all around!  They never ignore you anywhere at the Luxor!

A group of friends and I met in Las Vegas for the Halloween weekend, as we had in 2009.  We again chose to stay at NYNY, due to our experience last time which was pretty stellar.  Once again, we had a great time.  This hotel\/casino is pretty classy, without being ridiculously expensive (i.e. Bellagio, Wynn).  I booked my room no more than 2 weeks in advance, due to not being 100% sure I'd be able to make it this year, and still had 3 nights for $500.  Sure, there are cheaper places to stay on the strip, but NYNY offers the glitz and glam of some of the ritzier places without the super-heavy price tag.  Book earlier and I'm sure you can get a very decent room rate.

The casino itself covers a lot of floor space, and it really does feel like a miniture version of New York City in there.  Last year, they had $5 blackjack tables on weekdays (except Fridays), but apparently now they have converted over to minimum $10 tables, according to one dealer.  I guess that's my only real "complaint".

There are plenty of resturaunts, clubs, and bars in this hotel to entertain yourself if you don't feel like venturing out of the hotel.  I never rode the rollercoaster, but some friends told me it was pretty fun.

For the most part, the staff and cleaning crew at NYNY are friendly, helpful, and polite, which is refreshing for a place that caters to many thousands of people a night.

I may try staying somewhere else next time in Vegas, simply to add a little variety, but NYNY comes highly recommended by me.

Nice casino that is made to look like a baby New York. I like the casino and the shops located outside and inside the casino. My favorite shop was the M&M shop located outside. A little bit of everything from kids to adults. I think that the NY casino is one of the most accessible of the casinos.

For my first trip back to Sin City in at least a decade, my friend and I decided to stay at NY, NY (even though we're both from NY to start with. It's got a pretty central location on the south portion of the Strip, making it easy to walk around to MGM, Luxor, and Mandalay Bay to the south, while being within very walkable distance of all the new CityCenter stuff (which wasn't around last time I was here), Planet Hollywood, Bellagio, and the likes to the north. Although we arrived quite late (after midnight on Friday night), there was still quite a bit of a line to check in, with only 2 people helping to get people processed. It was late, but this is Vegas - so expected a bit more attention to service to be paid. They also didn't have the room we booked handy, so they gave us a 'Madison'-style room in the smoking section that was clearly for people with accessibility needs. I didn't mind the extra space, and they actually did a decent job of keeping the smell of cigarettes muted (the hallway, not as much). That said, the amenities in the room are of rather poor quality - the TV had really bad reception; the shower set-up (a no-bath setup without a door) had water leak out a bit more without the proper sloping towards the drain; and the weirdest thing of all - our toilet always required 2 flushes to work properly.

The room experience was rather poor, but the rest of the hotel is pretty solid. The roller coaster was actually a very fun\/solid ride, and there's a good assortment of restaurants inside the hotel to cater to any stereotypical New York-inspired needs you may have (steakhouse, Italian food, Nathan's hot dogs, etc.). The casino itself was okay, although I felt like there weren't enough tables for card games relative to how many slots\/video poker terminals there were (I'm sure these are the main moneymakers, but still). Parking is free, which is a nice plus given how hectic driving around the Strip can be. However, just like nearly every other Strip hotel, you get charged a 'resort fee' (in this case, $20\/day) that's not really worth the price.

Would I stay here again? Possibly, but I don't know if I would pay the price that I did. The weekday prices (which are around $60\/night, as far as I can tell) seem fairer than the $130\/night that it gets on the weekend, given the absolute quality of the hotel. That said, there's plenty to keep you interested within the hotel itself, and they do a pretty solid job of imitating the look (if not the exact experience) of New York City.

Hotel is older now but still decent.  Wish it had a fridge or coffee maker in room. They don't have a shuttle to the hotel.  Our room had a safe in it but someone broke it and pieces were in closet.  Beds were comfortable but pillow was very lumpy.

Had a great 4 day vacation. Had an issue with a broken water line in our room and they quickly moved us with an upgrade and were really nice. Liked having all the food in the hotel, and husband loved the $5 blackjack tables. The smoke in the casino was there, like everywhere, but not in the rooms. Overall, great.

My wife and I stayed here for a night just for the heck of it.  We loved it.  It has a very upbeat atmosphere that some other hotels don't have.  It's located in a nice area on the strip.   We all know that the south end of the strip is older and are in need of updates.  We really didn't get that feel here.  It was cheery, clean and lots of fun.  Above all, the price was super reasonable.  We like to go on off peak times and really found a gem here.  Stay here and I'm sure you will feel the same.

Staying at the MGM Grand, a walkway bridge takes you to New York, New York without crossing the busy street below.  It was fun to see what they did to condense Manhattan into this building.  The little bridges actually imitated Central Park, but other than that felt like a Disney version of New York.

Plus was the live band playing which was pretty decent.  But the best part was the mirror 'ball' shaped like a big apple and when you look at it, you inadvertently exclaim, "Look at the big apple!"  And then you feel like a dork when you realize what you've just said.

Okay, just who the hell absconded with all New York New York's charm?  And for the love of God, WHY?
Where are the trees, the street lamps, THE LITTLE BABBLING BROOK?  
This used to be one of my very favorite casinos!
Now there are 4-count-them-4 VP machines with decent pay tables, 2 have blurry screens and 2 have the jiggles.  WTF!?
The decor has become boring, boring, boring.
If I wanted to hang out at P-HO, I'd schlep my ass over there.

stayed here with my bf from thanksgiving day till 11\/30\/08. we booked the broadway room with king bed, through tripresv.com i think. and we got a free night off. we paid $316 total. so we got there like at 11pm thanksgiving night. the check in line was short. the girl at the desk said that they didnt have the room that we wanted. but they had a 2 queen bed non smoking and a king bed room smoking. we dont smoke so we got the 2 queen bed. but we did tell her to get us a king bed room for the next day she said ok. so we went up to the room and it  smelled like smoke inside. the room though was pretty big. 2 beds, a mp3 ipod radio\/clock, a big dresser(with light inside when you open the door, it had 4 drawers and places to hang clothes oh the iron and ironing board) and big tv stand with drawers. it also had a table, 2 chairs, like 2 floor lamps, a seat that looked like a high heel in leopard print, a small blue chair, the bathroom had a dryer, a moveable mirror, big tub with a glass sliding door and granite sink, the soap provided was made out of bamboo. the water in the tub took a while to go down. we tried sleeping in one bed but was not possible so we each slept in one bed. 

so the second day we went down to the check in area and asked for a king bed room. we did get it after a lady went "to the back" for a while.  this room was in the 24th floor. the room did not smell at all. it was a decent size, smaller than the other room. it had the same stuff as the other room. 

oh yeah the maid came into our room twice....once each day in the morning. like at 9am we were still in bed. but dude i did not like that!  i guess that i should have locked the door, or put that do not disturb thing.
