as for the casino...this place was not happening. it was a lil bit empty. i tried to get a beer at a bar while playing video poker but when i ordered it i was told sorry because i have to put more money into the machine i was pretty p'od! so i was like well then dont bring me anything, thanks. and i cashed out. never did i play again at this place. 

as for food the only place that i at was the pizza place in the village that was good. 

there is construction in the middle of the casino but its boarded up so i dont know what was there but it had ROK vegas ads i guess thats the new club idk. 

ps this casino is really confusing!!! i got lost a lot of times!

i wouls stay here again because i liked the rooms.

We stayed here for SEMA 2016.

The hotel is well laid out, It looks like some of New York's neighborhoods and streets, with a cobblestone walkway and rows of what appear to be brownstone buildings with fire escapes  with the bars and restaurants sprinkled in.

The room was very nice and clean the bed was comfy and the staff was very friendly.
I was lucky I got checked in very quickly and also checked out without a wait.
pleasantly surprised!

The valet was very quick and they have it set up for automated service you scan  your ticket and they bring up your car right away.

They also have a Uber\/Lyft stand if you need those services.

Would definitely stay here again.

I just stayed three nights for my birthday last month and had a really pleasant stay. The girl at check-in was friendly and actually asked us if we would prefer a higher strip view, which obviously we agreed to and she even had her manager throw my name up on their rotating sign behind them to say happy birthday to me!

I loved that they had good restaurants and a bar that were close off our elevator without having to walk all the way to the strip for a bite. I was of course ready to start day drinking at 10 AM, but I guess 11 wasn't too bad... 

Inside our room, the bed was comfy and the wifi was solid throughout the hotel. The layout to our room was easy and parking in the structure near the hotel elevator was also a breeze with their light up signals, albeit still stupid that you now have to pay for parking. We even spent a little time in their arcade which was pretty cool.

I'm only knocking them for one star because the pool wasn't that great... because of the high rise buildings and parking structure, the sun doesn't actually come down on the pool area until like 11, which means all the chairs are filled and it's so hard to find a spot. 

But if maybe you don't care so much about that, NYNY is a great place to stay!
One of my favorite Las Vegas Hotels. Super clean rooms. Staff is always friendly. Tons of choices in casino. I love all the restaurants.  It's my first choice if we go back.

It's one of the older hotels on the main strip, but they still deliver in terms of cost comparison, games, restaurants and access to Strip.  I stayed here for 3 nights and 4 days for a total of $100.82.  Like any other MGM property, you will have to pay for parking unless you have a Nevada state driver's license which then will be free.   The parking here is a little hectic because they don't open all of their parking decks.  3 parking levels are closed off to the public for some reason so it's a fight to find a parking space anytime of the day.  

Registration at the front desk is easy because the staff are great.  The elevators to the rooms are really quick and clean.  I found my room very clean and functional.  The only thing I would recommend is adding a small refrigerator.  

The hotel has a game room on the second floor which also leads to its famous roller coaster.  If your staying at the hotel, you can get a second ticket for the roller coaster for free.  It's definitely a good place to drop off your kids :)

There are plenty of various slots and tables like any other location in the Strip.  Your luck is the same so no need to go into great details about this topic.

I would recommend visiting the Nine Fine Irishmen Restaurant\/Bar, the Hershey store, Gonzalez y Gonzalez Mexican restaurant, among others on property.  It's Vegas so expect to pay a little bit more.
My wife and I where playing the slots and the waitress was very rude and seemed like she hated her job when she was serving drinks even though we where tipping her.

If you come to Vegas you have to stop by New York New York. They have a roller coaster ride which is a bit pricey but if you stay here you get a discount and there are always discount coupons floating around the internet. I have ridden this roller coaster a while back and it was really fun. One of the things I do come here for is the gambling which the floor is not overly huge like MGM but not as small as Harrah's. 

There is the famous Coyote Ugly bar which I think I am going to visit the next time I come to Vegas and all the around the area they have many little shops such as this magic shop which is really kewl and many food places such as New York Pretzels, the famous Hershey store where you can get the Hershey Milkshake, Starbucks and many other food and restaurants here. I like the vibe here and is very lively and it is just a walking bridge across from MGM and Excalibur. 

They are also apart of the MLife Rewards cards and they host many big show names like currently Lady Gaga is coming up. Since it was night I didn't have a chance to walk below but one of the most memorable things about this place was that after 911 there is a gate that runs around the perimeter and many people had tied notes in remembrance to their loved ones and I still remember that being an amazing and very touching sight to see. The structure is just amazing and the details of the buildings look so incredible at night. I highly recommend stopping by this hotel and checking out what they have to offer and I am going to say it, they have like these hunky dudes with no shirts always running around near the bar and I can say that they pretty much look like they came off a romance novel or Thor. LOL

My favorite thing about staying at the NYNY hotel is their Chinese restaurant Chin Chin on the casino floor. Nothing says hangover cure like a giant bowl of their yakisoba!  
The 2nd thing I love is the roller coaster, formerly known as the Manhattan Express (like Prince, I do not know it current name). I go on it every time I come to Vegas. It's the scariest ride I will go on (I managed to elude the bungee ride at the MGM until they took their amusement park down) and it rises high enough to see a large portion of the Vegas strip - for a quick second. It also cuts through the casino - which I think is very creative.  
The 3rd favorite thing is that you can take the sky bridge over to the MGM or cut over to the Excalibur (meh!) then to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. You can also walk north and hit the Monte Carlo next door. I love being in the middle of things and although this isn't exactly in the middle, it's close enough. Besides, from the MGM, you can take the monorail all the way to the north end, stopping at any casino except the Stratosphere. 
I also love the good deals you can get to stay here.
The rooms are nice - for what you pay. They are standard, but then, you won't need to hock the pink slip of your car to afford a few nights here. I was sold on staying here simply because I had never been to NYC, so a hotel in the design of the New York skyline was the next best thing. 
They house the Cirque du Soleil production of Zumanity - but it is not kid friendly. This is for grown up's who want to go to a strip club but don't want to admit out loud that they want to go to a strip club. 
On the down side, the pool is small. So small, that we opted to sneak into the Monte Carlo pool and risk getting the boot. We didn't get caught, but it was a close call. If a really great pool is your main criteria, stay at their sister hotel, the MGM Grand.

My husband and I just spent our honeymoon here in a Jacuzzi suite. It was clean, nice and we really enjoyed our stay. The staff here was extremely friendly and Celia, one of the managers upon check-in and checkout was so wonderful.

The Dealers at the table are really fun, we found a few favorites and will be letting the hotel know how much they contributed to the fun we had at the hotel. 

Great Food (TIP MUST TRY THE PIZZA ITS AMAZING).

We will definitely be returning.

Not a great hotel too many issues. Waited in huge line to check in only to get to our room that wasn't cleaned, messy bed, etc. So had to wait even longer for a clean room. Ugh!! ..Food not great, ordered room service corned beef hash, was so salty I could barely eat it! Says on the menu homemade but yuck was terrible. Went to get our car at valet in the morning, they had 1 valet person and he didn't even offer to load our luggage in the car. Not ok! This hotel sucks!!!!! I can go on & on but next time I will pay a little more to stay at the encore hotel or MGM signature suites!

This hotel might be great at the price point being offered today, but my experience is based on a visit prior to the economic downturn that is currently taking place.

The only real advice I can provide that hasn't been covered in other reviews is that I wouldn't stay in the Zanzabar suite or anything in that stack of rooms.  If you look at the NYNY Hotel from the outside, you will see that there are several "buildings" that make up the rooms of the hotel.  For the Zanzabar Suite (and certainly some other room types) the exterior is green glass. In theory, it sounds nice, but after a few hours in the green glow, I was ready to leave.  It did not provide a good feeling.  Sound strange?  Check it out for yourself.  I have spoken to others who experienced the same thing.

As for the hotel and the amenities, I don't really know what to say.  I don't understand who NYNY is trying to target.  They have magnet stands and Nathan's Famous hot dogs for sale when you walk in, a roller coaster and arcade for kids, and a themed restaurant row.  However, it is all wrapped around a casino that is for adults.  Didn't Vegas give up on the "kid friendly" thing in the 90's?  Time to renovate?  I think they did...oh well.

I can tell you that the worst massage I have ever received came from the spa in this hotel back in 1999.  I can also tell you that the pool is in a terrible location where most of the sunlight is blocked by the towers of hotel rooms.

On a lighter note, I once saw a guy in the NYNY casino win a small jackpot on the Wheel of Fortune machine.  The next day when I walked by the same machine, he was still sitting there.  I asked him how things were going and he said that the machine was still paying out.  He was smiling ear-to-ear.  The day after that when I walked by, the entire bank of machines had been removed from the casino.  I have no further information to share so you will have to decide how much of that is good vs. bad.

First time staying here and I liked. The staff is very helpful....room service is great. And house keeping is also very good. It's very nice place to go eat by the where all the restaurants are it very cute and you feel like you're no longer in a hotel.

Casino is just like any other not much of a gambler so it all looks the same to me.

The beds are comfortable. I didn't really like the bathroom it was a bit small. The room itself was nice though but our view sucked.

I like this hotel.

Though I've never stayed in one of their rooms, whenever we visit Vegas it's a hotel we always walk around in. The set up may not be an exact replica of New York, but it's close enough. I think they did a good job. Lots of restaurants in here, which look like good eats. They have a roller coaster, which I've yet to try since it's on the pricier side. There is a spa and salon in here as well. Hershey's Chocolate World is also close by.

My room safe was robbed of A LOT of money and it was an inside job! I had to deal with NYNY 'Risk Mgmnt' Dept for wks and they ultimately told me they weren't liable and found no fault on their part. I filed police report and starting talking to a LVMPD Det and after their investigation I found out NYNY Risk Mgmnt was not disclosing all info to me. I'm suing for much more than what was stolen from me! Stay away from this place, no cameras in hallways and shady employees.

This was our first trip to Vegas so I don't have much to compare it to by way of Vegas standards, but here's some things I would have thought could have been better. 
- Check in process was fine. We had to learn a few things on our own...the desk failed to mention if you are on a high floor you need to put your card in the elevator. We asked after getting to the highest floor we could and dragged our bags up five flights of stairs. 
- We stayed in a Madison, and our view was toward T-Mobile, not the greatest to people watch, but at least our view was obstructed by other buildings so I guess it wasn't too bad. 
- We had a king bed that came with only two pillows, a sheet, and a cover. We called down to get more pillows, a blanket, and towels. 
- Room has no refrigerator, which I knew going into it, but still annoying. There wasn't even a room coffee maker, so they really make you pay for everything. 
- There was a HUGE walk in closet which personally I thought was a waste of space. Probably good if you have children though because it's defiantly big enough for a crib, pack and play, cot, or blow up mattress. 
- They gave a buy one get one free breakfast at a restaurant downstairs. For two of us getting a plate of food and cup of coffee, it came to $25 total, which I guess isn't terrible in Vegas. We thought about getting the breakfast sandwiches next door, but it ended up being cheaper to sit at the restaurant. 
- Even though we had a non-smoking room, the floor smelled of stale smoke. I have a high sensitivity to smoke, and wasn't TOO bad in the room, but was smacked with it when you open the door to the hall. If smoke bothers you, make sure to plan appropriately. You clothes will stink after a day in Vegas. 

All in all it wasn't a terrible stay, but I would have thought a few more in house amenities would have been nice. But then again, that might be standard for the area.

We stayed in the larger room for a couple nights and it was comfortable with views. The hotel has everything one needs and is right next to The Park. There are restaurants inside and just outside, and they have a rollercoaster! If you don't want to eat inside, step outside to the park and try Bruxie for great chicken and waffles or sushi just down from there.

We ate breakfast each morning at America restaurant. Great service and good place to eat.

If I could put zero stars I would, this place sucked so bad... You can't find a waitress to serve you at all during slot play and when you do they ignore you and walk away... Then when you ask one of the staff to find someone they tell you oh that's a different area we can see if we see someone and send them your way but we cant call them... WTF never staying here again!!!!
Third trip to the Strip. A decent room with good space. Not quite the view. Back end of Monte Carlo for us on rhw 15th floor. Not a seperate shower. Pros lots of small deli and eateries.

We were trying to be economical and my friends from NY wanted to stay here, so I went along for the ride. We got a great deal on hotels.com with the third night free.  The room was fine albeit the bathroom was small by some Vegas room standards.  The hotel wasn't very crowded, so parking right by the elevators was nice and easy.  I didn't really like that housekeeping knocked then entered before we could answer, but she kindly came back later as we asked.  We had pizza and garlic bread in one of the stands downstairs and it was fine.  They allowed me an hour late check out which was appreciated, and they have a business center where I could print out my airline boarding pass for free.  My biggest gripe was that we could hear the rollercoaster fairly loudly from our room, not good for me the light sleeper.
Not bad especially if you are on a tight budget, but personally I would rather spend a little more and stay at one of the other hotels which I prefer.

This is just for Manhattan Express.

$12 you get the best way to see the strip and that's if you're not closing your eyes like a wuss!  The ride is long for a roller coaster ride and the wait was like 15 minutes.  The ride can be ruff and there isn't any padding in the seats, its just you and plastic!

Oh and the hotel seems pretty nice too!  It hasn't fallen apart like some of the other hotels over the years.

Follow up to my last review.
The management of NY, NY contacted me, did not make excuses, apologized and offered to and did fix the problem.
We did have fun, enjoyed the pool and the great piano bar....
I give them many thanks for following up and not making in my fault. They truly turned it around....
Thanks

Great Hotel, great value.  Not expensive, but the rooms are beautiful, the bathrooms spacious.  AND the only hotel I've stayed at where you don't hear the other guests in the hall or in their rooms!  Heaven.  Make sure to get breakfast at Il Fornaio off their casino.
The rollercoaster jerks you around a LOT, so if you like that kind of thing, go for it.

Be aware the MGM hotels have started a parking charge of $10 which you don't know until you arrive. All considered I wish I'd spent the extra money on the Venetian. With the extra $10 at NYNY there was only about a $25 difference and the rooms at the Venetian are twice the size. Bathrooms are superior also. NYNY no longer has fridges in the rooms which doesn't bother me but might some people. Our room was clean, furniture was new. TV was great. The resort fee continues to irritate me since I wouldn't by choice pay an extra $25 plus just for Wi-Fi which is all I got. I assume they'd let me use the pool anyway. The padded lounge chairs cost an extra $50 for two for the day. I'm still laughing. Another $10 if you want an umbrella.  What must the cabanas cost with a couch and TV?

Stayed at Ziggurat Suite @ NYNY over Thanksgiving. Service: Although the line was long at the check-in, some of the clerks were just looking into the computer screens and not bothering to help ppl check in faster.   Unit: EVERYTHING in the unit  was very dated: from plumbing to the bed covers. Not even basic toiletries were provided. No tea or coffee pot.  Old bulky TV's taking up lots of space. .. Dual Piano bar was hideous with $25 per person entry.  Wait is extremely long by the elevators,  10 -15 min during check-out time.  Will never stay there again.

The New York, New York is a wonderful safe haven from heat when trying to walk from the MGM Grand to CVS.  The only down side is, well, it could have just been the time of day we were there, but the drink attendants are not nearly as attentive as at MGM.

Other than that, I enjoyed my time here, really like fact that it's not overcrowded, and there's a couple of good restaurants in there!

This is the second time we visit New York New York but this time it was extra special. First, last time we came my husbands service dog did not join us bc she wasn't done training, but this time she was fully trained and ready to support my husband. The hotel's hospitality to us with her has been amazing. Today, we returned to our room after a long day of walking and a horrible experience at the Christian Louboutin store (at the Caesar's) where they thought she was a pet, and their security guard disrespectfully called us names under his breath, to a clean room and our guest room attendant, Maria had even made her (Moka) floor bed. This made our day. As Moka provides a service to my husband that is unparalleled to anything else filled with unconditional love. Being it our 6th wedding anniversary today, this gesture just enhanced our experienced. 

Such a small gesture, created the best experience for us, mainly me...because I care for them both. 

Sincere thanks for that extra gesture that we did not expect.

I stayed in this hotel for a birthday trip with my husband and two of our friends.  We got the room through a deal online, so we got a much cheaper price than normal.  That made up for the location of the hotel.  It is a far walk to anything, which I already knew, but it was not fun hiking down the strip at midnight in high heels.  

The rooms were clean which is most important to me.  It was a decent size room as compared to most hotels and while it was sparsely decorated, I appreciated that it was not over the top with the New York theme.  

The casino floor is nice, but small.  It never seemed overly busy to me and I liked that it was less insane than some other places.  We felt free to play slots and not have to listen to drunk people screaming at the blackjack tables.  

The staff was friendly as well.  I used the gym twice during my visit and was happy to find more than your standard two treadmills and an exercise ball.  They had four or five treadmills, several elliptical machines, and all kinds of weight equipment.  Free water, fruit and towels were also available.  

The roller coaster is fun, but watch your neck.  This coaster is not what I would describe as a smooth ride.  Still cool though.  The New York theme is not as over the top as some other Vegas hotels, but it is done tastefully enough.  

Overall, this was a good experience and I would stay here again.

I was travelling with a friend who was visiting Vegas for the first time. As we were roommates in the real NYC for many years, I thought it would be funny to stay at NYNY in Las Vegas.  I haven't been to Vegas in over 3 years, so I was curious if it had changed much, and curious how exponentially more expensive Vegas is now than in the many times I had been there over the past 12 years.

We arrived on a Thursday to check in around 5:30pm.  Despite traffic on the strip being a gridlocked parking lot, the NYNY wasn't crowded at all. There were only two people in front of us in the check in line, and very soon we were in our room on the 21st floor. The room was a looooooong walk from the elevator, but I didn't request a room closer to the elevator so I can't really bitch about it.  We faced the Orleans and Monte Carlo and had nice views of the sunset. And, despite being close to the roller coaster, I didn't hear it at all, as many online reviews had warned.

As far as large resorts on the strip go, NYNY is probably the smallest, which is a good thing for me. I am partially disabled so walking at length can be painful.  The casino, restaurants, gift shop, and exits weren't a ridiculously long walk unlike other places (MGM, Luxor, Venetian). I didn't gamble for long at all, but the cocktail waitress swooped down on me like a hawk getting me a drink in a New York minute.  Lots of new machines in the past few years:  The Hangover, Sex and The City, and Pawn Stars to name a few.  I'm waiting for HoneyBooBoo slots!  

The only restaurant we ate at was the America restaurant, which had very good food and excellent service. And, the prices though high, weren't ridiculous for the strip. Cocktails were strong as an ox and were a better deal than the food. There was NYC favorites like Ben & Jerry's and Nathan's, plus higher end options like Gallagher's and Il Fornaio.  I wish they had a Blimpie like I used to get in NYC all the time.  Blimpie is far superior to Subway sandwiches.

The rooms were the smallest Vegas rooms I'd stayed in, but not exactly tiny either.  The beds and sitting chairs were very comfortable. My only complaint was the bathtub which drained slowly and had the highest step-in I've ever seen. You almost need a foot stool to get in the tub.  The resort fee was extortionary but every Vegas hotel has this now, not the NYNY's fault.  At least the wifi was the fastest hotel wifi I had ever used. Even faster than my broadband at home.  Maid service was good and didn't steal anything, always a plus.

In summary, I enjoyed my stay at NYNY and would definitely stay here again.

We had a perfect time here, got in at midnight waited only a few minutes to check in. We got lucky and got a room in the Chrysler building, its a little futher down but worth it. The elevators are never crouded and it is the quietest part of the hotel. The room was very clean, bed super comfprtable and the temp was perfect. We will come back here many more times.

Extremely dissatisfied. I am a long time regular to the Las Vegas strip, however I had never stayed at the New York New York. Upon my arrival (5pm) the employee that checked us in was rude, pressured us to "upgrade" to a room without the strip view I requested then was very nasty after I declined. Finally got to the room and it hadn't been cleaned, trash everywhere, used soap, etc. We called down to get it cleaned and they protested for 10 mins giving me grief before agreeing to send someone up though I arrived 2 hours after the scheduled check in plenty of time to clean. Also the safe was stuck locked and I had to wait almost an hour for a member of security to reset it. The room keys provided, only one worked from the start, the first evening both weren't working and the attendant that I spoke with to replace them yelled at me and insisted that I was carrying magnets!! (I was not) she gave me the worst attitude and  insulted me. I certainly will NEVER stay here again and urge all of my friends and family to do the same. My advice, don't even come here for anything, staff is rude and the place is disgusting!

This place thinks every young black female is a hooker. I've been here for 4 nights and I have been harassed by security every day and night, no matter if I'm alone or with friends. I've been singled out for random ID check even when I'm not drinking.  You guys are racist. Never again!

Hotel and casino both seem very nice. 
I do wish there were seating available to wait for those riding the coaster or playing in the arcade. After doing a lot of walking it would be nice to sit and rest while the others play.
Great rooms. Very clean. A fun casino floor that makes you feel like you're in the big apple. Cocktail service is okay. Table limits are a little high for us low rollers. Great overall experience.
Stopped here to ride the roller coaster.  I need to have some fun while in Vegas.

I realize this hotel is no longer the newest on the strip, but it still has charm to spare, and the staff went out of their way to ensure my 12 year old and I got maximum enjoyment out of our one-night stay as we traveled across the country. For just $10 more than the standard room rate, they upgraded us to the 29th floor of the "Chrysler Building" with a semi-private elevator and a gorgeous view of both the strip and the airport. My daughter was mesmerized. Our room was clean, elegant and comfortable, and the decor throughout the shopping, dining and gaming spaces is fantastic. You could sit in one place for hours just looking around and still not take in all the detail and whimsy within your view. Again, I cannot compliment the staff enough, from the valets and porters on up. For people used to dealing with big rollers, they handled this ditsy mom and her exhausted 12 year old with such class and good humor, finding us fun, child-appropriate and inexpensive activities that we thoroughly enjoyed and will remember forever.
We always have a good time at this hotel\/casino & especially like the little shops & of course Coyote Ugly. What's not to like?

This is a really fun hotel. I've been coming here since they opened over a decade ago. The roller coaster is still a blast to ride and not usually much of a line. You get to it through the arcade which has all the newest and fun arcade games. It's a great place for kids to hang out while adults do casino stuff. Rooms could definitely use some updating. Has a little to much of a motel feel when it comes to bedding, towels, etc... The Piano bar at time Square is always a blast to hang out at. good food court with many options and a tiny sports book for placing bets on the games.

I booked a jacuzzi suite 6 months in advance because I was coming for the National Finals Rodeo!  When I went to check in at 2pm I was told that my room was NOT ready!  WHAT!!!  The rude lady asked me to come back in an hour because their check in time was really at 3pm.  I told her that I was on a short time table and that my room HAD to be ready by that time.  I've stayed at TONS of MGM properties and I have always checked in early...12 noon, 1pm and even once I checked in at 10am!

So we go have lunch at America (their cafe) and come back in an hour.  I get a second rude lady and she tells me that my room is still not ready!  Now I'm PISSED!!!  She tries to give me a smoking room on the third floor.  I tell her that if I have to take that room I want a major discount.  Or she tells me that my room would be ready at 5:00pm!  I even asked if they were sold out due to the rodeo and the lady said...NO, we have plenty of rooms!!!  Then WHY wasn't my room ready???  So she gets a manager...and he comes over and in TEN SECONDS finds me a nice room on the 28th floor!  HELLO BITCHES...you just wasted an hour of my vacation time!  

So we get up to the room and it's a really nice room with a jacuzzi shaped like a four leaf clover!  The bed was O.K. and the view from that room was nice.  After the check in problem things went really well for two days...until check out time.  We were leaving early because we both had to be back to work later that day.  So when I went to check out via the TV I see that they charged me four "resort fees" for only two nights.  SO I have to go and check out in person.  This time however I get a nice lady and she takes off ALL of the resort fees for their error.  That's great customer service!  I would stay here again but if I encountered problems at check in I would ask for a manager right away instead of wasting an hour of my time!

Awful.  They tried to rip me off and not give me my $35 dollar dining credit.  The manager wouldn't even come out of his office to talk to me.  It's supposed to be a 4 star hotel but I don't see why!  Very plain room and it was dirty.  Air conditioner didn't work correctly and we were told they could not move us to a different room.  Steer clear of this one.  I certainly wont be coming back!  WiFi is free but it doesn't work!

We got the large suite and were disappointed.....The room was dated, well worn and the carpet was dirty.....The king mattress was kind of cheap and was sagging to the center causing us back pain each morning . It was hard to get a good nights sleep because of the mattress and the roller coaster running until all hours of the night right out side near our room. We liked the rest of hotel and eateries   but not enough to go back again.

Worst customer service I have experienced, ruined my first trip to Vegas. No welcome, no smiles, couldn't get back in our room for an hour because of lock which didn't dawn on front desk staff that just kept recharging our key card promising this time it would work.  Long wait at check in. No freebies as others offered on strip. Won't ever be back. Billing issues that were handled by front desk as rudely and incompetently as you can imagine. So many hotels to choose steer clear of this one, walking past gives you the best experience

This review is for the casino area. Nice layout, I love the central park area.. a number of restaurants and shops in a Manhattan style layout.. This place is kept nicely updated and seems state of the art.

The good:

The location is very convenient to a lot of stuff you might do on the strip, to start. Although everything is under construction as of Oct 2015, which makes getting in and out a bit of a pain, you can access a lot just by walking. The dining selection is very good; there are several nice restaurants and many smaller things like Starbucks and Nathan's hot dogs. They have plenty of shopping if that's your thing. NY-NY souvenirs, plus themed shops like Hershey's World of Chocolate and Houdini's Magic Shop.

The casino itself seems to be very spacious and in good condition, offering a large variety of table games, electronic games, sports book, and more. There are bars around and plenty of stuff to keep you going all hours of the night including dueling pianos, Coyote Ugly, and much more. You could probably spend a whole weekend here and never leave the premises. 

The less-than-good:

The room I got, a Park Avenue King, was just OK. The bed itself is good and very comfortable. Standard furniture and bathroom, nothing special. Lack of accessible outlets and newer light\/climate controls gives this away as an older room. They've put a veneer of updates on it, but the whole thing needs remodeling and refreshing. Everything was pretty clean, but one of my pet peeves is hotels who still provide unwrapped drinking glasses in the bathroom. We have no idea where those have been or who cleaned them; please just give us a disposable cup in plastic wrap. At least we know it's clean, and not left from the last guest or wiped with a rag. 

The bad:

The A\/C unit in the room was noisy and inefficient, with an ancient thermostat and a loud metallic rattle. The shower temp dial was so hard to turn that I had to grasp it in a weird way and actually cut myself on the sharp edge underneath.

I don't think I met a single employee here that appeared to enjoy their job. The desk clerk at check-in was robotic and never smiled or addressed me by name. The attendants working the arcade and roller coaster looked like they could barely stand to be at work. Bored expressions, looking at their shoes, never smiling or interacting with guests. The dealers also looked glum and disinterested, even the ones who had guests and their tables. I went to another property and gambled where I got smiles and welcomes. Bad form, whoever hires these people. 

I won't return because I can get a comfortable bed at any number of places on the strip. It's personal attention that makes the difference in this industry.

My first time in Vegas, went with my gf and my cousins..  And soon as I walked in.. I was amazed but figured this was the norm for Vegas. The lobby had a great decor, whoever designed this was on point. Check in was fast and simple tried to butter the lady at front desk for a better room.. She entertained me lol. Our room was the park Ave, room had a great view of the strip, I will say I wished the bathroom was a lil more on the luxury side but it wasn't bad at all.  We went to all the hotels and casinos and for some reason nyny buy in was more affordable and the vibe was better, the NY pizza was on point and one restaurant was open 24hrs! Would go back any day. Definitely recommend especially if you catch a deal on Expedia. Would be 5 star if the  bathroom was fancier.
I was disappointed with my room the last time I stayed here. It wasn't cleaned properly. I only stay here when I'm on a budget crunch. The restaurants at this hotel aren't good and are very pricey.

I wasn't too avid or excited when gambling, but overall with the shows, the shops, and the arcade, I believe this is a great place for family time with the kids.  The coaster and the good (bad food) Is fun at times.  I've come to this hotel more than most and it's because I genuinely have fun here.  More of a hangout or a hotel, not so much a place to gamble

Really nice , EXCEPT: the registration desk is in the smoky casino.  And registration, at 11am, required waiting in line 30 minutes. Also, they now CHARGE FOR VALET PARKING.  $18 per day..  Boo, hiss.  Oh - and don't forget the $30 resort fee.

Notes:
1.  Study the hotel on the internet before you actually check in.  There are lots of great things (numerous restaurants & shops, a Starbucks, food at the pool bar, upgraded chaise lounge options at the pool, a spa, a roller coaster, etc... ) but no way to find out about them from your room - there is no hotel binder!!!  Even the hotel website is vague. (i.e. Online spa menu has no prices listed.) Write down what interests you, and be sure to ask at check in.  Otherwise, good luck getting the front desk on the phone for info. 
2. The concierge is quite helpful, though, and easier to reach, but remember, they make their $$ on commissions.
3. Almost all the hotel eateries close by 11pm, on week nights, anyway. We  got back from our show and the only choices were pizza and stuff from the candy apple stand. Wait - the actual restaurants might have still been serving, but all we wanted was a late night snack. One candy apple, a Stromboli and a bottle of water came to over $30!
4.  Late check out (noon) cost me an extra $20.
5.  There is no charge for early check in!  Hooray!

Would I return? Probably, if the price was low enough to counter the valet fee. And I would know what to ask about and be able to plan better, so I could get my money's worth from this very nice hotel.

If your considering the buffet, beware.  Even with a $14 discount I found it in no way possible,  worth it and barely editable. The line was long, the hostess staff was very slow and the food dry dry dry and not at all flavorful. Should Of went to In and Out Burger.

Bad bad bad bad bad experience here. Management didn't even help. Room was dirty upon arrival. Sheets were not clean. Which made me question the integrity of the entire room. I went down to talk to a manager he didn't even come out to apologize. Just told the front desk to move my room. So I got a new room. It was clean. Then all my family's card keys weren't working. Including mine. Went to complain again and the front desk waived my resort fees. 

But still. Horrible. Manager should've come to apologize and fix situation. I work in hospitality and this was just disgraceful to me. My family's room also got robbed and there are no cameras in the hallways so they couldn't help. And in some of my family's room the hot water wasn't working. Everyone had to be moved multiple times. 

I will not not not be back to this hotel. I was so unhappy with my stay. I didn't want to pay at all for my stay because of my horrendous experience here.

Annie in Group Sales is the absolute best! She helped me make sure that the reservations for my group (24 persons) were all processed correctly!

NYNY ROCKS!

We had a really great experience here. It was a place to sleep and store our stuff. On that basis, the service was excellent.

We got one of the renovated rooms on the roller coaster side. The roller coaster noise didn't bother us at all. It just sounded like thunder occasionally. The bed was comfortable, the water pressure for the shower was very good for being on the 23rd floor, and we only noticed our neighbors if they were showering while we were at the sink.

They were definitely doing some major renovations, so presumably the whole hotel will look as good as our room did.

I had pretty low expectations for this property and was pleasantly surprised!
Don't expect accomodatations along the lines of Wynn or Venetian (I'd be more apt to compare NY, NY with Planet Hollywood or TI) but this resort did not disappoint during our one-night stay in October 2014.
We stayed here for Red Bull Air Race for one night (company paid--we paid for Friday at the Trump) and had a fairly easy time checking in with a pre-paid room, even though the line was long. The associates checked in guests quickly and efficiently and gave us clear and concise information on the hotel, amenities, policies, and directions to our room. 
The property itself is a lot cleaner than I remember, but I haven't been to this part of the strip in years (it definitely caters more towards families\/tourists vs. the northern side of the strip that's a bit more geared toward the party crowd). The casino was lively and there were plenty of food options within the resort.
We had a room with no view, which was fine because we were barely there the one night. The windows did have a weird red tint which was a little annoying but not bothersome when the curtains were closed. The room was pretty standard--don't expect a massive layout or lots of luxury. The bed was comfy and there were plenty of easily-accessible outlets (which is surprisingly rare!). The bathroom was pretty basic and the toiletries were ok. The water pressure was actually much better than some of the pricier resorts I've stayed at!
Room service was surprisingly cheap and very fast, albeit standard diner-tasting food.  They deliver pizzas late which we definitely utilized post-club (it came REALLY fast!).
Parking was really easy as well. 
One bonus for a Kings fan from LA--they actually had Fox Sports West in their cable package so I got to watch my game! (although it wasn't HD--crappy quality hockey is better than no hockey!)
New York, New York wouldn't be my first choice when staying in Vegas but I certainly would not rule it out when looking for a cheap, no-frills stay.

So I'm waiting on house keeping to clean the room which was not fully clean to me checking in. It has now been over 30mins to get house keeping to come and clean the room which, had trash in the basket and then I went to turn the sheets to the bed found hair in the bed. The front desk waive my resort fee. But I'm still waiting for a clean turn over from house keeping worst service ever.

Thank you Lori,

I would like to also add your front desk staff Michel was very helpful with assistant with this problem.  The staff upfront has always been very friendly and helpful.  I appreciate your reply back and yes please address your cleaning staff supervisor that was on duty, I have there name but will not place here. But that supervisor drop the ball yesterday. Thank you for your time, Lori.

I stayed here with my family for 6 days and 5 nights during the winter of 2015.

I love the overall theme of the hotel. Viewed from the outside, you could see that the buildings are modeled after actual famous buildings in New York City. Inside, you can also walk through a section of New York-y places to eat.

I also love the water pressure of the showers. Sounds weird, but I was actually very impressed. It felt like a mini massage! 

The Roller Coaster had a surprisingly short line for New Year's Eve and was very fun. Because we were guests at the hotel, we got a buy-one-get-one-free deal on the tickets. It only costed a total of $14 for one ride for two people! The Roller Coaster had fast turns and steep drops and took the picture at such a great moment of the ride.

What I didn't like about staying at the New York New York was its housekeeping services. Room cleaners will actually never come to your room unless you call for them. My family learned that the hard way after our tiny trash cans started to overflow. Unfortunately, after one room cleaning service, my extremely expensive retainer was missing. Myself and everyone staying in the same room with me recalled seeing my retainer in a clear cup in the bathroom. I had put that cup on the opposite side of the bathroom counter to signal that I intended to keep it. But later, the cup and my retainer were gone. Also, after each service, we found the thermostat on full blast on the coldest setting. In the winter!

I had to check out soon, so I didn't have the time to notify the hotel. But, I highly doubt anybody working here would have made the effort to search for my retainer.

This is the reason I am rating New York New York Hotel & Casino just 2 stars. Housekeeping does its job too poorly to overlook. 

A note to others: Make sure you close your suitcases and seal all bags before calling room service. Organize your items in one area and take a picture as proof in the event of anything going missing. 

Have fun & don't forget to go to the casinos!
I actually felt like I was in new York!  This place is huge with great gaming!

New York, New York is one of the best casinos on the Strip, mainly due to its theming. While the inside of the casino is small, it makes up for this in its attention to detail--its microtheming of thematic elements like smoking manhole covers and the forced perspective used to create a Greenwich Village eating experience. If you hate theming, then avoid the NY-NY, or perhaps Vegas all together.

We arrived here impromptu and decided to get a room for the night.. It was a bit on the pricier side for a hotel such as New York New York.. $70 for the night but the front desk worker, Johnny, was kind enough to upgrade us to the Park Avenue room.  I much appreciated the service and how friendly he was.  The rooms to be honest is nothing to be wowed by.. The furniture definitely need some new ones and some new designs to the room.  It looks old and gloomy!  I mean granite bathrooms and such but it still didn't really impress me.  The room itself was quite roomy but nothing compared to my past 2 nights at the Encore!! Major stoop down I KNOW!

What i enjoyed about this hotel though was the theme it had. New York New York.. It is unique.. It is indeed different from the other hotels on the strip.. It gives you a more chill relaxing environment compared to the glamorous hotels such as Encore, Bellagio, and Caesar's.  I loved how there were so much food downstairs just like how you would walk in any real NY village to grab some food to eat!  I was able to eat at Coney Island Hot Dogs and Broadway burgers.. At the moment, my foot long chili cheese bacon dog satisfied my appetite!  It was just a good relaxing environment to enjoy with your loved one.. 

Too bad the view out of my room was of the rollercoaster carrying the folks up the trail!! boring!

Yes they have a casino (doesn't all of the hotels on the strip in Vegas) but what really impressed me about this establishment was not Lady Liberty herself (although I loved it),not the cobblestone street imitation through downtown New York (that was cool too) it was the roller coaster, the Manhattan Express I believe. You walk through the casino, up the escalator, through the woods (just kidding) through the arcade to the back and there it is. The line moves rather quickly once back there. They have lockers you can rent for 50 cents to put your stuff in before you ride. They offer military discount too. But it's so neat. You can see most of the strip from there. Great experience!

Never be back. My husband and I came here expecting a decent hotel with a great view (we paid for an upgraded room and then paid additional for a view of the strip). $150\/nt (after tax\/resort fee) on a Thursday on the Vegas strip for a hotel of this quality was apparently way too much. 

Good: The person checking us in was friendly and helpful with questions we had about the area. The location was really special. The theme inside the hotel common areas was adorable and was a great thing for us to see. Check-out was super fast, dropped our keys in a box by the elevator. WiFi was good\/fast. We only stayed there one night so it didn't manage to ruin our whole vacation.

Bad: Price for the quality (way too much $). Paying extra got us nothing extra. Our "view" was of the rooftop of the lower floors and the roller coaster which was plenty loud (luckily it closed at 11pm, but still really obstructed the view we paid for). Our "upgraded\/recently updated" room got us nothing : no coffee maker, no fridge, wallpaper peeling off of the walls. And okay, ignore all that an I just want a clean place to rest my head. But this was not that either. Didn't take showers because I saw a few curly black hairs lingering in our tub so good call there. Couldn't walk around the room without socks on (I guess that's pretty typical in a hotel) but I was even a little uncomfortable taking off my shoes. Do you ever vacuum\/shampoo this carpet? 

This place was so sad and old. I had such a great first impression but I guess I shouldn't have let that fool me. Next time we won't be staying on the strip for fear that the experience will be like this again. Gosh I hope the real New York isn't so bad....

What a pleasant surprise.

 We generally stay off the strip at Red Rock but decided to shake things up and stay on the strip. I'm a pinball geek and the deciding factor for staying and gambling at NYNY was the new, well maintained pinball machines in the arcade.

 Terra (sp?) checked us in flawlessly and was over the top cheerful and personable. We get to our room and are thrilled to see that we got a corner strip view. The room, and for that matter, the entire casino was spotless. Our cable went out in the middle of the Masters, which we had bets on. Called the front desk and within minutes, Lamont was at our room and fixed the problem. He couldn't have been nicer.

 Really liked the Flintstones, Rolling Stones and other newer slots. We originally had booked three nights but were having such a blast, we added two more nights. Couldn't get enough of Bruxies and other eateries in and around NYNY. Also, the guy that sings at the main bar is a hoot.

 Only downside is the sports book is really small and the sirens on the strip woke us up each night.

 Well done, NYNY..... Can't wait to return.

I didn't stay here but when we walked in to check it out, all I could think was - cheeeeeeeeeeeap! The casino had a strong cigarette smoke smell that I couldn't shake and the crowd was definitely different from the one seen at the Wynn. 

Yes, if in Vegas, you should definitely do a walk-through, but I wouldn't stay there. 

Sound bougie, but it's the truth!

ALFONZO  at REGISTRATION was awsome! He is very personable,  friendly,  and answered all our questions.  Thank you Alfonso for a great experience...because of you, we will definitely be back.  The room was great too.

I upgraded to a spa suite within the last few weeks from a promo email that they sent me.  It was nice having more space.  

The front desk staff was so-so as I observed inconsistencies in hotel employee attitude.  I will assume that the ones who didn't smile was having a bad day.  I notice these kind of things as a guest at resorts.

The pros is the location right next to the T-mobile Arena if you're there for an event and it was easy to get to just about anywhere for other attractions from NYNY in Vegas.

The cons is that the rooms are feeling old.  The electric outlets were very worn and some of my AC adapters for the electronics had a tough time staying in since they were so loose.  The rooms did not feel as modern as I expected from a bigger hotel on the strip.  I was a bit disappointed with the size of the bathroom, considering that I upgraded to a suite.  After passing by the newer properties, I knew that I probably wasn't going to come back to NYNY in the future unless I received a real good deal.

The "A-OK" rating is simply as it states, NYNY is just OK.  Would I stay there again?  I could but there are so many other choices out there especially being a M-Life program member that promotes numerous other properties which are newer and has similar rates.

I like this casino, for whatever reason people seem like their having a good time at the New York New York -more so than other casinos I've been to here in vegas. They are opening a park right outside which will be the only park on the strip so that'll be cool. The staff at the N.Y. N.Y. is very helpful, the rooms are a bit dated...kinda like 1992

Nice hotel in decent location however it had more of a family atmosphere and the rooms were not that nice for being a 4 star hotel. Rooms seemed a bit old and outdated. If you are looking for a fun nightlife experience I would recommend Planet Hollywood down the strip. Its in an ideal location for walking and they have a TON of restaurants and shops in the attached Miracle Mile Mall.

I remember New York New York being family friendly when it first opened 20 years ago but now it's targeting the adult market. Lots of changes have happened here like removing have of the arcade and replacing the strategy games with video rides. Also the Brooklyn Bridge is now water less. 

Change can be a good thing with the changing of the times from child friendly to the adult oriented. Parking was free for me because I have the Mlife Credit card plus I have the Gold player's card so that's an advantage for me. Front desk staff was super friendly in helping us find a room with a view of the strip. Luckily, she was able to find a corner room in the Empire Tower with views of MGM GRAND, Tropicana and Excalibur. The room was nothing special nor was it updated. Who really needs an updated room in a mid class resort when you're hardly doing to be in your room. The beds were comfy and bathroom was clean, so overall it served its purpose. 

Lots of options for bars and restaurants instead of going to going to other resorts. 2 for 1 breakfast at Fornio if you're a hotel guest. Happy hour deals on he outside of the hotel. Chin Chin was overpriced but that's a separate review. Hershey's was nice to visit as well as viewing the Big Apple Arcade. Location wasn't that bad at all. It was a nice change from the Mirage even though the Mirage a more superior than New York New York. Plenty of slot choices in the casino as well as drink waitresses.

Overall, New York New York was a fantastic stay. There's not a lot to fault in it despite it being a mid level resort. We also had a view of the country festival where to shooting took place. It's sad to see what happened to concert goers just tying to have a good time. Let's not forget the added security in the elevator lobby. For sure I'll come back to New York New York.

Go Mlife!

Had a wonderful time staying here. I love that you walk in and immediately see cool decorations and get the New York sights. Some hotels you have to walk around for a bit until you see their cool things, but this hotel was very cool right away. The roller coaster is fun and you can get two for the price of one. And the pizza and Mexican restaurants are delicious! I also really enjoyed America's for breakfast. They have yummy coffee. All the employees were very nice! I would stay here again :)
i enjoyed visiting the restaurants (Nathan's hot dogs and crepes available).  my kids had a good time riding the roller coaster.

Good things: Great roller coaster, Above average restaurants (affordable), Nice room, on strip, SMS discounts, GRRRRREEEEAAAAAATTTTTT concierge (curly red head, mid 30's) - talked us into Beatles LOVE!  P.S. GREAT SHOW!

Bad Things: Smoke, smoke smoke (bad ventilation), Bad plumbing (SLOW drains), a\/c \/ heat thermostat is from the seventies (difficult to regulate), very small happy hour drink selection, mixed drinks very expensive, oh....smoke!

Would do it again though! Overall good times :D

Ooooohhhh!!!....one more thing, ....PUT A DAMN COFFEE MAKER IN THE ROOM, THANK YOU!

This review is for the candy shop on top level.  Worst attitude and service ever.  To think I had the audacity of interrupting a workers IPOD listening enjoyment during work hours.  My 8 year old daughter wanted to purchase candy and I had the nerve to interrupt the Asian girls iPod time to ask  where the candy bags were..  The  Asian girl  pulled her ear phones out of her ears and waved us to the bags and then proceeded to make facial gestures rolling eyes etc.  When My husband pointed out her obvious irritation with us  and her ridiculous behavior.  I put the bag down and she screamed.  Yes, literally screamed at me that she didn't want our business anyway.  Wow, I was Shocked.  I contemplated going back in but, I reasoned that just maybe it wouldn't of done us any good to complain to New new York. Maybe shops are independent?? That and it was our first hours in lAs Vegas and my little one was already upset she didn't get the candy so we rushed her away to M&M world which was very pleasant experience.  The rude Asian girls boss or coworker was standing right there watching as everything took place.  Still in shock with her behavior what happened to customer service?  We will never go back .

Before this trip to Vegas, I had stayed in 2 previous hotels here. This time I wanted to try a new one, and I chose the NY-NY because the price was very reasonable and, since I wanted to stay on the strip, the location is good.

I am very happy with my choice: I got a Park Avenue room and I upgraded it to have a view of the strip. For a great price I got that great view and a very elegant, well decorated room with super soft bedding and a pretty spacious bathroom.

The casino is nice, and store\/restaurant-wise they have everything from pubs and saloons to candy shops and pricey restaurants with great food. 

I'm giving it 4 stars because the bathroom door was a bit jammed and they didn't really fix it when we called maintenance. Other than that, I really liked the hotel!

Tip: If you are into in-room dining, the prices are super reasonable, and the daily values are a bargain: I ordered a steak and crab dinner with mashed potatoes, veggies and salad for $14.95, and it was SO good!

This was my favorite casino out of all of the casinos on the strip. I loved the design of the New York "streets" and eateries within. Gorgeous. I had some great New York style pizza and also some amazing beer battered halibut in "Chinatown." Yum. I agree with other reviewers that there were many afforable options to eat compared to other casinos on the strip, along with high end restaurants. We were there on a Friday for Zumanity, so the atmosphere was club like. The music was great and we had a great time playing the slots. Before we headed out, there was a Michael Jackson impersonator that was kick ass. The crowd really enjoyed it. I don't know that I would stay here because it is towards the end of the strip, but I would definitely hang out here again. There is a roller coaster and arcade, too...lots of variety!

Just got back from a 3 night 4 day stay at the NYNY.  We had the Marquis Suite up on the 32nd floor.  Check In took a  little longer than I expected ( 20 minutes) as they only had two employees on at the front desk.  Room was great, clean and very very large.  The view of the mountains was great.  Enjoyed the atmosphere of NYNY.  SLOTS were not in the giving spirit and seemed very tight.  Did not gamble a ton here rather used other casinos to gamble in.  Got the Facebook Fanbook (coupons for attractions, restaurants and lounges.  Only used one but that was our choice.  Overall I would definately stay at this Hotel again.

Checked in and was not given the room I reserved. I reserved a queen size non smoking. He said oops, all we have is 2 beds smoking. BUT for $15 a night we can bump you up to what you want. UHM, no thanks. Once we got in the room, we had a view of the corner strip, basically the rollercoaster and Excalibur. The bathroom is teeny tiny, but the bed is the best I have stayed in a long time. I like that there are 2 Starbucks, lots of restaurants and options of games. I would stay again but hope they will have what I "reserve" when I check in.

3.75 stars for our fun stay at NYNY Hotel. =)

NYNY is one of those hotels I love to walk through but have never stayed at...until now that is.  It was the bf's birthday so we took a 4 day trip to Vegas and I wanted to try this hotel.  The rates have gone down considerable which made me worry just a bit but after spending 3 nights here, I say it's a bargain (especially for families).

I booked a Park Ave. room, non-smoking with a king bed...they gave us two queens instead because they didn't have a king available & asked if we wanted to switch in the morning - I said we'd just stay with two queens since I didn't feel like moving around.  Here's the good & bad of our stay:

The GOOD!:
*Clean room & bathroom - our room was at the very, very end of the hallway...kind of a walk but that's fine with me since it seems to be more quiet the further away you are from the elevator.  Bathroom was also very nice...had marble floors, clean sink area & shower was nice as well.  Everything in the bathroom seemed new...room also had ipod docking station which is nice

*Arcade & gambling - for families, there's an arcade area where you can play games and win tickets, which is something nice to do to keep you out of the harsh temperatures.  There's also the rollercoaster but I hear it's expensive so we didn't give it a try.  The slots are just ok here...they don't have some of the newer ones here & I think you'll have better luck playing in the daytime rather than at night.  

*Restaurants - good selection of restaurants & lots of noisy fun; there's a section that's meant to look like the streets of NY with cheaper food options like pizza, fish & chips, sandwiches, etc.  Also has two Starbucks, Haagen Das and sells Krispy Kreme doughnuts - if they had an in-n-out inside I would not have left the hotel.  =)  We tried the pizza place at about 1am...it was fantastic!  Lots of restaurants and drinking to choose from as well - tried Gallagher's Steakhouse and thought food was excellent for the price.  The Bar at Times Square has nightly rowdiness because of the piano bar - seemed like a lot of fun

*Easy access to...MGM & Excalibur.  MGM has good restaurants & the monorail station that takes you northbound all the way to the Sahara.  One ride is $5, one day is $12 - a good way for you to get to places like the Venetian, Paris, Harrah's & the Wynn.  If you go to Excalibur, there's a free monorail ride to Luxor & Mandalay Bay; love the restaurants in Mandalay Bay too so I enjoyed the easy transportation to different parts of the strip.


The Not-So-Good:
*Blankets - the comforters & blankets on the bed are old and thin...would be nice to get something a bit more plush.  

*Old box TV - why do hotels still have these?  Everyone should upgrade to flat-screens.

*In-room safe did not work for us

*No sliding closet in the room...instead had a wooden wardrobe which housed the iron & ironing board.  Not a big deal to me though.

*Not having the room I booked for me.  I make a reservation for a reason - to have this particular room ready for me & when I check-in, it's not available?  that's the reason we make reservations!

*A resort fee of 12.95 a day.  The new trend is to charge resort fees...daily fees that include crap stuff that should already be included in the price of the hotel!  Why not just bump up the price & include these imposed services in the room\/hotel description.  $12.95 is not bad compared to some other hotels & at least it includes internet access but we did not get the newspaper and I would have preferred bottles of water instead of cocktail vouchers.  

Overall, I would stay here again.  Like I said, the rates have lowered & it's a pretty good value for the hotel.  With taxes, room rates and resort fee, it's probably $80-100 a night...& if you stay with other people it can be a pretty good deal.  Get the pizza!  =)

Great facility,nice hotel with very nice new features and entertainment options.
I've stayed here before and never had any issues.HOWEVER,this time was just ok.
Lumpy pillows,shower didn't get past lukewarm,no blankets on the bed-only sheets.The area by Chin Chin restaurant\/by the elevators smelled like the sewers by the streets in Mexico.
Probably not coming back...

Manager and staff at check in was more interested in finding problems with my reservation (my reservation was paid for by 3rd party) than finding solutions. Had to wait in line 2 times, he then proceeded to tell me I'd have to come back because it'll take time to hear back from the bank. I then told him I am not waiting in line again. He said he'll go ahead and get me a room but if there is any issue with the card he will lock me out send security. 
Auth form was sent ahead of time through an encryption service they required which failed time and time again. 

Cool looking hotel from the outside, we'll see if I get to my room. 1+ hour and still waiting...

J'adore this casino.

Every trip to Vegas requires a trip here. The casino floor is just big enough to have room for everyone (except on the busiest of nights in Vegas). The location is perfect with cheaper casinos within easy striking distance.

The rooms are just fine. Nothing overly special - just clean which is all I really want out of a room.

The pool sucks, yes, but I never go to Vegas for the pools. The rest, however, is perfection.

Stayed at NY NY Hotel & Casino with my wife 4\/2-4\/5. This was the honeymoon we never had. Called for early check in a few days before we arrived. We asked for a view of the strip from our room and Monica working the front desk hooked us up! We had a wonderful corner room that had 2 walls of windows showing a view of the strip in both directions! Bed was  nice. Cleaning lady forgot to pull out desk chair to remove some cake crumbs...Other than that the room was clean and spacious enough. The pool was great, good music and cold drinks. NY NY had a good selection of low to medium priced venues to eat at, but no upscale restaurants. When we needed a replacement iron, house keeping was there in about 35 minutes, not too bad for such a huge hotel. Gaming floor could have been a little bigger but never had to look long for free slots or tables. I liked the very high ceilings over the gaming floor. This hotel is one of the few that tries to cater to families and couples\singles. Located in a busy part of the strip theres lots to see and do in the immediate area. If you are looking for a nice spot to stay that doesn't cost an arm and a leg consider NY NY, especially if you're traveling with kids. My wife and I had a blast and I can't wait to come back and if I bring my kids we'll stay at NY NY.

Thank goodness for GREAT deals for Vegas! Hubby received a promotional code for $49 per night stay here and couldn't resist so off we went. We stayed here once before but I don't recall the experience but this time around, I will definitely remember it since I am also yelping about it.

Yea, I don't think I'll be staying here again unless it is for free. The rooms have NO insulation to block out any noises. I mean ANY noises!  I was woken up at 1:30 am to a moaning neighbor...(yes, pretty gross). The number one thing I hate, when I am in my REM sleep! I mean what if I had a family with kids...that would be horrid! The walls in the rooms are so thin, you can hear every word in conversation if people were not whispering, you can hear water running, like everyone was in the same room.

Besides the thin walls, I don't know how well they clean. I won't go into details but I saw some left over stain on the bathroom walls ( I will let your imagination roll with this). If I think about it too much, I think I'll throw up. =P

I have stayed in other hotels with better insulation; maybe NY NY needs to do a make over!?

This Hotel\/casino is a joke, I checked in an hour ago (check in is at 3) but here it is 4 pm and my room still isnt ready, so im outside waiting and this woman walks by and falls flat on her face.. me being a registered nurse in the state of florida walk over to the woman and start rendering aid and call the paramedics about 5 min later a team of ppl walk over and start demanding ppl clear the area, (ppl being myself and another woman) I immediately follow directions thinking they were medical personnel, boy was I wrong! They stood over the woman asking each other what they should use to clean her blood off, then started asking her name and what hotel she was staying at, sickened and frustrated I called one of the ppl over explained my profession and who I was, also.explained it was critical to obtain any past medical conditions she might have to pass along to the paramedics when they get there instead of asking her name and hotel which makes NO DIFFERENCE at this point, I also told them to take her pulse and time it b4 paramedics got there, the woman replied to me we know what were doing ... then continued to stand over her and talk amongst themselves and hold the womans hand instead of rendering aid or letting a trained professional such as my self give aid... it was a very disturbing thing to watch and very unprofessional... I sure hope that poor woman is ok critical minutes were lost while these idiots were busy playing doctor! Btw its 4:15 and still no room !! What a joke! Pls stay somewhere else! Your health may depend on it!

We stayed over the July 4th weekend in a standard room with two double beds. The room was pretty large and had a view (corner room). Staff was friendly.

I wanted to give this hotel a four star, but the bathroom took one star out. While the room itself doesn't, the bathroom shows the age of the hotel. The sink is small and old. Cold & Hot water knobs were confusing!! We never got the right direction for opening and closing the knobs - LOL. I felt the bathtub was kind of odd with a heavy glass door, which was hard to open. The tub was deep so you'd have to bring your legs up. Otherwise you'll hit your knees with the door frame (ouch!). I like taking a bath, and am a bit picky about the tub...

Our rate included two buffets per day at the sister group hotels. We tried MGM and Monte Carlo, and enjoyed the one at MGM:) WIFI and parking fees are included in the resort fee ($15\/day). Bed was SUPER comfy!!! Five star matress!

The room was nice and clean and check was a at 11am which was nice. It's located at the end of the strip located right across from the MGM. I have been on the roller coaster awhile ago and remember it being really fun ( they offer pictures). 

The room seemed pretty plain, nothing really unique about them... Just standard. Everything was pretty cozy, the only thing that was the absolute worst was the television. It kept coming off to a weak signal and the screen would go blank. It was not just once, but we stayed 3 days and it was the whole time. It was really annoying when we would come back to want to relax and watch some television. Every time we gout into a show we would miss parts because it was off... It might had well of been off all together! It would be a 4 if it weren't for the TV.

We just stayed here for three nights, never having been in the hotel\/casino before, and excluding the slow check in process have nothing but praise for this place.  We loved the feel and vibe of the casino, the city street aspect of the restaurant area, and our spa tub room was huge!  We felt the hotel had a terrific urban vibe and a nice layout.  The Italian restaurant had excellent food for reasonable prices (I highly recommend the seafood pasta), all the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful, and the walkways to the Excalibur\/Luxor\/Mandalay Bay complex and the MGM Grand make it easy to wander without pushing through Las Vegas and Tropicana Blvd crowds.  The roller coaster sound other reviews mention really seemed to be a non issue, particularly if you leave the room A\/C fan running.  It was simply a fun place!  This is now our "go to" strip hotel.

I've had 2 occasions to stay there, both in the context of business trips. Even on someone else's dime:  it wasn't enjoyable.

The only good thing I can say is:  the showers get hot quickly. Otherwise, the design is poor, the rooms are small , the acoustics are poor, some of the rooms are dark. Depending upon what tower you are in (I was in the 'Chrysler" building-  VERY small windows) you either have a view or you look @ a parking lot.

When the rollercoaster runs  you can hear it-  the screams, the cars on the track- and it can interfere with sleep. The fire alarm was set off when I was there and for 10 minutes a BLARING message was PA'ed into the rooms warning us of a possible emergency. I understand it's  a safety precaution but that thing is ULTRA loud, I suppose to wake up any drunk passed out people.

I like higher end digs- even the MGM is better than this.

The NYNY is a very nice hotel conveniently situated on the four corners of the south end of the strip.  Easy access to MGM and Excalibur.  The rooms were clean and tastefully decorated.  With that being said, the casino was quite small in comparison to the other hotels on the strip.  The restaurants seemed uninteresting, and the hotel lacked any draw for me.  It seemed that we barely spent any time in the hotel and instead opted to walk to the other hotels nearby.  Next time i think we'll just stay at one of the other hotels instead of walking to them all the time.  The NYNY was nice, but i think there are so many better options for the same price, that i probably won't stay there again.

Very basic hotel & casino on the end of the strip across the street from MGM.  Good no frills amenities, although I was rather annoyed our room didn't have a fridge.  I wouldn't mind staying here again although I probably won't.

I really love the layout of this casino as it's easy to get around. Also, the ceiling is very high so you can breathe unlike some of the smoky casinos with low ceilings. There is a good variety of places to eat. The only negative for me is the roller coaster. The line was very long and the ride itself hurt more than it was fun. This is coming from someone who is a roller coaster junkie.

This hotel confused me a bit...  I chose this place over others because I love the casino.  The decor and overall scene is great, the place has been kept up relatively well.

First off, we pulled up to the valet and there was no one working, I stopped my car got out and walked around looking for someone to take my car.  I looked around and couldn't find anyone so I figured screw it, I'll self park, it's not far.  As we drove out of the valet area there was at least 40 people waiting for their cars.

We park and walk to registration.  There wasn't a large line by any means, maybe 6 people in front of us and 4 employees working the counter.  It took almost 30 minutes to make our way to the counter, once there the room reserved was no longer available so the guy upgraded us.  We originally reserved a Park Ave room which is just above the standard room, the clerk told us he put us in the Broadway room which was a level up from that.  All was fine and dandy until we got to our 'room?'.  Ever been on an Indian reservation?  Well me either until I got to my room.  The indian theme was pretty tacky but the purple pleather chair with tiger stipe seat cushion really pushed made it incredible awful.  The room was big enough for an after party but I mean even Motel 6's have coffee makers in the rooms...

I can say for a room that runs $400 for a Friday and Saturday it's definitely, DEFINITELY not worth it.  We got a good rate, that's the only thing I can say I came away with from this stay.

First time staying at this hotel. Been to Vegas multiple times. Conclusion: excellent experience! 

Details: 
We came here for a friend's surprise proposal. So there was like 10 of us that were staying at this hotel. We arrived after everyone else and when we originally checked in we got the 6th floor and some tower on the other side (no where near our friends).  
We decided to go back and ask if there was anyway we could stay on the same floor or at least the same tower as our friends (21st floor\/century tower). We had a clerk name Laurie (or Lori) she was super nice and not only did she get us a floor close to them (20th floor) she upgraded our rooms from the park avenue to the Madison avenue deluxe for free! Our room was handicap accessible so it was so spacious! It was huge! Also right next to the elevators. #winning

Our room quickly became the room for everyone to come hang out in. 
Such a great experience thanks to Laurie! She helped us out and was super nice. I will defiantly come back and stay here. 

We also uses the valet and baggage claim. The baggage claim was great when we go there but lacked organization when we departed. (They came to the room to get our bags and we were told we come get them later when we're ready to leave. ) well we went to give them the ticket to bring out the bags and then went to valet to wait for our car. Our car came out first. And we wait a total of like 30 min for our luggage (I went twice to go see what the hold up was) 
Turns out they couldn't find our luggage so they had me go in the back to identify my belongings. It was just a little annoying. 

Overall still a great experience.

I have died and seen what heaven is like !! 

http:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=qwBl16dMT2M

Dueling pianos,  are you fucking kidding me?? Out of all the places I went to in Vegas, this place was by far my all time favorite. If you want to have a loud evening of singing, dancing and hollering walk over to The Bar at Times Square where everyone is best friends. 

You will suddenly find you are all singing drunkenly at the top of your lungs the classic lyrics of miss Elton John:

http:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=alGL1-6pp9s

"... my gift is my song and this one's for you... and you can tell everybody this is your song... i hope you don't mind. IIIiii HOPEYOUDONT MIND that i putdown inwords howwonderfullifeis now yourinthe world...."

I must admit. Best singin group hug I've ever had in my life.

Stayed here for my 30th birthday.  Rooms were nice, room service was quick and generally everyone was friendly and helpful.  This hotel also has a nice mix of high end, moderate and inexpensive places to eat and drink.  Pool was a little lackluster and small for a hotel of this size.

Eh... it's ok.  It would be 2 stars if the New York skyline and skyscraper theme didn't just make me happy.  I am staying with a friend who broke her foot- so we've had the unique experience of being handicapped this week- and the wheelchair accessibility of NY NY was sub par!  Several doors did not open when pressing the ada buttons.  
$20\/day for valet parking!?  And $12.50\/day in self park!?  WTF!?  What's the resort fee if we don't even get parking?  $7.99 for the ATM Geesh!  I feel nickeled and dimed here.  AND- if you're a gambler?  The floor is cold.  I didn't see people winning... and I certainly wasn't.  And the casino seems small. I won't be back.  I typically stay off strip at Green valley ranch- we get comps, free valet, free self park, $4 ATM, nice sports book, movie theater, and bowling alley in the hotel!  I'm going back to GVR...

Very nice casino! Great game room upstairs for kids!
Roller coaster the kids loved $14 a ticket to ride. Or buy 
Arcade deal & save $$$. Ac worked well. No smoke smell! Kids loved it! Jelly bean Statue of Liberty by arcade was cool!

The casino is good and the position on the strip is good. The parking is now $10 a day but we booked before that came into play. The car park is a bit of a trek to the motel part of the casino and you have to walk through the gambling floor which I'm not used to nor a fan of. 
We stayed for 5 nights and were in the century tower. Our room however, was right at the end of the hall which required hiking shoes to get there!
The room was dark, quiet and the beds EXTREMELY comfortable. The only problem we had was a group of 'young' people two rooms away, saving all their yelling, arguing and yahooing for the hall. After 3am of course, every night! Also, every time we went in the room after the cleaner we could smell cigarette smoke. 
The $7 beer\/slice of pizza combo was excellent every time. The duelling piano's was a let down. They play the same show every night and just hope someone requests what's on their play list. 
It mainly gets 3 stars because of the quiet dark room with incredible beds.

Located at the edge of the strip but definitely cheaper than most that are closer to the center. If you can barely afford on the strip then this might be a good pick. If money is not an issue and you want to be at the center of the strip, don't stay here.
